review_content:
First impressions: (rollerball)
I really like this, smells like white floral clean, kind of like a clean jasmine smell but not too indolic more on the clean side.
Dear Fragrantica an add every 3 seconds is horrendous. Change it.

Ugh. I wanted to like this. *so* BAD! The notes are totally me, Lavender, Lily of the Valley, White musk, and Green Apple, all notes I was hoping would shine through equally and mend together well, but this is too floral, too clean, almost smells like straight freshener, it isn't a chemical like smell, but just so floral it really doesn't allow the other notes to shine through! I got this as a blind buy at TJ MAXX, and I always adore Clean's perfume's, but this one is genuinely too much. On the plus side, I love to use this as a base scent to layer my cleaner scents, usually I will use this as a base and layer on Daisy Dream, which is light enough to where they actually meld very well together, and almost balance out! I still will give this a decent rating simply because it can be a very good base for other perfumes, but alone I think you might smell like Fabulosa. 6.5/10.

I didnt put this on my skin yet, i am too scared. it seems too air freshener-ish. A little too much with the cleaner vibe. Not sure where i would wear this? It is too happy for a funeral, too clean for a date, too juvenile for work, too feminine for the gym, too effervescent for chilling, too bright for night time. It is like music that never seems to go well in any playlist. It’s like someone used chatgpt to come up with fragrance notes for “spring”. This is the kind of thing that Ai could use against humanity, future generations will believe this is what Spring smells like. I dread the future.

Clean really does put out "clean" scents. Every one of their fragrances I've tried are compositions that remind me of 'out of the shower' cleanliness. This one, compared to some of their others, is more on the floral side. Yes, you can absolutely still smell the aldehydes, but there's that very bright and crisp apple note that hits you on the opening. The more prominent florals in this for me are the lily and the lavander as it develops. I came across this one at a discount store and since I have loved a lot of their fragrances, I blind bought it. It wasn't anything groundbreaking of course, but I've grown to enjoy this one as the summer has progressed.

I REALLY wanted to like this. I got it as a blind buy since the notes interested me. I can hardly smell the floral notes, and as much as I love “clean” scents, it just smells like chemicals. if layered with something more floral, it’s a lot more bearable but I probably wont purchase this again.
Go to a funeral home, take a nice big sniff, and it will smell the same as the disaster that awaits in this bottle

Clean perfumes to my nose have a tendency to smell the same depending on which fragrance (IE: aqua neroli and solar blossom (?) smell the same on my skin after a few hours) but this one is very nice!!
I live in a climate that gets scorching in the summer, so I've been searching for some more clean perfumes and was able to get my hands on a rollerball sample set. This one is extremely clean, almost to the point of it smelling like a bathroom product? But not enough like it to turn me off of the perfume. Super great to keep smelling fresh throughout the hot months

I was able to try this from the Clean Classic rollerball sampler I got from Marshalls. Lovely spring perfume. I put it at night before bed and when I woke up the next morning it was the first thing I smelled. Sillage is intimate tho, I think. Overall a lovely fragrance.
Rosy muguet... somewhat reminds me of Aqcua Universalis.
Spring in a bottle! I' m amazed that they could make such perfekt scent for this season, I'm amazed! Just so nice and effortlessly beautiful.
I got a sample of this from Clean. Not too bad, I would say it is a very floral perfume. Tbh it smells very generic on me personally. I would say it's a safe blind buy but pretty boring overall.

I am a bit dissapointed. I was hoping it would smell close to Clean Air that has been discontinued. I like the opening, but after a few minutes there is a sharp note to it. After 1 hour it smells like something you would clean your bathroom with. Blindbuy.

I love this scent. It’s strong but not overwhelming. Floral but not sweet. Modern but classic at the same time. I think it’s perfect for office as any of the Clean perfumes. I’m scent sensitive but I never had negative reactions on any of the Clean perfumes (I have 7 😅)
Nice spring scent.
Really good on paper but the atomizer is terrible, and was STICKY on skin. Also didn’t smell great on. It was giving playdough.

I love this. It's my second favorite in Clean's H2EAU line (Musk Noir is my #1, one of my favs of all time and my current signature). This is by far my favorite nectarine/peach scent ever. It's sweet, fruity, feminine, with a slight powderiness that really smooths it out. Highly highly recommend.
Smells like peach shampoo
I can't be the only one who smells watermelon and not nectarine

I liked this on paper—I remember it being pleasantly juicy and sweet. However, this and the one other Clean fragrance I’ve tried (Rain & Pear) have both turned unexpectedly musky when I’ve sprayed them on skin. I know “musk” is in fact listed as one of the base notes, but this felt different from others I’ve smelled and became noticeable immediately rather than in the background or the dry-down. I wrote it off as the chocolate note or some other characteristic of Rain & Pear but the fact that this one had such a similar quality and it wasn’t present on paper is making me wonder. Maybe it’s my chemistry?

Maybe I just have unsophisticated taste, but I really like the whole H2Eau collection, especially this scent. It smells like expensive salon shampoo in the best way. But I am also a sucker for any fresh & clean scent, so I don't necessarily have high standards.
Pretty, soft, clean floral scent. This isn’t a show stopper by any means. But it will be nice once the weather warms up in the spring for quick errands or to take the kids to the playground.

basic floral-fruit fragrance 8/10
- kinda smells like Pantene
Summer teenage vibes. Not sophisticated. I’m dismayed at reports that it stains clothing. Got rollerball sample in Sephora kit. Gave it to my mother-in-law.

This scent is bright, juicy and fresh. On my skin it is nearly jammy. It clean but very edible- kind of like the liquid filled bath beads my great aunties had in their Maximalist-Coquette, ruffled powder rooms. This seems timeless, any age could wear this! The fruit does not smell synthetic, the amber really shines hours into wearm this lasts 8-12 hours on my self. It does dry down a bit sticky and can stain clothes.
Soft floral nectarine scent that I actually like better than Jo Malone's nectarine and honey because the honey sometimes in that scent can be too much in warm weather.

It's absolutely a shampoo-y fragrance, but one that's very fresh and appealing, in my opinion. I really like it. And I can still smell it very well almost 3 hours later. Strangely, though, it has made the part of skin that I sprayed sort of sticky/tacky?? This would make me reluctant to spray it on my hair or clothes!

A very clean scent. It smells so good, LOREAL kids type vibes, a grown up better version of it. Clean linen on a breezy day, probably by the pool, sipping on cold iced water with an orange slice on the rim just for the aesthetic. I really like it. The chamomile really comes through in this perfume, I'm obsessed with it. It's very calming and energizing at the same time. Could be worn on the hottest days (boat days). But also perfect for cold winter days. From day to night, great after a shower. Very clean girl, (total unisex) light citrus, nothing too sweet but it does smell a bit like sour green apple, in a good way. Pairs well with sunscreen (tanning lotion), Byredo Gypsy Water, Gucci Flora (pink bottle) Le Monde Gourmand Citrus Glace, to name a few. BISOUS

Terrible formula. I got a sample rollerball of this and it dries incredibly sticky on skin. Just a small amount on clothing will leave a noticeable stain. The scent itself is okay, slightly tart, citrusy, and not too sweet, but almost no projection at all. It would be an okay summer scent with a different formula, but absolutely not worth buying as is.

Quite fruity, I just wish the nectarine was a touch sweeter on me. I definitely wouldn’t call it a floral scent. It has minimal sillage and only lasts about 4 hours. In terms of perfumes listed as similar—
✔️ Jo Malone Nectarine Blossom & Honey: very similar
✔️ Oakcha The Beekeeper: very similar

Based on the notes I thought I'd love this, however unfortunately this is a no for me. The notes all kinda blend together to smell like a generic fruit scented liquid hand soap. While I applaud the effort to innovate with using a water based formula, this does unfortunately take a while to settle & dries sticky which I personally wasn't a huge fan off

This is a disappointment. This fragrance dries down STICKY. Not only that but because it's water based, it stains the clothing it touches. While this fragrance is nice, it's nothing to write home about. It's very juvenile, with the nectarine being a lasting note from first spray to dry down. That's all I smell is nectarine and nothing else. This would make a decent scent for a girl in her teens, maybe even early 20s. Not a sophisticated or expensive fragrance at all. This reminds me a lot of Jessica Simpson's Fancy. A very fruity gourmand, your-skin-but-better fragrance.

Hands down, my favorite scent from the line. I'm surprised that the current rating is so low.

It's light, bright, clean - simply lovely. I'd classify it as fresh scent with some floral and fruity touches. Beautifully blended. Easy reach for spring and summer, any occasion. Nonoffensive.

If I could buy only one scent from this line, it'd be this scent.

I only wish the brand replaced rollerballs with travel sprays. I never buy rollerballs.

Yes it smells like shampoo but once the Amber note pulls through OUU 😮💨😮💨. This is a perfect perfume for spring and summer time for me because it’s not too fresh but it still has a nice lasting power ! That peach note is wonderful aswell

The spray was a weird one. It came out almost like foamy or bubbly. The liquid is thick and different. Now on to the smell it’s light and fresh smelling like nectarine. Like others have said it has a shampoo type of scent. It’s pleasant but nothing ground breaking.

Be warned - this line of H2EAU fragrances stains clothing like a spill of vegetable oil. It is not alcohol based so when you apply, make sure to not let it touch fabrics. Also, it gets gummy / sticky. This line is great in concept but disappointing in execution.

I agree with the other reviewers, this really smells like shampoo. Also reminds me of sweet pea from bath and body works. But synonymous with clean, freshness. The floral notes are very pretty. Simple, would be pleasant for everyday

I definitely get the nectarine, and although it does smell a bit like shampoo, I don't mind it. However, it disappeared on my skin within 2 hours. Granted, I did not prep with any moisturizer or other type of base, but most of my scents last longer than that on their own. Perhaps it is the nature of this fragrance line, so if lighter scents appeal to you, I recommend giving it a try!

Such a pretty fragrance, especially for spring and summer! To me it’s bright, fresh, sweet, radiant, watery, florals with the peach blossom and chamomile. It also has the prettiest sweet and slightly tangy nectarine note and a touch of warm amber and musk! The amber and musk develops more on me during the dry down. It has this rather unique watery scent to it too! I don’t see watery notes listed anywhere, but I do find the watery scent to be fairly prominent. I think the picture they use (Clean Reserve) with the hands, petals, and water really shows the perfect visual representation of this fragrance!

I’m not typically drawn to a lot of floral fragrances (I’m more of a beachy/coconut, vanilla, and gourmand kind of girl), but I was really intrigued by the description and notes of this one. While I can’t say it’s my favorite fruity floral, I still think it’s a beautiful fragrance. I definitely do really like it and hope I’ll like it even more when it’s not 10 degrees outside. I do think it’s slightly similar to Clean Reserve Radiant Nectar, but definitely more floral and watery. For reference, some of my favorite florals are Coach Love, Coach Poppy Blossom, Coach Poppy Wildflower, Flowerbomb, FB Ruby Orchid, FB Nectar, FB Midnight, and Chloe Love Story.

Since this was a blind buy for me, I bought the travel size which is a rollerball. I wasn’t sure what to expect with this new H2Eau water-based formula, but it surprised me. This lasts all day on me and the projection is nice as well, it radiates out about an arm’s length with just a light application.
Very light. Smells like shampoo. Not worth the price tag in my opinion. Smells good though

Straight up cleaning chemicals/hospital disinfectant /cough syrup/bug spray or something. Very unpleasant.

There's a hint of musk. Other than that I don't get anything I recognize.

The sting of the nose is for sure there. But calms down to a soft fresh blonde scent with roses hinting. For the price it’s a good buy in a smaller size until you find out how your skin handles it. Honestly it’s a spring and fall frag. Unique.

This is very soapy and clean, but very strong on me. It gives me 'old lady' meets 'cologne' but I mean that in a good way. The florals come through but the rose doesn't stand out to me. It's very feminine and sexy to me. I honestly want to like this more than I do because I think it's interesting, but most of the time it triggers a minor headache for me so I may end up needing to sell my bottle.

Just got two pieced by a fragrance. First quick jab in the 1-2 combo was the sharp floral that slightly singed my nose. Then soon came the cross that knocked my nose out with the strong soapy aldehydes. At no point do I get any hint of the base notes. Definitely not a safe blind buy. Clean reserve Skin and Radiant Nectar remain as the favorites from this line for me.

I am really picky about aldehydic laundry scents (I declutterred MFK 724) but I find this one entirely inoffensive, feminine, and soft. It’s not the most special thing in the world but it does evoke a Cicely Mary Barker flower fairy doing laundry. Layers nicely with Nest Wisteria Blue for a bit more flower dew or Ellis Brooklyn Salt for a bit more sandalwood.
Woods and musk and woods and soap and woods. Maaaaybe a touch of rose in there. Stings the nose.

Ummmm, this is a beautiful freshie! I don't understand the reviews but fragrance is subjective. To me, this is a beautfiul feminine, clean girl scent. I don't see in what world that this is masculine leaning. It's clean, floral, and super pretty smelling. The value is unbelievable too. I paid $50 for a 100ml. This is an everyday easy grab. I adore it! Lasts all day on me too. 4.5/5.
A blindbuy because I love rosescents (nowhere to test it) ....All I got was the smell of a cheap soap bar ~ gave it away because I couldn't stand it .
The initial scent smells of aldehydes which quickly gives way to a lightly smoked woody celery. I do not detect more than a hint of rose. It is poorly named or my batch forgot the rose!
Was hoping for something more rosey, but this is like all aldehydes.

I've started going through my honestly massive backlog of fragrances (thanks pandemic era hyper fixation!) and I grabbed this one on a whim and ended up ADORING it. Its cozy but doesn't scream 'wear in cold weather', unique but familiar, sophisticated but not too 'mature'. I can't wait to spend more time with it and get to know it even better. My only real complaint is that I feel like, on me at least, it doesn't have much lasting power. I also wish the company wouldn't use outdated terminology in their marketing.

Yes it doesn’t necessarily smell rosey or sweet. The dry down is honestly masculine but its still intriguing and pleasant. I’ve had this perfume for more than 2 years now but I’ve only found the opportunity to wear it maybe 5/6 times in total

oh you gotta wait for the drydown!

upon initial spray this does smell like greens and leans masculine

but the drydown smells sooo good. it reminds me of gap grass
reminds me of old traditional herbal medicine. yuck
It doesn’t smell like rose. It’s like a cheap synthetic rose that you’d find in a cheap oil. It’s more aldehydes and musk than anything else. This is one of the very few fragrances that I hate.

Very clean scent with a backing of rose. Love to wear this when I don't feel like doing much to my appearance and still want to smell nice. Doesn't permeate the whole room, but is noticeable if you are next to the person. Overall good everyday perfume.

Starts off like a dewy fresh green rose for a few minutes and then develops into something oddly rooty-earthy-vegetal. Someone below mentioned peppered celery and that's spot on - a green vegetable V8 smoothie with nothing to sweeten or sex it up, just straight up celery, spinach and kale in a blender. There's something weirdly bbq-ish going in the background, like some smoked ham or salami. A very odd scent that does not evoke "clean".

The initial spray reminds me of ...peppered celery. Then it dries down into leather or suede and dirt. I can't believe that there are flowers in this! Definitely masculine, but not in a good way. I wouldn't want my man to smell like this.
This leans very masculine to me unfortunately 😢

Something in this fragrance gave me a huge allergic reaction. When sprayed in the neck, it made my skin very dry and itchy. The next day I sprayed it on my hair, careful to avoid my scalp, thinking that way I would react less to it. The result: runny nose, itchy scalp and face and breakouts on my face. Obviously, not my smartest idea.

Too bad, because it's a pretty nice scent. Nothing special, but pretty good as an everyday scent. Floral and musky, and maybe a bit too masculine for my liking, but the woods had an interesting effect: they gave it a nice hint of cigarettes. Not tobacco, but the lingering smell of a cigarette you've smoked an hour ago. Something I've always had a weak spot for, both on men and women. It transported me to my early twenties, when most of the time I smelled of The BS White Musk and cigarettes.

So yeah, nostalgia and allergies. Not the best of combinations.


If someone in NL is looking to buy this, I have a full bottle for sale :)
This smells exactly like what it smells like after you fake tan and you’re left with that syrupy smell. I don’t find this to be an extremely pleasant smell. This ones a no from me

Tested this out today because I was looking for not-in-your face rose fragrance. I was pleased that some people have been mentioning TF white suede and that smoky note! (which TF White Suede also has). -- So it wasn't just me.

I'll keep it short and sweet. I really do not get rose here :( But it's a combination of clean woods, soap, powder, and a hint of smoke. The combination is quite subtly sexy.

Though I have converted to the idea that perfumes are genderless, those who haven't embraced this idea 100% might find this leaning masculine.

Shall I purchase? Hmmm, still sniffing my arm, but it might be in my list of future buys.
Pleasant, light floral scent. I can't imagine this bothering or offending anyone.

I absolutely love Blonde Rose. It's a very pretty, clear, tender, scent. I get some roses from the get go and a delicate musky drydown. It lasts for hours, but always stays close. It's my go-to feel-good perfume.
About the whole baby oil vibe: yeah, that's the best part for me!

I’ve got a tester a while ago, since then I have tried it several times but I still don’t like it.

The name Blonde Rose is very misleading. They’re is nothing blonde or rose here. It smells like cologne for men. I don’t feel rose at all although it’s listed. Just woodsy male smell. If you are into unisex smells you may like it.
Blonde Rose gets male'ish on my skin. Its a wonderful, soft, longlived scent that I would looove on a man. On my skin I get the cedar, sandalwood and an airy note - very fresh mix.

I really like this. I was surprised that few people commented on the smoke smell. Most perfumes that people say smell like cigarettes just honestly don’t.

But this?

Cigarettes, soap, and roses. I absolutely adore it! The kind of smell that I can’t stop sniffing where I sprayed it because I enjoy it so much. Also reminds me of staying in moderately upscale chain hotels (a smell I am chasing always)
This perfume smells musky and peppery with just a hint of rose. It has amazing lasting power and is uniquely feminine!

To my nose this is very woody. It initially smelled masculine and a bit like an old wardrobe. I kept smelling sandalwood until I kind of sunk my nose into the spot I sprayed the perfume on in the morning and I was surprised - smells like flowers and it's rather sweet! It does smell like baby oil - it's soft and clean, here I can sense the rose and jasmine. It had been developing for 10 hours at this point. Its longevity is outstanding! It sits very close to the skin though, I showed it to my colleague but she has to get very close to the spot I sprayed to feel it. She said she found it floral and clean, she really liked it. Try this on a cold day - I think it flourishes when it's windy and chill. It would probably work well in rainy weather too because the wood makes it feel cozy.

I originally disliked this a lot but it grew on me. What I didn't like about it was how harsh and detergent-like this was but the brand is called "Clean" so maybe I'm asking this perfume to be something it's not branded to be. I am catching whiffs of aquatic florals on a soapy base after a while. I also get a nice rose water scent in the dry down. It leans masculine. Not the best perfume ever, but also not the worst.
I use these to make my own blends. Love mixing this with the Sueded Oud, the Sel Santal or Jennifer Lopez Still.

I am surprised with all the negative reviews! I absolutely love it. Someone mentioned baby oil....yes there is that element in it. It smells powdery and fresh and clean with some hint of smoke (not cigarette smoke, more like campfire) and florals. It reminds me of my childhood, not sure why, something in this scent has triggered an emotional note!

Definitely unisex - way more masculin than feminin IMO. Blonde roses? Not many roses on my skin, just a lot of sandalwood and soap. Not at all unpleasant, but a disappointment if you wanted some fresh, sweet roses in the blend. And I did.
Very clean, dry and woody. Nice perfume, but not at all what I expected or wanted. Won't use it again, it triggered my migraine.
This is just a big, huge nope for me. :(

Well I don't see Leather listed as a note, but I do see musk. I say this because my first impression after two sprays and 10 minutes is..... a more pedestrian Tom Ford White Suede.

I don't really get rose that much at all, and it has less of that "laundry" note than White Suede, but honestly if you like WS there is no reason to bother with this one. And if you DON'T like WS, well there's even more reason not to bother lol!

Clean has some winners, but I wouldn't necessarily say this is one of them. It doesn't really evoke anything specific or fun or intriguing.
bunch of vertofix.

I purchased a trio of mini size rollerballs from the Reserve collection, one of the fragrance was Blonde Rose, being that I enjoy rose fragrances it was the first I opened and tried on my wrist... it was a dissapointement to be honest, on me , the first thing that came to mind was Johnson's baby oil. Not unpleasant just not for me.

Today I am wearing a sample of Blonde Rose that I was sent along in a recent swap. Since I am a rose lover and never cease trying yet another fragrance claiming to smell like the Queen of the Garden, this seemed like a fair attempt.
Let me preface my comments by saying that I truly wish that reviews did not include ageism, sexism or snobbery! The beauty of this site is that we are all here to voice our opinions and thoughts with regard to this wonderful subject of fragrance.
For all of us who adore vintage fragrances...how "OLD LADY" is that?
Perhaps the perception is merely misguided and what others imagine to be frumpy or old fashioned just stems from the abundance of inexpensive and highly synthetic fragrances that some maiden aunt, teacher or grandma may have worn due to limited resources and choices.
Having said all this, Blonde Rose explodes with aldehydes (found in many older fragrances) and dries down to a very synthetic smelling concoction not unlike a fabric softener or deodorizer. It's not awful, young or old...just ordinary.

No offense to old ladies, but this smells like what an old lady would wear. Musty flowers. After reading comments about how it smells like Chi Silk Infusion (which I am infatuated with at the moment) I put some oil on for reference and hurried on down to Sephora to compare it in person. At first sniff, it smelled nothing like it. I then had the sales person smell me (I'm weird, I know) and then blonde rose to see if the problem was my nose. She thought it smelled similar and told me it may change on the skin. Since I was still on the fence about buying it, she was nice enough to give me a sample. Wearing it today and it still smells the same to me....old lady musty flowers. Oh well...my hunt continues.

I smell the rose but it's heavily concealed with aldehydes. Very fresh, clean, soapy smelling a la laundry detergent and hairspray products. Took me 5 wears to get into this. Initially I could smell sandalwood meshed with musk which turned me way off. I gave it another go during cold weather and viola, amazing! Clean clean clean - but, somewhere in there I get a ashy vibe, almost like an ashtray at a laundromat. Stale cigarette smoke mixed with perfume is very nostalgic for me so I'm digging it. I don't know what is causing this reaction from me, as there is ZERO actual tobacco I smell in this, more like ashy residue. Might be the aldehydes (?)

Rose, ashtray, clean air, soap. Great performance. Full bottle worthy? Not for me, but I sure am enjoying my samples.

Rose? Where's the rose?

Masculine, musky, watery woods. It is pleasant and has depth. This would be a great man's cologne. The opening is shaving cream, as other reviewers have stated. The drydown is much the same, but with the emphasis on sandalwood. If unisex or femme scents are for you, then Blonde Rose is not. If you prefer masculine scents, then give this one a try.

I am glad to see I am not the only one who finds this to be rather masculine.

It starts out with an almost citrus-y bitter lime note (is that the aldehydes?) that gives way to water and wood. The rose is there, but it is drowning in shave gel and hair-cream.

I had a great uncle, a WWII vet, lifelong bachelor and ladies man who, even in his 70's, would slick back his hair, put on his best western shirt paired with a turquoise and silver bolo tie to go out to flirting with all the gals, young and old, at the Elks and VFW. He'd have loved this, I think. Blonde Rose has that same sort of freshly scrubbed vibe to me, and his visage instantly came to mind when I smelled it.

Likewise, I find it as appealing a fragrance for me as I would Ol' Uncle Smokey's cologne.

Yessss I agree with the others that this smells exactly like the chi silk infusion hair product! Hahaha that is so crazy....but anyways, this isnt a very feminine fragrance tbh. Its musky and woody, very masculine. I dont mind it as a hair product but as a perfume, just not my taste!

I completely agree with the review below, this smells exactly like chi silk infusion. It has that masculine side to it. This is definitely a unisex fragrance. I don't get much rose, I get mostly woody notes.

Not what I'd call a "rose" scent! Definitely more of a musky/masculine fragrance, almost a dead ringer for CHI hair products (Silk infusion, specifically! Hahaha). I think this is very cozy to wear, I do love it!

After a consistent number of run-ins with typical celebrity scents and some pungent outlier scents, I've finally got a new potential favorite. Despite how blandly this scent is billed, it has a lot of character. It's very feminine but there's definitely a masculinity to it that I like. This scent just sinks into my skin and almost warms to it, instantly creating more depth. I do get the feeling that this scent has the potential to become cloying if applied to heavily though. I'm going to use my sample up and if I'm still attracted after awhile, I'll splurge on a bottle.

X-posted/submitted to the Sephora's product page for this scent.

I never paid much attention to Clean, until I received a sample of this fragrance. The most predominant note is the sandalwood (to my nose-the amyris, or West Indian type), followed by musk and rose. It is definitely unisex. I would love to smell a man wearing this! Somehow it reminds me of Prada Luna Rossa. At times the soapy note is so strong that it is reminiscent of Irish spring. Despite these associations, I feel like this scent is very natural and could be recreated by mixing essential oils. I hope to do exactly that. If I am not successful, I will definitely buy this one.

I adore this fragrance! I will start off by saying that I might be a little biased, as I truly love rose, but this one is a different kind of rose. There is a wooden element that really makes the bubbly, green notes stand out. I lucked out with this one because the roses are identifiable on my skin. It definitely is soapy, but in a feminine way, unlike something like Pure Grace from Philosophy, which just smells like soap. Oddly enough, I got to make my own fragrance this past summer, and it smells very similar to this. I guess I just like these kinds of scents.

This is not a heavy, sensual, sexy rose. It's a light scent, a bit of rose, a bit of "makeup" or "soap" smell. Mostly it's just clean and pleasant and lightly floral. I can wear it to work without gassing people out or coming on strong. It's probably not going to win any awards but I enjoy it.

This is the soapiest rose I have ever smelled. It might even be the soapiest perfume I have ever smelled, but I digress. This is more soapy smelling than even a bar of rose scented soap. Needless to say, I'm not a fan. Yes, it smells clean and inoffensive, like you've been scrubbed all over and are ready to mingle. But it's just so uninteresting, and the drydown is that same boring slightly sweet musk that I can't stand in so many fragrances today. I was really hoping for more rose from this, but it really does smell just like bubbles.
I'm not big on aldehydes but they are tolerable here with a fresh, crisp rose. Could be considered unisex.

I bought a three pack of CLEAN Summer fragrances and it was a blind buy for all three-I hadn’t even heard of them but 1) I LOVE the brand Clean 2) I love summer fragrances so so much 3) it was a steal
Of a deal so why not! This one is so lovely. Reminds me of sailing day by replica (which I love) I wouldn’t say it’s ground breaking or something never done before, but it’s summer, it’s fresh, it’s beautiful and worth the money! I find it definitely unisex I meant to put that on here but I hit more feminine by mistake. It lasts a decent amount of time. Like I always say-you wear your fragrances when where and how YOU want to! Don’t let specifics make you think you can only wear them at certain times of day, year, etc , with that being said, this does lean it self to being a summer fragrance, but I would absolutely wear this year round. Fresh fragrances are my jam so I think they are beautiful year round but each to their own I suppose!!

I have always wanted to try the "clean" scents but they are not always readily available in the UK.
So when I saw this in TK Maxx for a tenner, I snatched it up.

This has the same vibe as Demeter "Thunderstorm".

Then I read the perfume notes and it states that the "heart provides accords of fresh air after storm."

I wouldn't buy this scent again because my nose is also picking up something that smells like a chlorinated swimming pool.

CLEAN Summer Sailing is like an ocean breeze and refreshing cucumber water! Salty sea air with crisp cucumber that settles down to a fresh mossy musk and green violet leafs. It is a little more on the masculine side, but I think if you like the CLEAN brand then your taste in fragrances falls more in the unisex category. Every now and then I crave an aquatic type scent that is super fresh and CLEAN Summer Sailing is the perfect fix! Honestly, the longevity is awful so spritz liberally and bring the bottle along for touch ups. I own four other CLEAN fragrances and I think Summer Sailing is tied in third place with Cotton T-Shirt as fas as my favorite CLEAN’s go. They are similar fragrances, but Summer Sailing is more sea notes and cucumbers whereas Cotton T-Shirt is a musky lemon scent. Enjoy!

This fragrance is marketet unisex. It's more on the masculine side but certain types of women can easily pull this off (active outdoor type women, not super-feminine women)

The fragrance is mossy and marine. A bit dark but very "outdoorsy" I don't get any lime or cucumber notes. In whole a beautiful scent but as with all Clean perfumes the lasting power is rather short.
Muskier verision of Glossier's OBM body mist. Sticky on the skin.

Weird, nonlinear citrus. I get more bergamot than mandarin in the opening, itself more peel than fruit. The astringency and whatever is supposed to be the "water notes" would make this smell like a disinfectant (albeit a nice one) if left to their own devices. As it is, neroli and musk create an unsettling someone-else's-skin accord which clashes with the blue-tiled mall fountain profile found in the opening. The overall effect is that of a freshly showered armpit, the final traces of a boyfriend's body wash combining with one's own deodorant. It'll disappear before you figure out how to feel about that.

A citrusy, aromatic burst of bergamot and mandarin, with watery bitters. It's not overly sweet.

Then, neroli/orange blossom enters and feels very realistic. The wetness of citrus flowers, cool and fresh. It feels citrusy, but not in the jarring lemon or orange oil way, rather soft and with depth.

A touch of musk that has a touch of skankiness further softens and extends it.

It has a bit longer life than most citrusy perfumes and is very pretty. I am not generally a fan of citrus themed perfumes as they are strident and brash and acidic, but, with the neroli, it is really beautiful. I like it.
Gorgeous watery citrus. It is literal but not in a bad way. Highly recommend for those who love aquatic fresh citrus fragrances. Perfect for the summer.
too sour and straight up neroli. if you're into bath room scented scents you will like this one.

This smells citrusy, musky, and comforting like a hug. Something in it reminds me of fresh laundry swaying in the golden sun of an afternoon. Brings back a lot of pleasant memories for me. Absolutely lovely.

Unisex, sharp, tangy, it honestly reminds me a bit of a cleaning product.

I gave it to my husband, and he really likes it.
sticky laundry detergent. fresh, inoffensive, but i gave mine away because i just didn't love it

This is kind of your standard issue citrus, neroli, musk fragrance. I didn't notice any staining or residue as others have reported. The brand says they used South American Mandarin, but they make no mention of the providence of the neroli (which is expensive) and this doesn't smell like natural neroli.

It's fine, I'd never buy it because frankly there's way better stuff out there. I think if you want a top tier Mandarin you should look towards LV Afternoon Swim,19-69 Capri, Guerlain Mandarin Basilic, Atelier Orange Sanguine, or Acqua Di Parma Mandarino.
--------------------------------------------------------
Scent 52/100
Performance 45/100
Smells like citrus clean detergent. So synthetic and offensive. Dries down STICKY and stains clothes. Hard pass.

Too much musk for my liking. I was expecting citrus to be a bit more noticeable, but the musk overwhelmed my nose. At times it almost smelled like a hospital or nursing home? Like cleaning products trying to cover up the smell of sick people due to the combination of notes. Did not wear well on me at all, needless to say.

If you're expecting a fresh citrus scent, look elsewhere.

I don't know how I feel about this, because it really is a generic clean detergent scent. I enjoy the neroli and orange, but really don't like the water notes that are prominent here. It scratches my nose in the worst way, and makes me feel like sneezing. I'll keep it as a "clean-smelling" perfume.

Like someone else mentioned, it's sticky and gummy on the skin.
I really wanted to like it! Smells like a harsh detergent. Too artificial.

Be warned - this line of H2EAU fragrances stains clothing like a spill of vegetable oil. It is not alcohol based so when you apply, make sure to not let it touch fabrics. Also, it gets gummy / sticky. This line is great in concept but disappointing in execution. Sigh.….

I purchased a roller ball of this scent as a blind buy. The first 15 seconds or so the scent is very acrid, almost nailpolish remover. It quickly disappears and the orange, florals and musk start to appear. It isn't quite the bright, refreshing citrus I was hoping for. The musk, on me, really overpowers the scent. It is like a dulled orange paired with fresh laundry/cleaning product "clean" scent together. It's a cozier (?) type of scent with the presebce of the musk and the florals are fairly strong in the beginning. I was hoping more for a stand out citrus scent but this didn't work for me. I will say that I was surprised by the strength and longevity of this scent, being water-based. This *could* be kind of a headache inducer type scent IMO if overdone.

I'm having a weird experience with this fragrance. The top notes are gorgeous- light, fresh, crisp and green with a hint of citrus (I actually expected it to be very citrus-heavy given the name). The dry down is warm and musky, still with a bit of green.

But the middle notes... smell horrendous on me. The first time I tried it, there was a period where the fragrance smelled like decaying flowers on me until it settled into the base notes. I don't know if anyone could smell it since it sat really close to my skin, but I would have been mortified if anyone else could smell what I smelled.

I've tried it two more times since then and depending on when I sniff, I may or may not get some of variation of that ickiness as it dries down. I've never had this happen with any frag before and it's honestly a bit alarming.
Straight neroli. Very unoriginal

This is a sweeter & more citrusy version of TF Neroli Portofino. I really like it. It has the most noticeable dry down out of the collection. This layers beautifully with their Brilliant Peony. Also this reminds me of their Acqua Neroli, but sweeter and less harsh.

The only complaint I have against this perfume is it is too intimate.

If this scent were amped up, it would easily be my must-have.

It is very clean, very meditative and refreshing to sniff. If you want an oak moss scent that is fresh, foresty, and earthy, look no further! This is one of the best rain in the forest scents I've come across. That said, it becomes skin scent immediately.

I normally don't mind scents that are close to the skin, but at this price point, I'd expect some sillage for the first half an hour at the very least. This has none of it.

That said, it is among the best oak moss fragrances I've smelt. The other one I can immediately think of is Rewind 1984 (it's a niche brand from Thailand which is extremely hard to source.)

Expensive. Slightly overpriced, but still acceptable as it is unique.

I blind bought this for a good deal, and honestly I love it. It's woody and clean, kind of like a just sharpened pencil. I know that might not be appealing for some, but if you like the smell of freshly cut wood, this might be up your alley. It's not overly floral, and it hangs out well enough to enjoy.

This is not what I was expecting. It smells quite masculine and there is no sweetness. It mainly has an English rose, strong green, and woods accord. This could be well suited for a professional setting and someone who prefers masculine-type scents.

It smells like Irish Spring. The original Irish spring. Great if you are looking for a good quality eau de parfum version of that, otherwise you’ll be disappointed as it’s completely masculine. I’m a male but I gravitate towards more androgynous scent profiles and this smelled too masculine, too male, too soapy, too much. Very men’s deodorant.

Oh, I love oakmoss in this. It has such a nice retro vibe to it. Gorgeous. This fragrance is a distant cousin of Coriandre by Jean Couturier in the drydown. It is basically what I wanted Gypsy Water to be. It has a very hippie vibe but in a refined way. This is what you would smell on someone with an expensive boho taste. I only wish the longevity and sillage were a little better. On me, it stays a skin scent. I will not upgrade to a full bottle.

Citrus floral opening, hints of sweetness and a cozy woody base. I don't get that much moss, this smells clean and light and a tiny bit earthy but it mainly gives off a fresh green vibe. Imo, it smells very expensive. Unisex, versatile and unique.

Wow! This was a blind buy, and while it wasnt exactly what i expected (are they ever?) it is amazing!

Soft, old english pink roses, kissed with dew. A very subtle hint of pepper. Then oakmoss. So much deliciously rich, cool, damp oakmoss! I feel like Ive rolled through a hidden moss forest after a stroll through a rose garden.
A mossy gem.

very nice, very similar to nagel's myrrh eglantine without the heavy myrrh. i might like this better. if you've been eyeing the hermessence but don't want to spend the money, give this a try. lovely lovely sweetbriar/eglantine note over a slightly powdery and faintly earthy base. i'd be interested to know who the perfumer is for this one.

I enjoy the Clean Reserve offerings.
This fragrance is light, happy, woodsy, natural, clean and green.
It also lasts.
Very pretty and great for daily wear.
Easily Unisex.
Rates 7 out of 10

Hint: Sweetbriar is an old world rose. It does not smell either sweet or like a rose, though. It smells somewhat like an apple.

For someone who loves to blind buy like me, this is a total disappointment. On my skin, I get no sweet elements at all, just mossy smell. Although the notes are nowhere near the same, you get similar but weaker Rose 31 opening smell, which stays all the way through until the fragrance wears off. Moderate logetivity, but the sillage is non-existence; don't know how anyone can get enormous silage with this. While the eco-friendly concept is a nice gimmick, this is way overpriced and definitely not recommended.

This is one of the cleanest, slightly sweet and dapper frag. I've ever whiffed. Definitely unisex. The sweet is very underwhelming. Barely noticeable. I can't believe how long it lasts for a citrus frag. Gentlemen don't pass on this, It's worth at least a samples worth.....;)
P.S. Perfect for a certain type of woman. Not a sweet girly frag.

I have sampled most all of the Clean Avant Garden collection and I really like this one! I'm not sure I could identify sweetbrier as a singular fragrance note, but it just translates to slightly sweet florals on my skin. I happen to really like moss scents, so that aspect is a plus in my book. It is woody, but the sweetness, which is not overpowering, tempers that. I think this is one of the few Clean fragrances that doesn't reduce down to one or two notes after dry down, which is a nice divergence. I would call this a safer blind buy than other Clean Avant Garden fragrances, some of which really need to be tested first. It is also what I would consider to be more feminine than other fragrances from Clean, because of the slightly sweet florals, so keep that in mind.

Avant garden collection from clean...you seem to amaze me again and again... It´s as if they seem to be better and better as they arrive.

Love this one

This is a woody , comforting, peppery and flowery scent.

The cedar is the most prominent note in my nose. Oakmoss, amber and cashmere wood.

Velvety and soothing on the skin. Lasting power and silage is above average on me.
Smells like mother earth in a very plesant way.

I definetly recommend.

Imagine an Amazonian goddess doing yoga/meditating in the forest. Thats exactly what this smells like. I was out shopping with my daughter a few minutes before the mall closed and decided to breeze in Bloomingdales near the fragrance counter. I tried a few of the other scents from the Reserve line before I sprayed this. Its been almost 3 hours and I can’t stop sniffing my arm! It is nice and earthy but not grassy, it has a woody scent that is very comforting and the moss makes it smell like a wet wood on my skin. This is a unisex fragrance done perfectly and I could see this becoming someone’s everyday scent. My husband smelled this on me and he liked it as well. I won’t say its a must have but if you need something to balance your collection, get this!

I LOVE THIS. It smells so beautiful and clean (hehe), perfect for cold weather. Like throwing on your favorite cozy sweater and snuggling up inside on a snowy day. I'm devastated though as I'm running low and can't find it anywhere!!!! Does anyone know where I can purchase it for a reasonable price?

I'm a huge clean fan, loved warm cotton, cool cotton and bought clean cotton t shirt three times large size.

AND.... I HATE THIS!

Possibly among the worst fragrances I've bought. with the exception of headachey mom perfumes.

No idea where people are getting the relaxing floral from.

I second the review that it smells like black licorice. slight burnt rubber. chemical. bitter.

it smells a little bit like shoe polish

it also smells similar to a suede jacket.

it's an absolute masterpiece in that it PERFECTLY REPLICATES the unique smell of a clean itchy wooly sweater, washed without any fabric conditioner. it also smells like freshly ironed clean men's business shirts. the steamy bitter vapours of damp cotton being ironed.

I can see that some might smell it as white woods but not sweet wood, more like freshly cut timber. take a wiff of some raw cut timber or snap a handful of twigs in autumn and smell it. woody. not sweet. just wood.

unusual compared to the other clean fragrances in that it doesn't smell of soap or lemon

occasions to wear it? definately unisex. not feminine at all. I actually wonder if it is men's. I thinkk the only time it would be OK to wear this is in the office if you like the above smells and want something inoffensive and clean. or maybe if you haven't had time to clean your clothes.or as a fabric or room spray if you want your place to smell like everything is freshly washed but not smelling of citrus or detergent.

bought, tried, will sell immediately 🤢
I like it for the bed time. The beginning is sharp, then your can smell relaxing levander and other herbs. I don't know if I like it to wear out...

Tried a sample of this today - it smells good. It smells like clean fabric, a room full of folded laundry. In the best way. I would love to use this as a fabric spray around the house. I could be ok with spraying this on clothing but I don’t like it on my skin. Kind of gives me the heebie jeebies.
Reminds me of CK Obsession Nigh for women, more soapy though, you can kind of tell this is a Clean fragrance.

I'm wearing this right now, I've had it for a while and I thought I might as well review it. It's actually quite lovely. Like all the Clean Fragrances, it just makes you smell like you have clean skin times 10. This reminds me a lot of pretty fabric softener musks with a bit of woodiness in the dry down. You really do have the feeling that you're bundled up in a nice warm cashmere sweater. This is a high-quality skin scent. It lasts an incredibly long time, but it doesn't project wildly. It's a little pricey, but deals can be found on the net. It's cruelty free and vegan, which I like. Sadly, I think this is discontinued. I want to try the Reserve Warm Cashmere by Clean to see how they compare. Maybe it will make a good replacement. Overall, an A+ perfume.

I really like this! At first the bright citrus smell in the beginning threw me off. As it starts to dry down it starts to smell more warm. It's very close to skin but still noticeable. I keep getting whiffs of a musky, clean and almost masculine smell throughout the day. It smells like I went to an expensive hotel, took a bath in their whirlpool bathtub and used the expensive musky lotion they left for guests lol. Smells mature and creamy almost. Definitely a fall scent, such a comforting scent!

Very cozy and comfortable fragrance. the name says everything... cashmere! it smells like those jumpers/sweaters you grab from your wardrobe to wear during winter time. Very inoffensive but lovely unissex fragrance. Great for winter time after shower to stay cozy at home

I got this one for free when I was purchasing some other perfumes on an eBay-like site in my country.

This scent is synthetic. Very synthetic. So much so, I use it to spray my bathroom. In the air, it smells very appropriate. It mixes very well with the air and creates a very comforting, warm smell.

On me though...it makes me sneeze. I usually enjoy these notes but the synthetic notes just make this scent feel metallic and cheap.

I usually despise CLEAN scents, so this one isn't any different from the others.

I enjoy the way this smells. It's a clean, musky fragrance with a sweetness and a warmth to it. It's kind of quiet and unassuming, but every so often you will turn your head and subconsciously realize that something smells nice. I would keep forgetting that the pleasant smell in the air was actually my perfume. The musk has an almost mineral feel, not quite resinous and not quite powdery, but something like soft rocks. Perhaps it's the lavender giving me that aromatic feel, clean but not too sharp.

Perfect for autumn and winter.
Cosy, musky and inoffensive. A big hug from a soft cashmere sweater.
The lavender, tonka and woodsy notes are wellblended.
This works perfect in cooler weather.
Unisex, clean and cosy.
I wear this a lot for periods of time and it gives med great feel and vibe around me.
Silage and longevity is about average on my skin.

One of the cosy, musky quartet from CLEAN (Skin, White Woods, Cashmere and Warm Cashmere). I like them all. Warm cashmere definitely makes me think of a cosy cardigan, but not this one. Cashmere is just nice and musky. First minutes there's very much going on. Citrus, flowers, some spices - a hint of tobacco? - and - of course - musk. But it soon settles, and you have more musk, now together with wood and lavender for a while. Then: here comes the tonka beans! Enjoy the sweet musky/caramel blend for a couple of hours before Cashmere fades away. Luckily there are some sandalwood strokes in the sweet mixture. Sometimes I really love it, sometimes I'm not into the caramel sweetness. It's office safe. Unisex? The first hour perhaps. To me, it's definitely on the feminine side, but we are all different and unique and that's great!
// Update a few years later: I can safely say that this is one of my all time favourites, and definitely the best of the CLEAN perfumes. So sad it's discontinued, but I have an unopened 60 ml bottle still. It's elegant, grown-up and safe, and nowadays I don't find it as sweet an caramel-y as I did before. Perfect for me for autumn and winter.

It's got a smokey, dry incense feel to it. I daresay soft oriental.
For people who want to humbly enjoy a taste of oriental without making a scene.

Cashmere is different from all the other Clean scents. It doesn't try hard to be clean and fresh.

Close to skin, lasts about 3~4 hours.
Unisex, no doubt.

Woody and musky, with a slightly sheer lavender undertone. It's almost dry! On me the first hour is straight up pine needles. I'm not complaining. It smells a little like Needles and Pine shower jelly by Lush, which is one of my all-time favourite bath products. After an hour or so the musk adds in with the lavender. In the end it sits close to the skin. Very pleasant. Not that long lasting, though.

I like the woodiness and muskiness. It's so different compared to the other Clean perfumes. I hate them and the detergent-y aesthetic. This I can dig. It's a good combination of feminine and masculine.

I love this one, and carry a rollerball in my purse at all times because A) it doesn't last very long and requires touch ups and B) It layers and plays nicely with all other scents. This is a skin scent, and clean white musk. It really does smell like a cosy cashmere sweater! But like all the Clean scents I have, it doesn't LAST and I use it more like a body spray! A good way to try this is the buy the rollerball trio - Clean Skin, Cashmere, and Warm Cotton - and try them all if you like laundry musks and skin scents. They also play well together. I love Clean's scents in the way I love Philosophy's scents - when I just can't think about what fragrance I want to wear, or can't justify using a luxury scent, these are what I reach for. They're easy on the wallet, and you can use them with abandon. As a signature, not really one that stands out or smells unique, but there's a place for these in the world nonetheless.

This is a really interesting scent...kind of unique. It reminds me of my grandma because IT SMELLS LIKE INSULIN. I'm not sure if insulin has a smell on its own, or maybe they used to add something to it that gave it a certain smell, but I remember how my diabetic grandmother would inject it into her stomach and I remember liking how it smelled. This is a sweeter version of it, but I don't think I can wear this scent without being reminded of insulin and my late grandmother.

My go to-scent at the moment.

Almost liquorice finish to it, this perfume suits woolly jumpers and vintage dresses alike. Personally, I have never been able to smell lavender in anything (not even when sticking my face to a bush of it) so it is lost to me but the scent opens to fresh bergamot which then gently deepens to the liquorice-tinted muskiness. It has almost become a security blanket to me as it simply smells so wonderful.

Febreze Light Bergamot and Musky Lavender

Clean Cashmere opens up with a burst of bergamot, warms up with a hint of white flowers, while tempering down on the bergamot, a light breezy lavender appears, anchored by a strong musky base.

Sounds nice? Let's explore this a little more. Most of the notes are very thin. The bergamot is pale, the white flowers are but a suggestion, the lavender is not the lush, herbal green camphorous lavender of a garden, but a kind of fractionated type that smells light and a bit powdery, there is a faint hint of powdery vanilla/tonka bean, and while the other notes are light, the musk is about as demure as neon spandex, it is heavy as hell, wears like lead, and the musk base lasts longer than 12 hours on my skin. The musk is identical to that found in commercial laundry detergent.

I never thought about perfumers working in the home care industry, and while the average person who goes sans traditional perfume probably doesn't consider the daily dousing of shampoo, conditioner, body wash or bar soap, lotion, face cream, laundry detergent, fabric softener, air freshener, and linen spray as 'wearing perfume' my lord no wonder no one needs to wear perfume anymore! You are already wearing a gallon of it anyway!

Anyway I read an interesting article by Chandler Burr called "Purple Odor Eater" about a perfumer who works for Proctor and Gamble. She was trying to design a new scent for Febreze, and she wanted something that smelled 'natural' as was popular at the time (2007--I think we are starting to enter another fragrance trend now, but that is another subject) and was trying to center the perfume around Lavender. When they blind tested several lavender profiles, most people hated natural Lavender, in all its green pollen sharp edged strong glory. Instead they liked "lavender" which just smells like a soft purple flower that has had all the actual lavender rinsed out. So that's what she ended up formulating, a perfume for Febreze centered around that focused grouped lavender.

That's what Clean Cashmere reminds me of. I actually enjoyed the scent a lot, and its lasting power is amazing, I truly got a full day's worth out of it, but lordy that laundry musk base got grating after awhile. As a perfume for the skin it's a no go. If I can find it on sale, say $20 a bottle, I would actually buy it as a linen or car spray, it smells very pleasant, but in no way is it something I want to wear all day on my skin. Does this company just buy perfume formulas from Proctor and Gamble or whoever and then bottle it in minimalistic bottles as "perfume?" And why do they charge so much? This perfume has to be among those were the actual perfume ingredients cost pennies per bottle. Oh well these perfume must appeal to someone or they wouldn't keep churning them out. I just think that they would work better as home care perfumes.

I smelled this on a test strip at the mall. The beginning of it smells absolutely intoxicating, like a warm blanket on a cold fall night. And then something kind of "off" hits my nose in the "after-smell." I wish I knew which note it was-- I suspect the Tonka.

I really like this perfume, but don't love it. It is inoffensive and unobtrusive. It's good for wearing to work and the grocery store and hanging out with the kids. It doesn't rock my world or that of my husband. I absolutely love Clean Provence, which was discontinued, and I still keep searching for something to replace it.

This is an awesome after-bath or chilling-at-home-on-a-Sunday fragrance. I'm having a lazy day today and this is the perfect scent for relaxation. It's soft, creamy, slightly sweet, and cozy--like being wrapped in a cashmere blanket. I'm really enjoying this today!

I really like this perfume. I received a sample vial in from a Sephora order and used it up so quickly. If I can get it discounted, I will likely buy a bottle.

The main note from this fragrance is musk. I can smell some cedar and jasmine when I wear this but the other notes aren't very prominent.

When wearing this out at night, I got several hours of wear and a low-moderate sillage. Other people could smell it on me, but it was more of a skin scent and not overwhelming.

Of the Clean fragrances, this is my favorite. In fact, I despise most of the others and thought I'd hate this one too, but these notes are some of my favorite. Very comforting and safe scent. Not particularly unique though.
It's not bad, I have had a lot of those "sunscreen" type of fragrances but this one gives me a headache and is somehow sharper than the other ones I've tried. Not a favorite.

1. Smells fruity like grapefruit and lemon fresh
2. The smell is ok, but doesn't last
3. I think Clinique had a grapefruit scent perfume that can possibly be "similar" to this one.

This is a pretty scent. Its mostly floral(Heliotrope) & does put you in mind of summer. I don't smell any coconut at all & no rose. It is a skin scent from start to finish. The longevity isn't very good at only 3-4 hours. While its a lovely scent & might be worth it to some to keep respraying its not to me because it doesn't project at all either.

I bought this today after trying it on a second time and I absolutely love it! ❤️ The name matches the scent just perfectly I think. I sense an aqua/ocean note in this that is just beautiful, or is it just me?

Smelled this for the first time today. I sprayed it on my arm just to get a idea of the scent.... wow, I was blown away. It is fresh, clean with a slight sweetness. Clean does a great job of that. Not too strong but this has lasted a long time. I would love for my lady to smell like this one.
Smells really good- not sure how to describe it but it's very well rounded, not too sharp or sweet.
I’ve only smelled it on a card, but this could be an awesome summer scent for gourmand lovers! Funny there is always another scent out there that I suddenly NEED! ;-)

Wow, this is gorgeous! After hating the first spray test when I received it, it sat for 2 weeks and I get it now! This is like a musky cotton candy. The violets are prominent and the sandalwood reads as cinnamon rolls. It's a gorgeous scent. Really sweet, musky, and floral.

Love love LOVE this scent. Some people say that a few notes are overpowering, but on my body chemistry this scent is only a bit more than subtle, no where near over-powering, and so pleasant on the skin, it smells like skin, but deeper, a smooth yet dark scent, I think the term "Noir" in the name fits almost perfect, I really could imagine a gruff detective in a Noir film or a dashing femme fatale wearing this scent, my only real issue with it, since it is alcohol free, it sticks to the skin slightly, and I do like to put it on my wrist and neck, so it feels a little sticky for a time, but it's a small price to pay to smell so mysterious, so eerie, like I hold a thousand secrets that will die with me. Quite irresistible. Will definitely be buying the full bottle. 9.5/10.

I really wanted to like this because in theory it checks all my boxes (minus patchouli), but I've found that whenever I try a Clean fragrance with a patchouli note it overpowers EVERYTHING. So I end up hating it... way too sharp, way too persistent. I wish this existed without patchouli because before it smothered the rest of the notes, I did like this!

This is the best and most versatile fragrance Clean has ever released. I am absolutely in love with this. My favorite fragrance category has always been powdery sweet iris or violet scents so I am biased but it's still amazing. It's sweet with our being gourmand and it's noticeable without being too heavy. I would say this is a more nighttime scent but it's perfect for the daytime as well. It's definitely one of those "your skin but better scents" so it's perfect for warm weather but there's also something very comforting about it making it a great choice for cold weather as well. The violet, musk, and vanilla are definitely the most prominent notes and they are blended beautifully. Considering making this my new signature scent. 10/10 absolutely love this.
doesn't smell all that unique when you spray it at first. but the dry down is divine. smells like skin with a subtle hint of sweetness that lingers. it's quite nice

I applied it an hour ago thinking, wow this smells like hairspray, but then sat down to draw. As I was drawing, I kept thinking, what is that wonderful smell I keep getting a whiff of? It's the dry-down! Excellently clean but dark, like water in the shade. I can see how it comes off as chemical for some, but it's a pleasant chemical that smells quite fresh.
It smelled good on the little paper but when I sprayed it onto my skin it reminded me too much of a cleaning spray :/

The combination of violet and patchouli dates scent in a way that I don't enjoy.

Gave it to my younger brother

I'm very surprised at the notes. I get straight up aldehydic civet from this (hence the name I'm guessing?) and bought a travel spray on impulse at Sephora because it was a total love at first sniff. Personally, most of what I get is musk with maybe a little violet giving it that powdery (some might say "pissy") aspect. I don't get citrus or orange blossom/neroli (phew) or patchouli (thank god). I absolutely love this and it will be a getting a lot of wear in the coming weeks/months (it's more suited for cooler days/nights). I have never fallen in love with anything this brand had done but man, this is super good. Lasts a good few hours on my skin which is surprising considering most of what I tested from Clean only lasts 2-3 hours. Pleasantly surprised!

For starters I don’t think the listed notes are correct, big one is a lack of amber and I get zero orange. Anyway, wasn’t expecting to like this one that much, I think the water based thing is kind of a gimmick, but it actually grew a lot on me, I mostly get sandalwood, vanilla, white musk, amber, and patchouli. There’s also a big of fresh almost aquatic floral notes that make it a really nice summer scent, it’s not super unique but I really like fresher take on amber scents and it’s good for when you wanna have something without wasting a more expensive scent, also inoffensive if that’s a concern. Overall it’s a lot better than I expected

At first this gives the vibe of a nicer gift shop (I guessed cedar and rose, but that must be the sandalwood and violet). Within a half hour it sours a little on me. But then it mellows in the drydown. With moderate longevity and sillage, this is one of the best in the H2Eau line.

When I bought Clean’s H2Eau discovery set, this was the fragrance I was the most skeptical of, as I don’t like patchouli, vanilla, or amber (yes, amber. The notes listed here on Fragrantica are incorrect). I tend towards fruity-floral fragrances, as I live in the tropics and almost anything else is too heavy for this climate. When I did a preliminary sniff of all the bottles in the set though, this is the one that caught my attention. It’s warm and musky, but in a soft, comforting way that works for winter here (it’s 80 degrees in February).

This collection does leave a sticky, tacky feel on the skin, but I haven’t experienced any clothes staining. I haven’t sprayed directly on fabric so I don’t know if that would cause staining, but I haven’t had any issues with skin-to-clothing transfer.

The other issue I’ve been having with this line is they all go through a transitional period where they smell… off. Initial application smells great, dry down is lovely, but in between there’s a temporary period where it goes kinda ick. It isn’t as noticeable with this one and I’m not quite sure how to explain how it smells with Musk Noir, but with a couple of the more floral ones there’s a decaying flower/fruit smell. I suspect it’s some sort of reaction that results as part of the water-based, non-alcohol formulation this line uses.

Speaking of florals, this one leans feminine when first applied due to the floral top notes, but the dry down is much more unisex.

Actual notes as listed on Clean’s website:
Top: Lily, Violet, Musk
Mid: Musk, Vanilla, Amber
Dry: Sandalwood, Patchouli, Musk

There’s NO citrus in this.

Be warned - this line of H2EAU fragrances stains clothing like a spill of vegetable oil. It is not alcohol based so when you apply, make sure to not let it touch fabrics. Also, it gets gummy / sticky. This line is great in concept but disappointing in execution. Sigh.

at least to me it's muchhhh sweeter than clean reserve, the combo of heliotrope, muguet, and praline gives it an almost fluffy, powdery, chocolatey vibe? dare i say it leans almost gourmand on me which is crazy bc i feel like my skin usually makes things smell a little more bitter -- it's pretty ok longevity (around like 4 to 5 hours for me) and it doesnt seem to project all that much (no one has ever commented on it for me) which makes it perfect for a short, casual outting when you want to smell like chocolate without being intrusive to others with it

Compared to Skin on Reverse collection, Muguet & Skin seems to be more edgy. Woody notes and amborxan give the sharpness balancing the heavy sweetness from musk and praline. Personally i like it more.

I smell the original CLEAN skin (which I also own!) DNA in this, plus a LOT of woodiness, but in a pleasant, musky way. The woody notes smell earthy to me in a fairly dry and powdery way. I do pick up just a touch of cardamom and just a hint of florals that I could not put my finger on without seeing the notes. Mostly musk, woods, and a touch of warmth/spice from the cardamom and patchouli! I like it so far but this is my first wear of it!

As a lover of Clean Reserve Skin, i got this as soon as i saw it, not even thinking to sample before hand. do not be like me. This is so much more woody. Not in a bad way, its lovely, but if you aren't prepared for it you might be quite disappointed! I also get quite a bit less floral sweetness, making it feel a bit more masculine.

First impression: As a die hard fan of the Clean Reserve Skin scent and a fan of cardamom in frags, I had high hopes for this one...and I'm a quite underwhelmed. It is very intimate and smells faintly of white white flowers with a shower gel or shampoo element - sometimes I even think of nailpolish :/ there is something harsh about it and to me it has no similarity with Clean Reserve Skin, unfortunately. It does remind me of Gucci Rush somehow - must be that Freesia note? Yeah not sure about this one..
Update: it actually has great projection and lasting power on my skin and really good lasting power on cloths, like for days... but it still find it smelling quite synthetic and will be selling my bottle

At the beginning there is some spiciness (the cardamom?), but overall the scent is very sweet. The sweetness in the beginning reminds me of extremely ripe fruit, although the scent itself is not fruity.

After the spiciness subsides, the scent reminds me of warm, sweet, condensed milk. Borderline cloying, and not fresh. To me, more cozy than sensual. I’ve enjoyed wearing this during snowy winter days. This could also work as a late summer evening scent. It seems to become more floral when I work out, so might smell different during summer. Sometimes I sense some woodiness, but it’s very subtle.

My boyfriend likes this. Said it smells “sensual” and “like a victoria’s secret model” without me telling him what the perfume is supposed to smell like. I’m very curious how this compares to the reserve skin perfume, as it seems to have a similar vibe.

Two sprays lasts me the whole day, and I can faintly smell the perfume next morning. Others can only smell it when they’re close to me, which I like.

I blind bought this from another person based on liking CLEAN classic skin. The classic version is soapier, fresher, suitable for every day and season. I guess they are somewhat similar, but to me, these are different scents. I currently prefer the classic version. Muguet & skin will probably be something I need to be in the mood for (very sweet and milky).

I have tried all of the Clean Avant Garden scents and this is one of my least favs. Full disclosure, I'm not a fan of skin scents in general but I love much of the Clean Reserve and Clean Avant Garden line so I wanted to give it a fair try. It smells strongly of the skin component right away, and in the dry down that's all you are left with. I was hoping that I would smell some of the woody notes (which I generally like) but they are AWOL. If you really, really like Clean's other skin scents, this may be for you. But if you are expecting something more multifaceted, at least try before you buy.

Smell like cotton soaked with milk on my skin

But in the good way 😄

product_name: Summer Splash Warm Cotton Breeze Clean
review_content:
It is an inoffensive scent which focuses mainly on aldehydes
citruses with a touch of greenness, followed by light floral musk in the background. It isn't memorable and long-lasting.

product_name: Summer Splash Warm Cotton Breeze Clean
review_content: Blind bought this for $14.99, and so glad I did. It starts off as the previous reviewer mentioned: a bit bathroom spray-ish, but it turns soft and fresh and light as air quickly. Quite frankly, the bottle is so pretty that even if I hated the scent, I'd keep it for the bottle. It's a simple rectangle of blue glass, but it's this gorgeous carribean aqua blue that catches the light spectacularly, and the lettering is a happy, sunny yellow. Everything about this fragrance is sunshine in a bottle. One of the few Clean scents that truly works for me.

product_name: Summer Splash Warm Cotton Breeze Clean
review_content:
Refreshing and Uplifting. This is a very light version of Warm Cotton. It instantly lifts my mood and it's like spraying liquid sunshine. The fragrance and projection does not last like a stronger perfume but I do notice a very light aroma for many hours and sometimes that's all that matters.
It's a very personal, close to the heart fragrance. I absolutely love it!
Update: Recently in 106 degree weather this is the only one that survived the heat change. It did not become overly sweet and transform into a hidious aroma. It remained fresh and nice.

product_name: Summer Splash Warm Cotton Breeze Clean
review_content: More citrusy than the original but they're both similar

I'm not sure if it's because I compare everything to food, or I'm not familiar with galbanum, but this smells like fresh pickling brine on me. This perfume is long lasting and the scent doesn't change much over time, but it only takes a few minutes to make pickles or to eat one, so I'm left wondering how long I want to smell this way.

Did a blind buy from a thrift store no less, full bottle - $15.00 ! Good deal. Ironic that it was an overcast day as well. I have nothing more to add but you gotta like oak moss (which I though the IFRA banned a few years ago, no ?) , vetiver and general "greenery". Personally, I would have liked a little "sweetness" in there -- but , I guess that's not the point. In my opinion , the opening smells nicer than the dry down.

This is heaven for clean scent lovers. It is literally the smell of a dark, rainy day in a forest. Galbanum is really lovely in this one and makes it unisex. You clearly need to love moss notes to love this one. Very gentle and pleasant, but with excellent sillage and longevity.

Love this fragrance, one of my favorites. Definitely something that anyone can wear, truly unisex. A nice alternative for those who don't want the sweet fragrances that seem to be the all the rage lately. Faintly floral, but mostly woody/mossy and clean with a hint of incense. Impressive sillage and longevity.
cucumber

I'm sure this is just my funky skin chemistry, which makes many fragrances diverge from their intended notes, but this smells like straight up celery on me. I get that celery is watery and it is definitely the galbanum, not the rain component, that is responsible for this. However, the effect is like taking a deep whiff of celery seeds right out of your spice cupboard. I was hoping it would dry down to something wearable, but the celery seed smell persists. I have Clean's Rain fragrance, and it doesn't do this to me at all, so again perhaps that's just how galbanum works on my skin. Nevertheless, I highly recommend testing before buying just in case you have the same reaction as I did.

Wonderful fresh opening with the patchouli adding just the slightest amount of sweetness to fool my nose into wondering if there is some light fruit hidden somewhere in there. This initial sweetness, however, quickly gives way to a delightful blend of wet green and woody notes. It indeed conjures up images of walking through the countryside, passing green pastures and going by patches of forest right after a heavy rain. It's really really well done.

The dry-down is heavy on the moss and vetiver, but kept at a very fresh level via the "water notes" - whatever those are. Btw. is it just me, or does the prominent moss give it a bit of a 70s retro vibe? It just reminds me a bit of some products my mom would use when I was a kid.

Sillage is arm length on me. Longevity is very decent. At least inside in the AC it lasts a whole day.

Personally I find this to be perfectly unisex, and I'm someone who usually gravitates towards so called 'girly' fragrances. There's nothing too harsh in it to make it smell too male or cologne-y to me. The vetiver in here is very pleasing and mild. I would absolutely wear this.

Now, would I spend that kind of money on it? Probably not. But that's just cause at the end of the day it's not completely up my alley. It's very nice alright, it just doesn't knock me off my feet. But that's just me, I can see this being someone's favorite, absolutely.

Bottom line, it's a well-blended lovely high-quality fragrance. Maybe not ground-breaking, but definitely quite lovely. At this price tag, however, testing before buying is a must.

Very good, but also kind of familiar. I'm guessing that the "watery effect" in the official note pyramid is, in fact, violet leaf. The first association for me was Narciso Rodriguez for Him EDT. Then I started to get more woody notes with a bit of incense and was therefore reminded of DSquared2 Intense He Wood. Both are heavy on the violet leaf, which gives off this wet and damp, slightly sour impression. But it seems that Galbanum & Rain doesn't have the artificial "chemical" sourness that I got from Intense He Wood.

I had high hopes for the Avant Garden collection since I've found previous Clean Reserve offerings to be pleasant but overly "clean". This is a bit of a letdown. It's woody-aquatic with some sweet green notes, but it smells like a go-to office scent for a well-groomed man. I gravitate to woody, incensy unisex scents and own quite a few fragrances geared towards men, so it's odd for me to find this too masculine, but maybe what I dislike is the work appropriateness of this particular masculine scent. It's not a bad scent. But for me it's too buttoned up and functional to warrant the luxury price tag or the designation as "avant" anything.

I´m beginning to have a serious addiction to avant garden collection from clean. They are a bit expensive but definetly worth it.

I have tried the other Rain scents from clean...but this one is by far the best.

Sweet, earthy, light summer rain. Wet Woody forrest notes. Starts off with water notes and dries down to sweet, woody greens and lovely galbanum.

This is very comforting and dreamy. Uplifting an soothing and the same time.

Longevity and silage are above average on my skin and clothes.

So lovely... wonderful and different in a very plesant way.
It's very soapy and kinda potent i would mostly just recommend this while working out it has no florals is kinda dry 6/10

This is very similar to warm cotton. With that being said if you want to smell like mr. Clean with a mix of tide or gain this is for you. It’s extremely nauseating and headache inducing. The aldehydes over power the entire scent to where you can’t smell any of the other notes. It’s very strong at first but after an hour or two the scent is gone. 0/10 for me

Looking for a just very good perfume? -Look no moore, this is it!

10/10

I "blind" bought this based on the reviews, and the comparison to Bvlgari Black, which both my husband and I adored when it was available. I agree with the comparison! It is startlingly similar to BB, complete with a faint "rubbery" smell within the first hour of wear! I don't detect the lemon or orange blossom. However, it's warm, soft, woodsy, powdery, and elegant. I would agree that it leans a bit more masculine, but I do love musky scents so I'm still happy to wear it. And I love heliotrope too; it smells mostly of that, sandalwood, cedar, and vanilla to me.
