Got this as a blind buy - and am happy I did. At first I thought it was a bit dated, but as the cold weather is setting in I've found it to be a really understated and elegant scent. Great for the office. Sillage is fine, longevity could be better, but overall, a very nice scent.

I’ve been thinking about decluttering this fragrance because I just have too many perfumes but I’m glad I picked it up and wore it today because this is a really beautiful scent. Someone else said this is a very niche smelling perfume and I totally agree with that.

I don’t have many perfumes in my collection with this combination of santal and heliotrope. It’s sweet, warm, and super duper cozy. I love the combination of the cinnamon, slightly soapy orange blossom, bright lemon, sweet heliotrope and vanilla, and woody sandalwood. The vanilla in the base helps to make the scent increasingly sweet as it dries down.

It projects very softly and has a decent longevity, so I think I’m actually going to keep this. I’m really enjoying my scent bubble. It’s unisex, leaning a little femme but I would love to smell this on my boyfriend as he pulls off a lot of different scents well. Lowkey, it’s reminding me a bit of Mix:Bar’s Vanilla Bourbon. Both are woody, spicy, with a sweet vanilla note. Clean did a great job with this scent.

The opening is gorgeous, thankfully the cinnamon is very soft (a note that can get very overwhelming to me) and the lemon is too. I don't find it masculine in this stage, but it does smell quity soapy and clean. It's a very creamy scent through all the stages.

Santal and heliotrope is very descriptive, those are the dominant notes and what dominates as the scent dries down too. It does not smell like almonds, but it does smell like heliotrope.

I agree that it's a cozy and comfy scent. It's very smooth and mild. Longevity and sillage is not the best, and it does get a bit cloying if you overspray. Performs pretty good the fist hour, then settes down to more of a skin scent the following hours. A very nice one!

Initial thoughts were wow, this does smell really clean. And a bit masculine. I think it’s the combination of a citrus opening and a woody base…. Luckily this wears off quick. Like within 5 minutes.

After 5 mins this becomes sweeter, and you can smell the effect of the heliotrope, although not really any orange blossom. During this middle stage it has a nice almondy vibe, a sweet, nutty scent. Not a super strong cherry like almond, or anything remotely as almondy as something like Italica, its more of a soft, gentle comforting warm almond than an in your face one. The middle is infinitely more feminine than the opening. Like a totally different fragrance!

After an hour or so of almond it gets progressively more powdery, but still projects a lovely bitter almond creamy sweetness. If you smell your skin it smells almost soapy, it’s such a bitter almond. Hard to describe but it’s lovely.

From 2 hours after spraying the sandalwood gets stronger. It still projects but is richer, a bit less powdery. I like this stage best, it lasts maybe another hour or 2.

Then in the late dry down you get a sandalwood almost skin scent, that’s more of a soft feminine sandalwood rather than a strong woody note. Lasts maybe 6 hours until it’s just a soft skin scent.

I was hoping for more sandalwood sooner, as currently I have many sandalwood fragrances I prefer more than this. But if you buy this expecting powdery almond it’s really quite lovely.

Very niche smelling, and unlike anything in my collection.

I adore this fragrance. It's cozy and enveloping and for this reason I try to layer with anything I can. My absolute favorite layering combo is this scent with YSL Libre. To my surprise it creates a deeper, richer Mon Guerlain scent.
Definitely has a masculine edge but in a good way. The way a woman turns her partner's oversized hoodie into her own. It's that kind of burrowing comfort.

This was a disappointing blind buy. I find it very masculine-leaning and it bears a striking resemblance to the cologne that wafts out of Hollister as you walk by. I don't get vanilla or orange blossom from this at all, just a strong lemon in the opening and a lightly spiced woody fragrance with a faint powdery heliotrope in the dry down. Sadly, I can see how others like this and get a more unisex powdery sandalwood and vanilla scent, but it doesn't come off that way to me. It also gives me a headache on every wear.

This one is interesting! I first sprayed on a small area of my wrist at work and asked co workers what they thought. I got descriptions such as "it smells like a Barbie or baby doll," to "it smells like a cleaning product", to, "I just don't like it" to "damn that smells sexy!" That day I agreed with "I just don't like it." But I have to give perfumes a real chance to see how I feel. The next day I did a couple sprays around my neck and some on both wrists and went to work. I asked the same question again having different people to check it out. Every single one of them said it smelled really good! And I agreed! I move around a lot at work and kept getting whiffs of it all day. It lasted through an 8 hour shift! This is a soft hug, a log cabin, a rainy day, a fall breeze, because this smells softly and woody to me. It's incredibly cozy and comforting. There's no harsh edges, just softness. It's like cashmere, Madagascar vanilla, and soft woods with a touch creamy floral. This is identical to something that B&BW came out with 7 or so years ago. It was a one time only creamy cozy vanilla fall scent. They only had it one time so I kept my 2 bottles of the lotion for a long time. They're long gone and I'll never know or remember what they were lol! This one is good! Don't be scared!

Agree with other reviewer, this is gorgeous. Really comforting, warm and cosy. Perfect fall, winter perfume. It comes off to me like a modern re-working of a classic like Shalimar or even Opium. Not nearly as heavy as those. Much lighter and classier. But I love cinnamon in a fragrance when it's done well - meaning it's in the background. And the vanilla citrus mix is great. Dry, rather than syrupy or sweet. I don't get any almond notes from the Heliotrope in the title, but beautiful nevertheless. The santal gives it a lovely spiciness.

Expensive and sophisticated scent from clean.

Woodsy, cinnamon, heliotrope and tasty vanilla....very well blended with citrus.

Definitely a unisex.

Sweet ( but not too sweet) and dry. Louder than whispers in the library from Maison Margiela,

Warm and comforting like a cuddle-up-blanket.
Nice clean and highly refined.

Will be perfect for autumn and winter days.

Silage and longevity is both amazing on me. Worth every penny !

This will be an all time clean favorite for me.

Love love love !

I was hoping for a sweet playful summer scent, in the style of Pina Colada. Sweet, fresh, easy to wear. This reminds me of Coconut Skin by Phlur. It's more dark and muddy coconut, more green or woody, to my nose. It's clean, which i really enjoy, but to me, it's more a scent for the colder summer days.

A little fresh sweetness from the pineapple in the beginning, and after a while it becomes a more grow up, woody, creamy coconut, in a not sunscreen-y way.

I've found myself growing out of my old summer scents. They just don't hit the spot any more: beeing to sweet, to fruity, to strong and even to childish. When I walked by the display of this I immediately became intrigued, as Clean has inpressed with some scents in the past. I absolute love this summer scent! It starts of fruity with the pineapple, but not to sweet or overpowering. The coconut milk then comes through, beeing soft and tropical without screaming COCONUT. After a few hours it smells like warm skin after a day on the beach, warm and delicious, but still discreet. It's a very subtle scent and comes of as quite delicate for a summer scent.

I love Clean perfumes and this is no exception. It's floral and fruity, very summery and beautiful. The pineapple note is there but so well mixed in that the perfume doesn't smell like pineapple juice. This has some similarities with Escada summer editions but quality and longevity are better. I might even get a backup bottle of this delight!
smells like laundry soap .
smells like cleaning products. one of my favorites
Can’t stand the smell of cheap laundry soap yuckkkkkkkk scrubber and on top it immediately gave me an allergic skin reaction
this smells exactly like the lemon mr clean 😳 i would use this as a room freshener, or wear it at home for coziness but not sure about wearing it out ..

I used to love this and get compliments on it. There is also a shampoo and shower gel from Ida warg that smells exactly like it. But now I associate the scent with my ex and my past as he loved it too. Also I find it a little screechy nowadays.

My boyfriend now hates soapy scents so I doubt he’d like this so I dont think this is a man eater scent lmfao. Just making that clear. 😂
Smells like laundry day. Clean, quiet, beautiful sunny day with fresh clothes, and bedding. Yummy.
I do not like this as a perfume. It is too strong in the citrus opening, and reminds me of cleaning products. I use my bottle as a room spray. I will not be repurchasing.

Love this. But it has been «taken» from me by my man ha ha. He loves squeaky clean and fresh vibe scent gives he doesnot like sweet perfumes and always compliments me when I wear Tardes or Iris poudre btw.
WC Scent smells even better on him, love. We share this both, but its funny how it became signature, completely unexpected and so fast😍
I don't get detergent or laundry anything from this at all. It's straight up lemon disinfectant. A freshly mopped bathroom floor. So clean definitely, but not warm or cotton!
i like to spray this perfume on my sheets or clothes sometimes but not on my skin reminds me of air freshener or like lemony floor disinfectant not a huge fan but it’s okay
Smells like a really nice candle you'd get at Bath & Body Works. Pleasant scent, but not what I want to smell like. Works well as a room freshener or to spray on your comforter.
Reminds me of washing the dishes and using a lot of lemon dish soap because it smelled so good
I went to ULTA and they had a tester and I don’t remember if it was this one or the pure soap scent but this smells like dove original soap bar and a fabric softener sheets but in a good way.
This is genuinely laundry detergent - so job well done😃👍
galaxy brain fragrance where you do a full 360 back to the start and decide you actually wanna just smell like cozy warm dryer sheet cause that’s kinda awesome
This is not like warm cotton but more like running dish washer.

Absolutely smells like nice breezy fresh detergent. I always liked detergent scents.
Is the only profile I can tolerate on other people when they walk by because I think they are wearing freshly laundered clothing instead of perfume.
I really wanted to like this. But just.....no.

Too sharp and strong, for me it actually smelt like a washing detergent
I will not buy it again

Smells exactly like fabric softener with no other nuance. A little too literal. Not into it as a standalone but I mix with other "fresh" fragrances. Pairs well with Clean Skin and oddly enough my DKNY Delicious

I went to the perfumeria some two weeks ago and sniffed though all their Clean perfumes, l think l can collect all of them, but this day l came home with this little, stunningly good beauty!

These Clean perfumes have always been on my radar, but l dont know how they managed to get lost in my odd space, or, proably because l bought this perfume as a pressie to a very special woman some 12 y ago...

Nevermind, at last it's mine, and it smells as wondeful as you other loving fans describe it, and it is def a COWABONGA good perfume!

Citrus, verbena, cotton, and musk with aquatic notes lingering somewhere in the background. A very clean scent that smells like lemon detergent powder. This smells like walking into a self-service laundromat with every customer busily pouring in detergent onto the machine and simultaneously putting it into wash/spin mode. I've never smelled any fresh laundry fragrance this straightforward. It's so "in-your-face laundry day".

It's called "warm cotton" but I'm honestly not getting much warmth. Just pure clean, lemony detergent. If you like that, good for you. But if you want more dimension to your fresh laundry fragrance, you might wanna layer this with something floral or warm (I might layer this with some sweet florals just to tone down the harshness). Or try other fresh soap fragrances like Maison Margiela's Bubble Bath or Lazy Sunday Morning.

---Oh, another thing this reminds me of: That lemon-scented dish soap paste in a tub my mother used to buy when I was a child. I think it was Ajax? O_o

Exactly what @riclovesscents said. This got this dishwasher lemony smell that I thought I’d like but don’t. It smells more like a dishwashing soap then laundry detergent which wasn’t what I was looking for. Nevertheless it smells pretty nice for smth decently priced but its pretty boring as all your getting is that lemon and nothing more. My search for the perfect laundry smell continues.
It smelled like lysol cleaning products to me. Way too much lemon for my taste
Wow what a clean laundry scent. Fluffy warm towels, no over powering notes, definitely full bottle worthy.

This thing is quite popular in Japan, borderline hyped, because some people think the smell of laundry detergent to be “inoffensive”. NO!!!
Tried this as I once fell for the hype but had to scrub it off. Very headache inducing because of the mixture of harsh, artificial soapy smell and the linen/sheets notes that are strangely photorealistic…so much so that I could smell the dust underneath. Bedspread without any contextual clues, like the texture, pleasantness of the morning sun…is just a piece of sanitized cloth. Maybe for some people this works alright. I really think we should stop associating the soapy aquaric with inoffensive and crowd-pleasing, at least in my country. Because I believe there are better things than to resort to what’s marketed as a crowd-pleasing and “inoffensive”…including not wearing any fragrance in certain occasions.

Smells just like fresh lemon cleaner or Gain laundry detergent. I personally LOVE that smell but I could see how a lot of people wouldn’t like that and expect a more abstract scent. I hope they never discontinue this because it is the one scent I’ve found that actually smells like detergent or dish soap and it’s my favorite scent in the world.

A strong citrus opening overwhelmed me, making the fragrance almost unbearable. It’s one of the few I didn’t finish, even though it was just a sample. Later, it calmed down a bit, only to fade away entirely rather quickly.
horrible. might as well drench yourself in tide laundry detergent.
@candiedpeach, I'm afraid your review is on the wrong page. Cool Cotton is not the same as Warm Cotton. They are very different.

This is terrible. Yes I can smell what they're going for, but goodness gracious this stuff could take your head off. It's just way too chemically. I got this in the Clean Classic sample pack and this is easily the worst one. Apple Blossom is way better to me although even that one is quite chemically as well.
Very soapy, citrussy and clean scent. It smells a lot like a dish soap or laundry detergent. Makes me feel fresh and fun!

Assuming this is the same perfume I have, though my bottle says Cool Cotton for some reason instead of Warm Cotton being the scent. This doesn't sit too well with me out of the atomizer. I really like clean cotton natured scents, especially for a candle, but this smells like burnt cotton to me. Not clean. I can almost smell some kind of cleaner behind the cotton note. That's definitely the citrus. I went ahead and sprayed this onto my blanket because the smell from the atomizer freaked me out, and it smells exactly like Clorox wipes. Not an exaggeration, EXACTLY. I let it dry down too, just because I was confused, but the scent didn't change. If you love the smell of disinfecting wipes and want to smell like it for yourself, go ahead and get this. Very confused where the burnt cotton smell ran away to. Honestly outside the atomizer isn't a bad smell, I just don't think I could wear it because of how much it smells like Clorox. I'll probably keep it to spray my bedsheets or laundry. I don't know.

Clean Warm Cotton does capture the essence of fresh laundry in a very photorealistic way, evoking the smell of crisp, clean linens. It’s like walking into a room filled with laundry products, which is both its charm and its drawback. The scent is quite loud and prominent, making it feel intense and possibly overwhelming. While it smells good and true to its name, the strong, laundry-like aroma might not be the ideal choice if you prefer something more subtle or complex.

It reminds me of powder detergent and airwick wall fresheners.

I have never in my life used laundry products that smelled like this. When I think of a linen fragrance, I think floral/watery/aldehydic/musk. This is a cascade pod or blue dawn dish detergent from start to finish. Lemon verbena is a prominent note used in several cleaning solutions and while I don’t mind my countertops smelling of it, it doesn’t smell like something that should be worn on your skin. I don’t want to smell like a freshly sanitized hard surface, I want to smell of warm bedsheets fresh from the dryer. And for $40?! FRIEND, NO.

I don’t know what they use in the US to do laundry. But this smells like straight up lemon dish soap!. No laundry like at all. My first thought was FAIRY liquid dish soap exactly that!.
Primark has better linen sprays. Maison Margiela Lazy Sunday morning smells more like sun drenched laundry. Ohhhh what a disappointment.
Freshly washed white bath towels with a tad too much detergent :') I like this, maybe could be a bit less soapy though. But definitely clean and fresh perfume, that's for sure!

Smells EXACTLY like detergent, I thought it would be a more abstract kind of laundry smell but no. The dry down is more pleasant than the initial smell, but I will be selling my bottle. I recommend Egyptian Musk by Nemat if you want to smell like beautiful clean powdery linen.
Smells exactly like a 5 star luxury hotel bathroom

For literally anyone who just wants to smell like clean laundry. Not very solar like other clean scents I’ve smelled. By solar I think of the scent you get from sun dried on a clothes line after washing, this is just like I have good laundry detergent. Very basic would t buy a perfume for this just maybe a clothes spray.

Smells like fresh clean laundry. Nice inoffensive scent. I really liked using it when I was doing my teacher training because it's so intimate that it doesn't really bother anyone but still gave me that fresh and clean feeling.
Longevity isn't the best (around 2-4 hours for me) but I own the rollerball version so reapplying during the day isn't a problem for me.

I bought this to use as a room/bed spray to keep my apartment smelling fresh. It smells like wet clothes that were just washed with about half a jug of very strong laundry detergent. It is very very strong and can be headache inducing so he careful if you are prone to that. But overall, it does smell very fresh and clean.

I have opted to use this as a “before you go” toilet spray. The lemon and verbena combo smells exactly like the little Lysol lemon toilet clips.

It is headache inducing and harsh for skin.
It is headache inducing and sharp on fabric.
It does quite well as a bathroom freshener.

I am so grateful for this community. I thought it smelled fine, but then I kept reading that so many people thought it smelled like wet dog, and then I couldn't stop smelling wet dog. Thank you for keeping me from smelling like a wet dog.

@bijoubean and @aenflex covered this fragrance brilliantly with their reviews. Clean classic warm cotton succeeds in only one thing, and that’s to create a smell (not a scent..,) that neither leans masculine nor feminine. This toxic waste of a fragrance is as unworthy of being called feminine as the term masculine. I’d like to echo the notion of other reviewers in this thread and concur that it smells harsh, synthetic and overall unpleasant. I cannot grasp how anyone could possibly stand this smell on their own person or their surroundings. Like @bijoubean I’ve been using it on my bed from time to time rather than tossing the bottle in the dumpster, but like her I’ve found it too harsh for that usage as well. I suppose I should probably just get rid of this sooner rather than later. I cannot image myself ever wanting to wear it ever again. Disgusting fragrance in my opinion.

I initially did not care for this because it has a strong citrus opening. It smells very synthetic and like cleaning solution at first. However, when it fades, I do get a nice soft cotton, clean laundry smell. I wear this to work since I personally get low projection with this. It also doesn't last very long on me.

It’s very citrus forward for the first few minutes. Lemon, specifically - synthetic, cleaning chemical lemon. Then it’s straight up Tide powder. After about an hour it’s salty. The way skin smells after Atlantic Ocean water has dried on it. Mixed with Tide. The dry down is actually disgusting. I’ve never used those words to describe a fragrance before.

Weird. Strong, definitely could be considered harsh.

I use unscented laundry soap. No fabric softener. But I always smell those people who choose to use ALL the fabric softener and scents beads on their clothing. If you’re one of those, you might like this.

It’s Tide, bottled and spray-able. The whole composition is super synthetic.

I get ZERO citrus from this. It smells like laundry detergent, but in a good way. The opening is a little harsh, but on me, it dries down to a warm and cozy scent. I must say, however, that I find it both smells and lasts better on clothes than on skin. At least on my skin, the drydown reminds me a little too much of a chlorinated pool.

Like others have said, there’s nothing warm or comforting about Clean Classic Warm Cotton. It’s straight up astringent, chemical, harsh detergent smelling. Stings my nose and makes my eyes water. I can’t for the life of me understand why anyone would like this on their skin. In an attempt to use up the bottle, I spritz my bedding and it works ok as a linen spray. Even then, it’s still too harsh so better to do it long before you’re going to bed.
Smells like straight tide which I love.
very bad it poop on god smells like dishmedel

Oof. I always am intrigued by scents with descriptors like "linens" or "sheets" or anything indicating it'll make me feel like I'm wrapped up in the fuzziest blanket straight out of the dryer. This is NOT it. lol. Soooo sour, with a chemical blast in the forefront. And it just lingers around a cheap off-brand detergent scent after it calms down a bit.

Like others have said... there's nothing warm about this. Except it almost makes me squint my eyes like I'm looking directly into the Sun, but it's because of such a sharp feeling in the nose after I spray it. Hard pass.

Maybe I'll try and re-home this to a friend.
This smells like straight up laundry detergent, nothing more to say
If you like the smell of laundry fabric softeners/washing powder then this is for you. It projects lot more than Rain or Skin. So if you are after fresh laundry smell on you I can recommend this one.

The exact smell of the dishwasher after it finished a program and warm steam comes out. I can’t feel the laundry scent which I would like, unfortunately it definitely smells like dishwasher..
Besides the longevity and sillage is zero to me.
Way overpriced!
I hate it, smells like a laundry detergent that’s so strong.

This is the worst perfume I have ever smelled aside from Youth Dew lol.

I love laundry smell and I love citrus, but together is a hard no from me. It smells like toilet cleaner. I can almost taste it. Don’t even want to put it on to experience the dry down. I can’t. My mom thought it was alright so maybe it’s just my wonky nose.
I purchased a discovery set and absolutely all of the fragrances smelt so harsh, like potent male cologne. This harsh DNA dominated all of the scents and made them off putting.
i personally love the smell of fresh laundry more than anything! this scent is so so warm and comforting it's definitely my favorite!
to much of a strong scent for me so i will use it for the bathroom

Got this as my first perfume from my dad...

Legit smells liks laundry and toilet spray. If you want to smell like laundry then sure go ahead but I do not recommend at all 💀
The laundry detergent smell of this perfume is too strong. It may smell good on clothes, but I definitely don't want to smell like that.

Not a lot to chew on here. It literally smells like clean warm laundry. I have the travel size and wear it on my schlubby no makeup/sweatpants/unwashed hair/running errands days; it makes me feel a little more put together.

Classic Clean is the original Warm Cotton in a newer bottle. At first spray a sharp citrus with sudsy warm water hits my nose. Then a breezy scent of the ocean emerges and expands, reminding me of freshly washed beach towels slowly drying in the sun. It leaves a clean warm scent on both skin and fabric that lasts all day. Totally unisex, this refreshing scent is non offensive and easily wearable for anyone of any age, any time of year. This Warm Cotton and its counterpart Cool Cotton work very well when sprayed into shoes to make them smell clean and fresh, too.

if im honest i was disappointed with this at first- i smelled it in store as a fantastic fresh linen scent, bought a travel size and found out it dried down to be very aquatic/marine, a scent type i generally hate (a lot of beaches in my area growing up were covered in rotting seaweed and i now i cant smell the ocean without associating the two. if youve smelled it you understand💀). i was resigned to find a new laundry scent, but then a few weeks later i got a bottle for my birthday!

going into retesting the scent with the idea that i hated it kind of made it seem better than i remembered. i think the shock made the marine notes stand out to me more initially, but now after wearing it i think theyre subtle enough that it just brings a refreshing feel to the fragrance, and not much else (thank goodness). it is something i have to be in the mood for, but its grown on me quite a bit! definitely suited for warm weather and although it does wear off pretty fast ultimately i think its great
This one smelled straight up like fabric softner. Although its clean I cannot picture myself smelling like laundry. I would use this as linen spray.

This is so aggressively "laundry detergent". If that is your thing look no further, this is the scent for you. Discount stores have it sometimes, I got mine at Marshall's for $12. It is not my favorite fragrance, but it's great when I don't have time to wash my work uniform

The first 30 seconds are extra citrusy, harsh and screechy, but it very quickly mellows down to a soft and warm detergent-like scent that is very comforting and kind of makes you feel safe.

Projection and longevity are surprisingly good, almost too strong in my opinion. As it will remind most people of detergent, putting on too much will trigger people to react to it, which is not necessarily the goal here.

This one celebrates my 200th review on this website. Yay!!

Totally agreed with @matchanincense below. I get no 'warmth' from this fragrance. All I get is lemony citrus and a hint of sea salt. It is admittedly pleasant, though the first spray is very sharp and chemical.

Yes, it does remind me of laundry detergent, but I like laundry detergents anyway so I can wear this one without issues.

Despite that, I don't think I'll be getting a bottle of this one. (I've got a 2ml sample with me here.) It reminds me a bit too much of the moist underground laundry room at International Hall (where I stayed during my masters studies) at Russel Square, London. That room smelt like this all the time.

I don't know which season this would fit. It's lemon-scented laundry detergent so I suppose it's all seasons because everyone uses detergents all year round.

I have a lot of citrus scents but this one is not a dupe of anything that I own currently. It is strong, mind you. I was able to fill the living room wearing four sprays from another room and walk in here.

Regarding price, it's not the best, but not the worst, either. Whilst I understand the ethics of Clean fragrances, I guess I would still say it is overpriced by a little. It's not natural (as laundry detergents aren't) and you have to pay about $45 for a 30ml bottle. The design of the bottle won't win any awards and the same goes for the packaging. I sort of expect more, to be honest, but hey, at least, it does smell clean!

Edit: I think it smells somewhat similar to John Varvatos Artisan Blu, though that one is not as sharp or pungent. I prefer Artisan Blu to this one. Clean Warm Cotton lasts 5 hours on me.

a little too sterile and strong for my tastes and not getting any “warmth” from it

I’d prefer Lazy Sunday Morning or Body Fantasies Fresh White Musk for a clean linens smell

There has been a change because this is now a BEAST MODE freshy that is ready to stay with you until the day is over!

So… I purchased this several years ago and returned it because although it was exactly what I was looking for as far as scent profile, it did not preform well. I couldn’t even justify spending 20 dollars on a perfume that does not last.

Interestingly enough, here we are today. Lol
After the heat started to rise, I began to crave a clean smell. Specifically, I wanted for the clean aroma from my shower, creams and freshly washed clothes to get a boost! Clean Warm Cotton does it for me!
It lasts ALL DAY. It’s STRONG, SHARP, and THE CLEAN BEAST. Lol

Have you ever walked past someone’s home or establishment and immediately knew that they were doing laundry because of the fabric softener and detergent smell in the air? That’s what this provides.

You need this!

Smells like laundry detergent and I love it. To be more specific, the scent reminds me of when you take your clothes out of the dryer: warm and soft with a lovely detergent and fabric softener smell.

The longevity is great, which was unexpected. Therefore, one should be careful not overspraying this. The citrus and verbena can be overpowering if you spray too many times.
This smells exactly like the blue dawn dish soap to me, super clean. It's also super strong on the border of being harsh

Nothing really new to say here - this is straight up citrus laundry detergent, and an extremely linear scent. I love a good skin scent and enjoy a lot of things Clean offers (Reserve Skin is my favorite) but literal soap scents like this are not for me. It's wholesome and trustworthy, but very boring.

I bought this recently because I like clean scents and especially such that represent a feeling.
This precisely describes the feeling when you open your washing machine and gather the laundry.
To me it is fresh, clean (obviously), warm and somehow cozy scent, invoking good memories and good mood.
Because I love the smell of the fresh laundry.
For people that don't, I guess this wouldn't work.
It is very long lasting on me, more than 7 hours.
There is nothing 'perfumery' in this perfume.
It is just the smell of fresh and clean laundry.
It can cause a headache though because it's so linear and somehow intoxicating.
I am wondering if I would buy it again at some point in the future but it is hard to say.
That's it.

This is my favorite among the clean line, straight up clean laundry detergent upon spraying, as it dries down it evokes a pleasant memory of freshly washed sundried sheets. Matches my way of dressing which is usually a white button down oxford shirt and blue jeans, i mix this with a light spray of bath and body works saltwater breeze body mist, the combo makes me smell fresh all day and the body mist adds a little aquatic sweetness to the mix. Although use warm cotton alone when i'm working with clients (im a makeup artist) and this scent is perfect for clients with sensitive noses.

listen. this doesn’t smell bad and i’m all for the clean girl vibes and stuff, but do i really want to pay 50 bucks to smell like straight up citrusy laundry detergent? might as well just put the latter into a spray bottle - cheaper, lasts longer and maybe even smells better.

Smells like laundry detergent. Starts very like synthetic citrus. It lasts a long time, and the sillage smells good. Smells sharp, not skin-like on the spray, but on the dry down it's better. Makes you smell like fresh lemony laundry, but definitely not warm.

I love this and the reserve version. Smells like laundry detergent. In my opinion, as opposed to the reserve version, which is smoother, you can smell the citrus a little more however on the cool down, they typically smell the same but a little sharper with this version.

I love this so much. It smells like clean laundry but in a comforting kind of way, not in a chemical way. I don't normally enjoy lemony/orangy/aquatic fragrances, but this one it's so soft and soothing. You will smell fresh and put together + the sillage & performance it's good. Also - completely unisex, my boyfriend and me like to use this after showering.

this one by clean is such a winner to me. this scent does exactly what it tells you it will. it smells like warm sheets fresh from the dryer on a cool day, lying down to read a book and the scent of the washing detergent and the warmth congregate to lull you into an accidental slumber, but you don't regret it when you wake up. you feel well rested, and you smell like clean sheets. real longevity on this one skin-wise but i also highly recommend giving your outfit of the day a light spritz with this before you get dressed. give it some time to settle in and put on your fragrance of choice on the skin before getting dressed, you'll be golden.

Definitely smells like clean laundry and laundry detergent. But it's less nuanced than the Warm Cotton Reserve Blend, which I find softer, fuzzier, and cozier to wear. This Classic Warm Cotton version can smell a bit like a Glade air freshener if you spray too much.

sprayed some on, obviously first noticed the scent of laundry detergent. let it settle for one minute, smelt it again and i definitely picked up on the citrus top notes! super refreshing, but in a cozy way? i let it warm up for a couple hours, i'm not sure if i'm picking up on any fruits, there's definitely a teensy bit of an aquatic quality to it. otherwise it's a cozy, extremely clean, and definite spring-time scent. this smells just like freshly-washed sheets!

This was my favorite of the old school Clean fragrances. If you miss it, their Spring Breeze is satisfyingly close! There are a LOT of similar notes. Spring Breeze is less watery but still the same fresh, green vibe.

This is just lovely fresh green, lime, grassy, and then quickly lily of the valley and then dry down to faint LOTV with sandalwood and musk. The top and heart I love but I"m afraid the dry down is just faintly too unisex leaning masculine to me, of course, it's got no projection so it's only me likely smelling it at that point but I just don't care for that smell much. Not offensive though. I'd finish a small bottle if I had it. Good after shower smell.

This gives me headache. A blind buy amongst other clean scents. It was nice at first but boy, so strong, flexing it's strength for a long time and quite heavily. I used it to spray a room instead and wished I hadn't as I kept having a headache entering the room.

Found a bottle on eBay the other day. Why is this discontinued? Very nice, fresh scent, easy to wear and very office friendly. First there is a hint of sweet fruits, melon, pears and bananas that I don't like, but it soon settles to a scent that reminds me of fresh cut grass in the garden and of flowers after the rain. I don't understand why Clean stopped selling this? It's far better than the ordinary Shower Fresh. Like most of the Clean fragrances this fades too fast.

This is a very fresh floral aquatic almost fruity.. for some reason I am picking up a melon note like cataloape or something.. it's very nice reminds me a perfume I had from Abercrombie & Fitch kids long ago in 2007 Abercrombie perfume 15.
It has this similar vibe to estee lauders beyond paradise. I would call it as fresh flowery rather than aquaius.

This is the only one I have left of the clean quartet including the original, warm cotton, and shower fresh. I guess this means this is the one I fancied the least, or perhaps tried to save because I liked it more than the regular shower fresh, and then ended up tiring of the clean line altogether? I used to have a smelly job and would spray the crap out of my clothes with clean before work, but those days are gone now.

I really liked this fragrance. I thought it would be good to take a day off from more classic, complex scents, and this surprised me. On my skin, this was more complex than expected, with a crisp (in a GOOD way) note of Bergamot piercing through a clean, green rainforest shower. Clean and energizing. Doesn't last long, but at its price point I can spritz more often.

I adored this. It was so, don't laugh, CLEAN smelling. Quite obviously aquatic. Like you were doing laundry in the middle of a garden, and it's about to thunderstorm so get that hint of ozone. I smelled cucumbers and water. It was a little sweet but not enough to be cloying. Kinda reminded me of Love's Rainforest but THAT stuff is overpowering like crazy. This is just a wonderful spring/summer scent.

I smelled this in the store and absolutely loved it! It smells like a fresh spring or summer morning rain shower. I love how it smells on me. Like a mix between fresh breeze, clean laundry drying on the line and a rain shower!

This fragrance is the epitome of clean. Fresh without being sour. It brings to mind a windy, spring day here in North Carolina. Just a tiny hint of fresh juniper mixed with light citrus...truly captures a fresh, spring breeze.

I don't know if I got a bad bottle of this, but I'm getting a very sharp note like carnation or even clove, and none of the fresh clean scent that others describe. I can't pick out any of the floral notes either. Maybe its my skin chemistry, but it smells awful on me. Will try to swap it.

i love it! reminds me of the old Impulse 'O2' body spray. wet, juicy lemon/lime citrus opening together with aquatic watery notes, with middle notes as perfectly blended mild floral notes. i get waterlily only. then base notes of pine and cedar.

as an image, i think of cutting limes for ice cold mojitos relaxed and seated in a back garden full of flowers, on a hot summer evening.

refreshing, exhilarating, fresh, lemony.

Initial spray up to drydown is similar to BBW Rainkissed Leaves.
It smells fresh, aquatic and energizing but unfortunately it stays on me for a very very short time, i could hardly detect it after 10 mins considering that it's an EDP.

Tried this and BBW RLeaves on both arms and surprisingly BBW RLeaves body mist stays even longer. Effect may vary depending on body chemistry and climate.. wearing it in a tropic country btw.

Don't get me wrong, the scent is LIKEABLE and can be unisex in my opinion.

This smells a lot like Gain laundry detergent--- and I'm not complaining! I love spritzing it on when I'm feeling less-than-fresh at work or after a walk. Very clean- perhaps not sophisticated but pleasant
Great fresh, clean scent. However, it is very fleeting; what a shame.

I received this today in the mail. I couldn't wait to get it! Well, it smells great! It's very clean and fresh and soapy. HOWEVER, it has absolutely NO longevity…gone in 30 minutes tops. Quite a disappointment.

My favourite clean scent along with fresh laundry and white woods. Smells exactly like a damp garden drenched in warm spring sun. So lovely and fresh. It's more feminine than some of the onther clean scents, it has a more floral feel to it than just sharp, musky, soap. Even though it's still soapy, it's not overdone or sickening like the original clean, just fresh and delicate. I find the name of this one very accurate.

One of my favorite in the Clean line.
Is spot on its name. Green, watery with faint flowernotes.
A really lovely fragrance to enjoy when you just wants to be casual and comfortable.
I love it !!

First impression: The name definitely suits the scent. It smells like I just got down taking a bath in a crystal clear pond in the middle of the forest. The most noticeable, to me at least, is the waterlily and lily of the valley scents mixed with leaves. The base notes of musk and sandalwood give tone down the watery scent into more of a soapy one. It's almost a masculine scent, and very refreshing for springtime!

This was my first experience with any of the "clean" products. I really like it at first test, but I will know more when I test the staying power. It was very well priced and I may try more of them. So far I have no complaints.
To me this is longer lasting than other clean fragrances I own. This is better then the original shower fresh. Im sure I'll enjoy it layered or alone.give it a try (really good deals on ebay)

Bought a gift set of four Clean perfumes last winter, blind buy. And seriously, i thought all of them were horrible, very sharp and synthetic smelling, nothing remotely fresh about them, really just eww.

Decided to give them a new try now in the summer, and started with Outdoor Shower Fresh, as that was the one i disliked less in the winter.
This isn't that bad now actually! Once it settles, it does smell very clean and fresh, i don't get the horrible synthetic mess anymore.
Very green and outdoorsy, a bit soapy. Refreshing and cool.
In the winter the sillage and longevity were both outstanding, as usually happens with frags you hate ^^.
I have to explore these further now in the warmer weather, will be interesting to see how they behave. For now, to my own surprise, i actually like this.

This is so not my type of perfume, i don't do green scents. This might really work in the summer heat though.

Very clean and soapy smelling, which I really enjoy in the summer. I don't pick up on anything particularly outdoorsy, but it does smell a bit more aquatic and green than the original Clean, which opens with a blast of citrus. This is a little smoother and smells a bit more floral to me.

Edit: I swear I keepm picking up an apple-ish fruity note. It dawned on me today what Outdoor Shower Fresh reminded me of... Tommy Girl, which I used to wear in HS.

Yes, the begining of this is a little sharp and loud, and actually I thought ths was for men. However, it quickly mellows down to a clean aquatic floral with something green and leafy that gives me a green aromatic vibe (nope, it isn't exactly violet leaf either). It's quite soft and pleasant. Fresh? Yes. But it is not really outdoorsy, I am afraid. It reminds me of the discontinued Rainkissed Leaves by BBW as well.

I seriously do not like when people blatantly review things with words that could be considered insulting but I only have one word for this: Ew.

Something about it screams cat urine and toilet bowl cleaner to me and I had to make myself leave it on for more than 20 seconds, I seriously wanted to wash it off immediately. No go for me, I apologize.

Nice, very aquatic garden and clean!. On me it ressembles Armani's Acqua di Gio but with a pile of soap in it. This one even made me purchase the Acqua di Gio again after not having it since the late 90's.

The lasting power of outdoor shower fresh is good and also the sillage. This one is a scent that I really have to keep reminding myself of not overspraying, because the soapiness can be overpowering.

It's hard to describe the FEELİNG that Outdoor is giving, you should give a try, I highly recommend it!
That's like much more alike coming out the sea IMO...Or taking shower without soap after sea bathing. It's freshness is so energising but relaxing, peacegiving at the same time I think...

Outdoor fresh if you took a perfume bath outside! The water lily is very strong and pretty much all you smell. The bergamot helps it to smell fresh while a bit of sandalwood anchors it. There are some aquatic notes but not enough to really give an impression of a shower in the outdoors.

If you don't mind the very strong water lily you may enjoy this. It's too cloying for me and in addition, the whole scent itself is extremely fleeting.
Quite derivative and only note that's really obvious is water lily. You'll do better with other aquatics.
Really beautiful fresh scent, better than Shower Fresh, but unfortunately, very very short lasting.

Omg this was a total scrubber for me. Smells like Laundry detergent or fabric softener. I understand some ppl dig that sort of thing but I hate that. My apartment used to be over the laundromat and I got that smell for free!

If you are looking for fragrances that are similar to the original formulation, try Frozen Margarita by Demeter. It has the prominent lime note that gives Clean it's zest. It's not exact....but it's a very similar scent to Clean.
I have a set of the original scents and this used to be so good before the reformulation. Zesty and uplifting. Love the lime in it. I haven’t found anything that compares.
Just straight up smells like the blandest bar of soap. Dry and even harsh.

I have the new bottle with label that's wrapped around the side that says "The Original". It smells exactly like Classic Warm Cotton maybe with sliiight addition of bar soap to the citrusy laundry detergent but basically indistinguishable. No reason to have both, strength wise they are about the same too

I didn't know they changed this scent. This one smells like a milder version of Warm Cotton on me. The citrus is gone. I was looking for the original version with the citrus. Well, at least I didn't pay alot for this, but I wasn't looking for another Warm Cotton. I'll keep it.

Astringent dishwasher soap.
I was expecting a lovely powder mixed with flowers. I’m glad I only spent $20 on this

Apparently there are two versions, reformulated and old one. Reading the reviews past the maybe a couple of first ones the reviews are mixed on how this perfume smells. Few stating that it smells lemony , detergent like and others say it smells like a bar of soap. There is also a skin difference factor, but I wouldn't go that far as to say it would smell that different on us. But, anyway, it's not my imagination, my bottle does indeed smell like a bar of a good, buttery, white soap. Not citrusy. Not like flowers or cleaners. Tested it again after reading the last review, checked my bottle to see if I made a mistake, but no. So if you're looking for a soapy version I strongly suggest not blind buying and testing it first.
Edit: Checking it on their page it indeed does say and I quote: Reimagined 15 years later, it's back with a bright modern twist. Inspired by the faint scent of your favorite bar soap. So it is changed. Also, mine has The original written under Clean.
Notes from their site: Top Notes: Aldehydic, Peppercorn, Aromatic Accord
Middle Notes: Jasmine, Geranium, Peony
Base Notes: Orange Blossom, Musk, Sandalwood
No citrus here. We need an updated Fragrantica page.

Last review gotta be kidding...this is plain Joy Dishwashing soap (yeap, synthetic lemon a la Club de Nuit intense) with flowers trying to be noticed so desperately , nothing close to a "lovely bar of soap" (That title is already taken by Prada amber pour homme) yeah smells "Clean" but not in a "I want to smell like this" sort of way.

RIYL : Joy, Ajax, Palmolive or any fake citrus dishwashing liquid.

50/100

No citrus to be seen, from the very beginning this is a lovely bar of soap. A very strong soap, but soap nonetheless. For me there is no fizzy drink or cleaner vibe, at all, and I didn't even get the slightest, faintest wiff of those, nor a liquid soap or linen. It doesn't smell like bubble bath either. I was very confused as to why this wasn't mentioned in the soapy perfumes article. Instead of aldehydic freshness there is a very prominent buttery density of a thick bar of soap. I can almost scratch the surface and feel it collecting under my nails. I also noticed that people don't like wearing it on themselves but rather smell it on others as it gives of very calming aura. The smell of soap is so old and recognisable and yet people are so delighted and surprised when they smell it on someone as if they are used to complex perfumed pyramids of chypre, oriental or floral. So simple and effective.

I have loved the original Clean fragrance ever since it hit the market. This is the quintessential clean fragrance. I have garnered so many compliments from this perfume, I cannot even count them all. Clean is lemony, soapy, bubbly and effervescent. It's a very strong scent that has incredible projection. Clean will last for hours. Clean is not for the faint of heart, but for the bold individual that isn't a shy wallflower.

I just recently got a new bottle of this (a tiny roller-ball as part of a set) and it smells different than my last bottle. There is less citrus, and it has more of a baby powder and laundry detergent fragrance to it now. I really dig this new formulation. It reminds me of a freshly washed baby. Whereas I was fairly ho hum about it before, now I'm sort of crazy about it. It's very relaxing and comforting. Definitely one of my favorite low key scents.

I like a number of the other Clean fragrances including Clean Warm Cotton and Clean Skin, but this one just doesn't do it for me. The citrus in this verges just slightly into toilet bowel cleaner territory. Sillage and longevity are both moderate, and the smallest bottle is about $44.00 dollars. This company is also vegan and cruelty free. It's not terrible by any means, and I don't mean to offend anyone who loves it. However, I personally feel the company offers better fragrances within its line.

This was a blind buy, and I have to admit, and this is definitely not for me. I bought it in a gift set with 4 other of the clean scents, and this one is the one I like the least. To me it smells like toilet cleaner. I guess I can at least use it to scare off mosquitos.

This was a blind buy, and I'm happy enough. I was a bit concerned at first because the opening is a citrus bomb (I know the note is lime, but smells more like lemon to me). But the drydown is a bar of soap, which is a smell I personally love. It smells more like a fancy soap marketed toward women in the 90s, not necessarily like Irish Spring or Dial. I think this is just a nice, soft, inoffensive scent. Pretty unique in that drydown but I could see this being polarizing. I'll be curious to try more Clean fragrances. I'm glad they're cruelty free!

I really wanted to like Clean,I bought it blind, I was looking a soft summer scent, this was on sale so I thought I'd give it a try.
There isn't another fragrance this reminds me of. It does start off strong like lemon pledge but it does die down and reminds me of old floral soap that's been sitting in a wooden drawer for a very long time.
I wore it and kept checking it, it never smelt better and it lasted longer than I wanted it to.
I'm going to give it to my mother, I doubt she'll like it either.
I can only smell soap, ordinary strong boring soap... I wanted to like it, I love Clean but this one I cant stand.
One of the greatest clean, soap powdery fragrances. This one last a loooooot longer than its sisters.

My very first clean scent this was... and then followed by an enormous amount of the other ones from the line.
I SO adored it and it made me feel squeaky clean and fresh.
I still like it, but doesnt wear it very often. My taste in perfumes has changed thoughout the years.
But its still a fresh, young, and clean scent. It is innocense and playfulness in a bottle.
Shower, spring and femininity. Violets, lavender, citrus and musk in a perfect blend.
I still get a smile on my face whenever I wear it.
Longevity and silage is moderate and perfect for this one.
Nostalgia which I will never grow out of.
Love !

This was a blind buy. I wish it was a soapy scent, but it's not. It's citrusy, yet sweet, right-from-the-washing-machine scent. It 's not even surprising and didn't make me excited... Just a casual everyday scent. I would't repurchase it as IMO it's overprized.

It's not exactly what I imagine being clean would smell like, I thought Clean would be more soapy type of scent. This is described as citrus but while there is citrus, it is not the main note that I smell. I like it but it's no longer what I would pick to spray for my day because of poor longevity. It's just not going to be there by the time I get out of the house.

I really liked the idea behind the Clean perfume brand when I first read about it. Pleasant, clean, fresh fragrances - brilliant! So I tried this, the very first Clean and was SO disappointed. Wham! So fresh and harsh it almost knocks you out. A very synthetic and intense lemon/lime/verbena mix, way too sharp and strong. It lasted very long too. I kept it on, hoping it would turn into something less intense and more pleasant, but it never happened.

We are all different, and obviously there are many women who love Clean original. But on me it smells like I've just cleaned my bathroom, not like I've just taken a nice shower.

I still like the idea of a classy "fresh-from-the-shower"- fragrance though. A perfume that doesn't smell like perfume. Luckily I've found Clean Fresh Laundry (for very hot summer days) and Clean Cool Cotton (always). Exactly what I want. All's well that ends well.
This smells awful, like too harsh lemony detergent. Disappointing.
This one is probably in my top 10, I love it, it smells very different then any other fragrance out there and it's long lasting, love love love!!!:)
Smells like the idea of soap; cartoon baby pink bubble bath.

Sorry, this is just awful. I gave this one several chances and hated it as much everytime. It smells just like a fresh cleaned toilet, exactly like WC duck. So yes it's a fresh scent but it's not like I want to walk around smelling like I just cleaned the bathroom, I felt sick everytime I tried this on. So now I only use it as a air freshener..for our bathroom haha :)!
This is my favorite of the Clean fragrances that I have currently. It really is clean with a bit of sweetness to it. I like it alot!

I blind bought this fragrance within a year or two of its release, hoping for a clean, "just out of the shower but better", type of scent. Unfortunately, on my skin it smelled like a citronella based mosquito repellant spray and it never dried down to anything that even remotely smelled "clean". I'm typically attracted to citrus and citrusy floral scents, but I could never get past the pungent citrusy-citronella scent of this one. Ended up tossing the entire bottle.

I get almost just lime from this. It's sophisticated, simple and light. I use the body powder as a dry shampoo (xD) and it makes me feel super bourgie because I was reading a list online of all the scents that celebrities wear and I was suprised by how many celebs wear this scent!!

To me this is pure, clean, white soap all the way.
initially you get a blast of lemon grass, which dries down to pure alkaline soap. It's at the top of it's game for clean soapiness, so if this is the smell you're aiming for then this is your bottle. I have a few of the CLEAN range, but all smell very different in a clean way. However, nothing says "I've just scrubbed up with a soap bar" than this beauty. I love it and wear it most days for work for meeting clients, colleagues, managers and other service professionals. Perfect.

Whooosh, this one was like biting into a not-quite-ripe citrus lime or lemon and having my mouth react by going into a semi-permanent pucker. A real eye squinter, this one, and Pucker Power galore without even tasting it. Makes me think of a vodka gimlet. A double gimlet, no less. It's overhyped and overpriced, so methinks I'll pass it on to the Tidy Bowl man rowing away in my bathroom bowl in his little boat and hopefully he can put it to good use. In all fairness, though, our bodies do react differently to different scents at any given time. What works for some simply doesn't for others.

Not sure about this one yet, it immediately smells like a new Fisher Price toy or a Barbie Doll, very strange. Children may chase you down the street if you put too much on as you will smell like christmas to them. It's sweeter that I would have expected from a perfume called Clean but I would say it's an ok summer fragrance if you like mild fruity fragrances that smell like toys.
Smells like an auto body shop.

I tested this on my wrist in a store. It smelled just like lemon which I enjoyed, so I bought it. But a little while later, my wrist smelled like synthetic cleaning product. Oh no... not good! Unbearable actually!
2 hours later it smells less horrible. Like mild cleaning product.
I kinda wish I didn't but it. I guess I can use it as an air freshener, because as bad as it is, it doesn't give me a headache.

I bought this when it first came out way back in 2002 expecting it to smell like it did on the tester. Nope, again, I have trouble with “clean” scents and this wasn't any better. Smelled generic, sour, and cheap; not to mention the staying power of this is very weak. This is not worth the price, body sprays have more wear than this did.
Top notes are orange, lemons, limes, and wild berries. Middle notes are lily, lavender, violet, rose, jasmine, and passion flower. Base notes are heliotrope, musk, and geranium.

I was looking for this fragrance a while because a clothing store I liked smelled like this. I'll go ahead and be direct; this smells like air freshener... but REALLY good air freshener. I spray it around my house, not gonna lie. I generally hate citrus smells but I have grown to love this one because of the floral and musky undertones.
In summation..
Pros: Fresh, fruity, Clean (duh..)
Cons: Smells like air freshener, doesn't last long enough.

On me smelled like I have been cleaning the bathroom all day... Really bad. Strong lemon, like those detergents which are not modern anymore... I was attracted from the good reviews saying that it smells really clean and fresh. Yes, it is, smells just like freshly cleaned toilet desk. I returned it to the site I bought it from. And I am never going to buy again something only because of my curiosity!

I feel silly writing a review about a fragrance called Clean, as the name written on the perfume bottle is a nomenclature in and of itself. Over the years I’ve come across many maligning reviews on it which makes me shake my head, unable to understand the negative reactions to it, let alone the “industrial disinfectant” references used when describing it. However, after recently wearing it when grocery shopping and being pulled over in the store by a gentleman who couldn’t compliment me enough on how “so fresh and so sexy like I just walked out of a shower” I smelled (…yeah, I know… sweet but kinda creepy…) that I’ve decided it was time to offer a different perspective on this polarizing fragrance.

I first tried Clean EDP right after it was released quite a few winters ago. One spray on the tester blotter and I’ve wrinkled my nose, wondering by whom and why on earth this perfume was created in the first place. It smelled like anemic, generic musk that you can usually find on supermarket or pharmacy shelves for a handful of dollars. The thing is, I tried this fragrance right after I’d tested “Dior Addict (2002)”, which at that time was also a new release and sported the old heavenly formula. Okay… Honestly, who could give Clean a fair shot on a cold winter day after trying the delicious, spicy soufflé that is Addict?? Obviously, I was smell-drunk from the vanillic goodness that just permeated my nose and so I chucked the bottle back on the shelf and returned to the Dior stand. Fast forward to a few summers ago, I’d dedicated a good block of time in my day to dork around at my local Ulta to find out if I can ever like the allegedly *Clean* line and whether the flankers were also full bottle worthy. And now the truth comes out: Clean is undoubtedly a warm weather fragrance. In the dead of winter, it turns into a mixture of chlorinated pool, tap water, and a facial astringent on me. In the heat of the summer, however, this cold composition turned into a pure and wholesome aroma that gives me the feeling of having just washed from head to toe with a luxurious perfumed soap. In the opening, I detect a light but sharp citrus blend that persistently continues throughout its lifespan. I don’t get any floral notes other than a faint whiff of lavender in the heart phase. At the end, which arrives about a good six hours later, I am left with a citric, cool, musky drydown that is still refreshing with no detectable hints of going off the rails. Suffice it to say that Clean agreed to love my skin, which I believe is a phenomenon that is a prerequisite before anyone says, “Oh yeah - I like this!” about any perfume. So to be fair to the numerous reviewers who pooped on this fragrance, I can see how, with the wrong chemistry, this fume can make you smell like someone just gave you a swirly. I’ve tried another very similar fragrance called “Les Senteurs Gourmandes - Musc Blanc” by Laurence Dumont. The only difference is that Clean utilizes a lavender accentuated heart instead of the faint rose note Laurence Dumont used in his composition. Both fragrances, however, are startlingly similar on my skin. As far as longevity and projection goes, Clean is the winner. It projects about at least 3 feet and stays on me for a good 6 hours.

I don’t think Clean or its flankers (“Shower Fresh” is my favorite!) are meant to be a crowd-pleaser, as are most designer or celebrity fragrances. I see this collection more as a progressive, niche style creation that just happens to be mass produced. It isn’t for everyone, as the copious negative reviews all over the internet would suggest. Nonetheless, those who love sheer florals, light musks, or citric aromas could be in perfumista heaven as long as their skin loves this icy juice back.

Are we all smelling the same fragrance?

I LOVE this fragrance for exactly what it's intended to be...CLEAN! I think if you're expecting a burst of florals, or anything other than a clean, "just out of the shower" smell...then you should move on because that's exactly what it's NOT intended to be.

This was my signature summer fragrance until I graduated to niche fragrances but this will definitely make a reappearance this summer as a layering scent. I love this on my clothing rather than skin nowadays, as I think it enhances the smell of cleanliness (if that at all makes sense). This is also a good one on days when you don't want to wear any fragrance. It's just a clean hair-out of the shower-no/minimum makeup-relaxed maxi dress-flip flop-no fuss hairstyle fragrance. (If THAT at all makes sense???)

I could never make out the exact notes of this scent until seeing the pyramid here and it makes complete sense! Definitely opens with a blast of clean citrus that is immediately and I mean IMMEDIATELY followed by a musky-lavender-and other astringent (but in a good way) floral notes.

Longevity is moderate at (3ft) as is silage at 4-5hrs.

Clean is an incredible fragrance. I love feeling shower fresh when I wear it, especially during the hot summer months. It evokes fresh towels, laundry, and bedding. I love its lemony purity. It will always remind me of how wonderful it feels to be clean right out of the shower. I also think its perfect to wear around children because it is not too perfumey, heavy, or intense. The whole clean line is a brilliant concept because it is so different from everything else on the market. I love to keep collecting all the fragrances in the line. I hope they will always be available!!!
Too much citrus to wear with any seriousness in public, but my cat hates it, so if I wear to sleep, I won't wake up with the cat on my head.
Today I put this on after Fresh's Sugar deodorant - they smell very similar. Perhap when worn together the scent is twice as clean.

I get so frustrated by people not really understanding what Clean fragrances are meant to be. They are not "perfume". They are not supposed to smell like perfume. They are anti-perfume. If you go into it expecting perfume, no wonder people are so disappointed. Clean is not for people who want perfume...it is for people who do not.

I went for a couple of years not being able to wear ANY perfume. It all made me sick. I had some health issues that affected my sense of smell and I just could not tolerate anything that smelled "perfumey" and could not stand to be around anyone wearing perfume. It made me gag. During this time, I noticed that a client of mine always had this wonderful clean smell, like her clothes were always fresh from the dryer. I asked her how she kept that wonderful, clean smell in her clothes all the time and she said it was "Clean" perfume that she sprayed on her clothes. I had never heard of such a thing. So, I tried it and fell in love with the Clean line (give or take a few). It was the only thing I could wear for quite some time because of the anti-perfume issues that I was having.

In the process, I noticed that I was getting complimented constantly on how good I smelled. It was never "what are you wearing"...people just told me that I smelled good. And I realized they thought of me like I thought of my client. Just a clean, fresh smelling person, completely unrelated to perfume.

I only spray it on my clothes, not my skin. I think that makes a difference as well.

My perfume issues went away (as you can clearly see by my profile) but I still go through periods where I have to cleanse and "reset" my nose and just need a break from perfume. Maybe it is hormonal, I don't know. This is one of the very things I reach for - Clean Original. It is clean, lemony and refreshing and allows me to smell good without smelling like perfume. I especially like it in the summer. I don't think I have ever had it on without receiving a compliment - EVER. I can assure you that if I smelled like a toilet bowl nobody would be telling me how wonderful I smelled.

Clean is exactly what is claims to be...a clean smelling fragrance line that is NOT classic perfume, for those who just do not want to smell like perfume. It is for those who like to extend that shower fresh or fresh from the dryer scent all day long. It is also great for refreshing bedding, curtains and blankets. I just love it.

Burst of citrus -- especially lime -- to start, then some florals mixed in with the line's usual musk. As the name implies you really have to be a fan of clean scents to enjoy this one and it could be harsh if you don't like citrus or detergent/fresh laundry musk. But if you like citrus it is worth a try, inexpensive and clean. Nice in situations where you don't want to smell like perfume but still have a scent.

Starts out like commercial bathroom cleaner (very artificial citrus/cinnamon), then into something like Zest (the soap, a masculine-herbal-citrus-fresh smell), and then into a generic smell like on toilet tissue or facial tissue....Sort of a weird conglomorate of "clean" and "cleaning" things, but not exactly how I want to smell. Generic, industrial, sterile smelling. Fortunately, I guess, this scent fades within 3 hours to just about nothing.
I had such high expectations for this fragrance; Unfortunately I didnt like it on me at all. It did nothing for me.

This is the first citrus perfume i truly adore. It's so light and pure scent and so... innocent. I love those sticky sweet perfumes and Clean is truly opposite for those but brings a ballance. There are those days that i just want smell fresh and like i have just came from a bath. And when i want to feel cute and confidence in a innocent way.

I'm truly not a watery-citrus type of girl but this one is just my type.
This parfume makes me fysically sick! It must be the strong chemicals, it´s like inhaling toiletcleaner. To bad, if only it was not so strong, I´d like it!

I have had so many compiments on this fragrance. I wear it in tne summer and it is the perfect scent for the season. It is fresh and lemony and a bit sweet. I love this fragrance and I have been wearing it since it was first introduced. I now own all of the Clean line of fragrances and I love them all. It's great prolonging the feeling of being shower fresh.

YUCK! I really don't care for this. This smells exactly like soap but not good soap, like the cheap soap at a public restroom that you try and rinse off as much as possible because it makes you reek of cheap public restroom. Will never use this again!
I love this fragrance. It is the cleanest fragrance I I have found. Everytime I wear Clean I get a lot of compliments. If you like sweet lemon fragrances, you will probably like Clean.
i love sooo much!!!!!big summer frag for meeee

I applied this perfume after reading many celebrities love it and I couldn't tell if I loved it or not. It is definitely clean but the clean you smell in a cheap hotel. My husband smelled it and said he expected the smell of urine behind it. It's the scent of a cheap public bathroom. After it wears off,it just smells like you stepped out of a shower. Just soapy, so it would be hard to detect you are wearing perfume.
This fragrance smell like somebody pop out glass bottle of coca cola yummy!

Whoa!

I've been passing by this one at TJ Maxx for months because I hadn't read the reviews as I assumed it was probably boring and weak (the simple packaging...although nice...is what didn't do it for me)

I have never smelled anything....ANYTHING....with such a lemon/lime sharpness at first blast....in an IN YOUR FACE with an ice-pick sort of way! It was like being maced with ice cold 7-UP.

After yanking my face away from my wrist at a speed that should have induced injury, I told myself not to worry...it was a short ride home and it wasn't all that expensive either.After maybe 2 minutes I dared to take another sniff.

What's this??!!

How could something morph so quickly into something SO different? I have never worn a perfume that was capable of this....going from zero to one hundred in a blink of an eye at application then back down to around fifty ( and something entirely different) within two minutes.Ok......so what did I get after all those sharp citrus notes?? Well....you can probably guess......soap.

What's that gold soap......oh yeah...DIAL. Yeah....like DIAL and DOVE got together and had a baby! Just push a little harder Mam....I see the head...here it comes.Oh look! It's CLEAN!

All joking aside, I really enjoy this fragrance. It's simple...in a complicated way...and for me...unique. It's a way to smell nice but not necessarily perfumed. Sure, you could just take a shower as other's have stated but isn't finding a new perfume that you really like alot more fun?!

I also have to admit that when I read that this is Demi Moore's signature scent it somehow made it more appealing. She always looks so polished and well....clean....and I can imagine her smelling like this.

Definitely worth a try if you're in the mood for something different in a fragrance and want to smell like the bath all day!

EDIT: The more I use this, the more I absolutely LOVE it.....it's becoming one of my favorites. The sharp lemon/lime note in the beginning is either becoming less pronounced or I'm just getting used to it. I guess that's one and the same. Anyway....it' just a spectacular lemony, creamy, luscious, soapy, happy, clean smell! I agree that it is related to Avon's vintage Odyssey.....I wouldn't have even thought of it if it hadn't been mentioned. It is, however,soapier, more lemony and fresher and more modern. I like Odyssey though....reminds me of my Mommy and of my childhood!

Smells EXACTLY like lemon lysol to me. I actually really like it lol. After the dry down the chemical/lysol smell kind of fades out and it smells more like lemon candy or a lemon bar. Doesn't last but a couple hours and stays very close to the skin.

This perfume starts off smelling very lemony and at first I' did not care for it at all. However, after giving it a few minutes to settle it smelled very fresh and soapy like I had just stepped out of the shower. Great for summer.

A friend recommended that I try Clean. She thought it suited my personality. As it turns out, every perfume in the Clean line smells like detergent, and while that might smell great on your sheets, it's definitely not something you want to apply to your skin.
iheard that demi moore uses clean by clean so maybe it just need a strong personalty to use this perfume :)n still i didnt get the chance to try it on my skin ...

I really don't like this, and I generally like 'clean' smells (although not necessarily to wear as a perfume). I sprayed some on when I was shopping, and immediately regretted it. It smells of strong bitter lemon and chemicals. I left the mall with a serious headache brewing and couldn't get rid of the smell with any amount of scrubbing.
A lot to spend to smell like Dove soap. This is a more expensive parfum and it didn't last 1/2 hour. I have very inexpensive parfums that last all day.

i got a giftpack with 4 clean scents - original, warm cotton, shower fresh and outdoor shower fresh. I wanted to test them badly, and they are unavailable in my whereabouts, so I bought them online. And - guess what - curiosity killed the cat again! While other clean scents can be utilised as a bed linen spray, the original one just stinks. I don't know - like a hamper? Like a drawer with old ladies' pants? Like a musty attic? It is just dis-gus-ting, by no means clean! Cats - BEWARE!
perfect fragrance the most clean ever if i vant to smell nothing just clean here its voala``the best (specialy for somer)

being a huge huge fan of that "clean" smell seemed only right that this perfume was the way to go.....i loathe this scent smells like some sort of kitchen cleaner spray, nauseating & nothing i would want to spray in my kitchen let alone on my skin......

I have it but I dont like it AT ALL
Its so bitter and yuck I dont know, its just boring

I have learned to like this perfume. Its a very comforting, summer scent.

The opening has a very strong lemon pledge-y scent, but once that fades ,you get that fresh out of the dryer smell. It is spot on!

Dry down is very subtle but on clothing it lasts and on occasion I can catch a whiff of it. On the skin it does not last very long.

Do people, in truth, actually want to smell like this?

I know it's a tempting proposition, the packaging bringing to mind warm, ironed flannel sheets, perhaps a hint of soap and that kind of aquatic-y crispness that many perfumers have been capitalizing on since Issey Miyake debuted L'eau, but come on.

To add insult to injury, this thing doesn't even smell clean; it smells like flat 7up when you can only taste the plastic bottle the damn thing came in. If you were expecting soap, then expect the harshest, cheapest hotel room soap that leaves more residue than it removes. Clean indeed!
I just found a small bottle at Marshall's ( depot for discontinued fragrances ) I can't decide what it smells like , not like soap for sure...I think I will use it as a freshener in my car.
Smells to much citrus and lemon and it doesnt smell like a perfume,just like cleaning stuff. Dont like at all.

When I think of being clean, I think of stepping out of the shower and just smelling my skin. We've all taken showers, so we all know what it means to smell clean. I can understand not wanting to smell like flowers, or vanilla, or perfume, but this is not my idea of clean. This is a harsh and synthetic clean. This is taking out the brillo pad, dousing it with lemon scented cleaner, and scrubbing. I would actually love my bathroom to smell like this, so maybe I'll use it as a room freshener.
First time i just thought yeeek about this but now i just like it because it's so clean and you can mix it with the other Clean scents!

CLEAN ORIGINAL is a *very* citrusy citrus fragrance which seems to have been erroneously placed in the floral category on the basis of a list of flowers that barely make their presence known, awash as they are in a liquid empirically indistinguishable from Cointreau.

Needless to say, CLEAN caught me off guard. I was expecting some variation on the aquatic theme, or perhaps something with a soapy drydown. Instead, from the very first whiff down to the light, still citrus finish, what I found was Cointreau. CLEAN began very big and juicy and ended, like an empty glass of that delectable liqueur, with a faint waft of the same.

I do so love the smell of Cointreau. But I'd much rather smell it in a snifter than on my wrist!

I have read about this and it all sounded sooooo good. so when i saw a sample on ebay i thought i had to have it.

it arrived on saturday. i tried it and was more than disappointed. smells like ciff or any sort of citrusy surface cleaner. really do not think i will be buying any more of this perfume.
An extremely harsh, synthetic and sharp soapy scent. Laudry detergent to the nth power. I like soapy scents, but this is too much, even for me. Also ridiculously overpriced. Seriously, why?

WOW i don't think i've ever disliked a scent so much until i've tried this. I got a sample of this, put some on my wrist to try and had to wash it off ASAP and left the rest to be used as a bathroom spray. I liked it much better for that lol.....anyway from what i remembered the name said it all about this fragrance. It's clean, purely clean smelling, almost too clean? It's very sharp and soapy kind of, all in all, i don't like it and would never purchase. Oh almost forgot to mention, it is not a soft and gentle clean smell but a punch in your face clean, does that make sense? Well i guess that said a lot about this scent :p
Well ladies you may not like this so much, (for those who don't) but men LOVE this. I don't know why but they do. I'm in the female club of "i love it"!

I am interested in smelling the clean line. I cant seem to find them in stores anywhere, but theyre everywhere online. Did you all have to purchase it online to smell them or are they in shops? thanks
I smell like 7-Up or Sprite when I wear this. I don't dislike it, but I don't really like it either. It's not repulsive, it's just very soda, fizzy, limey to me.

I got the set of four 1 oz. perfumes. I DO understand why people love the clean line. It smells good on all people and with anyone's chemistry. Some people don't want to smell like musk or flowers. Just clean. It's a rather simple concept.
DONT like clean,none of them. Boring,unsensual and expensive - a big no no!!

Ack. Sharp. I didn't get much of a laundry type feel. It smelled like pungent tart lemonade to me. Granted, I'm pretty much repulsed by anything that smells like lemon. It dries down a tad better, but I don't like it overall.

I don't care for any of the fragrances in the "Clean" line. I admit, the fresh/clean fragrance category is perhaps the last interesting of all fragrance categories for me.
