Clean and its assorted variations all smell like a good quality soap. Fair enough, but they also don't last any longer on your skin than the scent of the soap you just showered with. Poof! They're gone in a flash. For the cost, I would expect a little more persistance.
It smells like juicy fruit gum spiked with limes. So fresh,Clean and mouthwatering.
This is nauseating.
Cant find this anywhere, must have been discontinued
I compared this wrist-to-wrist with Bal d’Afrique and this is a lot sharper and less well-blended but for the price…

Identical to Bal D’Afrique. You would have to be a trained professional perfumer to detect any difference at all! I only applied it a short while ago, so I’m not sure of the longevity yet, but if it’s similar to Bal, (which wouldn’t take much, that one only lasts two hours on me) then I’ll stick with Warm Cashmere! :)

So Close to Bal D'arfrique, the vetyver is just so tingent and cosy.

However, performance is lame. I eventually sold the bold because I did not bother to reapply...

This scent is less in every way then it's original Bal D'afrique. So it is 50% cheaper but also 50% worse in performance, sillage, longevity. So will not buy this one again but will stick with the original. Cause quality costs money...

Personally I just love it. I have a soft spot for deep, musky, woody scents, and this is lighter than what I usually wear but also definitely more unisex. Where I work - at a perfume section - people who are looking for an office friendly or unisex scent have loved this, also more men than I first thought. I think it doesn't lean on either masculine or feminine side, and it is one of those non-offending scents. A great gift idea for someone, who loves fall, cozy afternoons and woody scents. It is daytime appropriate and not too long-lasting either.

Starts off with a citrus note. Dries down as a warm,cosy, Woody,musky and slightly powdery scent. Very Nice and grown- up in a really comforting way. Love this one one a sweater on a autum or Winther day.
Warm Cashmere is one of my all time favorites from clean. So much substans in this one. Reminds me of White woods from Clean. Just a little bit more of it all in this scent.
Because of The small bottle size I immediately bought two.

Warm cashmere starts very citrusy. After half an hour it becomes warmer and woody (I get a lot of cedar after a few hours).

On my skin it lasts for about 4 hours and sits really close to skin, performance on clothes is much better. Definitely on masculine side and it reminds me of a detergent a little bit. Will wear to work.

I liked Warm Cashmere from the first moment. It's a very "grown up" scent, for autumn and winter. It's not heavy, but it's more intense than most of the Clean scents, and it takes a while before it settles. Office safe first after an hour or so on me, but I won't wear it at work anyway. This is a scent for lovely, cosy weekends from October to March and perfect for Christmas and New year.

A powerful start, smoky/woody like, but that doesn't last long.Those first couple of minutes it's definitely on the masculin side. Then there´s crispy citrus with the woody smell. Finally you have a nice musky/woody/fruity blend that stays 4-6 hours (on me). Very pleasant, warm, not too sweet, and still very grown up. It's perfect on me (woman 30+), but I can't imagine my husband wearing it. Cashmere hint? Yes, definitely!

EDIT: This perfume has really grown on me. It's become one of my favourites and it's sad it's a limited edition! Why? // New update: Still a favourite, and I found a new bottle on eBay. Seems like i prefer many of the discontinued scents from CLEAN. Hmm, maybe I'm just an oldfashioned girl.

This just isn’t for me. I can smell notes of pear, burnt sugar, and even a hint of coffee beans - but for me not in the good way. It reminds me of the candy-like perfumes I used to have as a kid (I think it was called Bonbons). Also very weak longevity and almost no sillage.

I love, love, love this from the Clean reserve line! I do not smell pear or tobacco in this at all. Rather, it is similar to a nostalgic burnt sugar syrup tapioca pearl and soy dessert (“taho” is what it’s called). The emotional and childhood connection made me like this perfume so much. I feel super good when I wear it.

I'm really glad to have this in my collection. It's a lovely, sweet pear perfume and I find it's great for layering. I love to use it with Chanel's 1932, which sweetens it up a bit. By itself, I find 1932 a bit too screechy, but Radiant Nectar rounds out the edges. I also love to layer it with Dior's Jasmin des Anges because it increases its longevity and rounds out the indolic character of the jasmine. I never wear it by itself, but it's such a useful addition in my fragrance wardrobe! I would probably repurchase this.
I love how people are describing the scent here, but i only get pear in the beginning and then it disappears.

I adore this perfume. Don’t let the Ambroxan turn you off, it’s not huge here. I dislike strong Ambroxan and have zero issues with this fragrance.

This is tobacco leaf (an unsmoked cigar, if you will), and honey to my nose. It has sweetness but isn’t gourmand. It’s a woman putting on her man’s jacket after a night at a smoky bar. Very intimate smelling. I have the full bottle after getting a sample of this. I don’t reach for it all the time, but when I do, it’s sooooo lovely. Definitely a fall/winter scent!

Gives no headaches, well blended, pretty unisex perfume.
Super sweet opening, but give it time. Juicy pear with a side of golden honeycomb. The dry-down is raisins. Some compare it to Thai milk tea and I smell it too.

This scent is almost identical to Studied, by Liis. If you like one, you will like the other. If you have one, you don't need the other. Only pear is listed in the notes, but the opening is very fruity, and smells more like peach to my nose.

Smells nice citrusy and fruity. Clean. My husband is OBSESSED with it. He will place his nose on my neck and just sniff it. Weird I know, feels great tho. Not strong, needs several sprays, will not last long.

The loose tobacco you buy at the smoke shops.
I love most Clean fragrances but this one is not for me.

Weak Sauce 🥱

They should label this as 'hair mist' strength. Just like their labeling, this perfume is practically invisible. I briefly caught a beautiful fruit wood sap scent but it was gone in moments. Very disappoint, much sad. 😔

It takes several sprays all over to wear this for longer than half an hour & will only stick to natural fabrics like cotton, wool, etc. Don't get me wrong! This scent (when you can actually smell it) is beautiful & delicate & a well built formula. The full size bottle is relatively inexpensive but I highly recommend Skin over Radiant Nectar all day.

3/10 Quality ingredients, nonexistent sillage.
An enjoyable mix of tobacco, sweet honey, and syrupy pear, in that order. It’s a bit strong for me with a lingering sweet pear note. If you love pear, you’ll probably like this!

Tested this out because I kept reading that it was similar to Liis Studied (which didn’t last on my skin) and I’d have to disagree. Studied is light and soft, Radiant Nectar is syrupy and dense to my nose.

I see similarities in the notes and can understand why they would be compared to each other but Liis is airy enough to be my post-shower bedtime scent and can be worn on even the hottest of days… whereas Radiant Nectar sits VERY heavy on me, especially if it’s humid.

This is what Ariana Grander’s mom smells like. It’s in the same space as the Ariana Grande line but more mature. Ripe fruits, less synthetic. Gentle but takes no crap. A warm hug on a sunny September afternoon in the fruit garden. This is THE mom perfume. Get this for your mom on Mother’s Day, she’ll love it.

To me this is a nice fragrance it's almost identical to liis studied.. the ambroxan and the pear and ambrette etc..
which I also like but this one is a lot more affordable so I don't see any reason to get studied. They're 90% the same.. ?

It's similar to sparkling sugar except better sparkling sugar has a unpleasant synthetic note that I don't like which this one doesn't have. It's a lot smoother.
This smells almost vegetal on my skin. Maybe it's the carrot seeds. Not a fan.. just smells like a slightly sweet, musty carrot on me. 😅
Nope, this smells like an old box of raisins.

I will preface by saying I'm not a gourmand person at all, so I'm not surprised that I don't like this. This is what I imagine those old preserved jars of fruit in your grandma's house would smell like, maybe add in a few cups of sugar. It's overwhelmingly syrupy, and before this I didn't know what syrupy truly was. It's just cloying for me personally. Maybe if applied sparingly on the right person this would shine nicely, but it's a no from me.

Based on the name I’d expected this to be really sweet, but it’s actually quite warm and musky. It does start as a syrupy pear, but it very quickly morphs into a soft, honeyed skin scent with a slight smokiness. This is something I would spray on when I want to smell “naturally” good and like I’m not wearing any fragrance. This smells so much like my usual skin chemistry that I become anosmic to it within about 10 minutes of spraying.

I love this scent! Very similar to God is a woman, but Radiant nectar is more...seamless? Like it's better blended. It also lasts longer. The pear is so juicy, and the ambroxan adds something to it that keeps it from being just an ordinary fruity fragrance. I love to wear it together with SDJ 40 to add some vanilla. It's also amazing layered with Pear Inc from Juliette has a gun. I want to try it together with Pear Gelato from Theodoros Kalotinis to.

It smells alright. I have a tester version. My friend said it smelt like “skittles spray” so ..not sure how to feel about that. After sitting in it smells..uhm odd. It smells kinda nasty. Before setting in it smells kinda fruity. It doesn’t take long to set in either. 30 seconds and then your slightly fruity scent turns into a sweaty/cig smell for me personally.
smells like cigs
All I get from this is fresh tobacco. If you're looking to smell like sweet, unlit cigarettes, this is the scent for you. I'm going to pass on this, though.

To me, this is a more boring version of Sparkling Sugar by the same brand. It's vaguely pleasant, I like the slight powderiness of it but I feel like this combination of pear and powdery and musky notes has been done a hundred times before.
If you want a more sophisticated version of this, there's Studied by Liis and if you want the same thing but cheaper, go for God Is A Woman.
a very light pear with a honey drizzle on it. it’s pretty for the brief moment it lasts

Have they weakened this perfume in recent formulations? I owned a 50 ml bottle of this 2 years ago that I used up in about 3 months but the juice from one of the newer bottles smells watery and not the same. This is not in my collection anymore, but I found a very similar perfume (Day for Women) which has an identical fruit note, but with a nicer brown sugar/benzoin note in the drydown.

Edit: over two months later, this reminds me of Sonic Flower.

Pear is juicy and light and Ambrette (Musk Mallow) is fresh spicy; middle Tobacco Blossom is an insency floral chypre, Carrot Seeds and Orris offer that vegetal, lipsticky, earthy floral vibe. It’s a pear version of Sonic Flower imh. I really like this! Kind of sweet but ripe fruit sweet versus high fructose corn syrup artificial sugar sweet. It is slightly soapy, which I love!



Upon first spray… it’s not a complete hate, but it’s in that vicinity. I don’t understand the thought process behind this composition. I was hoping for soapy waxiness from the orris and carrot. The best way I can describe what I’m getting is a high fructose corn syrup canned pear, respectfully. Perhaps it needs to macerate??

I expected to like this perfume a lot and so sprayed a good portion on me only to immediately regret it afterwards. There’s a very strong pear-like sweetness at first which although many have described as warm and natural, I struggle to describe as anything other than artificial, chemical soap. There’s something deeply unpleasant to me about the honey-pear smell that remains after dry down as well, it smells like if you took a poire Hélène and poured bleach all over it. I am such a big fan of sweet perfumes usually but the sweetness in this was genuinely sickening - wayyy too intense and not at all the summery fragrance I had been expecting from the reviews!!

Love this one so much. Very much like God is a woman but warmer, earthier, and less juicy. A few comments down says it smells like fig newtons and honestly yes I smell it!!! Lol. Longevity is so bad, but I do get compliments if I have recently sprayed it. If you get this expect to need to respray.
Lovely sweet pear for 5 minutes. Then it’s completely gone.
Sugary sweet candied pear. Studied by Liis made me fall in love with that juicy pear note, but had abysmal staying power. This one is fabulous for the summer. I can't stop smelling myself.
I oddly liked this. HOWEVER my husband said I smell like rancid cat pee. So immediately Resold it.
smells like a smokers home that has too many cats
Smells like fig newtons.

All I smell is cigarettes, musk and sugar. The opening is reminiscent of Glossier You, then it turns into tobacco. There is something sweet, yet bitter about it. It’s ok. Not sure if I love it or hate it. 🤣

It's crazy how noses pick up on different notes. Upon first spray I got a good dose of tobacco, threw me back to fashion school in the early 2000's when we were are smoking Djarum Vanilla cigarettes & Carrot Seads.
I'm a huge orris fan but I didn't pick up on the orris note.
Dry Down is a sweet pear-y nectar scent.
It's good, but I don't think I'll be repurchasing.

I am on bottle number two. I had to return the first one because both smell like a turned bottle of liqueur. The bottle I have now is only one year and three months old, so I'm wondering if there's a bad batch going around. This can't be the actual smell of the perfume... but then again I'm the one that gets BO when I smell Guidance.

i'm kind of surprised by how pleasant i find this. it resembles glossier you, but a shade sweeter. i mostly get musk and fresh, syrupy sweet pear with a light molecular note from the ambroxan running throughout
this isn't my taste in scents, and i find it a little too sweet, but i'm surprised by this one. not bad
Brief fruity pop in the opening, maybe 5 mins. Then fresh tobacco with zero smoke and honey. Delightful.
Wow what a fantastic summer scent. Soft and sweet it’s good for all ages.

I tend to not like fruity perfumes but I really like Radiant Nectar. The juicy top fades into a warm, ever-so-slightly woody and sweet ambroxan heavy musk. I totally get the comparisons to Glossier You because of the dry down. I think this is really nice in the spring and summer, although unfortunately it fades after just a couple of hours.

I am a pear lover, and I don't get pear at all.. saw someone compare it to smelling like boba, which is interesting because I can see that. much more creamy than fruity. while God is a Woman is bright and punchy, Radiant Nectar is musky. as I'm writing this the sprays on my wrist have all but disappeared. maybe my batch was bad or too old. regardless, when it comes to comparison, I prefer God is a Woman.

A very realistic honey perfume! It’s literally fresh pears with honey drizzled on top. It’s a very sweet and bright fragrance, definitely best suited for summer or spring—such a naive and happy scent! ✨ Not my vibe at all, but still, I can acknowledge it’s pretty nice. The name, the packaging—everything about this perfume fits perfectly and the fact that it’s related to a good cause for bees, is just lovely 🤭♥️

this smells gross. like screechy flowers, overly sweet candy, spit, and sweat. there’s some kind of secretion BO smell w something disgustingly sweet blasted in your face at first spray and it’s pretty linear except it smells hot? at the dry down just gross.

I had high hopes for this but my goodness no thank you. It smells like burnt brown sugar, not caramelized or lightly scorched, but full-on, smoke-detector-going-off, the pan is ruined, pitch-black burnt sugar.
I can’t imagine what in the notes would suggest such an intense burnt sugar scent, but that’s literally all I get. Did I end up with a bad bottle? This is just rank, it seems from other comments this can go off quickly. It's brand new but this has got to be off.

A cup of floral brown sugar bubble tea bottled—a delicate dance of creamy sweetness and airy lightness. I don't get any pear, but instead amber warmth swirling like caramelized sugar melting into milk, sweet blossom weaving through, akin to an infusion of tea. Smooth and comforting, joyfully indulgent without being surfeiting, and certainly a gracefully balanced fragrance.
I really like this. It's fresh, soapy, simple, get-stuff-done, airy scent.
I looove this scent... to my nose it's a sugary-sweet, citrusy scent reminiscent of a nice hair product, which definitely aids the "clean" element.

Initially juicy and very pear-forward, developing into a gorgeous nectar-tobacco scent, like honeyed cigarettes. The ambrette + orris + musk + ambroxan combination is probably what causes people to draw comparisons to Glossier You, however it lacks the pepperiness. It's You in the smoking area; it's You in its grungy teenage 2014-tumblr phase - You itself being the mid-20s clean girl Era that follows.

this has been my signature scent for about a year and i’m finally ready to write about my mostly pleasant, albeit rollercoaster ride of an experience with it.

i’ll quickly preface this by saying that i am a pear STAN. prior to coming across radiant nectar, i had been desperately searching for a musky, pear-forward frag for quite some time. jo malone’s english pear and freesia was my ride or die for a while – but alas, she has the longevity of a toot in the wind and lacks that musky skin quality. i’ve tried just about every pear-forward frag on the market with little success.

enter radiant nectar – clean reserve “skin” had already been in my scent wardrobe, which i quickly burned through a full bottle of, surprising even myself, because i’ve only recently come to like sweeter, musky skin scents. when i found out that clean made a pear-forward frag, i rushed to my local sephora and tested radiant nectar on my skin. reader, my immediate reaction was so kismet, so borderline orgasmic, that i almost fainted. it was a juicy, pear forward, sweet, musky, nutty, PERFECT little sexy musk cocktail on my skin. i distinctly remember sitting in my car, letting myself marinate in my little scent bubble, and thinking to myself that i would devour someone if i smelled them wearing this frag.

in the months that followed, i burned through at least 4-5 travel sizes with joyous abandon and finally broke down and bought a full bottle. in my experience, for a long while, every note alchemized harmoniously on my skin – the sharp, juicy pear opening, the nutty ambrette, the smoky quality of the tobacco flower and that comforting, grounding cedar…if it ain’t broken, don’t fix it. i got so many compliments and several of my friends mentioned that it was “me in a bottle”.

several months into my full bottle, i started noticing that the scent was morphing into a very linear, syrupy, artificial honey bomb. no beautiful, juicy pear note to be found. i stopped wearing it as often to see if my nose was faulty when i returned to it. alas, as i write this, this perfume has transformed into a sickly, uncanny valley-esque chemical weapon. it smells like pure alcohol and nauseating, indistinguishable syrupy honey sweetness. strangely, it reminds me of that artificial, plastic-y quality in ELDO’s “ghost in the shell”.

sadly, i pitched it as it’s now an unwearable scrubber. will i eventually give it another chance and buy a travel size? maybe. i adored this frag so much that it became a personality trait. i’m not sure what about the formulation made this go so rancid, but for those wanting to take it for a spin, i’d recommend sticking to the travel size and burning through it reasonably quickly.

rest in peace sweet prince
clean reserve radiant nectar
2024-2024

This is a strong like from me, I tried this recently and winter is well on its way already but I can imagine this fragrance smelling incredible in the spring or summer. The "nectar" smell really comes forward after a bit of settling, the dry down is something to wait for with this one. More complicated than the other frags I've tried from this line.
On me this is a warmer floral with a touch of pear, it’s sweet but I wouldn’t consider it a gourmand. An every day reach that’s appropriate for work or play. Best dupe for Liis’s Studied.

I love this fragrance. I would purchase a full size if I did not already have Studied by Liis. I loveee a skin pear scent, and this one is more bang for your buck! This one actually has musk in the base, and does not have that iris note some people think pencily. I will say I am not sure about a bottle lasting, but my sample has lasted for 3 years now (I bought it before and never used). Hopefully they haven't reformulated!
It's okay, but I don't really enjoy the pear note in this fragrance, it's somehow sharp and way to sweet to my nose. Definitely one I won't buy from this line.

I find this an odd scent. While I've tried to like this, my nose detects a note that just turns me off slightly. I only get a faint pear, some dried leaves and something metallic. Still using it, though, because at times it gains compliments from people at work.
Musky pear that dries down to something honey like and heavy. At $110 for 100 ml its a great deal, but geez I got tired of the bottle after a while. I had it for 3 years.

To me this smells like a pancake breakfast, with a focus on that messily handled honey bear that's dripping honey at the sides and stuck to your fingers and sweater cuff. I am not getting that leading pear scent that everyone else is. Perhaps the only other reviewer I agree with is the one that smells brown sugar boba. I can definitely see that too.
Anyways I think it's really nice!! It's not my vibe so I wouldn't wear it out but it's definitely nice for sniffing my wrist every so often at home.

Just found this at Marshall’s for 50$ CAD! I had it before, it does go bad quickly. Use it up within a year and really protect it from UV light. It’s really nice, wearable, smells like pear, but musky and with some depth and maturity from the tobacco flower

Edit: I ended up returning it without opening it because I went to Sephora to smell it and their tester had turned rancid. If I had 1-3 perfumes it would be ok, I would have enough time to use it before it got rancid but I have something like 30 full bottles + 20 perfume oils so…
Also I have sparkling sugar. They are not dupes at all, but I think it’s the ambrette that they have in common; so they have a similar vibe/profile and sparkling sugar doesn’t turn rancid to my knowledge. I prefer the peach scent compared to pear

Interesting and decent projection for a clean formula. The opening is a bit overripe pear which isn’t my favorite, but that luckily doesn’t last on me. I used to use carrot seed oil as a part of my skincare routine, and that is the dominant note I get when sprayed on my clothing and for the first 2 hours on skin. Earthy but sweet. Like the honeyed smell of roasted carrots, but not in a gourmand way. Once the carrots fade, this becomes a slightly woody white musk skin scent.

i have had this perfume sitting on my shelf for over a year? i think? i remember it smelling really nice at first, like a light but juicy pear with some floral notes, but now? it smells absolutely rancid. just awful, there isn't a word i can even think of to describe it. one spray ruined all other attempts to layer and i immediately washed it off with soap. use this one while its new and use it before it goes bad!

Literally the perfect quiet musk. They picked the right fruit, the right florals, the right accords and the just the right amount of all of it. Not too juicy, not too sweet, not too floral, not too woody, not too powdery, not too musky…. It has the perfect amounts of all these elements.

This dries down warm and sweet and in my opinion is better than Skin. As much as I love praline in fragrance, it’s too heavy in Skin for me and ruins the scent. But this gets its sweetness from a juicy, almost preserved, pear that balances well as a skin scent. It feels more natural.

I was lucky to get an older batch on deep discount at a rack store, as I’ve heard this has been reformulated. Sad to see perfection tampered with unnecessarily.

That is right that someone else also said that at the initial spray it's a blast of Alcohol and then settle down in 5 to 6 minutes, I think it's reformulated the lady in Macy's gave me this idea, it's a low key leaner scent for high school girls nothing ground breaking
the opening is juicy and delightful but the drydown on my skin has a sharpness that makes it musty rather than musky.

how does a pear get so juicy

fresh and sugary crisp pear, gummy worms, sugar rush to the max

love love love, reminds me of my beloved carioca crush body spray by sdj

--

update: I am sad to say that I must agree with other reviewers in that it does fade fast and turn into a strange acrid, plastic scent :'(
my everyday warm weather fragrance. smells exactly like you’d expect from the name: a juicy pear and sugar water on suntanned skin. the biggest compliment-getter in my collection.

(After the initial blast of rubbing alcohol...) This smells very vegetal to me. I don't detect any sort of "nectar" or fruity notes. It is not very sweet. Maybe slightly musky, but not really in a clean or cozy sort of way.
It reminds me of sticking my nose into my parents' spice cabinet in the kitchen and accidentally getting a whiff of fennel. Very much a damp, rainy day, muddy, green, vegetal, sweet carroty, fennel sort of scent to me. Rainbow after the afternoon storm in the garden sort of vibe. I wouldn't say "radiant" or "nectar" to describe this, but it smells good. Like a clean little garden/kitchen fairy should smell.
Smells like bronzer and sun-dried raisins. I am not a fan.
The opening has a sugary smell like bubble tea - the brown sugar tapioca! I feel like I'm in a bubble tea shop, love it.

I don't understand what is wrong with my nose or if I'm being gaslit by the entire world, but this, and perfumes similar to it (the AG one, Sweet, Glossier You) all smell SO disgusting to me, I am genuinely shocked that people find them nice enough to wear. Obviously it's normal to not like a perfume, or even hate some, but this to me doesn't even smell like a perfume. It's pure burnt plastic with strong musty undertones. Like, I genuinely cannot imagine what part of this people like. And I didn't just smell these once, I've smelt all of them multiple times in different stores. Reading the reviews feels like I'm living in a parallel reality and I'm smelling something other people don't. Where is the pear?? If pear smelt like that I would never eat pears again. This is in no way sweet at all. I can't even describe the notes because as I said, this doesn't even smell like a perfume.

pretty and musky, I like the tobacco blossom note! this is similar to GIAW but with less of that burnt toffee vibe that one has. this is slightly earthy but complements the sweet (kinda synthetic) pear. I like it, don't love it.

Opening: blasts of alcohol, after: sweet, sweet, sweet, almost cloying sweet. Actually kind of reminds me of Sparkling Sugar -CR but without a certain/ couple of notes. Nothing special, could probably find something similar at BBW.

This used to be my HG but I suspect the formula has changed :( It used to smell so fresh and sweet with juicy pear notes, and would last quite well on my skin and clothes. Now, my new bottle I find it almost musty, it's not juicy at all, and the projection and longevity sucks. I tried letting it sit for a few months and it hasn't changed, it's very disappointing and I am searching for a replacement :( (I do see the similarity to Ariana Grande GIAW as well but i don't find it has the same juiciness or projection as the original formula)

I’d had my large bottle for over a year now and it hasn’t lost its pear essence much at all, it also hasn’t developed any alcohol tinge or discoloration. Smells pretty similar to the day I bought it but with the sweetness deepening a bit, like fruit ripening. I recently bought Lattafa’s Kismet Angel/Magic and fell in love with it trying to figure out what it resembled to me besides the popular Angel’s Share dupe claime and it’s definitely this. Kismet Angel is the edible gourmand version of this sweet floral amber. And I get much more amber from this than musk, fresh amber like in JHG Not A Perfume and Dedcool’s Milk, instead of spicy incense amber. There’s nothing at all spicy or dark or caramel about this fragrance. It’s bright and sweet.

I don’t quite agree with the Ellis Brooklyn Sweet comparison, but I can understand it and think that if you can tolerate that *level* of sweetness, then you’d be able to tolerate this one. Both are saccharin and sugary.

This was my favorite spring summer scent last year and I’m really glad to have a spicier warmer version (Lattafa) to wear in the fall-winter.

Overall this one is a fav of mine because it’s much different than my usual sticky-edible gourmands. The only scents in my collection that aren’t edible gourmands are Mix:Bar Cloud Musk, Dedcool Taunt, Burberry Goddess, and a few other sweet florals that are pretty straight forward and hard to compare like Nest Dahlia & Vines or Chloe’s Rose.
The opening is suuuuper sweet. The dry down is actually very nice, but super weak. Not my cup of tea.

My husband bought this accidentally when he meant to buy Sel Santal, the perfume I wanted. Initially disappointed I came here to check reviews and decided to open it rather than return it. So glad I did! This perfume is perfect for work…musky and sweet but the tobacco blossom and carrot prevent it from being generic and precious. Radiant Nectar has become my go-to perfume this summer. I have the big bottle and I can’t stop wearing it. Ironically, I went back and picked up Sel Santal and ended up giving that one to my husband. Now we’re both happy.

Warning: pear is a very delicate accord to use in perfume so there are reports that this perfume expires quickly. Don't get a 50 or 100 ml bottle if you can't use it up in less than 6 months. After 6 months it starts developing a strong alcohol smell and the overall smell gets weaker.

It's okay. Sweet, warm, musky, not fresh at all. A real skin scent. I had the mini roller of this, and I ended up getting rid of it because the roller ball started looking very gross. So I don't recommend the mini roller packaging!

This landed on my radar for "Nectar" and my love of honey in perfumes. I happily skipped around Sephora buying pens of all the scents I had on my radar- without even testing them. I'm pretty disappointed there is no HONEY! LMAO!
Oh, pear nectar is in this. Great, I hate pears.
But I don't hate this. I'm wearing heavily to work and it's STRONG but sheer. Flowery pear musk clean laundry. It's nice. Perfect for work. I could even see myself getting more after my pen. I would have still bought this for the tobacco and carrot- I'm always down for trying a new scent with an oddball note. And while this isn't odd- it's good IMO- the kind of good that keeps me interested instead of moving on. BUT- as a whole- it's clean/shampoo and I crave DIRTY and STRONG.
So- very very nice, but not my thing. However a great day time pleaser.
WOW- reading this goes rancid quick. I wouldn't buy a bottle now.

Fun fact: this is the only perfume I've used up an entire bottle of (in 50 ml size) in my collection over 140 bottles. I would tell myself it's too syrupy and cloying but it's a sparkling pear scent with a beautiful tobacco blossom drydown. Turned out to be addicting to me so it became my signature scent last Spring.

Comment below mine saying this is "just honey" is from an amateur untrained nose.
Smells just like honey. Meh.

this opens with pear, musk, ambroxan and ambrette. the only thing interesting here is the tobacco flower, which grounds things a bit and adds a hint of a smoky floral. the pear starts out on the more realistic side, then gets cloyingly sweet, ugh. for once, i wish they wouldn't do that. the smoky element is there if i sniff my arm but not wafting from afar. this scent would be much better if there was no pear and no ambroxan, imho.

I was gifted this, so I tried very hard to like it, but after multiple wears throughout all seasons, I just can't. I ended up giving it away.
For starters, I don't like the musk mallow note, it doesn't play well with the ambroxan. I think if it was just one or the other it would be fine but layered together it's just stifling. If the pear is there, then it's giving sugar and nothing else. Then you have blonde woods for more dry, musky sweetness, orris root and carrot seed on top of that to dry it out even more, and at the end of things you have this strangely dense, dry, musky scent that's overwhelmingly sweet but somehow still not gourmand. It's heavy, it's artificial, and worst of all it doesn't remind me of anything. It's like an AI's idea of what a perfume should be. I think if the pear was stronger or brighter it would be better. It needs some tartness to break up the structure.

an ex used this perfume. she sprayed it on the shakespeare festival hoodie she lent me. i still smell it in the air sometimes

edit 8/24... I smelled this at sephora because I'm self-destructive sometimes and it smelled absolutely nothing like what I remember. Did she lie to me ?
Maybe I got a bad sample but this is horrid! Smells like bug spray!

This had all the ingredients to be absolutely perfect, yet the comment saying "the fragrance version of pretending to be happy when you're actually chronically depressed" is so incredibly accurate. On my skin it starts out bright, sparkly and freshly fruity only to suddenly become a water logged ashtray in the worst way possible. Like when your medication starts wearing off, it's incredibly strange.

Reserve Radiant Nectar (notes from Clean's website):
- Top: Ambrette Seeds, Pear Nectar
- Middle: Orris Butter, Carrot Seeds, Tobacco Flower
- Dry Down: White Cedarwood, Ambroxan, Liquid Musk

The Pear note is strong but it's almost a pear alcohol drink. It's a sweet, synthetic, bright, sharp pear. There's something slightly sour here. It's in the background to the more pleasant notes. Is it the way I'm reading carrot seed here? There's something completely off about this that I can't put into words. Something that leans dirty or subtlety... rancid. I've never been this puzzled with a fragrance in determining why or what I dislike about it. What surprises me most is that I don't absolutely hate it. 😅

This is very similar to Sparkling Sugar, but with a slightly more earthy note-- there's something almost nutty about it. I adore it, but unfortunately on me this disappears and settles into a skin scent very quickly; I have to press my nose right up against where I've sprayed in order to smell it. Would definitely be a love if it projected better!

I was going to blind buy this, so glad I didn’t! My nose picks up the weirdest note, like a really bitter dubble espresso on top of the pear, totally dominating the fragrance. The pear is there as well juicy and ripe, but this other note just kills it. Wondering if the bottle I tested had gone bad because it literally smelled like I had spilled espresso on my wrist.
Smells like syrup on skin. Very nice scent but lasts about 30 minutes then it’s gone 😔

this smells like burnt sugar on me, the sweetest bite of a crème brûlée. a very different scent than what i was expecting. this scent is intoxicating, but like the other clean reserve perfume i have, only lasts 10 minutes on my skin.
All of the Clean frags have this sickening synthetic note to them that I can't stomach. Musk 12 is so much better and a similar scent profile
I can't explain why, but this this is the fragrance version of pretending to be happy when you're actually chronically depressed

This! This is everything GIAW WANTED to be. They do smell alike, they’re dupes, but radiant nectar is so much more refined. This is a perfect unassuming summer fragrance — for when you wanna smell like SOMETHING, but nothing too crazy. I love this and sparkling sugar; which they do smell similar, but not quite the same. This is lovely. The pear, ambrette and musk just have the most beautiful marriage. If you’re thinking about GIAW and not on a budget, skip that and get this instead. It’s a lot better.

I tested this in the air at Sephora yesterday real quick before I left. Did not smell good. Smelled straight disgusting honestly. Like vomit. I’ll sample it on a test strip next time. Same thing happened with Sparkling Sugar. These 2 scents are raved about in the frag comm, I gotta wonder if their Clean Reserve bottles went bad or something.
boba tea

opens up with the juiciest, most mouthwatering ripe pear nectar. syrupy sweet but not in a sickly nor overbearing way. dries down to a musky nectarine and sits very close to skin. this fragrance encapsulates the nostalgic aura of spring - so delicious!

One of my fav perfumes!! It’s such a unique, nostalgic scent. It smells just like sweet necatarines cooking on the stove. In terms of perfumes listed as similar—
✔️ Clean Reserve Sparkling Sugar: nearly identical, just not as deep. I love both, but I prefer Radiant Nectar for its deeper and longer lasting sweetness. After a few hours, Sparkling Sugar fades to a kind of powdery sweetness whereas Radiant Nectar stays juicy and rich. BUT you definitely only need one in your collection.
✔️ Ariana’s God is a Woman: very similar in the same way that Sparkling Sugar is
✔️ Versace Dylan Purple: similar but the fruitiness is more fresh and not as deep
✔️ SDJ Carioca Crush: similar but the fruitiness is more fresh
❌ Ariana’s Mod Vanilla: a vanilla with fruity notes
❌ JHAG Pear Inc: much less sweet than Radiant Nectar
❌ Nest Golden Nectar: super faint and powdery
❌ Clean H2Eau Nectarine Petal: much less sweet
❌ Ellis Brooklyn Sun Fruit: much more of a fresh scent and not as sweet
❌ The 7 Virtues Amber Vanilla: has really distinct pink pepper that smells almost like vinegar on me
This is worthless to me in every way. I just want to say, try this before you purchase!

I've tried to find a difference between this perfume and Sparkling Sugar but I have to admit defeat. In my opinion, there's almost none. Overall very similar smell. It's ok but it doesn't seem original.

Smells like juicy pear when you spray it but after 5 sec it turns funky. I can’t stand it, turns my stomach.
JHAG’s Pear inc is juicy pear that does not go funky. Love that one.
this smells like a sunny but cold winter walk

A Beautifully Sweet, Tart, Juicy & Radiant Fragrance!
A Beautifully Sweet, tart, and juicy pear nectar that’s bright, radiant, happy, and summery with some lovely warmth from the musk and subtle woods/cedar notes! The blend of notes makes this such a pretty, pleasant, interesting, and somewhat unique fragrance! Very easy to wear, pleasing, uplifting, and great for everyday! Radiant Nectar reminds me somewhat of Coach Dreams Sunset and B&BW Chasing Fireflies, both of which I love! There’s even something that’s somewhat comforting to me and nostalgic feeling with this that I can’t get enough of!

Great performance! I typically get great longevity with fragrances (even body mists) and this is no exception, I get all day wear! The silage is really good too, it can be smelled within an arm’s length.

Similar to Sparkling Sugar and GIAW. It’s hardly detectable to me until the dry down…I have a rollerball so perhaps that’s why I can hardly smell this fragrance but sparkling sugar and GIAW did the same thing to me. It’s def more fruity syrup sweet musk, like canned pears lol. I’m not sure if it’s worth the coin tho, I think for a musky pear I’d rather have Pear Inc

When I first smell this, I picture ladies drinking wine in a fruit garden during golden hour. It's quite warm and a bit heavy, but not too overwhelming for me. As time goes on, the ladies make their way inside their fancy house and sit by the fireplace and chat. It certainly gets muskier at the end, but I haven't smelled cigarettes. I suppose I got lucky with this one because it doesn't work for some.

To me it’s summer and warm, yet elegance. I feel very feminine using it - even though the scent has a unisex feeling musk. To me the opening is giving juicy nectarine (not really pear to me), followed by a quite strong powdery musk shining through equally. There is also a white floral note in the bottom always present to me. It sparks happiness yet comfort. I must admit i don’t find it very sensual. It’s blissful and pretty. To me it’s not an everyday pick because the musk combined with the sweet citrus is a little unbalanced. I do think it is a little too powdery and musky for me. I still love it, but it has its occasions - for me mainly, fresh spring formal events or summer days in the city.

i’m basically on a mission to smell every fragrance with a pear note and i like Clean as a brand so i gave it a sniff/wear test today and by god i wish i hadn’t.

this is candied nectarines. sugar on top of sugar on top of sugar. i immediately wiped it off with alcohol because it was genuinely too much. not sure how this is described as powdery or musky but that’s not what my nose picked up at ALLLLLL. and my nose loves singling out musks/powder notes

this would probably be great for gourmand lovers and/or young people interested in juvenile feminine scents.

Perfect Xmas gift idea!

I’ve been buying this perfume for a couple of years now and its perfect for gifting to friends and family since it’s an easy universal likable clean scent and a great price. I love it, I use it constantly in my car, my hair, on my self, for naps, alone or layering, on my bed and especially on my dog; I don’t feel bad wasting it because it’s not expensive if purchased at certain places. It’s a scent that I will never get tired of and it lasts all day on me. It smells like Molecule 02 (which I’ve worn for tons of years) on me but with added sweet pear. But many people are anosmic to M02 and can’t smell it at all, NOT ME 🥰, so I recommend this one as an alternative. It also smells extremely similar to Glossier YOU, which YOU also smells the same as M02 on me; therefore it’s YOU or M02 but with pear.
This is not a bad perfume but I dislike it and I don't understand why. The notes sound amazing but it's too sweet.

I used the travel size of Radiant Nectar and it's a delightful scent, perfect for everyday use. I particularly enjoyed it while working from home. The fragrance has a comforting quality to it, with a sweet note coming from pear which is not overpowering but rather pleasantly subtle. It's also softened by the musk, adding a nice depth to the overall scent. It’s a very nice, cozy fragrance that's not too intense, making it suitable for relaxing.
it is sweet, smells like pears in thick sirup and cigarettesmoke. It is longlasting on clothes. It last 4-5 hours on skin.

i've seen this one compared to glossier you and god is a woman a lot. i absolutely adore god is a woman and i like glossier so i had high hopes for radiant nectar. i guess it doesn't mix well with my skin because i get a horrible sickly honey-like scent that is so sweet and thick... but in a nasty and headache-inducing way

This smells very clean. I can mainly smell pear because it's so well blended. This is totally signature scent worthy but it works the best during spring and summer. This is the type of scent that you can wear to gym and to school. It won't disturb the peace but it smells subtly seductive. The sillage is perfect for this perfume, it's not even moderate sillage but it's perfect. The lasting power is weak, just like Sparkling Sugar. They smell a lot a like but this smells more clean and fruity sweet. Sparkling sugar smells more sweeter in the sugary sweet type of way. Both of them smell fruity but not in a cheap way. I find them actually almost elegant, because they smell so neat and subtle. These are definitely day time scents.
I rate this 9,5/10.

To me, this sort of smells like the orange pixie stix candy. It's very sweet and sharp. It's not a natural scent. I find it to be a little too bright like it doesn't blend well with my skin chemistry. It didn't smell like the notes listed.

This perfume annoyed me so much. Hooow can it expire so fast? Just how? I have it since less than 6 months and already has gone bad. So if you have it, just use it up, like RIGHT NOW! But I must say my boyfriend got me compliments every time I wore this, but I would never get this again. Better off with the Ariana Grande perfume or whatever smells similar..

Save yourself the time and money when buying this fragrance and just get God is a woman instead. A) it smells way better and is a nicer sweet tone B) it doesn't smell like a musky old fruit scent and C) its cheaper at $65 for 3.4 ounces instead of $110 for watered down fruit water.

I lived for this fragrance on the tester strip, but on the skin I can say I did NOT like it. Everyone is different so definitely try it yourself, but in my experience is was a no brainer to just keep my God is a woman and not buy anything else.

i loved this at first, and tried it in store several times before deciding to buy a second hand travel size. however, it smelled expired to me and not at all like it smelled in the store. i just thought to myself that maybe the person who sold it had kept it for too long, or stored it badly, so i gave it to a friend who seemed to like the scent anyways.

for my birthday i got myself a full version, and loved it in the beginning! however, it's been less than a year and that expired smell has come back. i honestly don’t know if that's just the perfume at this point, but it's disappointing that it turned into a completely different scent than it was in the beginning. i still use it though, but sometimes it kinda grosses me out???
This smells like pear but if it it’s rotting in an ashtray full of cigarette butts. It’s very off putting.

Omg I thought I was going to love this, I love Glossier you, I love God is a woman and I love all the similar fragrances but the pear in this instantly reminds me of one of my most hated perfumes which is La Belle by Jean Paul Gaultier, I just can't with that pear, is so heavy and sickly. To me it smells just like La Belle but with the Glossier you dry down.

Failed blind buy

I have tried at least 85% of all Clean Classic & Reserve scents, own(ed) several, several are among my all-time fav perfumes, but this is the first Clean scent that I have disliked and will return.
The fresh pear is juicy and amazing, reminds me of Pear Inc, but this sickly, sweet and sour, almost rotten scent takes over. It's not revolting but certainly unpleasant to my nose. It reminds me of rotten fruit or almost beer-like in a way. It's honestly nauseating.
its a syrupy pear fragrance. it feels almost honeyed, and rich. I love the muskiness

I just had to return it. This is the first perfume in my 3K plus collection that smells like nothing. No smell at all. I got caught with ambroxan and pear and ambrette. But it has no smell. 1,2,3,4,5 minutes - none. So why pay for water? Very dissapointed.

My skin does not like this. The initial spray smells fine but almost immediately morphs into something nauseating. The tobacco blossom makes me smell like a smoker trying to cover it up with 10 different bath and body works sprays. And the worst part is that it stays on my skin for what seems like forever. I guess you’ll just have to try it for yourself but don’t blind buy this.

I've been using a sample of this I got at sephora and it makes me want to purchase the full size! I find this to be a very subtle, clean and fruity scent. It smells really juicy and sophisticated, but also very natural and light.

I LOVE the smell of this perfume. I am all about the warm, sweet, citrus/fruity family. To me, it is more of a "Skin" smell than the titled scent in the Clean Reserves collection; however, like many of the Clean scents, it totally gives me a headache. Something about Clean Reserve scents is very thick and heavy, which helps them be longer lasting, but for some reason, that heaviness does not agree with my body/brain.
What the...? it's a scrubber for me! Don't even know how to begin to describe this, but I can say it does not inspire 'clean.'
I wanted to like this, but on my skin is sickly sweet, with a touch of rancid spoiled fruit. Had to scrub it off after 20 minutes

I usually like how natural the Clean Reserve fragrances are, but this one was not. While there was an overpowering honey smell, making mostly anything else undetectable, I am able to smell a strange artificial that reminds me of plastic. It's not an offensive smell, but the impression was more negative than positive for me.

Scent Description: Sweet Honey and Floral
Sillage: Fairly Strong
Longevity: Medium - 5-6 Hours
Presentation: Square Bottle with Wood Cap
Not my favorite. Smells bit better as it dries down. Reminds be a little of Onika my Nicki Minaj.
sickly sweet for me. turned rancid within a year of me keeping it in a cool, dark, dry place.

Clean Reserve Radiant Nectar is quintessential late spring: juicy pear dripping in honey nectar, honeysuckle in the breeze, a picnic blanket warmed by dappled sunlight. There's something easy, vibrant, and luscious about this. It's almost heady at times, but dries down to a gorgeous soft and lightly fruity musk.

I don't really get the comparison Glossier You, which is much more musky and peppery to my nose, but this does remind me of Ellis Brooklyn Sweet. Sweet leans more into a candied sugar pear, whereas Radiant Nectar feels like more of a tree-ripened pear drizzled with local honey, but I tend not to love the DNA of Ellis Brooklyn scents and tend to *love* the DNA of Clean Reserve, so take that as you will.

Anyway, I really love this. Besides Clean Reserve Skin (my all time favorite every day scent, arguably my spring/summer signature scent), this is my favorite of the Clean Reserve discovery set. An absolutely easy reach for one of the beautiful, not a cloud in the sky, 75° spring/summer days.

Came up extremely sweet on me, but after a second chance test, I could smell the pear and sort of musky notes. Some other comments accurately describe it as "and overripe pear" but I don't think its necessarily a bad thing. I am not a huge fan of sweet perfumes, but this has some fruit and freshness hiding behind the sugar that I think makes this a more complex scent than I originally thought it was. Would not buy for myself, but this is very "clean girl" scent, erring on the side of sweet. Makes me think of walking through a park during the spring and getting a biiig whiff of honeysuckle. Reminds me of a sweeter version of Studied by Liis.

Juicy, refreshing easy reach. Sipping a fizzy pear cocktail in a freshly laundered soft white towel. Shines in heat but I would also love test in the fall time when I gravitate toward honeyed/sugared fruit vibes. Too much pear sometimes gives me cheap body spray vibes, but not in this. It is well balanced and inoffensive.
This has become a favorite... the perfume that reminds me of when Hades found Persephone picking wildflowers in a meadow.

I have tried this scent several different times - from tester bottles in store, in a sample kit, freebies given to me for free and decants from other people’s personal bottles. I am so utterly perplexed by this scent and I cannot understand it’s popularity, despite my trying.

Every single version of this scent I tried smelled like it had gone bad! Some worse than others, but overall this had such a screechy, off putting pear note in it (by far the worst pear note I’ve ever smelled in perfume, by the way) and then this awful, musty perfume-gone-bad note to it that almost tingles my nose. I wanted to love it and figured it would be a slam dunk as I LOVE pear scents in fragrance. Instead, it was a major NO for me. How is it possible that every single one of the samples/testers I tried of this smells so off and expired?

This unfortunately turns bad sooooo fast and I've had the same issue with skin! The samples I have gotten of both of these are amazing so I bought a travel size of both. In less than a year they both lost the brightness and developed the same odd smell making them both sweeter in a bad way. This must be an issue with the house's formula and "clean" aspect of it. I can say that I've had a bottle of amber saffron and have not had an issues with that! But if you are someone that doesn't use up your bottles quickly, I might opt to try a travel size! Such a shame because I love this when it's new!

I was gifted a travel spray and it sat in my collection untouched for a year because I didn’t love it. I picked it up today on a 90degree day and fell in love. I was surprised at the notes because to me this smells like a deep, rich honey syrup that I remember my Italian grandfather making from the leftover grape skins after he was done crushing them to make wine. I’ll have to purchase a full size bottle!

I get how people can pick up Glossier You, I think it’s the ambrette and ambroxan that are present in both bottles. The similarities are vague enough but I think this one has a little more depth and fruitier than You. Besides that, this is the only perfume from Clean Reserve’s Discovery Set that I can see myself easily reaching for. The rest of the perfumes besides maybe Rain and Solar Bloom did not work on me. It’s a very intimate close to the skin scent I like spraying on my wrists and smelling periodically through the day. Because of its lightness it’s a very easygoing summer scent. Easily my favorite of the discovery kit, unsure if I’ll commit to a full bottle with the reviews of perfumes turning rancid after a couple months.

This one is really a no brainer during the summer for me. I tried it on in the middle of Winter and I did not like it. However, came summer a few months later and this and Very Good Girl are all I wear (yes, I was told by my best friends that it very much smells like "me"). It opens up with a ripe juicy pear and after an hour, I get musky tobacco with a hint of sweetness. After the 3-4 hour mark, it's just a musk skin scent, which will last maybe another 1-2 hours. It does need to be reapplied, but for a casual summer day, I don't mind. However, there is no way I could make this into a nighttime fragrance even if I tried, which is another reason why I don't mind the shorter longevity. As for projection, I haven't had many compliments, apart from around 30 minutes after applying, but I haven't worn this out very much.

My problem with almost all the clean reserve line is that they all smell a bit like a body spray and smell cheap for the price tag.
This I would include in that category but that being said this one is pleasant enough.
Sweet nectarine/pear/orris blends into a light musk. It has a bit of a synthetic quality to it. It reminds me a tiny bit of Sweet by Ellis Brooklyn. I wouldn't get a bottle of this by any means but its pleasant

This is not my usual scent type but I found it on a great deal in Sephora and, probably because I was on holiday and feeling carefree, I bought 2 bottles.

It’s sweet pears, a bit of honey, syrupy and almost spicy. Intensely sniffable; I constantly want to smell it when I spray it on myself. I think it performs better in warmer weather, which is good because it’s the perfect smell for a sunny summer day.

This is what I imagine a peach terracotta colour to smell like.

Edit: ohhhhhh I think this has died on me. Alcoholic blast, then very little scent to follow. Sad.

Edit again: my unopened bottle also died on me. This has a shelf life of 2 years, tops. Beware.
Juicy pear. Not too sweet. Very wearable

this is a pretty, fresh, fruity scent. it vividly reminds me of a bubbly pear drink i would have as a kid:) unfortunately this has no longevity whatsoever, disappears after literal minutes on my skin. mine is a rollerball, so it might have to do with that, but i’m not sure if i’m willing to invest in a spray bottle if it ends up having the same performance… so sad because it would’ve been a go-to on warmer days!

This has quickly become my signature scent over the last couple months. It’s a juicy pear that dries down to a sweet musk with some nectarine. Very simple & I love that it’s cleaner than most perfumes. I get headaches easily so I think what attracted me to this is I could spray as much as I wanted & it’s always refreshing without ever giving me a headache or bothering me. I’ve noticed it lasts best in cool/warm weather & tends to disappear when it’s really hot out. I’ve gone through a whole bottle in 3 months.

Right off the bat this scent reminded me of a synthetic fruity candy. It mellows down a bit and becomes more of a juicy, ripe pear with a bit of musk scent which is perfect for any occasion. I see this as a great Springtime fragrance. It is very close to the skin which isn’t bad but I’d prefer more projection.

When I tell you that this and Liis Studied are the exact same perfume, I'm not lying. Down to the notes, performance, dry down, everything. It's the same. They are each other. Juicy pear to start off, then dries down to a soft, fuzzy, and sweet musk.

It's a lovely smell, but both perfumes are skin scents and do not last or project very long. If you really want Studied, save some money and just get this. You won't be able to tell a difference.

7/10

I love Radiant Nectar, it was love at first sinf. Mine did “turn” a bit over time -I’ve har it for little over a year- but not in a bad way, just the woody notes are much more present, which I don’t mind.
Sadly it has very poor sillage and lasts for maybe about an hour on my skin (maybe less) so I don’t think I’ll repurchase.

Like other commenters, my bottle went rancid after about 6 months. It was kept out of direct sunlight, with all of my other perfumes (some 5+ years old and still going strong). The juice didn't even turn yellow. What was once a light, caramelized pear scent turned metallic and sickly, seemingly overnight. I'm so disappointed because I loved this and how it looked on my dresser.

I sprayed this on and sniffed it, and I was like..."Don't I already own this?" So I looked at the notes and saw the ambrette note, and said to myself "Oh yeah...Fleur de Blonde." I own a bottle of FdB, and this really reminds me of it.

And that's about all I got - the ambrette and possibly some musk. Nice, but I won't be buying a bottle.

Edited to add: I got this out and used it today. It's very warm and humid where I live, and I didn't like this on me in this weather. It's a little sweeter on me than Fleur de Blonde. And wouldn't you know...this is one Clean fragrance that actually has longevity on me, at least in warm weather. Anyway, I put this away to get it out again and use it up in the fall. Thank goodness it's just a sample size.

A wonderful, juicy pear shampoo scent with absolutely no projection or longevity. It would be a “clean girl’s” dream. Bathed my skin and clothing in this in the summer heat and you can barely smell it. So disappointing because it’s an absolute treat, would be my new vacation signature if even massively over spraying did something, but it doesn’t. Got this directly from Sephora so I know it’s not the bottle. Maybe I’m just one of those people especially nose-blind to ambroxan.
I wore a sample of this yesterday and I would definitely reach for it again today. Great everyday fresh, bright scent that fades to a warm sweetness on my skin. Not getting the powdery component.

This smells syrupy to me, it does smell like nectar but it is very cloying to me. As it dried down it got prettier but I do get something rather bizarre I would also agree I do believe it's the carrot seeds maybe (?). I'm not sure for those who couldn't smell it because on my skin it was quite strong. It isn't a fresh scent just syrupy for me. While it does smell different and unique, maybe I'd want this smell in a candle but not on my skin.

Juicy and sweet. Smelt like ripe fruit. Syrupy and earthy. A tad cloying. Clean, slightly powdery and musky. Basic yet inoffensive. Wasn't as offensive to my nose as other perfumes containing Ambroxan.

I don't like this at all... The nectar accord is musky to the point that it smells musTy. And listen, i like musk. I blind bought it at TJmaxx, tried it on my skin a few times, and returned it. The mustiness is not a reaction on my skin because the atomizer gives me that same strange smell. This is not all similar to Glossier You.
I unfortunately could hardly smell this. It's very faint. To me it smells like a very light dusty, musky pear scent. Sold my bottle.
I think the carrot seeds might be turning me off from this scent (?)

I don't know why... but I can't smell this hardly at all!! It must be the ambroxan in it because I seem to always have a hard time smelling scents with that note in them. I was so excited to get this because I love Glossier You and God Is A Woman. I bought it off Sephora so I know it's my nose and not the perfume. What i can smell of it is delicious though. I get a juicy pear with cedarwood then nothing after a few minutes. Ugh!!

I do not get the Glossier You comparisons at all. To my nose, this is very pear forward. It actually reminds me a lot of a softer Zara Unusual Gourmand, which is a sweet and strong pear scent with some salty musks. Glossier You is probably my most worn scent and I know that scent inside and out. No similarities to my nose.

This is a very pretty scent, but it didn’t wow me. It’s not as much of a second skin scent as I was hoping for. If you love the pear note, Unusual Gourmand is a fraction of the price and is much stronger than Radiant Nectar.

I have a travel size, and for me, I don't think this is fbw. It's a nice scent and I'm pretty sure it's just me because I haven't seen anyone else mention it, but I'm getting a banana smell. Yeah, not a bad scent, just don't think this one is for me!

I'm honestly surprised there's not brown sugar or vanilla listed in the base. This gets caramelized and I kept getting whiffs of this sweet caramelized sugar and i was like it must be on my sweater from days ago and I smelled my arm where i sprayed radiant nectar and I'm like there is it. I never expected it to smell like this! Wow..this fragrance is gorgeous from start to finish!!!

It starts off more peachy than pear to me but there’s definitely a fruity nectar burst in the opening then it dries down to tobacco, a reviewer said it’s like incense cones- that is EXACTLY how it smells on me. Its super woodsy too and I love it. Super unique. I would say it’s also good for winter and autumn despite the votes simply because its warm and woodsy to me barring the fruity start. Goes from summer to winter in seconds.

This is the third clean reserve scent I’ve picked up and I must say the moment I smelled it on my skin, it immediately smelled like someone had spilled a flavoured Starbucks coffee on me, it’s quite a strange scent to my nose that I’m still trying to understand.

i have to say i’m obsessed with this scent. for me, it’s one of those perfumes that has me wanting to smell my wrists all day.

radiant nectar is the perfect name for this scent. it smells like freshly cut pears/peaches and musk that really lights up on my skin. it has that amazing salty note that i adore, and intensifies with dry down that to me makes this scent sexy. this reminds me of an elevated version of a scent i wore when i was younger , i wish i could recall what it was. there’s also an almost creamy note that makes this heavenly. my only issue is i would LOVE for this to project more and last longer.
Succulent pear covered with delicious honey. Sweet and cute but not sticky. When it dries, it has an elegant tobacco floral scent that blends very smoothly.

I’ve had my 50 ml bottle for less than a week but I’ve already used up 1/3 of it. Can’t get enough of the luscious brown sugar honeyed pears! This is my new signature scent for Springtime that I can wear everyday. The longevity is 3-4 hours max but I do not mind re-spraying. Figured I would just stock up while I can and had to make use of the clearance deal at Notino, £40 for a 100 ml bottle including shipping.

This is very pretty and inoffensive. I agree it’s not for those who want their fragrance to be noticed, weak longevity and sillage. Cottony pear jelly bellies. Lovely for cooler spring days. A fruitier version of Glossier You.

Not great as far as sillage and longevity go, so don’t get this if you want something noticeable.
This is almost a honeyed floral scent (to me) but a tad fresh. It’s not too sweet, but if you aren’t traditionally a fan of sweet things it may be best to steer clear. This is for someone who like things moderately sweet and floral.

I love this one.

Smells like juicy pears but the other notes balance it out to make it smell "rounder." This actually smells a bit like celery in a good way. Sweet and comforting but also like celery.

Even if a perfume that smells like celery sounds unappealing to you, I'd still recommend that you check this out.

I actually don’t understand the comparison to Glossier You, which I own. I get a hint of brown sugar or honey with slightly sour, natural pear that is much better than the pear in Jo Malone Pear and Freesia. I still find this fragrance very comforting and for longevity I would get this over Ariana Grande's perfume. I got my 50 ml bottle for £35 on Carethy which is a good discount.
My Top 3 recommendations for comforting fragrances that are signature scent material for everyday wear:
1) Clean Reserve Radiant Nectar
2) Le Labo Thé Matcha 29
3) Penhaligon's Changing Constance

The pear at the beginning is much more potent and realistic in Radiant Nectar compared to God Is A Woman, but once the other notes come forward, I understand the comparison. Radiant Nectar stays more fresh and less sweet, although it does still have some sweetness. If you're trying to save money and don't mind a sweeter scent, I'd say just get GIAW. I also prefer Glossier You to this scent, although they don't smell as similar to my nose. Radiant Nectar doesn't have as much of a pull on me.

The name is so apt. "Radiant Nectar" to me smelled like tobacco and honey with musk. It's warm and pretty. It's very linear though, like most of the clean reserve line on my skin. Most reviews warn that the fragrance expires easily... so, I am very wary of it and inspect how it smells from time to time. I got it from a legit source last November 2022, and so far, it still smells good.

When I first tried this from the Clean Reserve Sampler pack I tossed it aside, thinking it smelled like a juvenile Bath and Body Works spray. However, it has grown on me significantly. By itself it’s a bit linear, but it smells divine paired with Clean Reserve Solar Bloom or Le Labo Another 13. It layers very well with many scents, actually, so I appreciate its versatility. My advice is to buy a small bottle, however, as it can turn rancid. I bought a gift set that was on an incredible sale from Sephora and had to return it because even unopened it had already oxidized— it must have been sitting on the shelf for several months.
I'm sorry..but this smells like rich honey peach mixed with straight up cat pee

I am still undecided-this is slightly more powdery than glossier you. Glossier does not give me a headache at all but this one somehow does, it’s a little richer and more dense. I also find that glossier turns sweeter on my skin over time but this one turns more musky and powdery. It does project more but I haven’t figured out if that’s a good thing or not
Update: this transforms in hot humid weather! It’s sweet and marshmallowy, with some fruity notes-the musk keeps it from being cloyingly sweet. Less woodsy and more juicy. I really like it but it smells much different in warm weather, I would only wear this spring/summer

Actually, smells EXACTLY like the opening of Glossier's You, with a touch of honey inside.
"Radiant Nectar" is right - it's a light, bright, sparkling, organic sweetness from the honey, with a hint of fruity musk from the ambrette and pear.
It's pleasant, with a soft projection and about average longevity. It's definitely less "dusty" than Glossier's You (as someone also mentioned below), but on my skin, the difference is minimal.

I don't get as much musk or ambroxan as I'd like, but it's still a pleasant, inoffensive fragrance.

Amazing scent! If you like perfume vibes like blooming bouquet or bright crystal or dior addict 2 this might work perfectly! Very fresh and a little sweet in a pleasant way. Tobacco is not too strong but adds some very nice edge. Just perfect, juicy, delicious, mouth watering scent! Highly recommend

With all my love for clean reserve, this one doesn’t smell clean, it smells cheap. And dusty. Sort of grandma like. The pear is sour, that’s for sure. I would not use it, it smells exactly like cheap toilet water.
Fresh. Shampooy. Clean. Pear. A little sweet. A little bit too sharp.
I absolutely adore this perfume. One of my favorites and this would be my signature scent, but sadly it definitely does not age well.. Mine expired in about six months too. So be aware when buying!
fruity shampoo 😍

For whatever reason I feel like I am picking up very different notes from both those listed and other reviews so take this with a grain of salt but:

For me this is a rich, jammy fig scent, like a Fig Newton, with a sort of grape juice like sweetness. It has the earthiness of fig too, which gives it an interesting organic feeling. I do agree with reviews below that it is a warm, syrupy, fruity scent. Just disagree on the fruit in question. Definitely a unique summer or fall scent.

I have found most of the Clean Reserve line basic and safe yet unoffensive, but this one was somehow actively straight up nasty on me. I did not think something like this with these notes that I generally tend to like would be such a scrubber for me, but something in it is just completely off. I know the sample I tried probably wasn't turned because I got it new from Sephora when the fragrance debuted, so it was something with these particular components and my body chemistry. In the vial it smelled fine. I think it is probably the pear, as some pear notes can go well... pear shaped on me. I have not yet smelled anything in the Clean Reserve line that is spectacular, but I think that is probably good. There need to be safe, easy-to-wear perfumes that don't always scream their presence. Those just aren't for me.

My bottle has expired, I bought it around 6 months ago from Sephora so I checked the batch code and it’s not even a year and a half old yet, and I store my perfumes properly. Pretty upsetting considering these bottles aren’t cheap. It smelled incredible when I first bought it, so I’ll probably buy it again but I’ll stick to getting travel sprays any time I buy from this brand from now on.

i thought i would love this and that it might be a good alternative to another 13 based on the notes, but when i sprayed it, it smells just like the opening of god is a woman from ariana grande, except without the sandalwood which makes that fragrance compelling. there is something sharp and sour (probably the pear) in the opening of radiant nectar that makes me immediately wrinkle up my face in displeasure lol.

I didn’t think I would like this perfume because my first impression after sprayed it on a tissue was “Meh, another too sweet one”. I have a lot of perfume vials and it was not remarkable in my memory. But last night, after accidentally sprayed it on my skin before bedtime, I was supprised! It has a strange sweet smell, I thought it was vanilla or caramel at first but didn’t see them on the notes list. I really like the mixture of pear and tobacco - those two are stars in this perfume. Also changed my mind about sweet part, it’s not too sweet and very clean, well blended, and the scent isn’t mainstream. The sillage is weak but I’m a fan of intimate perfumes so I like it even more, and I quite supprised that it’s long lasting. I will use it in spring or autumn, but won’t wear in tropical summer days.

Update 3/12/23: I found out the strange sweet part was tobacco, after I had a chance to smell my friend’s tobacco CO2 extract. In my nose, tobacco now is the leader in this perfume, and how I love it! This perfume became my favorite bedtime scent, made me feel pampered everytime spraying. I changed my vote from like to love :’)

I know most people seem to love this in summer, but I prefer it in winter and cold spring days here in Scandinavia.
I find it too cloying and my experience with the fragrance in warmer weather is, that the tobacco note becomes way too prominent for me.

So I will review it, as I experience it in a colder climate.
It opens up with a pear note, similar to that of God is a woman. The pear plays really well with the ambrette, to create a pleasant, soft fruity musk. The tobacco note is not very strong, but it is there, but in a pleasant way. This is coming from someone who struggles with tobacco notes and don't quite enjoy it in perfumes.

I know it is not listed, but I almost get something resembling a brown sugar note, but without it becoming too sweet.
This fragrance pairs so well with a warm cozy sweater and will stay on my clothes until the very next day. It is by no means a projector. I can smell it all day in my cozy little scent bubble, but others will have to get closer to me to smell it.

My experience in summer is, that it becomes sweeter, projects more but the tobacco takes over and ruins the balance for me.

It's a big like for me, but not a total love.

I was really surprised when trying Radiant Nectar multiple times, because people have been saying that AG's GIAW was inspired by this and that Radiant Nectar was still better. I personally disagree, I would pick GIAW 100 hundred times over this.

From afar, RN does smell nice, a bit floral & rather clean. But you really have to be far away. I generally like how earthy notes add contrast to perfumes, but in here it's too much and it reminds me of celery.

However, what I hate the most about this perfume is how dirty it smells on my skin. I rarely get body odor vibes from fragrances but with RN I experience it completely. The first spray is celery mixed with sweat. If I get my nose close to my skin (no need for me to even touch it), it smells like I exercised really seriously, let my sweat dry, sprayed perfume on me and went about with my day. It gives me flashback of junior high and high school days, when many of my classmates would do just what I described and think that was the smartest move in town.

In comparison, GIAW just smell fruity and clean. Smells plain but pleasant with no dirty undertones to me. RN is really not my vibe.

Edit: After +10 hours, the fragrance is still sitting on my skin, so longevity is actually very good. I surprisingly get whiffs of the perfume without getting my nose close to my arm and thank goodness, only the clean notes are left. It now smell REALLY good... but it also smells similar to Clean's Simply Clean and Kayali's Musk 12, which I both really like.
So for this dry down, I wouldn't bother suffering with RN and would just get the 2 perfumes mentionned.

I really liked this fragrance when I first smelled it in its debut. It worked really well on my skin and had really good performance. I tried it over the summer and it seemed to just blossom on my skin.

I’m not sure what happened, but this fragrance doesn’t work with my skin the way it used to. I’m not sure if because my taste in perfumes has changed or because my collection has exploded, but it’s not giving what it gave before. It smells nice, but I think the tobacco flower gives it a weird and paradoxically dirty smell on my skin.

It does smell very similar to Ariana Grande’s God Is A Woman, so if you have that, you probably don’t need this one too. However, I don’t see the comparisons to Glossier You. This is something you can wear year round without offending anyone.

EDIT: I sold my bottle.

I absolutely love the smell of this fragrance. I definitely get the tobacco note which I love! It’s a fresh leaf tobacco not a smokey one. And I’m surprised by the pear note because I’m getting more of a juicy nectarine. This one definitely has a fresh vibe that is different from most freshies. I’ve also gotten compliments when wearing.

*PREFACE* After having Covid, it's taken about a year for my nose to get back to normal-- and it's still not quite 100%. With that said, my tastes have changed with my nose, but this scent is one that still smells the same to me as it did before Covid, which has been such a blessing. I can no longer do really heavy or smoky scents because my nose never adjusts to scents in a room-- I'm always aware of smells around me now. I wanted to preface this because my needs with scents are probably different than others.

*REVIEW* With all of that prefacing out of the way, this scent is fresh, juicy, musky, and just all around pleasing. It's in the vein of JHAG NAP, JHAG Pear Inc., Glossier You, and the "clean girl" scents. This has a fresh, musky and clean woody vibe on top of juicy pear and a bit of fresh honeycomb mixed in. The nectar vibe is really present. What is lovely is that I can douse myself in this scent, and my nose adjusts well but also, it just makes me smell fresh and clean without being too intense. I can layer any scent over it and it really gives a great base to any other fragrances. I love to layer it with Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia.

Dupe-wise, it's very similar to God Is A Woman from Ariana Grande, but GIAW is much more sugary and you can tell the ingredients are not as high quality as the Clean Reserve. CR is muskier, more woody and unisex while GIAW is more sparkling.

More than just being pleasant, this scent is just a perfect staple for day, night, any occasion, any season-- it's foundational to my perfume wardrobe and it's been a great reentry into fragrance now with the changes I am experiencing. I wear it to the office daily and get compliments quite often. Overall, this fragrance is a must for me and I'm so thankful I can lean on it as a safe go-to.

This smells almost identical to JHG Pear Inc (which I love), but with a touch of honeycomb. Clean, simple, not cloyingly sweet — I really like this one for right out of the shower. A very “meet the parents” scent. For some reason my boyfriend compliments this one over JHG, so I guess that’s saying something? I don't feel like you need both, but this is really lovely.

Smells amazing! Like Fruity and Musky at the same time. Extremely similar to God is a Woman from Ariana Grande and kind of similar to You by Glossier, but this is a sweet version of that one. The only downside I see from this brand is that it seems like most of their fragrances turn bad really quick. I guess that is because this is a clean brand that uses other types of ingredients which may not be as durable as others.
