So make sure to store this is a very dark, cool place where it can last a little longer.
smells like sour pear dont know if i like that. Like it smells like i ate a pear and just never washed my hands

On my skin, this smells like honey & pear with some depth to it. I don’t normally gravitate towards this type of sweet scent, but this one got me. It’s sweet but not cloying at all and it still has some clean vibe, which I love. I personally would wear this indoor during a daytime.

As a few other reviewers have mentioned, this is reminiscent of brown sugar bubble tea (minus a lactonic milky note). It's sweet and syrupy without being cloying. I love it so much. My only gripe with this fragrance is that it doesn't last long on my skin, but that's to be expected with clean scents.
Like glossier you but with sweet pear, and musty brown sugar

My partner's immediate response to this one was "That smells just like You, the Glossier one." I was really impressed, because although I knew of people frequently comparing this to You, I actually didn't personally pick up on a strong similarity between them. This is syrupy sweet on me—too sweet, in fact—which is not how You pulls on my skin (I get more of the pencil shavings side). I'd say this is a pretty 50/50 combination of You and Ellis Brooklyn's Sweet. I will say that the pear note here is gorgeously rich.
Warm sugared pears on my skin. Sweet woody musky sexy.
Why do I get a balloon like smell (latex?). Weird scent. Not for me.

On paper this was a little too sweet and loud. On skin this really does embody the word "radiant"-- a warm scent bubble of pear (not green pear, but ripened, warm, juicy pear) and musk. Ambroxan is hit or miss with a lot of people but when done right it adds an airy, resinous sweetness, such as in this. Reminds me of warm sunshine at the end of summer.

On first spray, I was a little disappointed, smelling only a sweet alcoholic scent.
But then... WOW!
The most divine, warm, sweet and comforting bouquet bloomed upon my wrists! I was so shocked. I actually left Sephora to walk home, and then I ran back to spray more. It is so good. Warm, powdery and delicious.
The warmth of this scent has parallels to coffee dates, cosy jumpers, autumn walks, phone calls with friends and vintage love letters.
It is a lovely scent with a nice projection and lasting power. Not insane silliage, but suits the intimate aura of this perfume.

I really really hated this one for some reason, I had to scrub it off. However, I found it kind of difficult to wash off and I guess that would be a positive if someone enjoyed it. Syrupy sweet + tobacco, I'm not getting pear at all for some reason
Smells like dish soap, spray mirror cleaner, and maybe a lemon sparkling water during a roadtrip. I do like it! I think this is perfectly suited to springtime.
Well, I can report that if you keep this stuff in my bathroom cabinet for ten years - it start smelling like black pepper, dusty old wood, cinnamon and.. dried apples? Not bad lol.

1/10
It's so airy it reminds the residue of a toilet freshener. Very disappointing.

lemony, fresh and clean. its nice but not suitable for a gourmand girl like me. i have nearly a full bottle of this lying around. if anyone would like to buy/trade feel free to dm. i am in the eu, scandinavia
Very fresh and airy. I’m not sure why but it reminds me a lot of Victoria secret’s coconut and rose mist.
A lesser Light Blue. Surprised lemon isn’t listed among the top notes on here. It’s a perfectly fine scent, and admittedly very fresh for spring and summer. Will need reapplying very often though.
This scent was nearly perfection and I am so sad its ben discountinued. Fresh, a little muscy, clean and so mild that you could splash it on without a thougt.
Too weak and short lasting!
a mixture of soap bar and air freshener.
I'm so surprised the notes do not list coconut - does anyone get coconut?!
My favorite out of the shower/freshen up scent. Clean really says it all. It’s fresh, bright, & crisp w/ a little citrus. Perfect for super hot days, it’s one of my go to for summer.

I actually own this perfume and this perfume is really interesting on my skin. For instance when I first wear it the first few month during summer (2019) it smells fresh, clean, musky and unique. I tried it again last year (2021) summer and the smells developed really well. It starts with the usual boring fresh, clean scent then it turn aquatic...and sweet at the same time. I always use the same Granny's soap with no perfume and put on Nivea unscented lotion. Nothing had change in my prepping routine except the perfume just kind of develope. I have gotten loads of compliments from co-workers about myself smelling sugary sweet when I wore it. Even when my boyfriend and I both wear it he tells me that it's sweeter on my skin compared to his.
I still adore this perfume and I sometimes even layer it with Gucci Mémoire D'une Odeur to make it smells a little earthy and really unique. I also add layer it with Tom Ford F*cking Fabulous to prolonged and make other perfume more unique.

I've left a review of this in 2015, and I need to write a new one - I just found out that this has been discontinued. (I live in Finland.) This is one of my go-to scents, and it has been since 2015 when I first got it. I've been through many bottles and today I bought the last one out of my closest department store.
I still deeply love it! It starts with some notes that I don't specificly enjoy but the drydown on my skin is so nice. So powdery, musky, soft and just perfect. Goodbye dear friend, you will be missed.

Lezzzzzzzzgetit.

EDT - 0/10
Straight up, headache inducing synthetic sweet smell.

EDP - 4/10
I'd rather buy a fake than this. It smells nice, but I could hardly smell anything. The smell lasts for like 5mins before it disappears. I'm only disappointed because it's very expensive (70 AUD for 60ml) for a very short lived perfume. Should be like USD $15 RRP nothing higher than that.

On a good note, smells so fresh 💯💯 & is definitely not offensive or over powering.

Does anyone else get pencil shavings on the dry down? This is a big NO for me, a real shame because I absolutely love the 'Clean Warm Cotton' scent from this line. No lasting power whatsoever. Maybe I'll use it as a layering scent for Moschino Funny.

It smells powdery on me, I don't get the citrus or the green notes unfortunately. I do like the musk and how this scent will disappear and reappear throughout the day. If you smell nothing, just wait ;) It's the perfect "out of the shower fresh" scent and is not the typical citrus kind of fresh, it's more warm. I like this more during the colder nights.
Tried this the other day and I got confused of what I am smelling. It smells nothing at first sniff.I had to focus just to smell the notes of this perfume. It has very minimal scent of citrus.

This, to me, is a true skin scent.
I don't understand what people mean by it being a fresh-out-of-the-shower-scent.

It's not.
It's not soapy.

It is, however, a mellow, slightly musky, human, comforting, barely there...mist?

I do not totally hate this scent, but would not re-purchase. It smells clean and lemon-y but reminds me of bleach immediately when sprayed. I put it on a few times in the hottest summer days and it mellowed down to a clean, airy scent. Stays well on clothes but evaporates quickly from the skin. Try before you buy.

First thing it reminded me of was Febreze, like an air or car freshener. But it does quickly mellow out into something a bit more ... "airy"? Compliments for conjuring the concept of 'air' very well, but it does immediately become apparent that 'air' doesn't make for a very riveting perfume. It's a skin scent in 10 minutes. 3/10

Dear members, I am writing this message because I would like to kindly ask you a favour. I was quite interested in this perfume and I found some good cases on ebay because Clean as a brand does not exist in my country. I quite reluctant a little bit because I see two different designs of packages with different prices respectively and I do not know if they are original perfumes or not. The first package is a totally light blue colour while the other one is white and light blue with some asymmetrical lines on it, if I can try to describe it. Do you know anything about it? I would appreciate any comments about that. Thank you for your time.
Clean, laundry, flower, maybe a hint of pepper. Doesnt last too long though.

i love this scent.....a fav in the line !!! im not sure how they did it but it totally smells like what i would think air smelled like lol............

its fresh , clean , crisp & something like clean mountain air is the vibe i get

its perfect if u love simple fresh scents or if u need a safe pretty scent

i find it uplifting :)

It must be a reaction to my chemistry, but after and initial fresh smell, it quickly turned to a urine smell. I tried it again a couple weeks later and the same thing happened.
I love the Clean Skin perfume but this just does not agree with me.

I’m a Registered Nurse on a critical care unit - patients are very sick and do not want to smell overpowering fragrances. I’ve stocked up on Clean Air because it smells as it’s named - clean and fresh - just like laundry detergent or soap. I gather that’s a major negative for a lot of fragrance connoisseurs out there, but there has to be a niche in the perfume world for crowd and work safe scents and this one is it. IMHO, this is a feminine scent. Unless a man wants to smell solely of laundry detergent and soap and lightly of flowers.

On me this smells like a breezy lemon cleaning product of some kind, with maybe a hint of a lovely laundry soap - nice, but not a great perfume. Smells much less complex than the notes suggest it should be. I'll be giving my rollerball to Oxfam and instead using similar breezy lemony perfumes that are much nicer.

Clean Perfumes is the best invention ever.

They are all so pure and clean. They simply replace the morning shower, ...actually they replace all kinds of cleaning procedures.

Since I have this I just give a damn about buying soap, shampoo and taking showers and now I have more time for more doing other things, ...mostly alone???

Gorgeous! I adore this stuff.

KEEP ON SPRAYIN'

"...a bottle of Clean a day - keeps the doctor away"
This reminds me of my much loved and discontinued Charlie sunshine. Only have a small 5ml of this but will definitely be buying a 60ml soon.

I liked the names of Clean Rain, Clean Skin and Clean Air. So simple and natural! Tried them and loved them all. Air is now my all time favourite and definitely my signature scent. It's clean, fresh, pure, discreet, uncomplicated in a very good way - wearing it feels literally like a walk in the park. Fresh breeze, flowers, leafy trees in spring or early summer. A nice walk a perfect day. Definitely for day wear, definitely office safe. Kind to us who easily get migraine and headaches. It's sold as unisex, but I don't know... Would not like it on my husband, but it's absolutely right for me. Smells very good from the start until it fades - sadly to fast, like most of the Clean perfumes do.
// Update a few years later: Things changes. I still like this scent, but it's no longer my signature. Guess I used it too often, too much and got a bit tired of it. There is a wiff of something artificial, chemical in the mixture that I didn't notice before, or maybe CLEAN has changed the formula lately? I loved my old bottle to the last drop.

I know what the previous reviewer is talking about with the rotten melon in L’eau D’Issy. I personally have problems with a lot of perfumes with melon. Honeydew, on the other hand, is an exception. That smells great on me, but melon as in cantaloupe reads marigolds on me and is quite stinky. Clean Air is not like that at all on me. No melon note!

The bergamot blossom is citrusy, but not tart. Mixed with fresh air accord, this is very nice and cooling. With musk and cashmere wood in the dry down this is a lovely fragrance to wear in spring and hot summer. Clean Skin which I LOVE is more for fall, winter, and early spring for me. Doesn’t wear well in the 100 degree weather we have here during the summer, but Clean Air IS!! So glad I tried this and wish I tried it sooner. Now I have a clean fragrance to wear to work all year long.

I work in a doctor’s office and these fragrances work wonderfully. People smell them, but they’re never overpowering. They LOVE how clean and fresh I smell and some compliment me all the time. Some people, including myself, even find these two scents very comforting. I haven’t tried layering them. Perhaps I will sometime.

I like the freshness of this scent. I kept wearing it, trying to figure out where I had smelled this before....then I realized: Air smells JUST LIKE my favorite hairspray, from the L'Oreal Studio line of products!! It's actually a great smell...but I wouldn't pay to have a perfume that smells like it. It is a very crisp, simple, and light. But seriously...if you wanna know what this smells like before an online purchase, go to your local Walmart of Walgreens, and sniff the L'Oreal Studio products!

Air is a very simple sweet musk. I'm smelling something citrusy even though there's no citrus listed in the notes here. It's OK on its own, but really shines when layered with some of the others from this line (I purchased it in a pack with Warm Cotton and Skin). Would be a good option for somebody looking for a clean light "non-perfume" perfume.

I found a three piece layerying box set the other night at Winners that had this one, shower fresh and warm cotton, I will say that I do absolutely love fresh fragrances and it is hands down my favorite the of fragrance! That being said, I think I found my new signature fragrance! This is so fresh so clean so amazing! Think of Poppy flower type , so pretty! I was shocked to see this as a unisex fragrance, not that it's super feminine but I just had not thought it would be but hey why not !

Clean Air by Clean smells so good – yet is very simple! It is a pure, fresh, breeze with a soft clean musk and crisp floral notes. It is nothing over the top or distinct – it is just so pleasant smelling that I cannot get enough of it and have worn it daily! I am a Clean fragrance lover and have six other clean brand fragrances from there line. I think they are great to wear to work or just as a light scents to freshen up with!

Oh this was such a disappointment.....as Blanche is a personal favourite I had great expectations for Air. First impression vas plastic, not like and aldehyde,but a weird smell I think it reminds me of barbie dolls. Several hours and washes later I still smell is. Few smells give me a headache but this does...no no more Air for me.

I ordered a sample of this and sprayed it on a tester strip. The top notes remind me of lemon-scented cleaning fluid. As it dries down, it becomes a bit more pleasant, and is reminiscent of mountain air with undertones of evergreen foliage. Not my favorite, though I have yet to try it directly on my skin.

As someone who's always been sensitive to strong scents, I never considered myself a perfume lover until this year. Then I found a rollerball set of Clean fragrances. Hey, why not, I thought -- an inexpensive way to try five perfumes at once AND an invitation to experiment with layering? I felt like a kid again with that toy from the 70s, the Barbie perfume maker or whatever it was called.

Cool Cotton captured my attention first. Air was so light, I pretty much saved it for when I wanted to add a floral note. But I kept coming back to it. Eventually I decided it really was a gorgeous scent. I kept wanting to smell it again, and I found myself reapplying throughout the day and smelling my wrists more and more often.

I finally bought the 1 oz. spray bottle. Now I can smell it at arm's length and it lasts longer than just a few hours. I'm in heaven! I'm not ready yet to commit to one fragrance (still having fun experimenting), but Clean Air is the closest I have to a signature scent.

This is so fresh, gentle, and light. When I smelled it my nose thought I was smelling Sea of Love, a discontinued Philosophy perfume. I always thought Sea of Love smelled more like air than sea! Yes... if fresh, cool air had a smell this is it. Aldehydes, lightly floral and just enough musk but not a heavy one. Perfect for day use and crowded work spaces.

This perfume really does live up to its name - Clean Air. It's very very clean and soft and airy and fresh, like a beautiful light breeze that just feels super cooling and good. No detergent smell or anything like that. I really llike it.

The bergamot blossom in the opening gives a touch of citrus at the start. The drydown works very, well, clean without being aquatic. The aldehyde does give a fresh, airy effect. Musky but not too much like laundry soap like much of the rest of the line. Good daytime work scent, sillage is very soft and I can't see it offending anyone. I wish it lasted longer just 2 hours.

Wow, no cirtrus notes? I'm shocked. It smells very fresh, aldehydic and citrusy.

I want to enjoy it more but as a perfume I don't. It reminds me of True Religion and Revlon's Charlie White.

No mountain air, this is beach ball in a bottle! OK it opens citrusy but then I get this strong plastic vibe, smells exactly like those blow up beach toys I had as a kid back in the 70's and 80's. Like the air inside them tasted and smelled like! Quite fun :) And then there's an ok musky thing growing stronger whilst the beach ball fades down. Fresh, light, perfect for the beach, but I prefer CLEAN Ultimate, White Woods and Skin. Very poor sillage and longevity is less than an hour on me.

This clean is one of my favorites. It smells a lot like the clean skin but with added watery and light floral notes. It's really pleasant and I think it will be a real winner when the weather here gets up in the 100s. None of the sharp soap note that is prevalent in a lot of the clean line. Just soft and airy.

I looooooove this one. Absolutely love it. This reminds me of D&G's 14, which is one of my all time favs ever. After few hours Air feels so soft on my skin, just like the touch of... Well, Air :) Love, love, love!
Love this. The perfect fragrance to pair with an existing one that shares some of the same notes or to wear alone. Been hooked on this since the day that I bought one.... Time to get a second bottle!

CLEAN AIR invokes a feeling of “blissfulness”. The scent is not overpowering, and for lack of a better word is simply clean, like fresh cotton or newly done laundry you bury your face in. The DOWNFALL of this fragrance is its longevity they name it right cause once you spray it proof 30 seconds vanished in the air. I purchased the rollerblade. Maybe the bottle perfume will have better silage & longevity, but I'm not willing to pay $70 bucks to see if it does.
Has anybody smelled this yet? I been wanting to purchase a bottle of it. But, hoping to read reviews of it first, to get an idea of what it smells like.

product_name: Air & Coconut Water Eau Fraiche Clean
review_content:
Nice enough, but honestly instantly gone. It's a steal for the amount you get, but you kind of have to overspray to get any kind of "longevity" out of it which never lasts longer than 10mins. I think you're better off trying to find something that lasts longer with similar notes if you want a long lasting scent.
However, it is an eau fraiche so I guess you're warned of the longevity and thus should expect this to be a refresher right after a shower, gym or swim.

product_name: Air & Coconut Water Eau Fraiche Clean
review_content:
Found on another website....

Top Notes - Italian bergamot, Lemon, Blackcurrant
Heart Notes - Coconut, Freesia, Rose
Base Notes - Musk, Tonka bean, Solar note

product_name: Air & Coconut Water Eau Fraiche Clean
review_content: This is heavenly! Coconut water is definitely present and is the most prominent note. Be aware however if you want a creamy coconut scent this is definitely not for you! The coconut is fresh and green on this . The longevity is very low. I get about 45 minutes on this . It comes in a very big bottle however so you can be spray happy without it going out quickly . Great cheapie!

product_name: Air & Coconut Water Eau Fraiche Clean
review_content: Nice. The coconut was pretty fleeting and takes a seat in the nose bleed section for the dryown leaving nothing but all freesia and musk. Impressive longevity for an "eau fraiche" sillage sits pretty close to skin tho. The sprayer on the bottle.....it's crazy huge, like a garden hose sprayer. Makes reapplying a cooling event for those with no aircon.

product_name: Air & Coconut Water Eau Fraiche Clean
review_content: This is a surprisingly good fresh summer fragrance. Smells like fresh coconut water, light floral and solar notes, it does not have that weird synthetic smell that many coconut fragrances have. I picked up a huge 5.9 oz bottle for 22 bucks, great cheapie for summer!

product_name: Air & Coconut Water Eau Fraiche Clean
review_content: I just received a huge bottle of this and am in love. I completely agree with Wwoman's comments below, and I would add that there is a Hawaiian touch to this because of a hint of green tropical lushness just slightly wafting with the fresh ocean breezes and solar notes. I love spraying this liberally when I want to feel refreshed and lightened up. I also do like that it lasts longer on clothes and hair, making everything smell like it's been on a laundry line in Hawaii.

product_name: Air & Coconut Water Eau Fraiche Clean
review_content: Not to be trite, but this truly smells like a tropical vacation to me. First it smells fresh, like Clean's other fresh air type fragrances. Then there is a lovely note of coconut that is *not at all sweet*! I hate that "tropical" scents smell like a pina colada smoothie half the time and are sugary as all get out. This fragrance, on the other hand, smells like you are standing on a beach with the breeze blowing and someone just cracked open a fresh coconut next to you. No fake sunscreen scent, no overly sweet fruits, and no weird seawater smell like other fragrances of this type. Sure, because it is a body spray, you have to reapply and it is not very pungent. But having the realistic smell of a beach getaway at your finger tips is worth all that. I love this for summer, obviously, but I'm kinda saving it for when I need to feel like I'm away from it all.

product_name: Air & Coconut Water Eau Fraiche Clean
review_content:
Top notes: Bergamot, Lemon, Blackcurrant buds
Heart notes: Freesia, Rose, Coconut Water
Base notes: Musk, Tonka bean, Solar flowers

Not sure why I'm not a huge fan of this one, and I was VERY surprised to not see lemon or lime listed in the notes. This one was just too sour for me, probably the way the bergamot and grapefruit are blended.
Really similar to golden citrus, but without the laundry-ness. Smells green, fresh, a bit sharp. I don't know how to rate this one yet... it's not great but it's not awful.

Sharp grapefruit and truly unisex.

I have it to my younger brother.

Be warned - this line of H2EAU fragrances stains clothing like a spill of vegetable oil. It is not alcohol based so when you apply, make sure to not let it touch fabrics. Also, it gets gummy / sticky. This line is great in concept but disappointing in execution. Sigh.
Mostly grapefruit!

Very different from what I usually like (Floral fruity perfumes) but I think I like it. Smells soft, cozy and calming. Very good for cloudy autumn days, fits the mood perfectly which is kinda funny as the name is Nordic light which would suggest it to fit sunny days. Nope, I feel like this fits the cloudy, gray, foggy and cold days much better but of course that's jus tmy opinion

Soft and clean, but i have came to realization that sandalwood does not really suit my liking.

Bought this mainly becouse it was described being snuggly, cozy etc. what sounded just what i liked, but definetely not cozy in a way i was looking for. This reminds me of basic, too clean, beige scandinavic home style of cozy and smelling this frangrance in pillow nearby makes me feel far from cozy and almost like unbearable even tough it is not bad scent at all just very unfamiliar and stranger type of scent to me. Giving this one away.

Fresh and airy. A bit floral and very cozy..I really like it! More of a skin scent with decent longevity.
Rating: 6.5/10

Boy this has really grown on me. If you want a gorgeous clean musk with just a hint of sweetness this is for you. I hate sweet scents and i love this because it is just a touch. Easy reach, good for sporty girls.
This is very soft and comforting. Not offensive, not complicated, safe to buy as a gift for example. Skin scent, just got out of the shower kind of scent.
Doesnt smell like White Woods at all. This was a bummer for me. Very artificial smelling

This is a fresh, nutty, woody scent with a clean edge from the citrus and flower notes. It's cozy and clean smelling, like an expensive furniture store or a warm hotel. As it dries down, it reminds me of clean, fluffy towels.
I normally go for gourmands, fruity scents, and blended florals, but this really felt like the a great clean, woody scent. It's definitely unisex and I think it's perfect for fall and winter.

(I can definitely see what others said about this smelling kind of like "baby wipes." It's more pleasant than that, but I get it.)
This scent is so light and inoffensive. It's pretty much a skin scent but it's lovely. It's targeted for colder weather, but I think it would be great for summer, too.

This is nice! "Soft" and "fluffy" are two words that come to mind when I smell this. Very inoffensive but not boring. The praline is surprisingly prominent, but it's not too sweet or cloying by any means. It's nutty and comforting. I also get the milky sandalwood, a tiny bit of citrus, some airy white florals and vanilla in the background.

I think you cold wear this any season, as I don't think it would be to light for cooler weather, but light enough for warmer weather!

verrrrry similar to Zara Fields at Nightfall on the dry down to my nose, but FaN seems to have better sillage if that’s what one goes for.

Nordic Light is great for healthcare workers— light, inoffensive, woody.

First thoughts on Nordic Lights.
Sweet, clean, cozy, airy and fresh. Lovely from that at first sniff and a really good one from Clean.

A relaunch of my dearly beloved and discontinued White Woods from the same brand. Citrus opening and cool and comforting woody notes. The listed notes on them are almost the same and so are the scent. Clean, soothing and calming for a cosy fall/winther scent. Longevity is better on clothes than skin and silage is moderate in the first couple of hours…then it turs into a wonderful skinscent. This one is mostly for yourself. Office safe and unisex. Love this little affordable gem.

This is actually very pleasant, mostly powdery wood with some subtle sweetness. Decent longevity and a soft, comfortable sillage. Smells like how a good day feels, if that makes sense. I'll evaluate if I'll get it or not, have to test it a couple of times more.
Does not smell like peony to me, not even a little bit
Does not smell like the peony flower.
Your typical floral fresh scent. The best way I can describe it is as a slightly sweet watery peony. Simple and gorgeous. If you love aquatic fresh florals this is definitely worth a try.

Brilliant Peony alone is very linear, but it's not a bad thing. It smells like straight up peony with a water note. That is it. If you love that, you will love this.

BUT when I mix this with Clean Reserve Skin, it turns into this soft, cozy, floral musk. It smells like cuddling in fresh sheets in a garden, under the warm sun with a cool breeze.

I like it, but I have other similar fragrances I just prefer because this is just so subtle and the product execution just.. isn't the best. It can leave a sticky film. I have this in a small rollerball, so it's also making the roller ball less functional with the residue. When you first apply there's a very 'sour candy watermelon' smell and then after about 30 minutes it gets pulled back and the peony comes forward. It's nice. I love fresh aquatic florals for spring and summer. I prefer 'Flower Fresh' also by Clean over this, though. If you want a fresh clean smelling Peony, I also really like 'Flower Bed' from Fine'ry, too.

This scent seems to get some mixed reviews, but I found it to be quite nice. Lasted for 6+ hours on me, however the projection is subtle. It is pretty one note, but the peony is so fresh with hints of an aquatic note.

Very odd dichotomy on my skin, simultaneously it smells like a delightful aquatic peony that is irresistible, but then smells a bit salty out of the blue in the next breath. I wonder if it has something to do with the water base? I'll test it again on a warmer day.
very pretty and lively peony fragrance ♡ it smells like swimming in a clear stream with peony bushes all around! 💧
It simply smells like watermelon on my skin, very watery. I hate it

Smells like aquatic peony fabric softener, very clean, this is in no way a dirty och jammy peony. I believe this is the best clean/fresh laundry fragrance on the market. As stated before it is fairly one note. But I must say it is a classy, refined, elegant and office appropriate scent. It doesn't have the hash detergent note of warm cotton and smells soft, the sweetness is really subtle. Really great everyday fragrance that is unlikely to bother anyone. I imagine Charlotte York smells like this. This H2EAU line has gotten really mixed response on the formula, but I feel like it bothers my nose and lungs less than regular perfume with alcohol, so it's a win in my book.

Edit: gave me a headache
Light, refreshing, linear, pretty, but has absolutely no longevity on my skin

The fragrance is nice but but pretty one-note. It does not overpower, but gives character. It gives you that smell of fresh laundry without smelling like fresh laundry.

The nozzle broke after just three weeks of use which is a HUGE minus for a product on this price range (even cheap 5€ fragrances won't suffer from this).

Another big negative is that this perfume gives me rash after few days of use and the rash won't go away quickly (and I never get rashes from perfumes). It might be due to it being water-based and the perfume not dissipating properly from the skin.

I just don't get the point of water based perfumes, Oil and water are typically not a good mix, And water lacks the preservative and anti-bacterial properties of alcohol, So they won't keep well. I wouldn't buy any, Only alcohol based or pure oil perfume for me. It's kind of a shame though, As some of these scents sound very nice.

This is, as others have stated, a more "one note" fragrance. It isn't complex. It smells like peony from start to finish... Maybe with just a whisper of white musk right before it completely disappears.
If a watercolor painting of a bouquet of peonies had a scent, this would be it. It's soft and sweet.
I don't find it to have poor lasting time. Quite the opposite of what I expected. After putting it on only skin, I still catch whiffs of this 8+ hours later. It's subtle, but it's there.
As to formula concerns, this is entirely unique to anything I own. It is not a typical alcohol based perfume and you can't wear it the same way. I tested it on cotton fabric and I didn't find that it stained, but I could see how that would be an issue if you sprayed the perfume too close and didn't allow it to fully atomize. It might also depend on what type of fabric you spray it on. It will make your clothes slightly sticky and it is tacky on skin. I put it directly on skin before clothing and just don't bother trying to apply it to my clothes.
It's a skin scent that forces you to wear it that way.

Be warned - this line of H2EAU fragrances stains clothing like a spill of vegetable oil. It is not alcohol based so when you apply, make sure to not let it touch fabrics. Also, it gets gummy / sticky. This line is great in concept but disappointing in execution. Sigh.

This smells gorgeous, but very one note on me. The top notes give me nothing but peony, and it continues to be all peony when it dries down.

I got this as part of a discovery set, so I’m looking forward to layering this with the other scents to create something different, but I can’t see buying a bottle of just this one note.

Peony is probably my favourite note in a perfume and this does not disappoint if that’s your vibe. This is very much that clean fresh lightly floral and very girly light perfume that’s an easy grab for any type of day, any type of weather, any occasion! It’s work safe and in offensive. Is it revolutionary-no. Is it ground breaking with wild notes that are so intriguing-no. But it’s a beautiful fresh aquatic floral that ya can’t go wrong with! It’s a love for me!
Very fresh, juvenile.

A pretty, fresh, bright, and watery floral! I think this would be especially lovely in the springtime!

The bright and floral peony and the fresh watery scents are what stand out the most to me. The musk and sandalwood are more subtle, but become more prominent on me as the fragrance dries down.

I think the peony is very well done. It’s very realistic smelling, just like the peonies in my garden right after they open.

I typically get great longevity with my fragrances, but I wasn’t sure what to expect with this new H2Eau formula. Surprisingly, it lasted the whole day on me. The projection was also nice, about an arm’s length with a light application.
This was quite nice. It smells floral but watery and youthful. Not very sweet
This is so delicate and beautiful! It's a fresh floral scent that would be perfect for the spring! I really like this one! Sweet flowers! Perfection!

This is a great everyday scent. Accidentely ordered warm cotton and immediatley knew it was wrong. This is a nice "freshly showered and clothes out the dryer" scent. It is really nice and I will repurchase.
This smells like laundry detergent dissolved in ice cold water, somewhat in a minty way. overall a great scent for everyday use.
smells like clean clothes :D

Cool cotton to me is a little too sharp for my taste of clean smelling fragrances. It smells a little two male colognish for my taste, and is a bit sharp with the fruity or citrusy smell. I’ll wear it to the gym and see if I like it. I don’t think I’ll be repurchase this, but who knows.

The best description of this perfume that I can give is that it's great scent when you have to take a three hours train ride and don't want to bother any other passangers while still smelling nice. Makes me feel clean and put together. I don't get much lemon though

The citrus is a bit much at first but once it dries down it smells like fresh laundry. Not my usual scent profile, but I can sort of appreciate it. Can't see myself wearing it out, but have used it to freshen up linens.

I have both cool and warm cotton, I find warm cotton smells like clothes fresh out the dryer while cool cotton more so smells like water mixed with laundry detergent. It has a subtle aquatic vibe to it also, smells really lovely. I have such a large and expensive perfume collection but funnily find the perfumes from clean classic I own really easy to wear and suitable for so many occasions and every day use.
Smells like a laundromat, I love it. This is everything I wanted Warm Cotton to be. For context, warm cotton smells like lice shampoo to my nose, it's gross

I definitely fall on the side of reviewers who get a light, cool, fresh scent rather than a synthetic lemon cleaner scent, so I like this -- it's great for days when you want a low-key fragrance. The only reason this is getting a "like" rather than a "love" from me is that the longevity is pretty bad -- 2 hours max, then you need to reapply (however, given the reasonable price, not the end of the world I suppose).

Dewy-Cool & Fluffy Cotton-Linen & White-Musk...

This is overall a white-musk scent, but with a dewy-coolness that verges on fresh. Opens with a soft, fluffy citrus with faintly fruity tones, but the musky cotton is swelling through with distant reminders of scents like Light Blue Dolce& Gabbana (although this isn't a dupe). As it transitions to the heart, the cotton-musk comes more forward with a hint of mint & mimosa that lend a powdery, fresh clean laundry vibe. Although this isn't a dupe, there's a dewy coolness here that reminds me of Cool Water Women Davidoff, but this isn't as sweet, and has a more musky-cotton vibe. The white-musk has some reminders of White-Musk The Body Shop, although again this isn't a dupe. The base notes, mostly white-musk, keep the effect going for average performance for a spring-summer wearing experience.

Overall there's an understated cooling, clean cotton/linen effect. I just have an aged sample of this, but this is nicely done and fans of understated white-musk scents might like this. Enjoy!
This is a beautiful warm linen scent. Good for spraying bedding before/during storage. Pillow spray.

I love this scent. Basically smells to me like fresh laundry, which is the point! I love how clean it smells and it's really simple too! In a way it smells a bit like hand sanitizer or cleaning supplies too, but the dry down has a fresher scent. Either way I still love it!

Longevity is mediocre, around maybe an hour or two. So reapplying comes into play.

Here's a comparison of most laundry scents Clean offers:

Cool Cotton - definitely straight up lemon cleaner as many people have said. I was expecting a strong lemon based on the reviews, and generally I like the smell of cleaners, but this is way too realistic, it doesn't smell like a perfume but like a literal window cleaner. Not much else to it

Fresh Laundry - compared to Warm Cotton this smells more like actual laundry washed with floral/sweet laundry detergent, rather than the citrusy laundry detergent itself, which is what Warm Cotton is. Fresh Laundry is almost fruity in comparison. Not masculine, but somehow leans towards a more mature scent I can't see myself wearing. It just doesn't have that clean, after the shower feeling I was looking for, it's actually pretty heavy, almost dusty.

Soft Laundry - not similar to Fresh Laundry at all. This is more youthful and lighter. Musky, slightly floral, and citrusy. There is definitely citrus in this despite what the notes show. Not sure if I would use it, it's a bit more like a cleaning product rather than laundry detergent or clean laundry which is what I was looking for. My main impression is that this is a soft musky neroli + lemon or some other unsweet citrus scent, not bad but not at all what's advertised.

Fresh Linens - very very musky. Musk is the dominant note. This is the closest one to Skin by Clean in a sense that this is a very warm musky clean skin scent as well, with some amber in the base. This one I can actually smell on myself unlike Skin, although barely. Definitely has amboxan or Iso E or whatever they put in these skin type scents. It's very weak on me but I wonder if it's stronger to other people that can smell these types of scents. I assumed this scent is exactly what Skin would have smelled like based on the description. Overall it's very nice, not what I was expecting but I am pleasantly surprised.

Warm Cotton - Tide detergent scent but in the best way. Pretty unisex but only if sprayed lightly, if you spray a lot it turns slightly masculine. These types of laundry scents aren't supposed to be loud or it comes off as a cheap cologne, so I would definitely recommend only spraying one or two sprays as this is extremely strong and lasts hours. The best one out of all the Clean laundry scents in my opinion.

Darnit. No. It really is too sharply synthetic. It smells like laundry detergent much more than I like and has a sharp edge. I really wanted to like this and tried hard, but it’s a clear no. Warm Cotton is much better, much less synthetic on me.
its my favorite perfume, my go to for almost any season/occasion (though its especially suitable for spring and summer days), its a lovely fresh scent that mixes well with my chemistry :)

I don't understand what the other reviewers are smelling here. I really enjoy fresh, clean scents, but this is a hard no. Cool Cotton has the same cheap, shriekingly synthetic scent as Febreeze and certain toilet bowl cleaners. And in my mind that always makes me think someone is lazy and doesn't clean or bathe properly - like it doesn't smell clean, just like you're trying to cover up the fact something isn't clean and that's just kinda gross to me - sorry ladies! (It seems like everything made by Clean seems to really make me ill. They're just so synthetic-heavy and headache-inducing. I'm pretty sure they all must contain some level of d-limonene because my allergies go crazy around that stuff.) This one has a minty note that makes it more bearable, but it's difficult to breathe when someone near me is wearing this. I guess the bonus is that this stuff is very resistant to fading and seems to stick to skin and clothes like glue. It's also a sillage monster, easily filling a room. With that said, due to the reach, it's probably not work-safe and definitely not health industry job safe.

This is one of my favs and go-to when I need a scent boost to lift my spirits. I love it because it just smells clean and fresh. Like you just took a fresh bath with some high-end bubbles and body wash. It’s even nice to spray on your bed or favorite pillow so you feel wrapped in fresh, clean laundry. It’s just nice. Does not smell cheap or heavy. It’s just a great everyday scent.

The touch of mint gives this one a refreshing, cooling quality. Cool Cotton starts with a quick mist of lemonade, then dries down to a fresh crisp cotton fabric scent. It's like air conditioning for your skin in summer, or a cold breeze from an open window in winter. The cool feeling stays with you even after fragrance becomes a close to skin scent. Cotton flower, mimosa and white musk combine to create the very slightest hint of a powdery feeling. It's really more soft musk than powder. Non offensive, office friendly.. Uplifting, refreshing, and a real crowd pleaser. Perfect for anyone, any age, to wear anywhere, all year round.

This is a pile of cut lemons on top of laundry. I enjoy warm cotton, but this is much more tart than that one. Mint is listed in the notes but unfortunately I don’t smell any here. I wanted a detergent smell but it’s so overpowered by all the lemon. In short, it smells like lemon scented laundry.

This scent is interesting. This perfume smells almost like men soap (you know the green dove one) but on the dry down it's a little more pleasant. This particular scent should be layered. When compared to the warm cotton, this fragrance doesn't touch it at all not like laundry detergent more like soap.
Yes, it`s smells like clean, wet T-shirts from laundry.

Smells like a cotton tshirt freshly laundered and left to dry on the line. My mum told me I smelled like detergent. She wasn't a fan but I am its so clean and relaxing. I am not sure about this scent as a perfume I am going to try it a few more times to decide but it won't be wasted as it will make a nice spray for pillows and newly laundered bed sheets. Dries down to be fairly aquatic.

I like this but only buy if you want to smell like detergent.

The name says it all.
Powdery musky cotton with minty fruits and citrus in the background.
Inoffensive, and easy to wear, definitely smells like fresh laundry.

•If you don’t like “aquatic” fresh scents, might not be for you.•

I like it for a “non perfume” kind of day, when you just want to smell like you went into the shower and put freshly out of laundry clothes on, while someone cut an apple in the background.

The sillage is weak , a skin scent after around half an hour. The longevity is moderate.

Def a unisex because of its fresh soapy fruity scent.

The September 2021 EDP formula
Very offensive. It's different to the other clean fragrances because it has an off putting pungent scent that is head ache inducing. NO THANKS

It’s funny, I love the CLEAN line-most of them or some of them. Warm cotton I can not stand, to the point that every layering package, multi package etc (which is at least 10+) and I’ve given the warm cotton away each time.but I purchased a large order from one of my online websites I purchase cosmetics and fragrances from so I got this As a free sample within my order and I can’t believe how much I love this. It’s citrus, fresh and laundry soap sort of, but it’s how I love it. Give this one a try!!!

I won't duplicate all the other reviews by describing how this scent makes you feel like you're fresh out of the shower after using expensive soap or wearing crisply ironed shirts, because this fragrance can be both of those things, but it also reminds me of burying my face in freshly laundered European linens while sprawled on a deliciously soft bed.

I like wearing this when I'm feeling blah and want to feel comfortable and calm--and very, wonderfully, fragrantly clean. It's also good for days when you get bogged down in between complex fragrances. This is simple and well blended: it's hard to pick out the distinct notes. Cotton flower, mimosa, and white musk are the most I can find in this.

Sillage is low-moderate and longevity is about 4-5 hours on me, finishing with a lovely skin scent that lingers for several more.

This is a type of clean scent that is bright and chilly, like stepping out of the shower on a sunny, spring day. It is brazenly acidic, unapologetically soapy, and absolutely refreshing. The best thing have been learning, as I make my way down this line, is they deliver exactly what their name suggests. This is critical for blind buying, and acknowledges the customer deserves some basic respect in determining olfactory identification. Unlike some that think you won't know the difference. Take Pure Honey, which smelled like everything but pure honey! They have claimed Cool Cotton, and that is exactly what you will get. Where as Clean Laundry had slightly warm, fuzzy chords, Cool Cotton jumps out with sharp citrus. One is cozy, and one is refreshing. I don't think I will go further with my analysis, because that would be like critiquing laundry detergent. I will say this one last thing. Dry down lingers with this herbaceous brightness that reminds me strongly of Bath and Body Works, discontinued and now deemed vintage, body spray titled Lemon Basil. Which I can no longer find. So bonus! That verdant characteristic has extremely respectable longevity for a Eau Fraiche, which also amps up my affection for it.
Inoffensive and very gym-friendly. This is what I would wear when I wake up late for class and didn't have the time to take a shower. Smells like soap mixed with fabric softener.

I've had this for a few years, but don't wear it often. I like it when first sprayed, but about 10 minutes later it takes on a metallic smell and it puts me off. The Metallica smell doesn't last long, but I really can't stand that stage of this scent.

Straight out of the bottle, Cool Cotton brought back memories of a lot of the fresh aquatic/green scents that were popular in the 90’s. Think along the lines of Cool Water, Polo Sport, Nautica, Tommy Girl, etc. As it began to dry down, though, it really started to exemplify its name. It’s not a “going sailing” type of aquatic smell, but more along the lines of “recently bathed.” It smells like fresh laundry that has been dried in a fruity-floral fabric softener. There’s really no other way to describe it. As their Warm Cotton scent also smells like fresh laundry, I think the mint note is what makes Cool Cotton different.

It’s not something I’d wear for date night or an evening out, but you could definitely wear this to run errands or to the office. (I mean, c’mon, who’s going to complain about working next to someone who smells like they showered today?) This could also be a workout scent or when you just want a good pick-me-up, as it gives that just-washed-up vibe. I’d say it’s a good selection for Spring/Summer, however I could see it appealing year-round to people who are fans of this type of scent. Cleanliness doesn’t really have a season.
The smell of Cool Cotton is clean and pleasant, but it lasts maximum 5 - 10 minutes. That's very disappointing. Not worth of money, not even 5 bucks.

Cool Cotton by Clean opens with a refreshing minty green pop of bergamot that mellows to a sparkling lemon-apple blend that gives way to a clean cottony musk. I love fresh laundry and laundry detergent and I want the whole world to know it, I really don’t understand why some people are embarrassed by smelling like clean clothes. You ever smell someone in stinky clothes? *yuck face* nobody would buy that perfume. I am a huge clean fragrance fan this is the 8th scent I have purchased from the brand. If I can’t decide on what to wear from my collection or am in a hurry, I can toss this in my bag and go – it’s a no brainer! Fresh and easy scent!

I would use it on my pillows and blankets to give them that out-of-the-wash smell between washes, but I would never use it on myself, and I remember after gym class in high school, spraying it on my gym clothes and having someone rudely omit "Who smells like laundry detergent?" with a frown!
I, personally, don't want to smell like detergent or my laundry, as my clothes already have that slight smell to them, and I don't need the world to know how often I do my laundry - doesn't much matter to me. I want people to smell me and wonder "That fragrance is gorgeous, what is she wearing?" or "she smells delicious" rather than "someone must have just done their laundry!" So I would not reach for this ever again on myself, though I would perhaps buy another one just to have to spray on my linens and blankets and such! Just not on myself :)

Very fresh, laundry detergent, clean scent. Citrus and apple are prominent. Like a “cotton” or “linen” scented candle. Normally not something I am very much into, but I wore my little sample of this extensively while in Barcelona this January, which was a bright spot in a very dark time for me so this scent to me is tied to unusually calm, relaxed feelings in a comfortable, “clean, well-lighted place.”
6/10

It smells just like laundry detergent so personally I like It! Moderate sillage for maybe 20-30 min before turning into a skinscent. Weak to moderate lasting power depending on your skin, moisture makes it last longer so use some lotion before spraying.
The budget version from H&M called "T-shirt" is actually better though, it is less sharp and much stronger than this.

I would say this is a unisex fragrance.
I second the voter saying warm cotton vs cool cotton is the same as warm towels from the dryer vs a shower with expensive soap.

Topnotes are juicy sweet apple, lemon and bergamot warmed with cotton flower and a hint of a bitter masculine tone. The citrus is not a very sharp smell - more like a very bright smell, more like rubbing your hand hard on a lemon peel and smelling the oil, than actually biting into the shapness of the lemon.

As it dries down, there is a hint of lemon cotton flower and musk. Base notes - definately some amber

It has a very weak sillage and is not long lasting. On me it lasted maybe 15 minutes?

Makes me think of a watered down version of Guerlian Acqua Allegoria Herba Fresca but less green, more warmth from the cotton flower and amber

A definate (but weak) "expensive soap" smell . Not a "laundry chemicals" smell.

Its OK but not memorable in any way. It is much more 'perfume like' than the other cleans (simply soap, clean original, ultimate, shower fresh, fresh laundry, summer linen) , which basically imitate detergent or soap . This one is definately a perfume with all the artisticness that goes into the perfume. If I didnt know it and smelled it on someone else, i would say it is defiantely a perfume and not simply clean soap or fresh clothes. The trouble is, in creating this fragrance Clean has shunned it's cult status of imitation smells, and has produced a perfume which is 'perfume like' with layers and artisticness but simply doesnt do it very well. So you have a perfume which smells like a perfume, but in fact is a mediocre one. I cant imagine it would be anyone's favourite because there isnt anything to make it stand out.

It is very similar to Clean Provence (discontinued) which was the expensive triple milled french soap one BUT this one is more green and warm, much much weaker

In summary.

Unremarkable, weak but pleasant expensive soap fragrance.

VEry different to warm cotton which is more of a warm clean towel smell. I would recommend warm over cold
A nice minty body wash clean., if you want to feel fresh out of the shower.

I'm really jealous of whatever it is that you guys are smelling in the other reviews, because to me this smells like febreeze and a portable toilet freshener had a child. I absolutely loathe it. I blind purchased at a deep discount, thinking that if I didn't like it I could at least use it as a room/linen spray. Nope. Never want to smell this again.

To me this smells like soft, cool cotton sheets. It's natural, clean, and refreshing. It reminds me just a bit of Estee Lauder White Linen, but a softer, fresher, less sharp and more updated version of that scent. If you like clean and fresh fragrances, I recommend trying this out (actually the entire Clean brand).

I tested a manufacturer's sample, and dabbed it. This is an aquatic, clean cotton t-shirt type of scent. I can't pick out any of the individual notes that Fragrantica lists (besides the cotton) as it is very well blended - but the overall effect is very aquatic, reminiscent of something Issey Miyake might make.

The sillage was quite powerful upon initial application, but died down to a skin scent within 2 hours.
This smells exactly like the green dove shower gel.

Here's how I'll put this because I'm being honest. If you like the scent of soap after a shower and want it to last longer, this is THE perfume to put on. It's just a blast of clean towel dried cottony goodness. You're gonna smell a little like dove soap and if that's your thing, you will love it.
I intend to by this one... :) recently I discoverd #Clean produscts and I think it;s another level of scent, androgyne, light, contemporrary.
This smells clean, oceanic, and almost fishy because it smells so close to the ocean. It also smells like clean laundry. It smells like the Yankee Candle scent 'Home Sweet Home' I don't like it.

So to start I will say that my favourite type of fragrance is a clean, fresh smelling perfume. So when I got this as a free sample I thought i couldn't go wrong, and technically speaking I didn't. It does smell amazing! It does smell fresh! And it does smel clean! But here's the thing.... It smells EXACTLY like the towels I took out of the dryer! So yes, this is absolutely fresh and clean....but it's like, how you want your clothes to smell as they come out of the dryer, or how you want your bedding to smell when you go to lay down at night! This one would be perfect for if you were to have a bath or shower in the evening right before bed, and then you spray your clothes with it, lightly on your body and then your bedding as well! As far as a perfume goes, no....I will take a pass on smelling like laundry!

Guilty pleasure... I kinda love this stuff! Perfect for summertime, when I myself don't necessarily have a signature scent, but like to experiment with different fresh fragrances outside of my usual warm/spicy preferences. I get the zingy citrus and clean cotton up front, followed by the gentle musk drydown, and it's really nice! I must be one of the lucky one's who's body chem mixes well with the product, because it lasts a good 8 hours on my skin and longer on my clothes. I love wearing this with a crisp white tee that smells like my laundry detergent.. Putting it to good use this summer, cuz who doesn't wanna smell fresh & clean on a scorching hot day? Very pleasant stuff for the warm season.
This smells like a wc duck in a public restroom. Including the urine leftovers.

Surprised how much I like this! There is a distinct dryer sheet/laundromat smell with something metallic and fresh right in the beginning. The dry down is quite nice on me--light, clean white musk--and it comes on rather quickly, about thirty minutes in. I can tell that this is strictly a scent to be worn for one's own personal satisfaction because there is next to no sillage and longevity is poor. If this came in a set with matching lotion and shower gel/body wash then it might actually be worth paying full price for, but I am happy with my small rollerball sample. This is also a good scent for layering with the other Clean fragrances, especially the Warm Cotton and Air.

Smells very similar to Clean - Warm Cotton. Unfortunatly this has absolutely no lasting power on me, it smells ok on me for like 15minutes, and then its gone.

Very weird, especially because Warm Cotton lasts all day on me.

Meh, what's to say about this scent.. I personally did not enjoy it too much, it's very fresh and clean smelling but there is nothing intriguing about it. My friends really enjoyed the scent, and one of my friends loved it so much I ended up giving it to her. It's ok I guess, but there's nothing special about it.

This is not a scent I would normally gravitate towards, but since it was a free sample I decided to try it. The name is certainly accurate - cotton, with a bit of citrus to make it more interesting. Projection is low, as I tend to expect from Clean. I enjoy it more than I thought I would. But honestly, I wouldn't purchase it. Perhaps I will finish the sample, perhaps I won't. I am finding it difficult to muster any opinions about Cool Cotton at all. It's "nice," but nothing more.
Smells like crisp, clean, laundry detergent. I wouldn't wear this personally, but it smells so good :) I would use it as linen spray!
This smells like a cotton candle. Way too strong of a scent for me. I thought it would be more soft. Didn't care for it but I did spray it around the house.
i don't usually go for a fragrance like this but smelling this made me feel like i had just been transported into a luxury spa. it's a nice break from the scents i usually go for, and an easy reach!

I adore this scent, whenever lending it to others I tell them it's what I think a freshwater mermaid would smell like. The perfect summer or spring scent, the lotus scent mixed with cucumber and marine notes is so perfect, it really paints an image in your head. It is definitely more feminine, but I could see anyone wearing it as well. This may be a little niche in this community, but if you play the game Overwatch, this would definitely be Lifeweaver's signature scent. 8.5/10

I love this. Clean and fresh. It's honestly real subtle but also a wonderful intimate fresh out of the shower and spa fragrance. The longevity is quite impressive it definitely remains pretty intimate for a long time it's a nice scent bubble for those who don't like wearing fragrances that project farther than arms length or to offend. The cucumber is obviously the most prominent note. It's like B&BW Cucumber Melon grew up and got her life together. She's in her healing era. I'd say this is a safe blind buy. You really have to dislike cucumber as a whole to not like this.
I smell water… just water. Disappointed. Nothing about this perfume stands out and I wasted my money

I’m basically obsessed with this whole line. I have full bottles of this, waterfall and nectarine petal. They all smell amazing, but like many I’ve tried from Clean they don’t have a tremendous amount of projection or sillage. My biggest issues are: 1. The product is sticky when you spray it on, and stays sticky for at least an hour while wearing. I assume this is due to the water-based nature of the perfume. And 2. Again, due to the perfumes being water-based they have a pretty short shelf life. The website says they are only good for a year, unlike most of my perfumes which can last for years if not decades when stored properly. I haven’t actually had these long enough to test that shelf life, but it is a concern of mine.

Edit a few months later: when these sit on the shelf long enough they take on a musty quality.

As true to its name as it gets. A slightly sweet very watery lotus scent. I am an enjoyer of light scents, though I tend to go for the powdery iris/violet ones, I still thoroughly enjoy this and if someone walked past me wearing this I would think they smell really good.
smells like a lemon lollipop at the pool on a sunny day when you were a kid, very refreshing and not that sweet

I've been obsessed with aquatic, clean scents lately so this one hits the spot! I agree that H2Eau Water Lotus is similar to the Dove cucumber soap, but there's an added floral sweetness to it, which I love! Sometimes cucumber notes turn picklish on my skin, but I don't experience that here. The projection is only a 1 foot radius and longevity is moderate, which I've come to expect from "freshies". Still, I think this is a solid choice to add to my aquatic fragrance collection!

sweet, aquatic, id call this a wet floral. evocative of lily pads, damp moss, and gently moist air. the lotus/peony/cucumber accord gives this levity and airiness but it still is fresh and undeniably saccharine. i would drink this if it was a tea/beverage
dove brand cucumber bar soap. the light green one that always felt fancy as a kid. it's lovely, and inoffensive, and not worth what I paid for it, but it fills a niche in my collection well enough.

one of the things i love about the clean brand is their ability to make inoffensive scents that make you smell shower fresh. of the ones i’ve tried, this is one of my favorites.
it reminds me of the cucumber melon bath and body works scent - very nostalgic, but a more modern take on it. this one is just an easy reach, especially for spring and summer.

The other reviews are a bit baffling. I thought maybe I just didn’t have a good enough nose or wasn’t rolling it properly, etc. I sniffed and sniffed and waited and sniffed again. I put it on my skin, I put it on paper. I applied a little, I applied a lot. I waited overnight, I sniffed more. I just do not sense any of the notes in this. It just smells like strong, synthetic perfume to me. What I must be smelling i the amber or musk. At one point I thought I got a bit of cucumber upon initial application but I quickly lost it. And I’m very familiar with cucumber fragrance as cucumber melon was my go-to in the 2000s. There is nothing aquatic. There is nothing white floral. It’s just generic artificial which I can only attribute to the peony perhaps mixed with the amber/musk if going by the notes. I will say it was only tolerable when I applied a very very small amount, the fragrance did have a light freshness to it then, but not without perfuminess. I purchased another brand’s perfume the same day with beach notes—that one smelled like salt water and sand brought in by the breeze, so I know it isn’t my nose to blame. Maybe I got a bad batch, I was really let down that this perfume didn’t have any of the important notes and is barely wearable, despite the good reviews.

cucumbery, aquatic, light. very fresh and lovely, but also nothing to write home about. still a good scent especially if you're into cucumber, this definitely has a good note of it. also felt very ozonic, which is a gorgeous combination of water and sky in a smell. suspicious about lasting power, lasted only about 3-4 hours on paper so can't imagine it to be better on skin. also i don't like limiting scents to seasons but this is like 99% summer frag

I never thought I'd like a cucumber-y scent so much! Excellent, clean, fresh, and the sweetness almost turns that cucumber into a very watery watermelon, but not in a bad way at all, as I don't usually like watermelon in fragrances. This scent is so lovely, I can't wait to wear it on spring strolls by the pond watching damselflies buzz by young green lily pads.

I bought a gift pack of the new H2eau line from clean that had all of the new line in it and some of them I looooved. I can’t remember all of them but I knew this one and musk noir(maybe that’s not even what it’s called) we’re ny favourites so I ordered a full size of this. The scent is so nice, it’s really aquatic and fresh smelling. If you are into fresh, aqauatics, citrus or aromatic perfumes this will absolutely be your jam. The one thing I will say about this whole line is that it has kind of a gross feeling to the liquid. It’s almost oily and sticky and then if you were to slide your finger along your skin it would kind of be like when you neeed GOO Gone for tough stickers, gross description I know but I can’t describe it any other way. It’s so gross in fact I changed my rollerball head and dumped it into a spray bottle, so I could spray it onto my clothes rather than my skin, it really is that bad. Scent 10 out of 10 , the liquid -10 out of 10 lol

So fresh and clean. Doesn't smell synthetic at all, the scent is soft without harsh edges. This isn't a head turner but the perfect fragrance to wear to the office or day to day when you just want to smell clean and put together. Wearing this kind of gives the vibe you go to an expensive spa surrounded by a peaceful lake with lotus flowers on it, and serene zen gardens. After taking a shower with their expensive body washes and shampoo, you leave smelling like Water Lotus.

It's a refreshing cucumber scent, but I wish there was something a bit sweeter to help it lean more feminine.

Gave it to my younger brother.
I’m a big Mojave Ghost lover and to my nose this smells very similar

this scent is one of my favorites! it is a light, summery scent that encaptures a vision of sitting nearby the lake. i can smell the lotus, water, and other greenery in this perfume. it also gives off a clean scent as if you just stepped out of the shower. my only wish is that this perfume doesn't spray too well and leaves my skin feeling a bit sticky. avoid spraying it directly on clothes, especially light-colored clothes, as it will leave a stain! overall, though, it smells soooo good. one of my faves.

Really pleasant aquatic floral, but nothing remarkable. It reminds me of countless other aquatic florals out there.

Some things to note about this line:

The spray does come out bubbly/foamy and is more likely to drip before it absorbs.

This collection does leave a sticky, tacky feel on the skin, but I haven’t experienced any clothes staining. I haven’t sprayed directly on fabric so I don’t know if that would cause staining, but I haven’t had any issues with skin-to-clothing transfer.

The other issue I’ve been having with this line is they all go through a transitional period where they smell… off. Initial application smells great, dry down is lovely, but in between there’s a temporary period where it goes kinda ick, like a decaying flower/fruit smell. I suspect it’s some sort of reaction that results as part of the water-based, non-alcohol formulation this line uses.

One of my top 3 scents from this collection.
Beautiful fresh, aquatic scent with a touch of green. I envision being on summer vacation at a park with a pond with lotuses - you can smell water and greenery. Doesn't smell artificial.

Great marketing photos and concept of the collection.

I would buy the discovery set if it contained sprays, not rollerballs.
a cute green, floral scent. Im not too crazy on the florals but this one I will get in my collection. The longevity on this one is okay though. About 3/4 hours on me

Be warned - this line of H2EAU fragrances stains clothing like a spill of vegetable oil. It is not alcohol based so when you apply, make sure to not let it touch fabrics. Also, it gets gummy / sticky. This line is great in concept but disappointing in execution. Sigh.

This is so beautiful! It’s very much like a cucumber melon fragrance but stepped up a few notches! This so far and brilliant peony are the two tops of this line for me and if you are into fresh watery light floral or aquatics in general you will live this! I have a travel size and I’m absolutely buying the full size soon!
Smells really fresh and green! similar to Rain but a little bit more floral. my favorite of this whole H2eau line.

When you get a bouquet of flowers from the store and you open then up at home and start cutting the stems to fit into your vase, that green earthy fresh scent of the green stems, that's what this smells like at first. Then I get all of the flowers, the light scent of cucumber, then it dries down to a soft clean musk.

Leans too masculine on me. Giving my sample to my husband.


This does not smell like Santal 33, Bois de Balincourt, Santal Vanille, nor Gris Charnel—I have all of those and this smells nothing like any of them. This is an ozonic salty Santal where the “sel”, wood, and orris/Iris notes dominate.

Too watery and ozonic.
This company aimed to create a light, refreshing woody fragrance. However, the scent is overly artificial and disharmonious. The fig, floral, and woody notes are all at odds with each other. The ozonic notes ruin the overall balance. It reminds me of plastic-coated paper. I don't recommend blind buying this perfume.
+ It's completely different from Santal 33!!

This is A LOT more masculine than I expected. I was hoping for more of a Wood Sage & Sea Salt kind of vibe, and just got a sharp, masculine, aquatic/woody. It's fine, but I don't enjoy wearing it, it's too sharp for me.

A soft, woody fragrance. Only get the sandalwood in the dry-down, and only then does it remind me of Santal 33. To me, this is unisex, but I can see how it might lean masculine to some people. This house does a good job of representing their brand, imo. All their frags are "clean" takes or interpretations of whatever fragrance type (or family) they take on. I get a clean vibe from this woody frag. Still prefer other woody frags of this type with more body or presence.

This smells so, so good, and also so very uninspired. Salty aquatic with fig. This leans masculine for me, because yes, it does make me think of Axe body spray.

I get really good projection with this, and moderate longevity. If this is your vibe, it’s a great affordable choice compared to similar luxury and niche offerings.
This fragrance smells like what Bali looks and seems like. Specifically Ubud, Bali.

Fresh out of the box review: this is somewhat high pitched on my skin. The fig aldehydes… the tonic water bubbly aldehydes, and the styrax is animalic quality. Hazelnut and whipped cream round of the sharp edges of the aldehydes in a creative way. It smells like soap bubbles enveloping all the notes with beautiful roses all around.

with maturation, it’s going to be REALLY beautiful and unique. The iris powderiness is so pleasant and modern. It’s strong and sensual… little sweetness and creaminess to balance the aldehydes. Salty, earthy, aldehydic, rose, dry ocean wood, creamy, powdery, slightly sweet fig, clean. Very unique.

It’s clean but not in a fresh out the shower way or dryer sheet/ warm cotton clean. It’s a purified or refined clean with salt and bubbly tonic, fresh out the ocean, a modern and versatile, slightly fruity/ rosy/ powdery/ nutty/ earthy creamy clean aquatic. Lovely scent.

oof. this is so harsh and unpleasant for a good hour. it dries down to an aftershave type smell. like a typical men’s fragrance reminiscent of the early 2000s. i love sandalwood but this is such a sharp mess. i understand notes are just marketing for perfume but the notes listed here can’t possibly be what anyone is smelling outside of a nasty “sandalwood.” smells like it cost $8 and would be a deodorant or men’s shower gel

Santal 33 pales in comparison to this beauty. I was so disappointed when I tried a sample of the former after being spoiled with this. Unlike pickles in a perfume bottle, this gives me warm, creamy, yet rough and mature sandalwood. While it's rather masculine, anyone can wear this. There's something about this that reads like a warm hug to me.

This is in my top 10 fragrances. I love the salty note and wear it layered over many other fragrances, from nerolis to roses to gourmands. I find it to be very long lasting, especially on the clothes, but it's still sticks close to the body. A beautiful fragrance, I hope they never discontinue it.

Havent been super impressed by any of the Clean Reserves so far so I was nervous to try this, but I actually super like this one! Yes it does err on the side of masculine/cologne-y but I dont think that should deter anyone looking for a medium-affordable sandalwood fragrance. I havent smelled Santal 33 yet but I dont get any of the "pickle notes" that I've heard can be found in this as well. Sillage is not amazing, and after trying a second time I do get what people are saying about the Axe Body spray/Mens Cologne thing, but this has much more depth and layers up close. Cute bright fall smell, not very dark or spicy but kind of a fresh sandalwood :)

To me, this smells like straight sandalwood, I do not get any of the other notes. Maybe a little bit of the salt. It also leans more masculine. I normally like scents like Santa 33 and Bois de Balincourt to give you an idea, but do not like this one. I personally use it only to add a little bit of a woodsy note to floral or fruity fragrances in my collection.

Classic sandalwood accord but very fresh and green. I don't get pickles, at least not on my skin. The longevity is not the best but ok for the price. I feel very chic when I wear it! Nice for every day.
to me this smells like a more unisex and worse acqua di gio profondo
I normally do NOT like woody scents but this one quite literally took me on a hike through the redwood trees. It’s a fresh but spiced wooden smell that’s more feminine. I absolutely love it.

does bear a resemblance to santal 33, but less woody, more salty, sharp, and ambery. this kind of leans more driftwood to me, that sort of artificial sandalwood that every masculine bath and body works scent smells like. the opening is surprisingly floral and soapy, lots of violet and almost a lavender scent, maybe this is the tonic water accord. then it turns more creamy and sweet, the whipped cream comes out along with that intensifying driftwood or sandalwood note and a tiny bit of savory nuttiness. i do actually like the dry down, velvety violet and sandalwood with a nice light salt accord, it's quite pretty but delicate, not much staying power
not my preferred formulation of this scent profile, but i could actually see myself wearing this occasionally when i want to mix it up a bit

VERY similar to santal 33, i'm sure the projection/quality is a bit worse. Very woody in an almost animalic way to me. I like to layer it with something creamy. Smells like something you would wear with Carhartt overalls.
The way a very handsome, distinguished dill pickle would smell on date night.

This is one of my all time favorite scents ever. it’s so soft smelling but lasts all day. one of the rare instances where i get better longevity on skin rather than clothes it also smells wayyy better/gets stronger when it warms up on your skin. This also does NOT smell like S33 i hate that scent and these don’t smell even similar to each other. 11 out of 3 stars

I just finished a 1.5 ml sample of this and I liked it, but I just did not love it. It didn't leave me with a feeling of needing it in my collection. It IS a nice fragrance though! I currently own something that's just too similar to this, Dolce & Gabbana's K EDP. My husband didn't like it so he let me have at it and while they are very similar to my nose, Sel Santal is very obviously unisex, much more softer and slightly creamy. D&G K is very obviously targeted to a masculine audience and lacks that softness, it's very aromatic whereas Sel Santal is more of a woody fragrance. Still very reminiscent of each other in my opinion. Both very good! I do recommend you sample, don't recommend you blind buy.

I have a travel size of this and I just don’t love it. I tried to reach for it throughout the summer when I wanted something neutral. I ended up finding it to be a little sharp on the nose, however, in the same way that some might find cheaper men’s colognes to be. I would wear it in the hope that the sharpness was coming from that tonic water top note and that it would dry down to something better, but it just never sat quite right in my skin.

Additionally, I didn’t find the longevity or sillage to be great, however that ended up being more of a positive based on how much I’ve liked it. I will try mixing it with some of my other fragrances to see if I can get through it, but overall I’m not a big fan.

This one smells like salty pickles on the opening, similar to Santal 33. The dry down is strong, masculine, salty & woody. Bergamot heavy with mild spice. Longevity is impressive for a clean formula and lasted over 6 hrs before I had to scrub multiple times to get it off. I honestly cannot get past the pickle opening of this and similar frags in this scent profile. Not for me.
On me, this is sweet in a woody, citrusy, fresh-spicy way.. smells like the colour green :) Really nostalgic, I love it. Reminds me of my dad's old aftershave and scented markers

this scent is a nice low-profile salty sandalwood! woody but not too masculine, it's super versatile and great for layering or wearing on its own. easy to reach for as a casual everyday fragrance without being overpowering
Who is the nose behind this fragrance?

I bought this in Aussie Summer of '23. It was interesting but not what I wanted for the season. This winter however, it's my absolute favourite. Fresh, sharp, woody. Divine on its own, or lovely paired with S.F Mysteriosa, T.M Aura or M.B Signature- for that sharp woody, winter fruits vibe. I'm out and I need another bottle!!!
I must confess though, I work in a fragrance department and I'm kind of obsessed with more niche scents 😅

Fresh. Nutty. Crisp and warm. Sparkling and subtly citrus. Familiar and bright, slightly aftershave and cologne and I enjoy it. Love that pop of amber and woods. The salt and fig invigorate. Nutmeg and hazelnut warm and sweeten, but it maintains a softness from distinctive iris and rose. It's a busy ingredient list, but its character is one of simple nutty and woody freshness. Includes the same airy backbone as Yesterday Haze with fig, woods and nuts; but fresher and without too much gourmand creaminess. It's relaxing, casual and fresh, and a favorite from the line.

this is the first sandalwood fragrance that doesn't give me straight pickle. it's aquatic, but not overly so. it's an uplifting, clean wood that fades into watery florals. i love this so much. i'd say it's unisex as well
This has become my go-to summer work fragrance. Tonic and sandalwood. It is a skin scent, but not in the ambroxan/musky style, which I personally dislike.
I love this! Just pleasant freshness. Man friendly

Reserve Sal Santal:
- Top: Mandarin Leaves, Bergamot, Nutmeg Tonic
- Middle: Iris, Salted Fig, Violet, Hazelnut Cream
- Dry Down: Sandalwood, Decadent Amber, Styrax, Rose Musk
