I'm halfway between picking up the sandalwood and picking up dill. 😂 The fig and hazelnut cream are nice and lend a nutty creaminess to the lovely addition of Iris and Violet - but I honestly can't get past that dill pickle mix and the overall composition seems muddied.

I do not personally think this is exact dupe for Santal 33. Same vibes, absolutely, but Santal 33 smells like literal hot garbage on me, whereas this does not. Blind purchased and do not regret; it’s a strong like. Sel Santal is definitely in the same lane as Banana Republic Classic (but more complex), and I get some Grassland in there, as well. There’s a bit of an Irish Spring component in there, but not in a bad way. I think the reason I like this more than the BR scents I mentioned is because it’s a but more complex and less pungent.

I like this very much! Warm and woody with a hint of freshness. I don't think this smells masculine whatsoever, but perhaps my perception of what makes a masculine scent is somewhat skewed. It avoids overt sweetness and the irritating "green" note that I associate with designer fragrance flaps in magazines. So far this is my favorite scent from Clean!

Sophisticated perfume! I liked it , definitely can smell the mandarin and sandalwood but the dry down is more citrusy notes.. I feel like it’s something your boss would wear at a business meeting or if you want to be professional.. The sillage is not to strong on this though .

Yes, very similar to Santal 33. They share a savory slightly powdery sandalwood accord. Sel Santal layers salty air and a humid greenness underneath the sandal which differentiates it from 33. It gives it a beachy-vegetal tang, which I really like. That said, they are still very similar and Sel Santal could be a flanker of Santal 33. It is very clean without being fresh and heat-compatible without being calone-cologne; an effect I love and it makes sense with the brand philosophy.

It is indeed unisex leaning slightly masculine, but not in a "generic man cologne" kind of way. It's more like a rugged outdoors scent. I feel comfortable wearing it as a woman.
On my skin it’s very fresh and green, no powder.

Blind bought on a TJ spree. Yes, quite masculine. Herbal and woody. But clean. Gets more powdery into a unisex smell that still leans a bit too mas for me. I haven't given up tho, I think misted over bare skin and fully dried will give a great clean woody vibe, and although cold Fall for me- this could be refreshing in heat? Has a refreshing gin/tonic and green vibe too.
Sort of reminds me of Pharrell Girl. Never smelled Santal 33, but this had an initial smell of the book/library/paper perfumes- which attracted me.
Might give to my hub. Love the bottle tho for displaying next to my Commodity.

nonononon I don't like this.
It smells like burning wood but in a barbeque way with a bit of powdery.
I don't want to smell like this. Close to skin, NO.
To me this is akin to Santal 33 without that pickle-ish vibe when first sprayed, I think it’s super nice and it’s available for cheap on fragrance sites!

This is 💯 a Santal 33 dupe. Super sharp/spicy sandalwood note, I really don’t pick up much else. Was hoping this would be completely different, something a bit more similar to Clean Reserve Sueded Oud but this is not. Unfortunately this is the type of sandalwood note I hate. Would not recommend if you are expecting a semi-sweet, rich woods type of scent.

The amount of women thinking this is going to be sweet/femenine, after looking at the whipped cream note has me rotfl. This is masculine leaning. Really well blended sandalwood, green woody fragrance, it smells absolutely amazing on my husband. I absolutely don't get pickle juice? This is a fresh, clean scent that lingers in my memory.

This is like a slightly sweeter, more fresh citrus version of axe body spray. Its not awful but not something that is my taste. Id put this in the leaning masculine category. Its fresh spicy with a lot of debth and interest as far as how many notes come out. This might smell good on a guy. But even after wearing it for a while it never stops smelling like axe

If you’re looking for a Santal 33 dupe, this is not it.

This is 100% straight-up cheap Axe body spray. I smell like a teenage boy and I’m not happy about it. I don’t even want my husband smelling like this.

0/10

Try Santal Supreme by Le Monde Gourmand for a much better and cheaper alternative.
I really enjoy the layers in this one. More complex than the other clean reserve fragrances. Fresh spicy sweet fruity woody musk.
I like this one. It’s a fresh sandalwood fragrance. It smells like a good quality aftershave. A bit basic and too masculine for me to wear.

First Impressions (sample spray):
If you love Santal 33 this might be a more affordable dupe for you. Other than that I feel like it's way more salty than santal 33, and has way less fig. I am already not a big fan of santal 33. Thus, I give this perfume a meh rating.
Edit: okie after trying the rest of the clean reserve this one is not bad. To me, it just doesn’t smell clean for a woman. This is a nice I like, but on a man perfume for me. It still does have a pickled dry sandalwood that still does remind me of santal 33 with maybe a clean shave version. It does remind me of something that I know yet I can’t remember. That might be the same dna as santal 33. Definitely more masculine, and has a man cologne feeling to it.

Summary:
Smells like: male cologne, a good santal 33 clone.
Family of: santal 33 (-pickly, +masc)
Silage: moderate to intimate

Verdict:
Pass- smells a little bit too much like man’s cologne. If a man wore this I would be impressed ngl.

I bought the Clean Reserve Discovery Set of 8 small eau de parfum sprays, and this was the first one I tried. The first note I noticed was an odd kind of sour spice. I see that tonic water is listed as one of the top notes, so that must be what I noticed and what other people describe as a dill or pickle smell. And then I got wood, and it lasted for maybe 2 hours.

This is a weird one, and I'd say it leans masculine. I'm sure I won't be buying a bigger size of it. I may try layering it over musk oil when the weather gets cooler, but I'm doubtful that I'll like it much better that way.

Maybe this is one of those fragrances where if it works with your body chemistry, it's great. And otherwise, it's awful.

Edit: I've changed my mind; I'm not giving this another chance. I just can't get past that pickle smell.

Yuck. Sorry, just don’t enjoy this one. Got the dreaded dill opening and the rest of the fragrance is unpleasant in my opinion.

Don’t know if I’d like it on a man either.
I think what Im getting is a lot of fig, salt and woody tonic? It is definitely masculine leaning to me. I like it but I would not wear this one.

This is a very nice, clean creamy sandalwood dominated scent. The creaminess is subtle attributed by the whipped cream note. Bergamot, tonic water and salt is lightly in the background supporting the blend. The florals are non-detectable at first, but ever so slightly come through within a 15-30min dry down. This is perfectly unisex, 49% feminine and 51% masculine leaning but if you’re into warm woody scents this is a pleasant, well blended easy wearing non-offensive scent.

I found an old sample of this that I must have tried years ago, before I was as serious about the hobby, and forgot, because it wasn't full. Anyway, thought it sounded like something nice to try on at bedtime after a shower tonight. I was a little surprised when I sprayed it, as I'd looked at the notes but not the reviews, so I could react without being influenced. Well, as most everyone else has said, this is very masculine. I don't always mind a bit of that, depending on the notes in question, and what feminine notes are in the blend for balance. Like, I love spices, lavender, many woods. This had no balance though, smelled overwhelmingly like a traditional aftershave or cologne. Out of my comfort zone for sure.

As someone else said below, there's no noticeable whipped cream here, maybe barbershop shaving cream. The dry down is more pleasant to me than the barbershop fougere type opening, but still decidedly masculine, and I'm a pretty feminine person, so it feels a little weird. I would've given it to my husband, but don't think there's enough left now. I don't really get pickles. I also don't get nutmeg, florals, cream, hazelnut, or fig. This would be amazing if I did. It's a clean scent, and has sort of a beachy vibe to it, which is pleasant. I definitely smell salt and sandalwood on the dry down. They are the prominent notes, so it's appropriately named. I get a touch of citrus, maybe a little amber and musk, mayyybe a hint of vanilla, but that's kind of a stretch. I basically smell like I'm having a gin and tonic w lime at the beach, and was recently canoodling with a well groomed gentleman. I don't dislike it, but it's not for me.

Edit: The dry down was reminding me of something, I just couldn't place it, but now I have. Salt by Ellis Brooklyn. If you want something like this that actually is unisex and has a similar vibe, minus the aftershave accord, I'd recommend trying it!

I found that after an hour or so, this settled down to something much more like Salt. Still slightly more masculine, but far better and more unisex than the opening. I think I am getting a touch of florals now. I think it's mostly the rose? I'd still never buy this for myself because of its other side, but it's nice. That was on my skin. On my shirt, it still smells quite masculine, but has lasted longer.

Well blended fruity sandalwood! This is a really cool unisex scent, with all kinds of interesting notes, but still quite crowd pleasing. I imagine this to smell amazing on both my boyfriend and me! I usually feel indifferent to sandalwood scents, but I really like this one!

I made the mistake of buying this upon only smelling it on paper. The top notes are feminine leaning but when that goes away it becomes definitely masculine to my nose. This smells amazing on a man. Picture your office crush who looks like he smells good (and actually does). Clean yet striking but still approachable. And even after a hectic work day, he still smells good. Salty, aquatic, woody and creamy in one bottle. This doesn't smell like Santal 33 to me and I don't get the sour pickle vibes at all.

I drink a lemonade walking on the beach at sunset; here and there lie wet pieces of drifted sandal wood and algae, a salty breeze brings fresh floral-fruity aromas from the gardens and orange orchards on the coast. I run my fingers through the sand and can almost taste this beautifully scented air...

This notes list is a hot mess express. They took everything that ever sounded good and just wrote it down and ran with it never mind what’s actually in this scent cause I guarantee you not even half of them are in here at all in any of their molecular forms. I get two things that pull concurrently in this scent but never really blend together cohesively. Those two things are men’s aftershave or some sort of abrasive (and cheap) fougere we’re accustomed to associating with men, and pickle juice. The pickle juice note must be sandalwood. I’ve heard that scents could pull this way on certain chemistries and I never doubted them I just never thought mine was one of them.

I get a delicious leather (albeit overpowering) in Santal 33. I love fragrances like Santal Blush, Samsara in all it’s concentrations and most recently Santal Massoia from Hermes, none of which I get a pickle smell from. I get the salty accord as well which only adds to the briny affect on my skin, but what I find most intriguing is that it doesn’t repulse me. I’ve tried seaweed fragrances that haunt my nightmares. A fragrance by Balenciaga that contains a pea note is what I imagine the demons in my own personal Hell would pump through the vents. I’ve had my fair share of trying perfumes that have reduced to celery water after poor storage. Pickles are a first for me, and I’m not running for the hills.

I wish there was more fig, or some of those other delicious notes that are in the pyramid but I accept Sel Santal for what she is as well as what she isn’t. Is it neurotic that I’m considering a travel spray of this? I’ll play with this sample some more, gladly.

Edit: after I finished writing that review I kept getting whiffs of something that was so savory I could at first only think it was food I was smelling. Was it my husband reheating leftover pepperoni pizza? Did someone order cheeseburgers with extra pickles? No, it was my perfume. I don’t know what it is about this scent that not only smells of pickles, it also begins to smell like warm cheese, probably due to how it reacts on warm skin. It’s still not entirely repulsive but way too weird and not what I’m going for in a perfume that others might smell, and I’m definitely smelling on myself. Hard pass.

Definitely more masculine. The combination of sour and salty is reading as STANKY FEET to me. Very little, if any sandalwood, no spice, and certainly no whipped cream. Fades to a soft, generic, men’s cologne scent. It’s a no for me dawg.

to me, sel santal is the more interesting and fun cousin of santal 33. it's more aromatic and complex, and definitely more masculine-leaning. it's very classy and almost aquatic- smells like you just went to the barber shop then stopped at a flashy new bar for a G&T. i like decently on myself, but i'm sure it would smell amazing on a wide variety of people!

EDIT- the drydown smells pretty minty/herby!
extremely pleasant crowd-pleaser scent. this is like a perfectly ironed white button down. fairly generic, masculine-leaning sandalwood scent

I picked up a baby mini roller ball of this perfume and my husband really likes it. This is very masculine. Crisp bergamot, w/ a salty twist, woody notes combined w/ a subtle florals, especially violet create a very pleasing easy dumb reach for any guy. The whipped cream and hazelnut are very subtle in this, lending a subtle sweetness and creaminess to a very fresh and aromatic woody floral masculine fragrance. This would be a good everyday fragrance for any guy to wear and could be a signature. Very pleasing and a good performer w/out being overpowering.

I'm pleasantly surprised by this one from the discovery set...in the initial spray, I swear I get a hit of saffron which could simply be that 'tonic water' note. I honestly am not getting the Santal 33 comparisons, the sandalwood is not the main star in this fragrance on my skin. There's an aquatic citrus vibe that predominates throughout. All this being said, pleasant fragrance but much like other Clean Reserves it disappears on my skin pretty quickly. Shame about the longevity on these.

Next day edit: okay I sprayed this again a day later and I'm getting a much more masculine vibe overall today. I suddenly think I'll give this to my boyfriend (lol!)
just going off of first impressions, will edit when i try it more- this immediately smells to me like the dossier santal 33 fragrance (have not actually smelled santal 33 just the dupe)

It's not bad, but if one's looking for a Santal 33 dupe there are better and cheaper alternatives. Otherwise... Clean Sel Santal has that aromatic vaguely pickle-ish sandalwood note with a dusty wooden pantry full of various herbs. Smells like a spa and aromatherapy scent, or Sam's Club Member's Mark Italian Herb grilled chicken breast.

To me, this is a pretty good alternative of Santal 33, only this is much green/woody/sharper and lacks some of the sweet softness and complexity Santal 33 has. If you can layer scents well, you can get a similar effect easily using this scent. Personally, I love layering this with Bronze Goddess Eau Fraiche (not the EDP) to get more layers of warm sandalwood and coconut to this. If you try this combo, spray Santal first, then spray about 2/3 as much of Bronze Goddess on top. Divine. If it had a bit more leather and papyrus, I'm not sure I'd be able to tell the difference between this mix and Santal 33.

The same main notes dominate both Sel Santal and Santal 33 with the immediately recognizable sandalwood, though I’m still unsure if this distinct scent is the result of a note blend, a specific type of sandalwood, or if the fragrance is synthetic. I never smelled this type of sandalwood before in my life until a decade ago, in Los Angeles, when suddenly every 20 something began wearing the same scent. Though if you asked any of them what perfume they were wearing, they’d claim that they designed it themselves at one of those diy perfume oil counters. Recently I picked up a “santal” scented candle while shopping. I fell down a rabbit hole searching the web about the scent. Reluctant to blind buy such a high priced bottle, and unsure if I wanted to smell like half the people I meet, I ended up grabbing this instead. I found the scent refreshing and I felt like it grew on me more over time.

Both 33 and Sel Santal aren’t anything like sandalwood I’ve known for my entire life. They are GREEN. Like the scent actually smells like it’s the color green. It isn’t the deep smoky sandalwood of incense, or the grandpas cologne crisp and musky sandalwood. In Sel Santal, it’s citrus and peppery, in Santal 33 it's that but also somewhat milky. When I smell either scent, I think of limes and a faint woody dried coconut shell, or driftwood on the beach, maybe with a touch of cucumber and some sexy sort of spice. Instead of grandpas musk, these make me think of fresh sweet white musk. Other people get pickles and plastic. Predominantly, they’re very similar and most people won’t know the difference if you’re wearing this, unless they have excellent noses and wear Santal 33 regularly. Even then, one might write off the variation as one's distinct body chemistry.

I find Clean Reserves note lists to feel a bit off for the scents I’ve owned. This opens with the strong “lime” woody note, which I think is actually a combination of the sandalwood and violet, with some bergamot/citrus pepperiness. It’s mostly just that. If you smell close, you can pick out some more florals, almost get a faint cucumber water touch, then something I guess is the cream, lurking deep under to try to soften and sweeten this up. But it fails to come off as creamy, ultimately I don’t find this to be a sweet scent at all, and I wish there was some coconut, vanilla, or more amber in this to smooth it out and warm it up. I can’t smell the tonic exactly but I did think this gave bubbly cocktail gin vibes without seeming alcoholic. I’m not getting any of the fruit, nutmeg, or others, which is disappointing as I hoped for some rich spice.

I consider Sel Santal unisex, mostly due to the fact I was introduced to this fragrance when it was worn by a woman, but it would definitely be too cologne-like and masculine for some women's taste.

Besides Bronze Goddess Eau Fraiche, layering with jasmine femme-s this up nicely, I prefer wearing with jasmine body oil. I know there are people that don’t consider this a warm or summery scent, as it feels a bit winter cologne-like, but it’s actually versatile and can be worn all year, especially if you layer.

I also bought Cremo’s Palo Santo EDP and it is also “in this family,” even though it claims to be Palo Santo, and doesn’t have any florals. It’s somehow still a typical Santal fragrance. It doesn't have any creamy, spicy, or flowery notes like Santal 33 or this one, so it comes off as about 20% more masculine and is $20 a bottle. It smells great, and it’s a beast, so if you’re looking for a better bargain that’s more masculine, grab that one.

Initially i get salty herbal citrus with a faint background juiciness from the fig. The fig is kind of overtaken by the citrus. There isn't much sweetness here, it's kind of salty-sour. Fresh and uplifting, almost makes me think of laundry detergent or soap. The florals are faintly present if you look for them. I don't get any whipped cream or hazelnut. The woody notes are pleasant and don't really steal the show.

I'd say this is pretty unisex. I wouldn't say i'm in love with it but i certainly don't find it offensive.
To me this is firmly "ok", it turns a bit simple-soapy on me which is a problem with my chemistry and no fault of the juice.

This reminds me more of men's perfumes;it smells marine-like/aquatic but also kinda sour which I dislike. It reminds me of Acqua di Gio Profondo but I think Profondo smells way better. I wore this on me and let it sit a while but I didn't get any creaminess nor did I get floral notes. It's not the worst scent or something but it isn't good either.

I have this, Maison Louis Marie No. 4, a small decant of Santal 33, and several other Santal 33 clones/dupes. I don't understand how Sel Santal is anywhere similar to what Santal 33 smells like; while MLM No. 4 and the S33 clones/dupes are very close to the OG in terms of being leathery, earthy, and somewhat herbal, Sel Santal, at least to my nose, smells sweet, creamy, and salty, with a faint background of woods and musk.

I can pick up the bergamot and nutmeg on initial spritz, and then definitely the hazelnut, whipped cream, and some of the fig once it dries down. The vibe is very different from S33. This smells quite bright to me and might work for warmer days, while S33 and its variants are definitely more appropriate for sweater weather.

I love wearing this on its own, but I also enjoy layering it with SJP Stash. They work very well together as they both smell quite comforting.

I wasn't expecting to, but I really like this fragrance. On my skin, I am experiencing a woody musky fragrance with a touch of citrus. I really don't feel like you can describe any Clean fragrances as "strong." Maybe at the initial spray. But once it dries down, Clean fragrances become either a light scent or a skin scent. This one goes pretty light, which makes it even more lovely to wear. I don't think I would buy a huge bottle of this, but it is travel spray worthy in my opinion. Sel Santal is a great day time fragrance that can be worn all year round.

Does anyone else think this smells a bit smoky? Like a flannel shirt the morning after a bonfire . . .
Anyways, this is one of my favorite fragrances in my collection. The sandalwood is front and center, and the fig and fresh/citrus notes complement it nicely. I can't smell the hazelnut, whipped cream, or rose AT ALL (fine by me), and the rest of the notes sort of fade into the background. My favorite part is the salt, which gives the fragrance an almost savory quality, which might be what makes me think of a bonfire. Projection and longevity are nothing crazy, but more than adequate for everyday wear. It does smell a bit masculine to me, but I don't mind. My one and only complaint is that I wish the fig was a bit more prominent, but I think layering with Diptyque's Philosykos or Demeter's Fig Leaf will easily fix that. I will definitely be getting a full bottle when I finish my travel size.
Reminds me of the inside of the mens section at a Nordstrom. Wouldn't mind it on someone else, and doesn't nessicarily smell "bad", it's just not for me.

I’m one of the people that gets straight up dill pickles from Santal 33 the entire wear. I did get that with this on the opening but it faded or I went anosmic to it after about 10 mins and I could actually enjoy the sandalwood. I’m not getting any of the other notes except for a bit of salt and iris maybe. So the name is very accurate. It’s straightforward sandalwood and salt. It’s a foggy autumn morning in an old cottage on the beach. A simple, mature, understated, masculine-leaning fragrance.

Don’t get the flowers, nuts or whipped cream. It’s tart, salty, woody and masculine leaning. I’m all for wearing gender bending perfume but, this doesn’t connect with me. Am I crazy or is there vetiver and aftershave-like smell in this?

Might be GREAT on a guy. But this is not for me. So if you’re a guy, try this out.

Find me on Instagram @perfumedmemoirs

I have to say it leans more masculine. I am used to unisex or bit masculin scents but this one i had to give to my husband. He liles it and i like it on him too. But it was strange on me. The beginning is salty more like an after shave and it dries down to a woody pickely scent. I do not smell the florals at all nor the nuts or the whipped cream. It is nice but definitely not a blind buy.

I'm a bit disappointed that I get absolutely no whipped cream. I get a touch of masculine shaving cream perhaps, but no edible whipped cream. I don't get much violet and iris, either. I definitely get salt and sandalwood, exactly as the name says, but not many of the supporting notes with the exception of fig and tonic water. I do smell some green fig, which may smell more green due to the tonic water accord. To me this starts out masculine, slightly wood polish-y, then dries down to a softer scent. It's not a love for me, just a like, and I find myself wanting to layer it with a simple vanilla, such as Comptior Sud Pacifique's Vanille Intense, because I am wishing for the creaminess that I should be getting according to the listed notes. It does last well- 8 hours or so. I would wear it casually in the daytime, as it is not elegant.

Blind bought this for a steel.
It leans more masculine to me, especially in the opening, in the dry down it’s more unisex.
Very green, woody, fresh, sweet and a little powdery.
Unfortunately I don’t get a lot of the salt, fig or whipped cream but in the dry down the violet, amber and sandalwood come trough.
I really like it and it will suit my husband really well, can’t wait to sniff it on him.

Powdery slightly salty aromatic sandalwood-fig-lime combo for summer. Fairly unisex, to me it doesn't lean masculine at all. It has a lovely salt water spa feeling with a fresh kick. Pretty unique, interesting compliment getter.

While this scent is fairly masculine, I am a woman and wearing it right now. It's absolutely lovely. I do think it's appropriate for a woman to pull off in simple blouse or sundress with simple lines.

Has anyone smelled this compared to Yesturday Haze by Imaginary Authors? That one is currently my favorite and I'm debating on blind buying this one, but would like to hear, if they are anything alike? :)

Another blind buy for me. It is very different from my expectations. But I really like the juice, though. :)

I expected to get a sandalwood scent, but to my nose, salt, fig, violet and amber are more prominent than sandalwood. Maybe the sandalwood in this one is more fresh and green than what I've used to.

However, I think the scent is quite different and original, and fresh and pleasant, too. Definitely a keeper for me.
Blind bought a sampler of this - and my lord I cannot stop sniffing it. It's a bit too masculine leaning for me to wear personally, but I can't wait to smell this on my husband.

There really isn’t much in this that reads feminine. It’s a straight masculine scent, although a nice one. If you’re a woman who happens to prefer manlier perfumes, this one is actually very well done and classy. Just not for me.
Really fresh scent but not overly green or soapy. Unisex, but it leans a little masculine. Santal Supreme by Urban Outfitters is a pretty close dupe. Picked up a big bottle for pretty cheap on eBay.
If Black Orchid and Philosykos had a scentchild it would be Sel Santal

Fig, salt, whipped cream... everything I was looking for in one bottle. Unfortunately I’m a woman who likes to wear more feminine scents or scents that are truly unisex, and this reads as completely masculine on my skin. Not much (if any) salt, no fig, no whipped cream. Woody, slightly spicy (somewhat generic) scent for men. Would be happy enough to smell it on my husband.

Whoa I wasnt expecting to like this stuff being the notes? I thought would be feminine. I went in to sephora, man I was wrong. I sniffed it and immediate said I will buy a bottle. Very fresh. Gets good response from everyone when wearing it.
Strong smell-TOTALLY masculine scent.

A coarser blend of Santal 33 with even more synthetic smelling ingredients.

I'm not Santal 33's biggest fan but I moderately like the fragrance and can tolerate the scent. This one straight up gives me a headache from start to finish.

I highly recommend Byredo Gypsy Water or Diptyque Tam Dao if you want a sandalwood fragrance that doesn't smell like a fistful of aromachemicals slapped together.

I tried this from a Birch Box sample. This struck me as very chemically, especially considering how natural it apparently is. At times it was rather astringent. I could get sandalwood and citrus, but nothing floral. Not my least favorite scent, but I prefer moist lemon towelettes over this.

Mostly tonic water with bergamot, almost like a salted cucumber style scent. To me this is more like a gin and tonic. Very refreshing. Not really picking up much sandalwood. It also doesn't last very long. A shame since I LOVE salty and woody scents.
Quite masculine, coming from someone who typically enjoys masculine scents. Gave it to my boyfriend. More green than I would have liked.

I've bought several of the mini sets at Sephora and love to pack three or four for trips to mix up my fragrance. I especially love to mix Sel Santal with lighter scents like Elizabeth Arden White Tea or Versace Yellow Diamond to make them a little beachier.
Smells like the scents wafting through the mall: popcorn, pretzels, soap, bath salts, etc. Maybe i’d like it as a room spray, but not as fragrance for the body

Beautiful fragrance!! Sel Santal was an instant love for me, it smells wonderful and performs fantastic on my skin. If you have ever been to the High Desert in Central/Eastern Oregon, that's the feeling I get from Sel Santal. The scent picture I get from this juice is so vivid that it sometimes stirs up a longing to return to those places of my youth.

I highly recommend giving Sel Santal a sniff!!

Clean Sel Santal was a blind buy which was a bit out of the norm because I typically only blind buy gourmands. Though it wasn’t exactly as expected, I actually like it quite a bit. Upon initial blast, it does smell very masculine (absolutely not a bad thing) and fairly medicinal. As the fragrance starts to warm on the skin, it becomes deeper and more inviting; to me, cozy. The drydown had me stumped at first because it reminded me of something and I just couldn’t place it. Then I figured it out- MINT TEA!!!!! It literally smells like a hot cup of mint tea and besides it smelling nice, there’s something nostalgic about it, like the memory of sipping mint tea on a cold, rainy winter night. I can see this being a fragrance one would wear during the summer, but I will wear this in the winter. It’s not my favorite among the CLEAN line (amber saffron holds that place), but I definitely like it and if you like fragrances which are sharp and herbal, you should enjoy this!
I have a pretty massive collection, and hardly ever purchase a new fragrance. When me and my wife experienced this one in Sephora, I knew I had to have it, absolutely love it.

I usually stick with perfumes like Light Blue and all the Armani code fragrances. This perfume is so different from my norm, but something about it has made it my ultimate favorite fragrance. It is def unisex, but I promise you won't smell like you're wearing a man's perfume. It's so strange but in a good way and you'll want to keep sniffing your arm. I especially love the smell after the first 20 minutes. I'm all about the Sandalwood. I agree with a few comments here. One that in summer it smells like the best beach perfume ever and another person commented that it smells like you spent time at your bf's fancy apartment and showered with his expensive sandalwood soap -couldn't agree more. Many many people have given me a hug or within close proximity have commented "oh my god, you smell amazing!". I love how I can wear this perfume any time of the year both morning or night. It's rare for a perfume to be so versatile.

A clean, salty, spicy sandalwood. Not sweet.

I've never been impressed by many of the Clean range but I reaaaallly like this one.

I like this better than my Hermes Santal Massoia. More beefy, more assertive. Better sillage.

Like if I had a fling with a guy who had a very fancy apartment with expensive sandalwood soap in his nice shower... and the smell lingered on my skin the whole next day.

With my skin. The chemistry between the cologne and it has a heavy sillage. The longevity is consistent but it goes away slower than I thought it would. It goes away after 7 -8 hours on me. But the time I last notice it, it was strong but then rapidly turned to nothing. Kinda like Jimmer Freddette. (NBA)

At first spritz Sel Santal is almost a perfect dupe for Santal 33 but that quickly fades and the sandalwood gets a little softer and cleaner than Santal 33 (IMO). It's almost floral on the dry down. Projection and silage are both weak too which is kind of a bummer. But if you're looking for something a little more budget friendly this is a good option.

Strange and gorgeous.

There's something of a shaving cream scent to this but it's absolutely addictive. It has an interesting evolution. It starts a masculine and bit harsh, but it mellows into a clean powder with bits of spice. Lovely.

Sel Sandal is one fragrance that gets tons of questions and compliments. The sillage is bigger than my preference, but it's a definitely one that people enjoy.

I would love this on a man. The salt note is prominent, and amber underneath that, but I don't get as much sandalwood as I expected. It's not like anything I've ever worn and I'm having a hard time deciding if I like it--half the time it reminds me of a man's expensive soap or shaving cream, and half the time it is one of the sexiest beach fragrances ever.
Super strange and I love it. Woody, floral clean fresh bold.

The opening can be a little harsh. But give it a few minutes before you turn it away. Nutmeg is noticeable and sandalwood too. Iris pairs perfectly with the spicy and Woody notes.
At first it might smell like a modern masculine fragrance but you just have to wait for the magic to happen.
After the harsh initial notes disappear, you are left with a calm, slightly powdery and clean/green scent. Sandalwood persist all the way.

This is slightly more masculine than I normally wear, but it is really well done. The notes are well balanced, and the sitrus gives the sandalwood a lightness that will wear beautifully in warm weather.

Love this! It's light, fresh, and clean. It reminds me of CK2 but the bergamot adds a light floral scent.
I usually favor gourmet scents but even I know this scent is a typical woody, oriental, green scent. Nothing special or unique but it's still great.

I was going to ignore the whole line based on the name and my disappointment with Amber Saffron & Smoked Vetiver, but I gave it a chance anyway..
It's surprisingly nice; imagine you accidentally spill Santal 33 on a baby (I hope you never do) and then use barely scented baby soap to wash it off--the soap sums up the middle notes.

I don't know what happened. When I first tried this, it smelled amazing. It smelled similar to Ellis Brooklyn sweet and Ariana God is a woman. I recently picked up a travel size bottle from sephora and it smelled so weird. It definitely doesn't smell the same and it smelled like old honey and pencil shavings smh!

I got a 30ml bottle two days ago and I love it. I had a 5ml in November 2023, and I truly enjoyed it. I love this for the fact that it is light, fruity and clean. This will not annoy anybody. Smells so nice, more expensive than it actually is. Doesn't cause my sensitive mother a headache. What inspired me to buy this, was my neighbor, a woman in her 50s. She told me that she enjoys these scents a week ago. I really wanted a light scent to accompany my La Vie Est Belle Vanilla Nude. This is just fantastic. The bottle is so cute. Sadly there is no ladybug on the 30ml bottle. I have worn this to gym and it doesn't bother others.

Word of warning, this fragrance goes “off” faster than any fragrance I have owned in decades of collecting and it smells really awful. It gets the rancid, rotting fruit mixed with dusty hay, chemical just “off” scent and collectors will understand what I mean. If you don’t use this fragrance within a few months it’s done.
My sample must have gone bad because it smelled like a community centre basement. Not in a nostalgic way either.

I really did love this, very pretty and clean girl and felt unique to me. Unfortunately, one day it simply turned rotten. I’ve never had this happen with a fragrance so suddenly before but it has turned me off repurchasing.

An Avon catalogue from 90s
I am millennial and this perfume brings a lot of memories from childhood. Maybe I am conservative, but I believe this perfume is not mature, it would be perfect on a young girl/ woman as it is sweet and mostly smell like youth. I would definitely go for this perfume if I would be 18 again. But maybe that would be the good option for a mature woman using it on the beach days. That would work for sure.

Generic, sweet, effervescent, airy. Smells beautiful to me but nothing out of this world. I personally think this needs to be over sprayed if you want to smell it on yourself/ want it to be noticed. I have received numerous compliments on this. Young smelling but any age can pull this off. An easy reach!

By the name, I was expecting something completely different. I expected it to be at least sweeter, or more sugary. But this is a watered down version of Radiant Nectar, imo. I find it redundant for the line. With this one you get a molecular, inoffensive peach scent that is almost identical to Liis Studied. I had tried Radiant Nectar first, and already thought it was very similar to Studied, but this one is also almost the same to my nose. I've also seen it compared to Floating, which I had a remaining sample for. To me, Floating is softer, and not as similar. But all these fragrances have the same vibe. They are all inoffensive, nice, clean scents to wear when you don't want a loud fragrance, like for appointments or bedtime.

If you like Liis Floating but it doesn't last on you, try this! It's very similar. The main difference is that it's not quite as fresh/sheer smelling since it doesn't have the linen note that Floating does. It's still very much a skin scent like Liis but this one's not as airy. They're definitely sisters, not twins. This one is more peach heavy which I love.

The most generic and basic scent ever... Sweet, light, clean… but nothing special. It just exists in the background for some minutes then disappears. A disappointing blind buy.

– Bhavna Darira Chesan

Fruitier than I expected. This is a fruity skin scent, with peachy freshness and musk. If you have their Radiant Nectar, you don't need this as well. Very similar.

Edit: my husband said it smelled like cotton candy and peaches. I was confused by the name "dazzling sugar", but it was spot on for his impression.
2000's body spray. I like the notes but can be very sweet.

an elusive mango that dries down into a comforting sweet scent. it's like walking into your neighbour's kitchen, waiting for them to offer you the ripening fruit on their counter, it pleasantly teases and pleases.

This is the more sophisticated version of Victoria Secret's Bombshell (it's a staple and a great one too!). I really like the peach scent, I could see myself wearing this daily. Three spritz is all that's needed for a day full of adventure and compliments.

I think i should have trusted the name: sparkling sugar, because it smells exactly like that. Its forward and direct peach scent which is nearly sickly sweet. It falls a bit flat for me and is def something i cant wear everyday. In my opinion it lacks in depth and would need more complex notes to round this off. Its okay and deffo okay looking at the price. I think i was looking more for a natural peachy frag, so this just kind of threw me off.
This smells like eating a juicy piece of fruit while taking a bubble bath, definitely one of my favorites from Clean Reserve! 10/10

I absolutely love Radiant Nectar and Liis Studied, but both my bottles went bad in less than 6 months. I bought this one, because it seemed kinda similar. Same thing happened, started to smell weird less than 6 months, fresh juicy peach and airyness is gone. It's a bit nauseating, thick and syrupy, nothing like it used to be.

I'm beyond mad, because these kind of DNA's are my favorite ones. Easy reach and signature worthy.

I just went to this big Sephora and I swear I sprayed and tried out almost EVERYTHING there. This was the one I walked away with locked in my head. It’s such a beautiful scent, it reminds me abit of the erba pura this super fruity scent profile with the only difference being this peach note that’s so addicting. Right after dowsing myself in this I went to Canada post to pick up a package and one worker in shoppers told me I smelled really good and one of them asked I write it down on a piece of paper.

That boosted my likeness to this scent even more cause I’m guessing others can find that it smells really good. It lasts and projects for about 2 hours but it dies down to a skin scent at 2/3 hours after spraying.

Still, in my opinion this scent is the absolute best from the whole clean reserve line. im so glad I ran into it!
Clean, sweet, musky, and safe. The kind of thing I picture an office worker or clinician wearing. Not bad, just boring

i do not get blackcurrant or peach from this (radiant nectar smells exactly like this but way more fruity, to me), i also don't particularly get sweet, but it is a very nice white musk on my skin. it's definitely overwhelming and a little synthetic at first but settles down fast and lasts all day with a pleasantly warm scent and a hint of fruit. i've been in the early stages of getting into perfumes and this is the first one that i've really felt suits me and that one day i might want a full bottle in my collection. makes me feel older and more capable somehow, kind of my girlboss confidence scent. i wore this to a job interview and then got the job.

not sure why majority vote places this as a spring/summer scent because it's very fall/winter to me, a rich perfume that is nowhere near light and airy enough for a warm day, but maybe that's just my personal taste and also the fact that there is minimal fruit when this hits my skin.

I got this in the sampling kit that also came with “Skin (Reserve)” for my birthday and I was excited to try it.
The name is a honest description of what this thing smells like, it’s a way too bright blinding artificial sugar that really snaps at your nose. Prepare yourself to smell this fragrance if you want to try it.
I’m being a bit dramatic but this is a very mediocre scent, the blackcurrant hits your nose first being carried by the musk and if you stick around for a little, you’ll also smell the peach!
This perfume brand gives me very “Organic” perfume, and this one to me does not fit into their branding. It gives very much Pink Sugar on a budget or a body spray mean’t for a toddler, not shade to either of those but this one didn’t hit me quite right. Good for the price, but very one trick pony.
soft and pretty, a gourmand leaning take on Clean’s Radiant Nectar. The peach is a great touch! Far preferable to me than sickly sweet frags like Pink Sugar

meh. smells like burnt caramel to me. the musk in this is sickly sweet. the peach is very faint but there. calling it staticky makes total sense to me. it kind of smells like the back of a big old computer thats running hot lol

fresh peach skin and staticky musk. this is sweeter than i prefer, but i honestly don't find it too cloying. the frutiness here is crisp, light, almost tart. the musk has that weird tickly, static electricity quality that i actually like sometimes (for example, in y-06s). this does resemble the other clean reserve fragrance radiant nectar, with the syrupy pear replaced with brighter peach. both radiant nectar and sparkling sugar resemble glossier you, though i think radiant nectar is a closer approximation
i could see someone really liking this, as long as this texture of musk is your thing. i think it's pretty nice for a sweet, fruity skin scent, not offensive, not overpowering, not too sweet

Smells like a tart peach, and the peach's skin, with sugar sprinkled on it. Like if I Want Choo and Glossier You had a baby.

I don't know why there are so many votes for moderate sillage... this sits SO close to the skin for me, but again this is my first time wearing her out. I even went a little overboard on my sprays because I know clean fragrances tend to be subtle. I guess I was just expecting a little more than *this much* subtlety?? Aka you smell it maybe inches away or holding your wrist directly up to your nose. I definitely need to try her more but idk. Will update.

Update: actively giving her another shot… sillage is better than previously described. I’d say it’s fittingly moderate. Perhaps I had gone noseblind before. This is pretty nice. Longevity and sillage are pretty good for a Clean frag!

ANOTHER Update- Kirke by TT was INSANELY close to this on my skin... if you are browsing for either one you should wear/skin test it!

At the beginning it smells fruity sweet and reminds me somewhat of scents I wore as a teen in the 90s. But as it dried down I keep getting wafts of it and it smells like glossier you to me. It may have something to do with what perfumers use for ambrette and musk, maybe they’re similar raw materials? Maybe they interact with my skin that way? Honestly, I’m 42 and love it. I don’t think it’s too young at all. But then I only think perfumes that smell like actual candy (like the old candy shop body sprays) smell too young for grown women.

Reminds me of something like a Victoria's Secret body mist from the mid-2000s. The notes surprised me, because it doesn't smell like peach to me. Blackcurrants are so rare in the US that I'm not sure what they smell like, but I guess it does remind me of a kir royale, which uses crème de cassis (a blackcurrant liqueur). My impression of this perfume is that it is very sweet and fruity, and it comes across as quite juvenile. I can imagine a teenager wearing this, but as a grown woman, it really doesn't suit me.

smells a bit too much like my tumultuous, alcohol-addled adolescence for me to be able to wear it these days. however, it is a delightfully effervescent fruity scent that plays nicely with warm skin and sweat. i wore this daily and was complimented often. sparkling indeed!

The peach and white musk blend seamlessly, for a somewhat caramelized fruitiness. Meanwhile, the musk and black currant also blend seamlessly, creating between them a sort of fizzy-fuzzy, effervescent woodiness.

Peach can often be syrupy and cloying as a fragrance note, but the blackcurrant and musk lighten things up with their dry, fuzzy crispness, turning the entire composition transparent and light.

It's like a dessert of peach slices sprinkled with warm brown sugar, accompanied by a bottle of crisp champagne. The table is decorated with a vase of blackcurrant clippings, but the woody-green pong of their leaves remains thankfully mild. After a couple of hours it dries down into more of a clean cashmere peach scent, which is also nice, albeit too mild for my middling sense of smell.
disgusting. all i have to say, it makes me feel sick. haven’t smelt since it came out because it makes me feel sick the rest of the day.

I dont really get much for peach or black currant (especially black currant, thats almost non-existent to me) - there is a slight hint of peach but I get a sparkly kinda fruit note with lots of sugar. It's honestly really pleasant. Musk comes out on the dry down. It's about a 3 hour scent on my skin and clothes both.
nauseating
hot fruity fart w a side of spit pee bubblegum and sugar
it smells like if a chocolate chip cookie were a soap … it’s not bad but the notes are really confusing. 7.5/10

It’s wayyyy to strong, and i wasn’t expecting that from a clean brand. honestly it gave me such a bad migraine i had to give it away to my friend. It was going to be my prom fragrance but i ended up using good girl by carolina herrera. Surprising to see it’s only 3 notes, straight out the box the fragrance is BOLD. Definitely doesn’t need to sit and age.

im reminded of i want choo by jimmy choo! sparkling sugar is like a softer, more realistically fruity, rounded out version. the peach is simple and wispy, but not synthetic. sort of smells how id imagine a peach syrup diluted with water would. surprised by how much i like it. the musk truly makes it feel as though its an extension of my skin; i cant pinpoint where my natural scent ends and the fragrance begins.
like most people say, it first comes off as a cleaning product (bad) but then evaporates quickly into a peach, it's just okay
Fresh, fruity, and clean. I get more of a pear vibe than a peach...but it's nice and my favorite from Clean Reserve. It doesn't have their signature dryer sheet scent. It reminds me of JHAG Pear Inc.

i don’t normally gravitate towards peach scents, but as a white musk enjoyer, this left me with a newfound appreciation for fruity scents. if you’re looking for a perfume that carries peach shower gel vibes outside the shower, give this a try.

initially sprayed, i get peach scented oxyclean. but once that wears off, you’re left with a pleasant fruity scent. definitely peachy, but i also catch something tropical— maybe coconut or pineapple? whatever it is, it evaporates early on, turning into an impressively realistic peach scent, like you just took a bite out of the stone fruit. this is also where the white musk really shines— clean, sweet, alhdehydically powdery, a touch salty. the scent doesn’t project much, but i think that’s a great choice for a scent like this, as it could become overwhelmingly fruity. great longevity imo, definitely fades quicker on the skin but incredibly long lasting on fabrics, more than i would ever expect from a scent that sits close to the skin. i wouldn’t say this is a safe blind buy. it’s not particularly offensive, but i could see some perceiving the fruity scent as juvenile.

i don’t think the comparisons to glossier you are accurate. the only overlap i detect is in the white musk, but the similarities really end there. reserve’s white musk reminds me of you’s ambrox+ambrette+iris combo. sparkling sugar is all fruit, bright, unwaveringly sweet while you is woodsy, earthy, floral pink pepper. essentially, sparkling sugar is a fruity take on clean reserve skin.

this scent isn’t for me, at least not as a perfume. i’ve used most of my sample up on my sheets and the peach white musk base notes have been really pleasant to wake up to.

oddly, this smells more like glossier you (og) to me than clean reserve skin does. clean and sweet in a timid/mild way, definitely a skin scent given how little projection there is. i keep a mini on me for the office since it layers pretty well with other fruity fragrances

I'm very unsure about what my opinion on this is. I think it leans a bit too sweet for my taste. It's very strong as well, and makes me feel like it's almost a bit juvenile to wear. I feel like I'm 14 and not educated on how many spritzes is a reasonable amount to wear (even when only doing one).

I get why some people love it. The notes in themselves are very nice, and refreshing. They're just a bit too strong for me.

Im in love with this scent. I use this before i go to bed and it instantly makes me feel clean, fresh, and relaxed with a hint of sweetness. I love simple it is and already know this is going to be a life long fragrance for me

I love the peach in this. It does, indeed, smell like musk with just a little bit of sugar sprinkled on top. Unfortunately, when I first got this, I got excited and oversprayed to the point of giving myself a headache. It's definitely one to use sparingly, at least for me.
Very airy, a bit simple. Fruity, but more on the plainly sweet side. Smells like sparkling sugar on the dry down, not initially. Smells a like something an older woman would wear.
I would absolutely love to smell this on a women I think it's sexy somehow. Although it may not last as long as some people would like.

Deliciously delicate peach-infused sugar water. Very sweet and fruity. Doesn’t lean artificial/synthetic, either; this is photorealistic fresh peach. As it settles the musk becomes increasingly prominent, until the whole thing fades airily away. Ethereal and beautiful.

This is a wonderfully light and airy fragrance.

It's fruity and sweet at first spray, like peach-infused sugar water or dewy peaches on a summer morning. The white florals and musk help to balance the sweetness and give it more body. The peach is there for most of the wear before leaving you with a saccharine skin scent.

This perfume is very refreshing and somewhat intimate. Not very complex but beautiful in its simplicity. The longevity is about 6-7 hours on me and the sillage is moderate.

No pear? Really? To me this smells just like Ariana Grande's G is a woman. Sparkling pear. Very sweet and fruity. I don't really get the sugar thing. I could not wear this, too sweet for my taste and doesn't have the Clean vibe.
Sweet in a somewhat watery manner, sort of like those early 00's clean fruity fragrances. Has an undertone of something hospital-esque - a bit too clean, perhaps.

I like the scent and all its aspects but it just leans a little too sweet for me. The peach really comes through and I think that's great. Combined with something really fresh or spicy it might be perfect.
The smell was fine - I liked it enough to try it on my skin - but it was headache-inducing, as many fruity and sweet perfumes are for me.
Peachy and sugary sweet. This reminds me a picnic on the set on Pride and Prejudice just after rain. A nice lakefront gazebo and frilly white dresses. Perfect for spring and summer.

I wear this when I'm on vacation, usually in a tropical setting, and it lasts all day... projection is not crazy but if anyone is within 3 feet of me, they can smell it. It's sugary but not too sweet that it becomes cloying. It's an easy throw on. It gives off "catching a whiff of your sweet and fruity shampoo after a shower."
I get musky pear. That’s about it. Poof it’s gone. On the positive side the pear is very juicy (yes I know pear isn’t a note but that’s how it reads to me.) it’s pleasant and would be easy to wear.
Reminds me of dish soap or a super abrasive cleaning product

juicy peachy/pear (where is the pear coming from??) with a bright and sweet tone

simple and inoffensive, girly and summery

--

update: while it doesn't turn yucky on me like Radiant Nectar, Sparkling Sugar does fade super super fast, unfortunately :(

radiant nectar is my favorite clean reserve fragrance and sparkling sugar is her younger, simpler sister. she’s sweet and fruity and evolves into something muskier. very delicious, would be a perfect candidate for layering due to its low sillage.

Aint nothing sparkling or sugar about this... with a name like this i was hoping for something fun effervescent sweet, but all i get is ariana grandes god is a woman. Which i used to enjoy until i started to pick up this weird plasticy vibe from it. Which essentially i get from this.

Initially I get a note of the most lovely refreshing juicy pear with a sweet sparkle. But ten seconds later I'm totally nose blind. It doesn't matter how much/little I put on on skin or clothes. I smell nothing. Identical to how my senses work with JHAG Pear inc. I'm so sad over this because what I catch initially from both these perfumes is sooo beautiful. I'm happy for those of you who can smell it.
a simple sweet fruity scent with a musky dry down. a bit screechy in my opinion, but i find most red currant notes harsh to my nose. i prefer radiant nectar farrr higher than this.
sweet, fruity, a bit musky, inoffensive. similar to radiant nectar but without the earthy/orris/carrot notes, this is sweeter.

This is an easy to wear, everyday scent you can wear to the gym, groceries or picking up kids. Heck, I even wore this to work(healthcare setting) and it does not offend anyone. In fact, I have gotten compliments on this scent. It's sweet but not too sweet, subtly pleasant whispery type of scent. I wear it whenever I am in the mood for easy softer fragrance.

I was pleasantly surprised by this perfume. I often anticipate "sugar" notes to be gourmand/musky burnt sugar, but this was very light and fruity, like a fizzy fruit soda. I smelled sweet pear notes predominantly. This perfume sits very close to the skin and has poor staying power. I could detect it on my clothes for maybe 15-20 minutes before it completely disappeared. Enjoyable scent, but wouldn't be worth a purchase for me.

I purchased a Clean discovery set at Marshall's earlier today, and I think I like this scent the best out of the bunch! It's a very fresh and pleasant fruity floral fragrance that's not overtly juvenile, much like Ariana Grande's Ari but sweeter and more berry-forward. Unfortunately, the scent is incredibly faint and barely there. It fades so fast that I won't consider purchasing a larger size, and I'll just stick with my beloved Ari.

I had a small sample of this a little while back and I really enjoyed it. It was the perfect mixture of a sweet but fresh and clean scent, despite sugar being in the name. I do wish it had more moderate sillage on me as I found it sat very close to my skin and didn't last as long as I would've hoped. I do think as a daily scent I would enjoy this however when I'm looking for a scent that isn't too strong or powerful.

This smells like dish soap.

The berries are very prominent, and there is a faint musk in the background. Super simple, sweet and fruity scent. It’s a scent profile that should be super safe.

But there’s something synthetic about it that reminds me of Victoria’s Secret fragrances. It also has a very effervescent quality that I normally love in fragrances, but here it makes it very soapy in a dish soap kind of way, not a fresh and clean way. So screechy and annoying.

Projection is almost nonexistent. 2 hours into wear, the dish soap smell subsides a bit and it becomes better, but the overall longevity is poor.

Whatever is in this fragrance is what is in Arianna Grande’s Thank U, Next, Le Monde Gourmand’s
Fruit du Dragon, and to lesser degree Cloud. I think other’s pick it up as “pickles”, but to me it’s sweetly-sour... and very prominent. What is it? Sandalwood?

This fragrance is very sweet and fruity, yet clean smelling at the same time! Makes you smell like you just had a shower with fruity body wash or shampoo. I love this scent for the spring and summer, and always get lots of compliments! Sillage is on the softer side but the longevity is excellent.
Smells like a peach dipped in sugar. Very sweet and musky. It is a skin scent though. No sillage or projection. It's VERY similar to Radiant Nectar

At first I could barely smell this on myself. A squirt to the wrist wasn’t enough to get any sort of impression. My hand cream was stronger! So I did a couple on the arms, and a couple inside my shirt. I still need to get up close to my skin to detect notes. My initial read is light, faintly fruity (but I wouldn’t have guessed peach without help), fluffy and soft. On the dry-down I get the white musk which mostly smells like pencils on me. (BBW Musk no. 2 is straight no. 2 pencils and nothing else to my mind). Someone described it as shampoo, and I would put it in that category. I get zero sugar sadly. I mean, no cotton candy or gourmand notes like I hoped from reading the name. This is a snuggly fragrance, like it will be cozy to those who give you a hug since it is not too strong.

Does anyone else think this smells like god is a woman by miss ari, which i used to be such a fun of. That being said i like sparkling sugar way more. However i do not see myself buying a full bottle.
i love a good sickeningly sweet scent but this smells sour on me :(

sometimes it smells precisely like *sparkling* sugar, a bright, vibrant sweetness, walking near the line of sickening, but never crossing it.

sometimes the peach note on my skin sours, like fruity notes tend to do with me.

sometimes, when i overspray on a second-day unshowered skin, the peach turns bitter, pouty, resentful, rotting. i love that aspect more.

never feel the synthetic musk base tho, the pre-diabetic sweetness just never evaporates on me.

not particularly complicated, fun warm weather scent. not gonna repurchase, but am enjoying my travel size bottle very much.

Sweet, fruity cotton candy, but very soft. I like it, probably won't buy a full bottle but maybe a travel spray.
When it dries down the fruity notes disappear and I onlt get a weird sweetness on my skin. Definitely not a favourite from Clean Reserve.
a very nice simple every day scent, for those days you dont really want to smell like anything in particular but just smell better than normal! fresh and clean but leaning sweet, would wear again

I actually really like this fragrance despite how soft it is. I tend to prefer strong, powerful perfumes. This is slightly fruity and sweet, but in a refreshing way. I do wish it projected a little more. I received a sample, and will likely be purchasing a full-size so I can douse myself in it. Lol Is it a new mind-blowing favorite? No. Is it worthy of adding to my collection? Yes.
It's a sweet, innocent, fruity fragrance. Nothing too special about it. I'm too old for this.
sweet and pretty peach!! does remind me a little of glossier you, but sweeter. clean girl aesthetic :)
This reminds me of Meliora from PDM!!! It’s so good!!!

Happy, bright, sweet, fruity, feminine, and overall just a pretty fragrance! This surprisingly reminds me of Clean Reserve Radiant Nectar, especially in the opening. I really agree with how another reviewer had described it… that Sparkling Sugar has more of a Berry peach white sugar scent and Radiant Nectar has more of a pear brown sugar scent. As it dries down I notice a softly musky, warm, and subtle woodsy scent as well. There’s this warm and comfortable feel to it too that’s rather nostalgic for some reason. I get the same thing with Radiant Nectar and B&BW Chasing Fireflies. I also agree with the reviewer below me, that it’s a sweet and fruity fragrance for the clean girl aesthetic.

I find this to be just an overall pretty fragrance! Something that’s easy to reach for, uplifting, and inoffensive. I love the nostalgic feel of this, it’s somehow comforting because of it. It would work really well for at the office because it is a softer fragrance, but it also lasts really well on me.

Smells like a fruity/sugary version of Glossier You in the dry down, but very similar to Ellis Brooklyn Sweet in the opening. I wouldn't consider this a gourmand. It's a fruity fragrance for the clean girl aesthetic.

Reserve Sparkling Sugar (notes from Clean's website):
- Top: Cassis berries, Ambrette Seeds
- Middle: Peach Nectar, Jasmine Petals, Pink Sugar
- Dry Down: White Musk, Tonka Bean, Blond Woods

Isn't as complex as the listed notes suggest. It also reminds me of a fragrance mist from Bath and Body Works but quite a bit more expensive with worse longevity and sillage.

This is a great spring/summer perfume for people who love fruity gourmands. It is bright and zesty and the word “sparkling” definitely describes the overall feeling of the scent.

The sillage and lasting power on this perfume surprise me. It is a light, intimate scent but one that I can smell on myself all day long. I’ll get a whiff of peach even 6+ hours after spraying.

I got it in a tester and will be buying a small bottle for the spring/summer. Definitely not a fall or winter scent.

Reserve Sparkling Sugar has the same fruity opening as Reserve Radiant Nectar, mixed with the aquatic musk from Reserve Skin. Radiant Nectar has a woody (pencil shavings) type of musk which smells so harsh and bitter on my skin, and that's the reason I can't wear it. Sparkling Sugar has the best parts from Radiant Nectar, but it's a lot fresher and a bit juicier and sweeter. Sparkling Sugar dries down to a subtle sweetness with fruity nuances. It's inoffensive and easy to wear. It's a so called dumb reach for everyday. It works anyday, anytime, for any occasion.

The longevity is surprisingly good, I get 6-7 hours on my skin, and it lasts forever on clothes. Moderate projection. It's not my favorite fragrance, but I really like it, and it's one of those easy reaches that never fails.

7.5/10.

I found a 100ml bottle for $50 at Marshall's, it was actually a blind buy. I LOVE this frag. It's sweet and fruity at first, but quickly turns into a soapy, aldehydic, pleasant skin scent. It doesn't throw super far, which makes it a great "every day, wear anywhere" fragrance. The longevity is actually great for the price point. I can still smell it on my skin at the end of the day.

I usually don't like aldehydes, but the sugar accord and fruitiness softens it quite a bit. I'm hooked.

When I first tried Sparkling Sugar all I could think of was Clean Reserve's Radiant Nectar. It felt so close in memory that I could have sworn they were nearly identical. As the day wore on it started to feel less and less like Radiant Nectar and like a sweet Dylan Purple. Eventually the sweetness dies down and I swear it smells nearly identical to Dylan Purple.

I tested out spraying the 3 and I have to say Sparkling Sugar and Radiant Nectar feel like similar DNA - though Sparkling more like a berry peach white sugar, and Nectar more like a pear brown sugar. Nectar keeps the sweet brown sugarness on the die-down for me, while Sparkling Sugar is more of a fruity musk that almost entirely matches Dylan Purple.

I think my biggest frustration with all 3 is that they're so short lasting. Sparkling Sugar seems like the best preforming for me, but even then I'm getting 3-4 hours if I do some heavy-handed spraying. Radiant Nectar seems to last 2-3 hours, and Dylan Purple lasts a hilarious 30minutes to an hour max. I have fairly oily skin which holds perfume pretty well so I was pretty surprised at the poor performance of all 3. The sillage is pretty close to the skin and intimate, which I don't mind, but could see it being frustrating combined with the poor longevity.

Overall I'm happy and am keeping the bottle, and would highly recommend to anyone who loves Dylan Purple but is frustrated they can't even get an hour out of it.
This smells so juicy! It's so fun and flirty and fruity.

Wow, I am pleasantly surprised by this one! I don't like too much sweetness, and I figured something with "sugar" in the name was going to be no bueno for me, especially after its cousin Skin Reserve was too sweet for me. But it's a balanced sweetness in this case! Feels like you just had a shower with a nice fruity shampoo. I think this is a light, everyday springtime fragrance, and office friendly as it's not terribly loud. I typically prefer something more unisex, but I can see myself spritzing this on when I'm feeling femme.

The top notes give me hairspray vibes, similar to Versace Dylan Purple. The dry down though…beautiful. I love the ambrette blended with the tonka & blond woods. This isn’t sexy by any means, it’s very much a girl next door vibe, but if your man likes a simple sweet girly scent that isn't too strong you’ll definitely get his attention. Honestly, this is what I’d imagine a Valentino Donna Born in Roma eau de toilette to smell like. Sweet & sugary with a clean girl vibe. Highly recommend this for summer if you love Donna but you find it too thick and sweet for hot weather.
It smells like Thank U Next without the pickles!

I'm impressed with this one! It does smell exactly like sugar to me. Not refined white sugar but unrefined sugar. I didn't like it but only because I don't like gourmand smells but If you like how sugar smells, you'll be in love!

More clean musk than anything. I’m surprised it was described by Clean as warm and spicy. Very dryer-sheet, shampoo freshness, and there’s nothing wrong with that. Peach does provide a little tang. and it is sweet, but not as sweet as the name suggests, certainly more fresh musk than candy. I’ve been combining this with Boardwalk Delight from skylar and they compliment each well- sweet and fresh for daytime. Sparkling Sugar is office-safe, if a little youthful, and could work for daytime pretty much anytime of the year, but I would say especially spring.

Smells almost exactly the same as Radiant Nectar, just a tiny bit of a lighter scent. I love both, but I prefer Radiant Nectar for its deeper and longer lasting sweetness. After a few hours, Sparkling Sugar fades to a kind of powdery sweetness whereas Radiant Nectar stays juicy and rich. You definitely only need one in your collection. Has a beautiful personal sillage but only lasts around 4 hours. In terms of perfumes listed as similar—
✔️ Ariana's God is A Woman: very similar, just a bit fainter
✔️ Versace Dylan Purple: a bit similar, but a bit more fresh
✔️ SDJ Carioca Crush: similar but more fresh
❌✔️ Glossier You: I see a resemblance ONLY after You sits for about 30 mins, but the initial dry down smells like dirty laundry on me
❌ Ariana's Thank U Next: very coconut heavy on me
❌ Ariana’s Ari: has distinct floral notes
❌ Ellis Brooklyn Sun Fruit: much more fresh and not as sweet
❌ Ellis Brooklyn Myth: much lighter and kind of gives me grandma energy
❌ Skylar Peach Fields: much lighter and less sweet
❌ Skylar Boardwalk Delight: a much more airy sweetness
❌ Parfums de Marly Meliora: fresher and has a grassy note on me
❌ Victoria’s Secret Tease Sugar Fleur: much less musky

This is a safe blind buy if you’re ok with low silage and longevity. It’s a light, sweet, fruity scent that doesn’t have the synthetic smell you get with some sugary perfumes. I would call this the grown up version of bath and body works sprays.

I tested this in the air at Sephora yesterday real quick before I left. Did not smell good. Smelled hecking weird if I’m being honest. I’ll sample it on a test strip next time, but, I wanna say this smelled like weird skin? Same thing happened with Radiant Nectar. These 2 scents are raved about in the frag comm, I gotta wonder if their Clean Reserve bottles went bad or something.
Pretty, sweet, safe scent. Doesn't last long on me, unfortunately. Still a love for giving me a mood boost, and for not causing headaches when I overspray.

This has a similar lightness to it as Clean Skin, but with an added tangy fruitiness which I love. It's a bit more of an active scent than Skin -- think the sharp scent of Herbal Essence shampoo lingering on wet hair rather than the subtle warm sweetness of body butter (which is more of what Skin is to me).

I can see this working really well for younger femme folks. Reminds me a lot of Viva La Juicy (if it geared more fruity rather than floral) and Gucci Flora Gardenia.

not a gourmand, despite what it says on the tin. evokes pleasant, fresh, slightly underripe fruit, like something plucked too early in springtime. it is cool and bubbly like sparkling grape juice, but it also reminds me of a high-quality shampoo. i like it, though it is nothing special. i would not have bought it at full price, but it was at tjmaxx for 30 dollars, which is great for this. lasts for a decent amount of time!

This is Radiant Nectar without the sour juicy note (which is what makes it special imo). It is beautiful and soft (too soft?) Think laundry drying sheets sprinkled with sugar. Having bought a 50 ml for the size of a travel size (a STEAL), I'll still be probably giving this one to a friend and purchasing Radiant Nectar as I like that one better. I'd say if you like Radiant Nectar, Skin, or even laundry scents, give this one a try.

This is a very subtle, but beautiful scent. It is very sweet but not overly sweet. From beginning to end, this scent was gorgeous. It is a good night time fragrance as it is not very strong. This will be a beautiful scent to layer. You will definitely smell clean! I rate this an 8/10
Authentic sugar bomb on skin✨
It's fine. It's totally unsophisticated and fruity safe. Skews young and simple. It's not trying to pretend to be anything it isn't. It has a lot of dopplegangers, of the Ariana Grande variety.

I reviewed this not long ago, but I have to come back again to say that this is so good that it's ruining other perfumes for me. 9 times out of 10 lately when I wear something else, I think to myself that I wish I was wearing THIS perfume instead.

The sparkly opening is already bright and beautiful, a nice balance of sweet and sour fruitiness... but that clean, powdery-sweet, musky dry down is positively ADDICTING. That's what makes this really shine to me.

It's so hard for me to find sweet/fruity scents that don't come off as juvenile (or generic, though I don't mind that as much) but this one doesn't at all. It's just... perfect. I wish the silage was better (especially for the price), but other than that I can't think of a single complaint or anything I would change. I could see this becoming my signature scent for sure.

Received a sample in my last Sephora order. I’ve been very into sweet/gourmand type fragrances lately so I was excited to try this but this is a sickly sweet scent. Smells more like an inexpensive body spray rather than the $110 bottle it actually is. I think I will give this to my daughter.

It smells like it's notes. It's a very close to the skin scent. Headache inducing for me. Not a safe blind buy. (none of the clean perfumes are safe blind buys imo) dry down smells like gone off fruit

Unexpectedly love this perfume. I don’t like Skin or Radiant Nectar and typically don’t love offerings from this house. I got a free sample from Sephora and really love it as an every day, light, clean and sweet perfume. It sort of falls into the same category as Glossier You - except sweeter and fruitier. Easy to wear, light, and effortless you but better kind of smell. Kind of has a creamy spun sugar accord.

I second that this smells nothing like cotton candy. Or sugar really. To call it a "fresh gourmand" is dumb.
It smells like a shower. Just clean skin, water and lightly scented floral shampoo.
Lovely.

From their website:

NOTES
Top: Cassis berries, Ambrette Seeds

Middle: Peach Nectar, Jasmine Petals, Pink Sugar

Dry Down: White Musk, Tonka Bean, Blond Woods

This does not smell like radiant nectar. Maybe a cousin. This smells like ellis brooklyn Sunfruit. As for the comment below saying it smells like cotton candy...no. this smells good don't get me wrong but it smells nothing like cotton candy. Honestly people leave comments cause they want to help sell their declutter. Absolutely no resemblance to cotton candy.

Sparkling sugar is Clean's fruity version of their Skin perfume - less gourmand, a little peppier! I love that this fragrance has an effervescent-ness to it - a little like a sparkling fruit juice. There's a juicy, sweet, fruity opening. Most of the fruitiness melts away after an hour or so and I'm left with a clean musk, which I enjoy because it layers very well.

This doesn't last super long and sits close to the skin. If you have Clean Reserve's Radiant Nectar, this is a little redundant in mood and occasion to warrant purchase of both. I'm wearing this in the winter, because of the "sparkling" quality of it - I feel like it's maybe suited to fall as well because it warms up as it sits on the skin, but it is primarily a spring/summer fragrance in my opinion.

Cute, sweet, lighthearted. It does smell like radiant nectar just a little more “sugary”. I spritzed my tester all over but my nose could barely detect anything initially and I was pretty disappointed. This fragrance is all about the dry down. It’s still very intimate to my nose but the musky sweet dry down is comforting and pretty. I wouldn’t buy it because I need a little more oomph from my fragrances for the price point, but I bet this will be a nice one to layer with other fragrances. This wore very well on my husband too so don’t sleep on it being unisex either.

Never have I been a person to see something with the word "sugar" in it and think Wow! I must have this! No I would run farther away, especially for scents. My whole world view changed when I got this is as a sample. ADDICTIVE. I had to roll it all over my body I couldn't get enough. It's sweet, yet not syrupy, soft yet head turning, has a whimsical nuance of being young yet suitable for mature women. Masterpiece of fresh & gourmand like the bottle states. Who knew that was a thing? I personally see this as a spring/summer scent because it is pure sunshine and happiness. Anyways, I bought it.

I feel like Clean's perfumes very often get the hate they don't quite deserve. Sparkling Sugar is no exception, unfortunately. It's pretty nice, fresh and sweet mood enhancer. Instead of peach I, for some reason, clearly sense pear. I agree with people saying it's pretty similar to Radiant Nectar, but, in my opinion, it's better. Cotton candy and bubblegum, it sits close to skin and reminds me of simpler times, my birthdays when I was a kid. Balloons, shiny wrappers, laughs and friends. It's a very innocent scent and it actually would work very well for a teenager. But it doesn't mean grown ups can't wear it. It's been on me the whole day and my mood definitely improved (if you, like me, suffer from season affective disorder, this is a must try to shake up the depressing greyness outside).
My main complaint about Sparkling Sugar and the reason I don't think I'll go beyond a 10ml bottle is the fact that both longevity and sillage suck. This is, indeed, a very big problem with Clean.
Overall, not a very complex yet also not a boring perfume for people who just simply want to smell nice.
Nothing unique or interesting. Opening is sugar clean with fruity note. Shampoo on a dry down. There are much more better perfumes for the same price and mood
Clean’s Sparkling Sugar smells like a sweeter, longer lasting version of Versace’s Dylan Purple. This is a fresh and green scent, but the musk does help with the fragrance’s staying power.
Strike three! My third attempt at a Clean Reserve fragrance and it does not smell good at the dry-down. Scrubber! Oh well. Glad it works for others

Sent a sample by Sephora. Not the sample I wanted, and not something I will buy. Why? Clean girl, fruity shampoo. Nothing groundbreaking but pretty. I agree with other reviews that this scent profile is easier purchased from BBW for a fraction of the price. Furthermore, it reminds me of Si Passione, which I had and liked, but didn’t love. However, it’s a nice and safe scent to gift to a young lady.

I feel like whether or not you like this one is going to be heavily dependent on how the musk in this reacts to your skin. For me this is a wonderful fruity musk that doesn’t smell overly synthetic or shampoo like, and I get wafts of it still an insanely long time after I apply it (I’m talking I put it on before bed yesterday at 11p and I got wafts of this over my sotd at around 7p today once I started moving around and my body heated up a bit) but I just KNOW that it will smell synthetic on some people and it probably won’t perform well on a lot of people either. Basically this isn’t one you should try to blind buy, get a sample or a decant/travel spray and actually wear it for a day or two before you decide.
