I would advise that for every fragrance but ESPECIALLY anything from this brand.

This also layers amazingly over top of so many fragrances, I’ve layered this with gentle fluidity gold, La belle, vanilla 28, CR Skin, br540 (regular and extrait) and a few other random vanillas I have samples of and it’s smelled great EVERY TIME. I think this may very well turn into my signature scent
it smells like pool chlorine. specifically the YMCA locker rooms. they should've leaned into that. YMCA parfum.

I have this in a travel size bottle. I have worn it a couple times, including today to go run errands and on a run then brunch. I will give it credit, I can still smell it on myself, about 5-6 hours in. I experience it as a sweet musky perfume. I struggle with the musk notes in Clean Reserve, so I would not purchase a full bottle of this. I also cannot differentiate this from Skin. I could quite literally copy and paste this review for Skin.

Very similar to Radiant Nectar - I would sample both and pick one if you’re a fan of these types of fragrances.

Sparkling sugar is just that - super refreshing and juicy with a soft and fuzzy musky dry down. The opening is almost a thirst quenching effect - like a sugary peach cocktail in the summer time.

I personally find this very pleasant and playful. Fun to smell! Great for every day - it doesn’t stray far from the skin. Leans more summer/spring to me, but could easily be worn all the time.

8.5/10
It's very nice, but can't be differentiated from a body spray from Bath and Body Works or the like. I would not pay more than $20 for this.

I’m not the biggest fan of this line, but this perfume is gorgeous! Sugary peach but not overly sweet, I completely adore it. It's youthful and fun, but can totally be worn year-round. It definitely sits closer to the skin but I don’t mind, it gives off that naturally sweet/musky vibe.

omg. This is the Italian villa summertime romance scent of my dreams; musky, heady, dripping with sugar, intimate. This smells EXACTLY like a sophisticated, adult version of Bath and Body Works’ “Pretty as a Peach”. I have always wanted that to exist.

So glad to have gotten this as a free sample; this is a sugary candy smell done just right for my tastes! It's fresh and bright, not at all heavy. I almost get hints of citrus? Probably a little sour note from the peach if I had to guess. It's a fun, happy-go-lucky kind of scent, then turns into a gorgeous, sweet powdery skin scent after ~5 hours. Personally I think it'd be great in cold or warm weather.

I have a lot of trouble with sweet, candy-like scents, but this one doesn't read medicinal or juvenile at all to me, both of which tend to happen. I initially thought this wasn't a scent I'd pay full price for, but... I absolutely cannot stop wearing it. If I couldn't find a deal, I would absolutely pay the price, even if I'd hate myself for it lol. It's just that pretty!

(edit: take Glossier You, replace the pink pepper with peach, and that's Sparkling Sugar! I'm very surprised I don't see the comparison more often because they remind me of each other so much.)

very nice. no longevity but a very clean fresh peach. sweet sweet sweeeet. liis floating = this + ambroxan + longevity + throw. liis studied = this vibe but its the first bite into a juicy crisp pear. safe, fine, not very special. reminds me of cool, dewy summer mornings in a big airy white house

a sweet sugary sparkling berry with a hint of musk. This is a "safe" scent in that it is not overly strong, pleasant and soft. It's a little more grown up than the pink sugar craze from the early 2000's but I feel this isn't just a young kid scent and could be worn by different age groups for a fresh,clean, sweet scent. In the sephora edition clean reserve sampler set on the clean website, it's a great bargain for a good size bottle. I wouldn't purchase a full bottle when it runs out but in the meantime this is nice for layering, spraying on a sweater or scarf.
Great for a young teenage girl, it’s fresh clean and sweet.

People are using the word "inoffensive" to describe this perfume. I really disagree... I tested this on my skin because someone said in another review that it was a dupe for Liis Floating. They are not even remotely similar. There is a foul plasticy smell in there that made me need to scrub it off.

This is basically like a less offensive, less strong version of Radiant Nectar, which I did not like either. They both smell very artificial, but at least this one doesn't smell like honey. This one just smells like sugar and plastic.

Scent Description: Sweet
Sillage: Weak
Longevity: Short - a few hours
Presentation: Square Bottle with Wood Cap

Oh my god. This is exactly what I wanted daisy love eau so sweet to be. This smells clean and crisp while smelling sweet and sugary. This smells a little bit like Ari by Ariana Grande. This is a beautiful clean girl aesthetic perfume. I think that this is signature scent worthy and it's appropriate for every occasion and everyone.
I give this 10/10.

Edit: This is almost an exact dupe for Liis Floating! Barely can tell the difference. Interesting that Liis Studied and Radiant Nectar are so similar and here Liis Floating and Sparkling Sugar are dupes...

This fragrance is really fascinating because it is so similar to Radiant Nectar but still really distinct in its own rite. I find this is like a black currant/berry version of Radiant Nectar where instead of a woody base you get a strong skin musk.

The opening is sparkling, sugary, and very pink/red berry with a musky, clean base, with almost an Iso E Super effect in the base. There's nothing earthy or super woody here, just clean berries and juicy peach and some laudry-esque clean musk.

The dry down is extremely distinct from Radiant Nectar, however, and I actually cannot handle the dry down. It becomes an acrid, sharp, almost BO-ish musk on my skin. I think it's a lovely scent in the opening, but it does NOT hang with my particular body chemistry! I can imagine it for other people, but it is not for me! I will stick with my tried and true Radiant Nectar.
Disgusting!!!! This is pure burnt plastic just like the Radiant Nectar
Basically a sweeter, fruitier you by glossier. They’re practically the same scent but this one is definitely sweeter and more feminine. Overall it’s pretty and inoffensive!

Ooh so this one actually smells good! As a person who HATES clean skin and clean radiant nectar , i was surprised that I really liked this scent. I quite like it on my skin as well as on paper. Its a very inoffensive scent and I think it is a safe blind buy. This is coming from me who hate gourmands and sweet scents.
lovely light smell but so corporate and boring.
Peachy sugar! Sweet and almost smells like pear? Reminds me of God is A Woman by Ariana. Fresh and glittery.

I love this for cooler warm days. Where it’s not to hot or cold and I’m just looking for something fruity and uplifting. This smells lovely! Every time I wear this I always think someone around me is wearing Glossier You.

I love layering my scents and my favorite combos for this
1.Milestone-Club de Nuit w/Sparkling Sugar
2.Warm&cozy- VS Pink w/ Amber oil- Nemat w/ Sparkling sugar

Absolutely intoxicating in the best way. It's super sweet and warm with a hint of musk. Great girly sweet everyday scent- I put on even when I go to bed because I love it that much. I do wish it lasted a bit longer but at $110 for the 3.3 oz I don't mind reapplying and spraying several times. Also- sort of a sweeter girlier version of glossier you! If you like that and more gourmand scents you'll love this!

I love this scent, and it sticks around on me forever. It is very clean-smelling to me and did give me a headache the first time I wore it, but I liked it so much that I risked wearing it again, and I'm good with it now, even overspraying like I normally do. I know some people have performance issues with this, but this will get me through a full workday, and I never have to go searching for the scent. I love this, and it's on the cusp of being a signature scent for me.
this gives fruity body spray vibes. definitely not worth the price. a little juvenile. but would be good for someone looking for an easy reach, everyday summer scent.

Picked up a sample vial of this. I'd read some describe it as a lovechild of Skin Reserve and Radiant Nectar. I absolutely love the Reserve blend of Skin, and I like berries, so I wanted to try it.

I was really surprised how much I dislike it. The notes are pretty but it's a little too 'bright' for me and gives me an instant headache unfortunately. It reminds me of fruity body spray from the drugstore. I can totally, absolutely see a lot of people loving this. Just for me, I think it needs a little more grounding. I have to learn that fruit + sugar tends to equal headache for me, no matter how bad I want to love it.

I will say the name is 100% dead-on. This is a sparkling, sugar fragrance! Light, cheerful, youthful. It reminds me of the vibes of Sparkling Hibiscus by Mix Bar. Not bad holding power for a clean fragrance, either! It lasts much better on me than say, Skin [Reserve].

I do think it's overpriced for something not particularly unique, but on the other hand it's vegan CF. I also love this brand's packaging. It just matches the 'eco' theme perfectly, and the full size bottle feels really hearty.

Out of all of the Clean Reserve scents i’ve tried, Sparkling Sugar is one of my favorites. It’s a girly, sweet berry scent that I could see myself wearing on a cute Springtime picnic date or on days when I want something feminine to wear. It’s very safe and familiar, which could be good for layering.
Fresh, musky, fruity spun sugar. Light hearted and fun. Love for spring and summer. Non offensive, easy reach. Love this one!

For me, this is a nice fruity sweet scent without being too strong or cloying. I like layering with it, it adds extra sweetness to any scent. This is a very cute scent without being too juvenile or overbearing. Very nice

Gourmands are tricky to pull off–more than any other scent profile, they often teeter the line of being too sweet. Sparkling Sugar by Clean at least delivers what its name promises–pure, unadulterated sweetness, an elevated and more mature version of the "Pink Sugar" spray scents of many a generation's youth. Although the notes listed include musk, peach and black currant, to my nose, Sparkling Sugar reads as cotton candy with a slight hint of fruit flavoring–the peach reads as almost candy strawberry, as well as the blackcurrant, which more resembles grape hard candy, if more subtly.

On my skin, gourmands can be a gamble. Outside vanilla and certain fruits, musky sugary gourmand fragrances can read as heady and cloying, almost nauseating when I wear them. Unfortunately, that's the case with Sparkling Sugar–this is definitely not a blind buy! I also read it as a bit of lightweight as far as fragrances go–good sillage, but less impressive longevity. This seems to be a pattern with many fragrances from the Clean Reserve collection.

For those who can pull of sugary sweet smells with pride, or those who pine for the Pink Sugar of their youth, then give this a try.
Love it! A brighter, fruitier Glossier You. Lots of comparisons to Radiant Nectar but this one is more pleasant to my nose. Sparkling indeed.

I really enjoy this one. In my top 10 most worn. Very sugary soapy sweet scent that i adore. I own Radiant Nectar and I think Sparkling Sugar is more crowd pleasing. RN is moreso honey drizzled over pears, sitting out in the sun. Whereas SS is peachy pear water that makes you smell clean and sweet. I feel like SS is the better option if you want everyday use, because sometimes RN bothers me. Both very faint but I was actually complimented twice wearing SS this week on vacation. I think it’s easy to become nose blind to these. . Both are very carefree, fruity and clean.

The peachy top notes disappear almost instantly and you are left with something that is almost, but not quite, indistinguishable from Radiant Nectar. I love Radiant Nectar, but they are similar enough that I do not think one would need both. If you have neither then I would say that Radiant Nectar is deeper and cosier. It's like honey milk bubble tea. Sparkling Sugar is lighter, like a peach bubble tea, if that makes sense.

no clean scent has ever been my cup of tea but i keep getting free samples and trying them anyhow. this one is a very soft peach with a soft musk and hint of blackcurrant but it's mostly peach to my nose. it's starts fresh and bright then gets sweeter, like peach candy. ok, but not my style.

Found it very similar to Radiant Nectar and Skin from the same line, almost like a mix of the two. Nothing that stands out but very inoffensive and nice smelling - if you have either one of the above I don't think you'd need this on.

I didn't like it on myself, but I think fans of CLEAN will enjoy it.. it smells like fresh laundry,  as most of their scents do. It's got that fuzzy, warm fresh towels from the dryer musk note in there that CLEAN fans will like.
There might be a hint of sweetness in there,  but not enough for me. Unfortunately these types of scents just turn into rubbing alcohol on me. 
I got a little rollerball for free from Sephora with a $25 purchase,  so keep an eye out for samples like that if you wanna try it and can't sample in store!

I bought this randomly lol I noticed that Sephora has this delivery same day from your local store and we’ve only had a Sephora for a few short months and so I shopped anything in stock I could get say day under fifty dollars lol there wasn’t much so I got this and I’m glad I did. It’s really sweet, but not in a bad way, it’s fruity, i would have thought it was more for cold
Weather but it’s definitely a year round gem ! Great buy!

I love love love and adore Radiant Nectar, I shower in it actually (:DDD), but dislike Sparkling Sugar (the dry down is great but the opening is very artificial smelling and plastic). No, they are not the same. RN is a sweet (not too sweet!) juicy pear that is very sexy and sugary. I' d rather recommend RN if you are unsure.

I love this perfume!!! Granted, you have to spray a lot on to be able to get the sillage you need, but to me, it's the perfect everyday or layering perfume. It's not obnoxiously sweet, nor does it smell cheap. I think the freshness of the notes keeps the musk not as heavy as you would see in most fruity sweet fragrances!!! This perfume is perfect for the lake or beach. Living in Houston, the warmer weather makes this the ideal summer gourmand. I highly recommend one of my favorites from this house.
Smells exactly like Radiant Nectar. Big disappointment.
I happened to be testing out PDM's Valaya and Meliora, and to my surprise, Sparkling Sugar smells like a mix of the two. The peach and musk from valaya, the sweet berry from Meliora.

new signature sent, once I get through my travel size I'll definitely splurge on the full size. honestly the best thing I've ever smelled though I am biased towards anything that smells sweet & peachy. :)
There's a strong similarity to Radiant Nectar (which I do like) but there's something unpleasant and almost plastic smelling that comes out of this with my skin chemistry.
Clean girl vibe for sure. It's a juicy sweet fresh peach. Great for everyday, office, on the go, brunch, spring and summer time.
Received as a tester! SO BEAUTIFUL!!! Peach and black currant sugary juiciness, very light on my skin!

mmmm! Sweet, fruity, and delicious! The name definitely fits this. A clean, juicy, slightly sugary scent that smells amazing on the skin. I received this as a sample, but I would not mind having a full bottle of this, I think it's so pretty. And the price point isn't really bad as well. This would be such an easy every day reach for the spring or summer months. This is also highly inoffensive, I couldn't see anybody getting mad at this or thinking that it's overbearing. This smells like peach slushies and rainwater hitting a fruit garden. I love it!!!

I’m so glad I tested this a second time and on clothing before buying. This was so pretty the first wear and I was thrilled to find the fruit notes were still prominent for several hours. The second time I sprayed in on skin and on my sleeve and pretty soon after started noticing something sour and unpleasant wafting up…I think this was a case of the cassis note going wrong 😟 It was a little horrifying and I had to scrub it off as soon as I got home and immediately wash my shirt.

I’ve also read that others had a similar issue with Clean Reserve’s Radiant Nectar, so perhaps it could be something in their musk note that can sometimes pull chemical-like and off. Be sure to test before buying!
I Love it! I'm scent sensitive and most sweet scents make me feel bad, but Sparkling Sugar somehow sweet but not owerwhelming at the same time. Honestly I'm obsessed with this scent.
Delicious peach shampoo mixed with clean cotton. Doesn’t last long and definitively isn’t a beast, but it’s lovely and uplifting.

While this is nowhere near FBW or even a scent that I like a lot, it is decidedly not bad. I just don't think it is interesting at all. It is a pretty straightforward milky-musky peach skin scent, so perfect for the person who wants a "non-perfume perfume" or something that is very subtle. It is a skin scent, so the throw is very close to the body. You will smell nice but in a way that others likely would not be able to identify as perfume. I could see this being a banger for layering to add a hint of sweetness or skin-ness to other fragrances that have a kind of airy quality but do not last, and that is likely how I will be using the remainder of my sample. This smells clean without being shampoo-y or soapy, which is the brand's whole ethos, so I think they have been very successful in what they've created. For me it is not something I'd buy more of, but I will likely make use of the remaining amount I have in the carded sample I got from Sephora.

I’m getting Si Passione by Giorgio Armani vibes. The fruity opening with the black currant is literally identical. Sparkling Sugar is essentially a fresh gourmand. Fruity, sweet, juicy and reminiscent of a pretty shampoo. I’ll have to test out longevity but so far I’m enjoying my sample :)

edit: just get Si Passione by Armani instead if you’re looking for something with this scent profile + better longevity.
It's a fun pretty sweet fruity scent. My nose gets a slightly lighter version of Escada Candy Love but Candy Love lasts longer on my skin.

Bright, fresh peach accord at the top, settles quickly into a sweet skin scent. couldn't get a lot of musk. lasts only an hour or two until it completely fades away - wouldn't buy a full bottle due to lack of longevity/sillage

The scent is nice but REALLY light....like seconds after spraying I had my nose against my skin to smell it. I sprayed it on paper to test if it performed different, but it faded on the paper too. I returned it because it lacked projection.

This is one of those scents that are good for people who only want to be smelled if they are skin to skin with someone, otherwise even inches away it will be hard to smell. I would hope there would be some sort of projection with a heavy spray....but even after it sat on my skin for a few minutes, it became such a faint smell that it seemed not worth keeping.

I do like the packaging though....gives a minimalist/day vibe.

Throwback time. Remember Bayla by Aeropostale? If you do, smelling Sparkling Sugar will take you on a nostalgia trip. They smell similar.

It’s clean, fresh, sweet and refreshing. It’s fun and flirty without being completely juvenile. Like a comment said below…if you take the sticky, syrup sweetness in Radiant Nectar and replace it with the freshness of Skin, then you have Sparkling Sugar. I really enjoy the Clean line. The perfumes are simple, light, easy and smell so good. The way they do skin but better scents is impressive. Like CR Skin, it’s an easy reach for everyday use when you aren’t going anywhere special…running errands, quick lunch, straight of the shower and lounging around the house. It’ll brighten your day a little when you wear it.

I originally wanted Radiant Nectar but I opted for this one. {I never smelt either.} It smells Bright; Fresh; Airy and Sweet. Not Tooth Aching Sweet. It’s such a Pretty Scent that’ll be perfect for Spring & Summer because it’s not a Heavy Syrupy Sweetness. I don’t think it’ll be offensive if You work in an Office or with Children. It’s also a Clean Brand. I purchased this in a Travel well my Husband did but I’m going to get a Full Size bottle. Definitely worth a Sniff! Projection and Longevity are pretty decent as well but I layer my Frags and Lotions.
IG/TIKTOK selfcare_introvery

On the Clean Beauty Collective’s site, the notes are listed as ..

Top: Cassis berries, Ambrette Seeds
Middle: Peach Nectar, Jasmine Petals, Pink Sugar
Dry: White Musk, Tonka Bean, Blond Woods


I smell mostly peach nectar with a bit of light musk in the drydown. It’s bright and super juicy, and it is shampoo-y … sweet and clean and nice. But it’s also screechy. However, that loudness does give it some strength and protection, so it’s a bit of a trade-off.

I bought a travel spray but will be returning it. On a day like today, after testing a skunky failure (Sorry, Kayali Lovefest Burning Cherry ..), it’s a welcome blast of clean, fresh sweetness. However, I just don’t love how screechy and juvenile it reads, and it ultimately gave me a headache.

Personally, I wouldn’t compare this to others in the Clean Reserve line. I remember really disliking Radiant Nectar and find this to be very different.
the name totally matches the concept - gently sparkling. great every day peachy softly sweet musk
Starts off smelling like Radiant Nectar & dries down to Ellis Brooklyn Sun Fruit.

I'll preface this with saying I haven't really ever been a fan of super sweet, sugary perfumes. My nose also typically prefers niche or indie...I have very few designer perfumes in my collection (my wallet wishes this were different). However, I've been on a sweetie kick lately and I am thoroughly enjoying Sparkling Sugar. It doesn't smell juvenile at all, I also don't think it smells that similar to Radiant Nectar or Skin. I find Radiant Nectar to be pretty similar to Glossier You, which also smells nothing like Sparkling Sugar. The fruit in Radiant Nectar never translated on my skin, which is what I was after.

Sparkling Sugar is juicy, bright, fresh, with the perfect amount of sweetness, the musk isn't warm and never overpowering. To me, this is an elevated body mist type of scent - something I want to wear on Saturday or Sunday while running errands because it beings me joy and isn't fussy. I don't want or expect scents like this to be beast mode, it does exactly what I want it to do. The scent profile is simple, smells the same from start to finish which again, is exactly what I want from a fragrance like this.

I really like this!!! It's smells just like they combined Clean Reserve Skin & Clean Reserve Radiant Nectar and created this fragrance! Very nice! I have both of those so I could probably just layer those and get this fragrance! But, on it's own this is yummy!
This smells like cheap shampoo, such a disappointment.

This just does not work for me, the citrus doesn't feel fresh but rather a bit fusty and almost rancid. I think it might be the musk causing the issue, since I don't consider it a particularly fresh note. Not very clean in my opinion.

First fragrance from Clean i totally dislike...i can smell only Lily of the Valley and Jasmine- top, middle and base....Reminds me of toilet deo....the good thing is, that it lasts so briefly, that nobody will notice it.

What do I know, but for me- I'm sorry- this smells like bugspray.
And I usually love the fragrances from clean line.

Initially it reminded me of the smell of hairspray. I could not perceive that much lavender or rose, but rather a citrusy greens and creamy white floral scent. Clean and inoffensive, great for everyday.
Was introduced by the brand from the Stray Kids promotion. Fresh linen scent, love wearing this after my night time showers.
The initial spray is a mix of citrusy bergamot and lavender. The dry down is a a clean musky scent. It doesn't smell very much like a perfume, almost like a skin scent.

Quite simply,
One of my Favorite Fragrances on the Planet.

✨
Clean Ultimate smells very similar to Tom Ford’s Neroli Portofino. The dry down is softly soapy where NP dries down sharp, bright and citrusy. The initial spray smells identical.
Clean Ultimate is the twin of Simply Belle. I use these clean type perfumes to refresh my sheets, clothing and curtains. I really enjoy them on fabrics.

A review by Energeticcrab below says this is lemon and suntan lotion. That is 100% accurate. It smells of Coppertone sunscreen specifically. The lemon I’d say is more of a nondescript citrus (maybe more like orange blossom? Or neroli?). But it’s not as sharp as lemon.
I like this opening. But within 30 minutes, it is musk, musk and more musk. And the longevity is powerful, and it keeps getting muskier until eventually I feel anything but clean.
I got this in a set with Clean Skin for a pretty good price. But it’s going back. Because Clean Skin is only straight up musk from top to bottom, all day, and it’s just too much musk. In fact they smell both exactly the same eventually.

This fragrance has two distinct faces.

The first one it reveals when you spray it on fabrics: Dry, slightly powdery, a hint of herbals. I associate that with freshly-ironed white cotton.

The second one is the impression it leaves on my skin.
After a moderately strong, herbal opening there is a soft, yet slightly medical cloud of lavender and lily of the valley which lingers on the skin for quite some time until it turns into a soft, neroli-infused musky note.

Clean Ultimate reads as a slightly unusual twist of a classic everyday-scent one could easily wear at work and at home alike. It is very unisex, has moderate to low sillage and lasts about four hours on my skin. It is an uncomplicated fragrance that I wear quite a lot.

So Delicate this is a "lovely" fragrance.. I get Neroli Lemon-lime musk and Lilly of the Valley. Predominantly Neroli and Musk. Its light and inoffensive, Innocent with a hint of Sexy. Its labeled as a unisex fragrance but I find it really femenine. This was the only one out of the collection that I liked it stuck out from the rest. I usually wear this after a shower before bed. I do like like it but I think it needs a little more personality and longevity for me to wear it out.

So, I gave this another try. We all deserve second chances. I realized at the time I tried this the first time, I was taking medication that may have altered my PH. This time, the result was so much better. I didn’t smell much in the way of lavender too much, but it wasn’t all lemon either. In fact, it is a blend and reminded me kind of like the original 4711, with better longevity. At times the jasmine can come through to remind of Susan D. Owens’ perfume, Child. Be careful how you spray this, can be strong if sprayed too heavily. Very citrusy and musky with orange flower and jasmine. I’m liking it now.

lovely and light for days where you want to smell fresh as a daisy. Still noticeable enough to project well. Definitely a casual daytime scent but a very pleasant one. Nabbed a bargain in TK Maxx so really pleased with this blind buy.

One of the better Clean fragrances. But it still is lemon and suntan lotion at its core. Like another user mentioned, this is clean without being laundry scented. That doesn't mean it doesn't smell like soap, though. To me, it is similar in scent to Lush's Sea Spray.

A musky Lemon, the most underwhelming perfume in the clean line. Yet, it fills a niche, for all of you who love the smell of lemon-scented cleaning products. This is your chance to smell like you’ve been diligently cleaning your house all day. Would I wear it? probably.. I generally prefer flamboyant orientals, but we all have our day jobs. The “clean” line is as “office-safe” as office-safe gets.

Lavender? Where? I wish! All I smell is lemon, lemon, lemon, lemon, oh, and uh.... lemon! Wish I could have caught the other notes, but lemon has this affect on me with fragrances. If your chemistry amps lemon, try before you buy if possible. Did I mention all I smell is lemon? :p
Smells exactly like coppertone suntan lotion.

My "palate-cleanser" perfume. I wear this when I want to clear my head, to start fresh, to start anew, to rest my nostrils following the days I wear heavy perfume. I also bring this on holiday when I know I wouldn't be able to shower everyday. Perfect for spraying on clothes after you've been exposed to car exhaust, or after you have been into a smelly kitchen. Weak sillage and staying power especially for an EDP, but I can't complain. Clean Ultimate really lives up to its name.

Squeaky clean, maybe to the point of harshness. Sometimes I really like it, but sometimes it's too sharp and soapy. I bought a bottle but don't use it all that often. I wish it had a touch of sweetness to it. I find it strong, but doesn't last long; maybe two hours. I can see the similarity to pure Grace, but Clean Ultimate seems more lemony/citrusy, and Grace a bit softer and mellower on me.

I can't smell anything floral in this; just lots of citrus and clean white musk. When I smell this in the winter it makes me crave summer and sunshine.

Great fragrance! Smells like fresh lemonate early in the morning. If you want to smell clean and feel energized, that's your fragrance. Not offending at all, but definitely recognized. Great choice for hot summer.
I can smell the jasmine after it dries on my skin. It doesn't stay long though, you have to respray again after an hour. Best to wear when you want to smell fresh.

Smells mostly like lavender and musk which I think is really nice. It's both cosy and clean at the same time. I was very calmed by the lavender smell. Unfortunately it's very expensive for what is essentially a very basic fragrance, nice as it is, and it doesn't last more than a couple of hours at the most. Still, for that hour or so I did like the smell of it very much.
The best clean skin scent hands down.

Love at first sniff.. that's how i remember this...

Something about this fragrance makes me feel confident and sexy. The combination of musk, floral and spiciness is well blended.. keeps me fresh and clean despite being exposed to sun the entire day! Suits my body chemistry so well. Though longevity is not so good (3-4hrs), i don't mind re-applying to experience the heaven in this gem. Can't count the compliments that I got from both men & women everytime I wear it. I highly recommend to those who hates strong scents but wants to captivate attention in a non-offensive way.

This is a great CLEAN fragrance. For some reason on me, it lasts far better than other CLEANs and even some of my other citrus/green/fresh types. It seems to last better on clothing than skin. I'm happy with it and may even repurchase. With the floral element, it's more unique than the usual fresh or citrus.
I absolutely LOVE this fragrance. I have had tons of compliments on it. It is not overpowering however the only complaint I have is that is has very minimal longevity.

Meh,very soapy,but that's the point,right? I guess I am just not into this kind of thing.Nice enough,if you're looking for a clean,soapy smell. Very light,I definitely get the lavender and citrus scents,and if I liked the soft,clean, laundry type smells,this one is very good.It's just not what I look for in a scent.
Sillage is minimal,definitely a skin scent,and longevity is not good wither,an hour or two,and I had a hard time smelling it on my wrists.Then again,I had a hard time telling the difference between this and my fabric softener,so,who knows,maybe I was smelling that.
End results,if you like clean and soapy,this one does not disappoint.If you want it to last all day,be prepared to take it with you,as it does not last long.
smells like laundry and although it is EDP the lasting power is very poor.But I like this kind of clean fresh scent.
My first Clean perfume! I LOVE it! If you are looking for a soapy clean smelling perfume, you will love this one. I also own Philosophys pure grace and they really smell simalar. =o)
Soooo fresh, smells clean, really clean scent, I like it that it doesn't smell like detergent or laundry, but it reminds me of angel's breath, a baby cologne which i can buy here at a cheaper price

Smells just like Philosophy's Pure Grace.
I like it, it smells clean and fresh, nothing special though.

Meh, it's alright. I can't imagine anyone being offended by this scent, but I also can't imagine anyone going crazy over it. I only wear it when I'm really not in the mood for any of my other perfumes.

It's pretty awesome when I layer a spritz of TBS' White Musk over it, though. I don't really like White Musk on its own, but combined with Clean Ultimate it smells really nice. Try it!

Love, love and love . I gotta say I'm super picky about scents,but not because I know allot about them, I don't.I'm really sensitive to strong fragrances. if I'm in a car (carsick) if I'm not ( headaches).i love perfumes,but just on other people.
Anyway i gave this a try because of QVC, they were going on and on about how great it was and you know if you've ever bought anything from them... you watch long enough they'll convince you :)
Long story short- This is my favorite from the set, not overbearing ,not in your face, not ridiculous, but a nice ...I'M HERE AND YOU'LL LOVE ME and I do...i do...
I love this perfume!!! soapy, fresh, so clean!!!

I used to think that the brand Clean made insipid and bland soapy fragrances, but since giving them a fair go, I have come to understand the beauty of a crisp and clean scent for everyday wear.

Heavy hitting fragrances can become tiring after awhile, and that's when a scent such as this one is highly appreciated. Clean Ultimate has unisex tendencies, with the dominant lavender accord giving this composition a slightly masculine edge.

Lavender has many soothing properties, so it's easy to feel comforted by wearing Clean Ultimate. It's casual, clean and smooth. I find it inoffensive and versatile enough to be worn all year long.

Some may complain about the linear composition, but for something so soapy and delicate, I don't know why you'd want it any other way. I personally believe that the simplicity works a treat.

I do happen to adore the scent of lavender and musk, so Clean Ultimate suits me to a tee. The only disappointing factor, was its lack of lasting strength. It lasted a meagre two hours on my skin.

I'm giving it the thumbs up despite the longevity issue, and I whole-heartedly recommend it, especially if you enjoy the somewhat unique Clean Warm Cotton as well.

I just love this one! On my skin the fragrance is lasting for DAYS.... I really don't understand everyone are saying it doesn't last for very long?? The smell reminds me of summer, holyday, fun and a lot of exiting places i've been to. It is sweet and yet strong, very feminin indeed. My absolute fav.

This stuff is pretty great. To me this does not smell at all like the other "Cleans." It is more zippy if that makes sense. It has alot of lemony freshness almost like fresh lemonade meets soap. I am planning on wearing this alot this Spring & Summer. Good stuff!!!!!!!
I love this perfume! Definitely one of CLEAN's best. Honestly this is so similar to Philosophy's Pure Grace that I can't tell the difference!
Summer+fresh+relax..

It's my first ''soapy'' scent. It is really nice, and i'm suprised my hubby noticed that i wore somemthing new and really good BUT it lasts for minutes...I mean after a while i have to scratch my nose on my arm to enjoy it.

Anyway, its light and nice soap. When i wake up, i get a shower and i put my ultimate on and all i get is a euphoria feeling.

I wish it could last longer...

update:I got lots of compliments today.But i do not smell it on me. The others do smell it and they seem to like it.
I loved this fragrance. Clean, fresh, fruity, and delecate.

Clean Ultimate EDP is the only fragrance in the entire Clean line that I have enjoyed. It's the first one that truly smells "clean" without smelling like laundry detergent. Like the others in the line, Clean Ultimate is a bit short-lived, but it's also so light that it would be impossible to over-apply it, and a second or third touch-up during the day is not going to overpower anybody. This scent could easily fly under the radar in offices that ban scent in the workplace. It truly smells like you just showered with a nicely-scented soap or shower gel.

The overall aroma is floral, but not too sweet. My husband also tried it and it smells great on both of us. Defnitely unisex. (I read elsewhere that it smells similar to a men's fragrance called Gendarme which I have not tried.)

Clean Ultimate is a great daytime scent, and suitable for hot or cold weather--smelling clean and fresh is seasonless!--but is not strong enough or mysterious enough for evening wear.

This is my first Clean perfume and I love it. It's really an ultimate clean scent like what the name says. I have to agree that it's not very long lasting but for me, it's better than other perfumes that disappear in minutes after application. I love this fresh scent. I like all its notes. So breezy and fresh!

This smells almost simular to Demeter's
Wet Garden; it wasn't what i expected
i thought it was going to smell more like Linen but i got is a Boozy Alchol
scent which i detest it doesn't last long on my skin this is the least favorite of my Perfume Wardrobe.

The scent is just as it says, clean. It doesn't last very long but it is great to use at night after a bath.
DK
I wear this one at work. Smells uncomplicated and like you just took a wonderful shower. I don't see how this could offend anyone.
It smells just like that "new car" scent they spray in your car at the carwash. Not my idea of good perfume, but I got it for $12 at TJMAXX, so I'll keep it in my car as an air freshener!
芭樂男性味 還好 (香根草) 持香不錯
It’s alright. At first I thought it had an alcoholic note in it but it doesn’t and it faded anyway. This leans more masculine IMO.
I tried this today and found it to be pleasant smelling however it isn't a blockbuster fragrance like Sauvage or Bleu de Chanel. It's just a safe scent that everybody will like at the office.

Currently, I have over 100 samples and came across this one over the last few days. On my first wearing, I wasn't sure, and today I put it on and still feel the same way. The opening is one of the best in all of perfumery, but in 1 minute flat after the fresh opening, the smokiness comes out, and it's quite bitter and tangy which I like, but also something which reminds me of an antique furniture store, but not an unpleasant dinghy one. It's definitely worth a shot, because I can see some really pulling this one off. To me this kind of reminds me something a witch could wear. It would be a favorite scent for a witch. I'm not even being sarcastic. I could envision this being a signature scent for some, but this is not a mass appealing scent. I could understand the mixed reviews, and completely understand how some will love it.
⭐⭐⭐⭐
Not good. These notes just don't go together. Smells like a women's wicker furniture, yankee candle, picture frame, Hallmark card, store.

I don't get much of a vetiver vibe off this. On me it smells very sweet...kind of like burnt homemade caramel or burnt sugar. I am resisting the urge to wash it off, but even after 1 hour, while lessened somewhat, the burnt sugar smell is still there.

I do sense the myrrh and amber, and some woods for a slightly resiny scent, but this is very far from the green vetiver scent I know and love.

Not for me since I am not a gourmand frag fan.

I'm getting lucky this week with finding new fragrance lines. And extremely pleasing blind buys.

Now for this the name clean couldn't be more fitting. Very fresh non soapy high quality gentle. Very smooth well blended wood, florals mixed with earthy tones. This could safely and easily be layered.

this line gets a lot of flack for smelling like laundry, but this literally smells identical to dryer sheets. the sueded oud offering was pretty good and not at all reminiscent of laundry, but this is disappointing.
nil sillage, weak longevity; as a "smoked vetiver" this leaves a lot to be desired. not for fans of vetiver to try. if you really wish to smell like dryer sheets, with that same headache inducing chemical sweetness/freshness, then be my guest.
I like it! I'm glad I've picked up a travel spray of this one. Probably my favorite so far of the Clean Reserve Line. Perfect soapy neroli and orange blossom cologne type scent.

This is so soapy! Not what I was expecting at all. Perfumy, very soapy, clean fragrance. Good, but I wouldn't use it on myself. Would spray on clean sheets, or as a room spray. Try before you buy if you're not sure about this type of scent. Otherwise a nice neroli scent, good quality too.
My personal favorite of the discovery set. Smells 99% like Ultra Deluxe Liquid Dish Detergent (Lemon)

Such a great perfume! Great longevity. Neroli is slightly sweet here with pleasant addition of oranges and bergamot. Clean fruity floral with warm sandalwood background. The best performance for this perfume for me was on a humid, hot day. When it is colder, it is less creamy and gets quitr sharp. My must have for tropical vacation (added bonus - mosquitoes seem to hate it).
a clean and inoffensive scent :) very cheerful and summery, kind of reminiscent of childhood summer camp

I got a sample of this perfume and to me it smells very fresh, citrusy, soapy and obviously clean! The neroli note in there is not sweet and powdery, it's more like creamy and soapy. It smells great, inoffensive scent for everyday use.
Dryer sheets :(

Ok, Clean, I see you!

I love neroli, but found most neroli fragrances to be too bitter on my skin, until I tried Tom Ford's Neroli Portofino (the OG, not the Acqua version, which I have yet to try). I actually prefer Neroli Portofino, which I find to be brighter and fresher, while Clean's version is softer and soapier, but I can't justify the price of TF, considering how poor the performance is. Acqua Neroli is much more affordable, and honestly quite beautiful. Even though Tom Ford suits me better, this smells close enough that I can happily overspray and respray without feeling my wallet clench.

There's something kind of gross about this. I might have to try it again to put a name to it but the word 'sweaty' came to mind. I think it might be the mix of the white floral and musk...

The best I can describe it is like the end of a long, hot day at the beach, after sunscreen has been applied a few times too many and the sweat has mixed in. Your group heads back to the car, there are half dried beach towels on peoples laps or on the seats and you're on your way back to the hotel to clean up. All you can smell is sunscreen, sweat, and and undercurrent of BO. It's tolerable but I wouldn't choose it.

Clean and oddly nostalgic. It smells like spray can sunscreen. Reminds me of being a child headed to the beach in Florida and walking past the hotel’s warm laundry room vents on the way. Summery without being tropical

Snuck a generous few sprays of this from someone's bathroom cabinet. Such a naughty way to smell so good. On my skin this had a delightfully clear feeling, exuding melodic neroli, orange blossom, and citruses, with some extra depth from what smells like perhaps lime blossom. The base notes are fleeting, so the cheery top and middle fizzle out rather than giving way to a new scent profile. I cannot imagine somebody objecting to this smell.

My coworkers, roommates, and girlfriend were all coming right up to me to put their noses to my skin. Perfume should not be about the opinions of others, but it is an undeniably good feeling when a fragrance makes others want to get close to you.

Absolutely gorgeous and clean and without risky ingredients and you smell like vacation, Normally I love gourmands but this is my go to for Spring and Summer now. I can't get enough of it. It's like a crisp clean shower all day kind of scent. Perfect for a man but also a woman. Neroli is my favorite from the Clean brand

I loathe this perfume...disgusting. I felt a lot of negative nostalgia when I sprayed this. I thought of sunscreen, then old ladies in the 90s, then the waterpark I went to as a little kid. I agree with all the reviews that say it smells like cleaning product. I've used neroli water as a toner, so I'm not sure if neroli is the issue for me; it might be the orange instead. This is not a fragrance I want to smell, nor one I want to smell like. Thank goodness I only got a sample of it, which I will not be finishing.

opens with juicy bergamot and something lightly powdery, which quickly evolves into a clean, musky, neroli and orange blossom infused laundry detergent. very bright. should be worn with linen and a big sun hat, not at a beach but on a boat
it's too soapy and sharp for me, but i do think this would work for someone else. it's missing something grounding, green, or earthy like a moss or true marine note, which could be fixed via some clever layering

This perfume helped me realize that I don't like Neroli. Not my thing...
Smells like suntan lotion.

First association that comes to mind is expensive Italian spa. This has a really clean smell, but the citrus and neroli give it that sophistication other Clean perfumes lack. I think this would be a great perfume for work and pretty much any occasion. I imagine someone like Natascha from Sex and the City or Kate Middleton would wear this.

Very linear. I wanted something very much in the herbal facet of neroli, and this scratched the initial itch. Very clean, lightly floral, and unwavering from that. Slightly icy and metallic, almost like the first deep clean after a very long winter. I think given that statement though, they could probably charge about half of its current price and it would seem more accurate.

As far as I've smelled, this is the pinnacle of clean smells. It projects and lasts surprisingly well on me too, I had someone sniffing all over the house trying to figure out what they were smelling (it was me). Definitely a clean laundry smell but just slightly complicated by the neroli, which gives this a mild, delicious streak of greenery and earth. One of the safest fragrances I have ever worn, and I tend to opt for things with more depth and less universal appeal, but this is a great scent.

So it does smell like laundry detergent or dryer sheets but in the best way. This is the scent that embodies the word "clean" to me... Nothing to make it stand out from other citrusy-soapy scents, but it’s nice! I described Sel Santal as the colour green, Acqua Neroli is dark blue or purple

I like this so much! Most will say it's smells like cleaners or detergent. And granted citruses are usually used in them because they do so well eliminating odors. But that's just what cirus smells like. Now to me, this smells like I just stepped out of the shower and used all lemony bath products and the steam in the room brings all of that out. It smells clean, as do all of the fragrances in this brand. Yes, it smells of citrus but obviously without that chemical smell that also comes with cleaners and disinfectants. But to me this was just so uplifting. It reminded me of the way I feel when I'm done cleaning the house for the day and the smell of cleanliness just makes me feel fulfilled and like I can only attract positive vibes. Very spring and summer this fragrance. I finishes a sample vial, now I'm going for the full size.

This is honestly my favourite perfume ever. It’s the one perfume I get the most compliments on, and I rotate pretty often between my collection. It lasts days on clothes, I once sent a package to someone overseas that took over 1 month to arrive, and I sprayed it on the items and the smell still lingered after all this time.

Super fresh, a great signature scent for me.

This smells awful because it reminds me of cheap mop cleaner or strongly scented dryer sheets. This would be perfect for a teenager but not for an adult who has a rich scent detector, if I’m wrong let me know.

Now I know why the Clean Reserve set was discounted at Marshall’s. What a depressing but overwhelming scent.
orange spic and span

Watery neroli citrus bomb. I could not stand it and this epitomizes the way that I hate neroli being done. Overpowering. I don’t get any of the other notes. If I have to say something positive..: it is very clean smelling and unisex. Just soooo not for me.

Smells sooo good! Many might disagree with this but on the first spray I got a blast that reminded me of Sundazed by Byredo (minus the cotton candy) because of the neroli. Then it dries down to linen dryer sheets (which I don’t mind at all!) This is veryyy clean. Can’t wait to layer this and see what delicious combos I can come up with :)

Edit: This one surprised me! It turns really really sweet on my skin. At the end of the day I still smell neroli with a candy powdery sweetness.

Fresh. Clean. Uplifting. It's a love for me. Reminds me of when I lived in CA and the whole city smelled of orange blossoms, only this is a little brighter. Great for layering. Today I'm wearing it with the ever so tiniest dab of Pirette.

My FAVORITE out of the Clean Reserves line! When I wear this I feel ladylike, pretty, clean, and confident. I also love how this scent lingers the entire day especially on clothing. Perfect office everyday scent and signature scent worthy. 10 outta 10!

Purple! Funny how neroli always comes across that way to me; like I can smell or feel the color. After a few moments, orange citrus juiciness, slightly floral and soapy and very aquatic. Refreshing, simple. Bright and crisp. But it settles into hollower citrus florals and without any woods, it's lacking notes that I typically find interesting or enjoy. Still a solid freshie.

This is a great summer/spring scent for sure, very clean and fresh. Upon first spray, I was getting overwhelming zest and orange blossom, but as it settled a little bit, the mandarin and neroli really came through pleasantly. The musk and sandalwood really save it from having that stringent headache-inducing quality that a lot of white florals have as well. Personally, it's a little too fresh for me to wear on its own, but I've been layering it with a really nice peppery-woody fragrance that seems to bring out the warmth a bit more.

This is pretty BORING. this definitely sits very close to the skin … does not project … it is fresh - but it’s very hard to even smell . Maybe for a bed time scent ?
I would not purchase a full size of this - came in a discovery set. This does not smell bad.. just not unique and pretty boring in my opinion
4.5/10

Beautiful beautiful opening that showers you with fresh Neroli scent. Gets soapy in dry down, a clean, fresh, and instant mood booster for spring and summer. This is my first loved perfume as it provokes a natural scent and freshness with nothing perfumy about it.

That's a whole lot of Neroli, and maybe a little bit of Jasmine. Honestly all I get from this is floral and I don't get citrus at all. It's also quite strong for the person wearing it, but it stays really close to you, so it's basically like a personal scent. It doesn't smell bad, but I don't particularly like it. If you like neroli and you want to smell it on yourself, then this would be a good choice. Otherwise, there are plenty of other floral options that are generally less offensive.

Scent Description: Neroli and Jasmine
Sillage: Strong on the skin, but doesn't extend far
Longevity: A few hours
This was love at first sniff. Perfect for spring 👌
Infinitely no. I have to learn that Neroli/Orange Blossom do not work with me. Instant headache.

I love this perfume but the neroli and orange blossom are so sharp that i'm embarassed to wear it ouside of my house. I feel like this could easily be headache inducing. I tried layering it with sweeter frangrances but haven't found a good combo yet.
I'm a neroli lover so I enjoy having this in my collection.

Ooooh, this one is yummy. The citrus isn't overwhelming, I'm mostly getting the neroli with a hint of jasmine (I didn't like Dolce&Gabbana Light Blue bc the orange scent came through VERY strong for me). It feels light, fresh, and flirty. I could see myself wearing this throughout the warmer months. It's the kind of thing that COULD be a bit obtrusive if it had strong projection, but it sits fairly close to the skin.

I think this is a really quintessential fresh-neroli-and-citrus fragrance at a pretty decent price point; clean, sun-kissed, and tangy-sweet. It's an easy reach that effortlessly evokes summer days, minimalist sandals on sun-warmed streets, soapy buckets of hand laundry on apartment balconies, and the glint of azure sea water somewhere in the distance.

Acqua Neroli's fresh, sweet-tart citrus is inseparable from its lemony-vanillic white florals and soapy musk, like multiple facets of the same Riviera-daydream. The base adds a little velvety woodiness, but citrusy-floral freshness remains the fragrance's defining feature well into the dry down.

When I smell this on its own, I really like it. However, when I smell it side by side with other, similar fragrances, I end up liking most of them better. So I guess I'm just a ho for summery-citrus-and-white-floral scents in general. ¯_(ツ)_/¯
Fresh neroli. Citrus with very subtle floral, green notes. This is an easy blind buy, a crowd-pleaser.
Fancy hotel shampoo vibes. Which I love. So, whatever.
Reminds me of diaper rash cream.
It smells like Huile Prodigieuse from Nuxe, clean powder and neroli. Not strong smelling nor longlasting.
I don’t get the powdery or soapy feel from this. I just get a fresh sweet neroli. It’s a nice scent but fades very quickly.

This opens very spicy, but dries down into this beautiful powdery, musky orange blossom that I just adore. Yes, it’s a very CLEAN scent so I understand where the “detergent” smell is coming from for some people. But this is a favorite for me!
Sample from Sephora. Smells like hand sanitizer/disinfectant

Biggest rip off ever. Buy this if you like to waste money. This is agua florida repackaged into a fancier bottle. You cannot convince me otherwise. This is still like 62.99 on Fragrancenet. A 7.5 oz bottle of Florida Water in Walmart? 5.27. On Amazon, you can get like 6 bottles for 22.00. It is the SAME thing. Use that 62.99 for something better/ more unique.
On my skin this smells like Expensive toilet freshener. Especially middle notes. Dry-down is fairly neutral, I can almost like it, but I just can't get out this washroom association from my mind.

The combination of Sicilian Orange, Bergamot and Mandarin Orange reminded me of Nenuco cologne. Apart from that, it smelled citrusy, bright with the orange blossom being the most noticeable one from the white florals. Nice but not for me.
I got a small travel size of this and I like layering it with Basil Neroli from Jo malone this is like a smoother version of basil neroli in my opinion. They smell very similar though.

Great big blast of orange blossom and neroli with the first spray that lasts a good hour at least. The drydown keeps the neroli going for a few more hours, but the projection ramps down and there’s more of a musky soapy backdrop. Its like a fancy floral bar of soap - clean, classy, and close to the skin. It’s not my usual scent profile, but it does make me feel like I’m wearing linen and drinking a $17 negroni at a garden party, which isn’t something I do too often but is nice every once in a while.

First Impressions (sample spray):
I thought I would like this perfume because I do love soapy, and indolic fragrances. However, I was very mistaken. The neroli and the orange blossom become very sharp, and the mandarin orange is EXTREMELY synthetic to my nose. This comes of as extremely cheap soap that's trying to be clean but has a weird after smell.
Edit:
Tried my sample of it again. Yep still have the same thoughts. At first it smells like a citrus Neroli detergent. So far so good for me b/c I love that detergent smell. After a time tho it becomes completely rancid to me. The piercing Neroli is getting too much. The indolicness mixed with the citruses is giving pee I will say.

Summary:
Smells like: aggressive cleaning products in the worst way.
Family of: neroli portofino (worse version)
Silage: moderate to strong

Verdict:
Big pass- synthetic neroli cleaning products.

I have searched for months for a blue fragrance. I have bought (and given away) or tried everything. I just don’t enjoy the standard blues like Dylan, de gio, D&G etc.

Absolutely love this one.

The opening is invigorating and the flower notes perfectly settle them down.

Sandalwood always performs well on me, so it makes it masculine enough, without screaming look at me, I’m a man.

And as with any blue or green, one spray of Beach Walk under it…boom, instant ocean banger.
This is straight up Downey laundry detergent. Not into it.
Citrus and white flower. Basic but nice

There’s something about this house that constantly puts a dryer sheet/detergent accord in every single fragrance and it’s inescapable save for a select few (looking at u Sueded Oud).

This is just your Nana’s old flowery lotion you found in her bathroom. It’s probably been sitting there since 1989. A little crusty around the lid. And then it dries down to... detergent. Again. Skin and Rain do the same exact thing.

It’s not my style and I won’t buy it. There are plenty of other more dynamic neroli scents out there.

0/10. Pass.

I enjoy the neroli and the sunscreen smell it gives off at first, it’s almost addicting. Unfortunately after it dries down for a while it starts to smell very soapy, overwhelming and gave me a headache.

I'm basing this review on an EDP spray from the Clean Discovery set. I'm so disappointed because this is awful on me! The second I sprayed it, all I could think of was "Detergent!" And strong detergent, at that.

I expected to like it because I like citrus and orange blossom. IDK, maybe this is one of those fragrances that just doesn't work on some people, and I'm one of them. YMMV.

This Clean fragrance lasted on me better than some of the others, so there is that! ( I have dry, perfume eating skin.)

I'd say this is a safe office scent mostly because it smells like laundry products, and it doesn't have much sillage or longevity. It's not a safe blind buy because of the laundry smell some get from it. I suggest trying a sample before buying a bottle. For a gift, maybe, if you know the recipient's taste in fragrances.

There are better neroli fragrances to add to your collection then this one. It opens pretty sharp, than the neroli is dominant for about 30 minutes. In the drydown the ambrette / ambroxan comes through, which gives it to my opinion a dirty touch which doesn't match well with a neroli fragrance.
Smells a bit like fruit loops to me. It's definitely citrus, but I'm not hit in the face with a particular fruit. This is a happy, pleasantly fresh, and yummy scent that is perfect for hot weather.

A white flower mix that smells of yellow pollen, fresh flowers and dusty wood undernotes. Not terribly original but pleasant and cheerful. I do like it, but this whole collection dries down to essentially the smell of dryer sheets. I’m not mad about it, but it’s a lot of synthetic clean in minor variations. Easy to wear, but you get what you pay for. That being said, I'm very pleased with several anyway.

I really enjoy the opening of this scent. I am trying the discovery set so I have aqua neroli on my left arm and warm cotton on the other. I get a very grape-y opening from the aqua neroli. I’m not mad about that. I also love the hint of Jasmine. This is exactly how I like Jasmine- just a touch. This morning I tried Leila Lou by Rosie Jane and the Jasmine was too much for my liking. As far as silliage and projection, I will need to wait and see. So far really enjoying it.
Longevity is weak but this smells JUST like Dial Neroli body wash! I feel like this would be perfect for the gym! Sweet but not headache inducing.

tried it in the discovery set - my first impression was "wow this really smells like spray sunscreen!" It's still pretty nice - citrus is not my favorite (I really don't like D&G Light Blue) but the soapy/powdery notes give it some balance.

This is my favorite fragrance to wear when I expect to get hot and sweaty i.e. the beach, boating, working outside, or going to the gym. This refreshing, light perfume makes me feel clean and sexy, despite having a little swamp-ass.

The Clean Reserve Collection really lives up to its name, no matter what fragrance it sells. All of their perfumes smell and feel very clean and fresh, not too strongly aromatic or heady. However, this can be a drawback when its fragrances star scent notes that are, by default, highly heady, aromatic or indolic. Neroli is such an note. Anyone who has smelled neroli in real life knows how powerfully sweet, alluring and even a little skanky these little cluster flowers can be, giving the equally skanky and overtly sexy jasmine a run for its money. It's a potent and likable scent, which pairs nicely with juicy or fresh notes. On paper, a neroli aquatic freshie fragrance sounds like the perfect fit for the Clean Reserve brand.

However, performance-wise, Acqua Neroli isn't everything it should be. Yes, it's a very sweet, fresh, watery and likable scent. There is nothing offensive or unpleasant about it. However, it smells too similar to some of the other Clean Reserve perfumes. The orange and citrus notes overpower the neroli, which all but disappears, or is rendered as soapy and almost detergent-like. Such a note worked for Clean Reserve "Warm Cotton," but it takes the neroli out of "Acqua Neroli," once again leaving it as a sweet, but unoriginal, freshie fragrance in a sea of other similar clean freshies on the market.

It's a shame, because had it been better executed, this could have a been a standout for this brand. For a better take on an aquatic neroli scent, I suggest Acqua Di Gio, which plays up the white floral sweetness without drowning it in the aqua notes.

This is definitely a little too soapy to wear alone, but like all Clean fragrances, it’s great for layering. It smells great with Solar Bloom (freshens up the coal note in that fragrance a bit) and improves the longevity of that fragrance. The longevity of this is great, probably the best of the Clean fragrances. It’s also extremely unisex.

I got this when I was going through a neroli kick, I really like it just don't know if it's really for me. My husband loves it and it smells really good on him. My sister also loves it for herself and her husband, it really is a unisex fragrance. It's smells fresh, clean, and a little soapy, but also beachy.

Oh, how I adore this one for the warmer months. It has all of the citrusy and floral notes I associate with spring and summer, and the neroli really shines. It’s got this high end soapy quality to it, which usually isn’t my style, but this just wears so beautifully for a day in the sun. It’s layering very well over my BBW Sensual Amber lotion, and Fairytale body mist. Plays very well with other citrusy/floral products, especially when I’m fresh outta the shower.

Got a sample of this from Sephora and I must say, I like it! Definitely smells fresh & clean, which I think is great for errand days and beauty appointments. I don't usually love soapy scents, but this one feels a little more high end opposed to other generic, boring ones. However, I did try it on my skin twice and I would've liked a more lasting longevity.

This one is a fresh scent of lemon and a bit of orange, no jasmine or other white flowers (most importantly no orange blossom), not that I can tell. Off the cap I get a soapy neroli. There is a slight strange "after smell", as indicated by another reviewer, which I too noticed. I'm thinking this is what was used to synthesize the "musk" note in this (ambrellotide?). I heartily disagree that it's like "Eau Des Sens" by dyptique. Eau Des Sens has a fragrant sweetness, a high-quality pureness, with no "after smell"; it is the closest one can get to an organic orange blossom in perfumery. This one is simply a synthetic citrus. It is not a "warm" scent, nor ambery or resinous as described. I get watery and "cool". Musty, even. I do feel it's necessary to reiterate that there is no comparison to the sweet, floral, and herbal orange blossom of Eau Des Sens. If I have to make a comparison, it's most like Artisan by John Varvatos, both in smell and weak performance.

Update - tried again 7 April - I'm getting straight up lemon pledge furniture polish. It's really kinda icky tbh, and it's burning my skin. I have it in miniature rollerball form, received from another fragrance collector. Simply not a fan at all, sorry.
Very white floral forward, with a spicy bit of citrus. It smells like a generic high end perfume. It’s soapy and pleasing, but nothing special. Would balance out a sweet fragrance well.
I actually like this. However, it smells so mild on me that I think I am the only one who knows I am wearing anything! That is the only reason I hesitate to use it more frequently.

smells just like a truck stop fast food restaurant bathroom soap I smelled on a road trip when I was 11

good if you like neroli.. sadly I can't stand it in certain fragrances

This is really similar to Tom Ford Neroli Portofino Acqua or 4711, it lasts longer on me than TFNPA, if i may say, its even better, been layering this together with Jo Malone's Lime Basil and Mandarin, very refreshing scent.

I go to the gym late in the evening as I have a long commute for work. After the gym I shower with 4711 Soap. After the shower I spray 4711 EDC all over then relax. But, on my days off i find myself in the gym much earlier. At first, this was why I purchased a travel spray of Clean Aqua Neroli; it is a fresh, invigorating neroli that will last longer so i can put it on at 3pm and it will carry me into the evening rather than die off in 30 minutes like 4711.

Now I am Hooked. It is a damn good fragrance and incredibly underrated. If you took the time to read this and you enjoy 4711, Neroli Portofino, Bright Neroli, etc. then pick up a sample of this. It is an accessible, amazing scent. It teeters on the edge of clone to Neroli Portofino by Tom Ford, but it is less refined and has some imperfections compared to its far more expensive cousin.

This coming spring i know i will be purchasing a big bottle of either:
This (Clean Aqua Neroli)
Neroli Portofino
Neroli Portofino Forte
or Ferrari Bright Neroli

Smells like laundry detergent but in a good way. If you like neroli in general, you'll like this: a beautiful soapy citrus that dries down to a soft woody musk. Perfect clean scent for spring or summer.
such a beautiful smell. definitely worth a blind buy if you're considering purchasing online. performance isn't amazing though which kinda blows. 7.65/10

Wow! Was not expecting this. I just LOVE the way the Clean line settles and develops into the skin and Acqua Neroli doesn’t differ. I’ve been searching for a bright and fresh citrus that settles into some thing a little more sensual and this is the one. Can’t believe it’s been right in front of me in a tester said I had for so long! I think this may be my new daytime scent or definitely one that I wear into the office when I head in. The description below from the last poster was absolutely correct bright and fresh soft and airy really beautiful all together. The first spray definitely comes up with a light fresh citrus something you kind of want to smell more and more not some thing you want to avoid. And then develops into a sexy soapy light skin scent. I’m excited to wear this out as I haven’t yet I definitely think this is some thing that people will want to get close to and discover more without being it offensive. Really well done!

I got a sample from Sephora, and I received compliments every time I used it. So I decided to buy this lovely perfume.
Fresh and clean, sweet and airy.
Sillage: 10/10 ( Based on compliments).
Longevity: Moderate. ( 1 spray every 3 hours on the back of my neck).

It’s great for all the reasons below, but am I the only one that’s picking on up a syrupy grape soda scent from the opening? Is it just me?

Like I know citrus is there, and yet my nose still can’t escape the sweet synthetic grape smell.

Still slays though.

A couple months ago I got a free spray sample of Clean Reserve Acqua Neroli with a makeup purchase. I told myself it would be such a light scent I'd likely be unimpressed. Then I tried it on and found myself sniffing and sniffing my skin without really thinking about it. I couldn't get enough of the scent. Once I admitted to myself I was really into the fragrance, I went ahead and bought it when a sale came around. (More recently, I went through the same process when I got a tiny roll-on sample of Clean Reserve Skin.)

To my nose, Clean Reserve Acqua Neroli is simple and linear. It smells like Neroli. I don't live in a tropical area, so the scent of Neroli reminds me of happy vacations. My fragrance collection is not huge, but this is one of my top five favorites. I'm not sure it would be a crowd pleaser though. So many people complain about floral scents. So I wear it at home and on errands when I'm just interested in pleasing myself versus getting compliments.

By the way, I noticed when I received my bottle of Clean Reserve Acqua Neroli, the bottle juice projected more than the spray sample juice did.

Update: After wearing this fragrance for a couple weeks, I started to notice more of the woody notes coming out on my skin. I've learned over time I don't like woody florals, so for me that's not good. However, today I tried wearing the fragrance on my clothes instead of my skin, and now I get the linear floral accord I prefer again.
🦋🧡🦋

this starts with bitter citruses and neroli backed by a clean musk and ambrette, the latter which adds a sort of soapy element. after awhile it softens a bit with some jasmine and amber, but the amber is very light. overall i find it to be a soapy orange blossom that works well in warm weather. not my cup of tea, as i like more aromatic orange blossom scents.

At first It didn’t really stand out to me. It felt like when you hear a song for the first time and you don’t like it till you hear it a few more times then become obsessed. it’s very citrusy fresh and calming. I applied a body oil I bought a a beauty supply store and WOW perfect combo, (the oil was a dupe of scandal by John Paul). It brought out the middle notes it just smells wonderful and the combo is my go to now.
The orange notes come through but I also smell something else maybe lemon or lime? It is overall a well-done citrus fragrance. It smells real, not synthetic.

I'll admit this has a nice dry-down but my first reaction after getting some spray on my hand was "oh no, wish I could scrub this off!" I am not a neroli fan. But I love ambrette and amber which saved this from being a true scrubber.

I can see the similarity to Tom Ford Neroli Portofino in this, but I think an even closer perfume to this would be Diptyque's Eau des Sens. This starts off with a beautiful green neroli and citrus opening which it maintains for a while, but the heart note in this was mainly the orange blossom for me with a little bit of sweetness that reminded me of the sweet musk in Clean Reserve Skin. There is a soapiness in the dry down that is sometimes found in a lot of orange blossom perfume and is especially found in Eau des Sens which is probably why this one reminds me so strongly of it. I love that kind of clean scent in warm weather, though and really enjoy it in here as well. This lasted a fair amount of time on me and especially on my shirt so I like the longevity of it as well.

I have this travel spray and I like it! It's very fresh! Sunny and clean! Great unisex fragrance! I've always wanted TF Neroli Portofino (I've read these are similar), which I now have coming in the mail. Yay! So excited. I will do a comparison once it arrives, same some other reviewers have done. But I really like this, and it is complimented when I wear it! A definite keeper!

Waxy citrus with faint florals. Can barely smell it without raising my wrist ten minutes after application. Gone in three hours. It is clean smelling, but the fragrance blend, projection, and duration aren't what I'm looking for.

This sounds so good on paper with the citrus and white floral. Unfortunately, the execution is very mid. It's giving laundry. I have nothing against laundry but I don't want my perfume to smell like straight up dryer sheets or detergent. Pass!

I feel very neutral about this scent. I only get two notes when I wear this. Neroli and citrus. Neither of these notes stand out in anyway as something to exclaim as being extraordinary in any way. I feel like Acqua Neroli simply smells clean and neutral. You will not likely offend anyone by wearing this fragrance. However, it is not memorable. I guess this is a good fragrance if you are looking to blend into the crowd.
Purchased a sample in hopes that it would resemble Maison Margiela Flying. Started as a sweet version, then all I could get was dryer sheets.
The best way I can describe this fragrance is that it smells like grape candy. Personally, its my least favorite from their discovery set of 6, but I don't hate it and will still use it.
I love this scent! smells like the summer time. White floral with a touch of citrus. I can still smell it on me 5+ hours later. Perfect neroli perfume.
smells like i just cleaned the house.
Clean and inoffensive. Smells more feminine. Not my favorite neroli scent.
When this dries down, the orange citrus smell turns a bit sweeter and reminds me of a flatter Jasmin 17, with a little bit added of freshness. Love the smell but love Jasmin 17 more.

I have Acqua Neroli on one arm and TF Neroli Portofino on the other. I have seen the two often compared and thought I’d add my two cents worth:

Neroli Portofino:
- lighter, fresher, sweeter
- performs much like a body spray
- delicate and crisp
- terribly overpriced (although I keep buying it because it’s just a love)

Acqua Neroli:
- herbal musky undertone, almost fresh spicy
- sweet, but with a strong lemon opening
- performs more like an EDT
- price is more realistic

Acqua Neroli is enjoyable and nice. I enjoy it on my husband. There are other neroli scents I prefer, so ultimately, I won’t be purchasing a full bottle.

Pilikins directly below me describes Aqua Neroli accurately: the scent starts off promising but quickly turns into a very strong detergent smell. It’s really a difficult thing to wear, a disappointing scrubber.

I can’t add anything else new to the conversation. A firm dislike.

This in my opinion is definitely not the best neroli out there. The opening is really lovely- but it lasts only a few minutes before being replaced with a rather harsh cleaner type note and the neroli takes a back seat. The cleaning product fragrance gradually becomes less harsh, but any resemblance to any other Clean perfume style of clean note is not there. I suspect my bottle, although brand new, may be off because this can’t really be what they intended. There is not really even any musk to round off the composition. It’s a real disappointment.

It's interesting to me that this is considered a "floral citrus." When I wear it, all I get is the most luxe, fresh, freeing whiff of what you might imagine the most expensive cotton to smell like. I don't think this smells like detergent, though. (I think Byredo's Blanche does, however. And not a particularly special detergent either.) This is something else to my mind. It's clean yet mystical. It reminds me a lot of CB I Hate Perfume's discontinued Beautiful Launderette, which I loved back in the day. I'm so glad I bought a full bottle!

I got this as a sample and had a weird feeling after I sprayed it that I had gotten my samples mixed up as this is exactly Neroli Portofino Acqua. Exactly. Especially from the silage. However, I adore NPA so I am okay with it.

There's something really soapy & cleaner-y about this. It reminds me of whatever cleaner / air freshener they use in the rest stop bathrooms along I-80. This is not something that I personally want to smell like, and I feel like it comes off as quite artificial and chemically on my skin. I use it as a room / air freshener, and it really does a great job!
One of the best and cleanest neroli fragrances out there!

This one started out promising. There is sweet orange with heady neroli and orange blossom that promised to be lovely. Then it fell flat. It turned into orange blossom laundry detergent. I don't even use scented laundry detergent anymore, but I remember the smell of scented a laundry detergent of many varieties, and aside from the headache-inducing qualities, I was having hives and other problems with scented laundry products, so I no longer use them. I admit that this is a rather nice orange blossom laundry detergent, but it is so obviously "cleaning product". That's not the vibe I want.

Super bright opening of citrus and neroli but quickly subsides to a warmer, sweeter scent. This transports me back to my travels on the island of Capri and the Amalfi Coast and reminds me of strolling through those stunning Italian villages. Fresh and not cloying.

rare that i will have such a strong negative reaction to perfume, but i find this disgusting! smells like windex or something else janitorial. reminiscent of what a school custodian might use to clean children’s vomit off of the cafeteria floor. the neroli is just so strong and synthetic, it actually makes me ill. i can taste it in the back of my throat just thinking about it! this might be alright on someone else—it isn’t quite heavy enough that it would make me sick on another person unless we had to share a desk or an airplane—but having such a dense cloud of cleaning solution trailing after me and lingering around my head all day is nothing short of a guarantee for a very nasty migraine.

I got a large sized sampler as a gift with purchase for buying CLEAN Rain, and I honestly thought I didn’t like or wouldn’t like many of the reserve blend that they have put out but this is beautiful! It’s very citrusy and aquatic for those who are into that-for those who aren’t into those you likely wouldn’t like this. But this has changed my mind totally on the reserve blends! Definitely going to try more of them

Does anyone else smell Smarties candies? To me it smells exactly like what Smarties tastes like and instantly transports me back in time to very specific moments of my childhood. (It is so fascinating how scents can trigger long forgotten, even decades-old memories) Ok back to the subject... Smarties candy smells and tastes good to many, including me, but I'm not too sure I'd want to smell like it personally.
