Also, a lot of reviews have mentioned this perfume smelling so fresh but to me it seems to smell more chalky/slightly viscous-feeling? than fresh (probably because I'm already thinking of the candy) Oh and disclaimer: This is my first experience with neroli so I really have nothing to compare it to. Overall, this scent is very nice and evokes happiness within me but it's not something I'd often want to wear on my body. Could grow on me though.

Purchased 5ml size from Sephora that came in a 2 pack along with Radiant Nectar (Which was LOVE at first sniff!) for around $20. A very well worth it purchase.
Love, love, LOVE!!! The BEST neroli fragrance on the market right now. Cleanest and pure ingredients you can smell.

OMG that citrus & orange blossom first opening, it's sooo good! Made my eyes roll back in my head!! But it lasts for about a minute. I agree with other reviewers that there's something about this that gives cleaning product/laundry detergent vibes. But I kind of dig it for the first 10 minutes. The orange blossom note in this is pure and fresh - not heavy/heady like some are. But wow, that clean-laundry scent is aggressive. It's giving me a headache. If you want to smell like clean laundry, you will love this!

I don't understand why, but some note in here reminds me of how my piano teacher used to smell. Clean Acqua Neroli is a scent memory portal for me.

Smells like a laundry detergent with a cheap, chemical aroma. I used a tester and in 5 minutes I was scrubbing my hand as hard as I could, to get the scent out. No matter, the whiff of this synthetic smell stayed with me the whole day, and sometimes it felt like soap in my mouth.

I like it because it DOES smell "clean". However, after an hour it starts to give me an headache which is rarely happened to me before. Then, couple hours later when it is completely settled on my skin, I feel like it gave me very fresh feeling. But then there is something in there really gave me a "familiar feeling" and I finally figured out. It smells like a Dawn bottle or the cleaning smelling after you washing dishes.

Such a lovely fragrance. I get orange, neroli and bright citrus. Over time it becomes more musky and soft. It's definitely a skin scent but I don't mind that personally. I can already picture myself spritzing this on a hot summer day as a little refresher! In comparison to Neroli Portofino, this smells more of clean laundry and oranges where NP smells like a Mediterranean seaside. They are both very unisex, however, NP is the most "masculine" leaning of the two.

8/10
Seriously in love with this

The opening notes of this fragrance are so off-putting to me. It smells like a gas station bathroom air freshener, or as another reviewer mentioned, like Windex sans ammonia. As it dries down this screeching opening begins to soften, but it maintains this undertone of a Mr. Clean-like scent.

This is hands down my favorite Neroli scent that has incredible silage and longevity. Up to this point Issey Miyake Soleil de Neroli was my favorite neroli scent but this has eclipsed that. It is so full-bodied, fresh and clean. There are some fragrances that have it all and leave you totally satisfied. This is one of them. Whoever the perfumer was who created it didn't miss a beat. This smells as wonderful on first spray and throughout its hours and hours of wear (10 hours!!!) right until the very end when it finally becomes a skin scent. This is NEROLI. Every other note is there just to accentuate that clean, creamy, lightly citric, sweetly floral note. The whole composition is a deluxe sensuous experience. Best yet, it is all natural too. This is an off the rails big, BIG, love for me.
Windex sans ammonia

My signature!

Another remarkably clean citrusy, white floral scent with a hint of sensuality.

Neroli, musk, jasmine, sandalwood and bergamot amalgamated beautifully.

I wear this everyday alone or layered it over other perfumes to enhance or improve their scent.

This is another masterpiece that I hope stays available for a long, long time.

It is expensive, but you can find it for less on Ebay and stock up - that's what I do!
I quite enjoyed the opening of this but the dry down smells like an orange scented cleaning product or dryer sheet.
This is the best Neroli fragrance out there right now !!

Nice, relatively accessible and affordable neroli that actually lasts on the skin? Yes please. I have been disappointed with many big names (Tom Ford, Jo Malone) when it comes to staying power with their neroli blends, so I was pleasantly surprised when Clean's version outperformed the higher priced versions. I have never been much of a fan of Clean in the past, but this one is very well done, and just what I want on hot summer nights when I need a little bit of an escape. It is clean, fresh, and invigoratingly crisp. Total winner in my book.

What Neroli Portifino should have been. Long lasting freshie!! What a gem. The perfect summer scent for men and women. My wife bought a bottle and we were blown away about how good it was and how similar it is to TF. I was so blown away that I bought a second bottle for myself! I don’t agree with most frags that say unisex because they always lean more to one side But not this one; this is truly 50/50. Smells great and still performs in high heat. Oh and it’s all natural!!! How on earth did they do this?? C’mon big name brands, take notes! I’m really surprised this isn’t rated higher than it is.

10 out of 10
It reminds me so much for Neroli Portifino, just the latter is more sophisticated. Fresh, perfect for summer mornings. I like it, my husband doesn't.

At first, I thought I was going to love it. It smells like a nice laundry detergent. It's light and airy, I can almost imagine a crisp clean white t-shirt. However when I spray this on my skin, it reminds me of a public bathroom... or a cheap air freshner. I'm so disappointed that my body chemistry isn't allowing me to enjoy this. I don't think this is a safe blind buy, definitely try it before you buy it!

The first thing I thought when I smelled a sample of this was "wow! that smells clean!" Then I saw the brand name and felt like an idiot. But even a year later, the first word that comes to mind when I smell this is clean.

It doesn't smell like a perfume. It smells like doing laundry on a sunny afternoon but not laundry detergent. It smells like stepping out of a warm shower on a cold winter evening but it doesn't smell like soap. It is a close, comfortable scent that is light, airy, and fresh without being too cold or warm. Aqua Neroli is a solid neutral clean in a bottle.

This is one of the few scents that I have that I will buy as a full size when my mini runs out

Female 27.

I tried this on my wrist in a store. I LOVED it! One spray and I felt like I was completely wrapped in it. I couldn't stop smelling my wrist all the time for the rest of the day. Lasts long on me. I don't get citrusy, though. More a warm, cozy, woody feel (I tried it in cold weather).

HOWEVER. I wasn't sure if I enjoyed it on me - or if I enjoyed it because it smells like sexy man.

I brought a male friend of mine to smell it in the store too. While I loved it, he absolutely didn't like it. He thought it was too weird that it's both masculine and feminine at the same time. He told me not to buy it.

Though, I can't seem to get it out of my mind. Still, I'm hesitant to get it as I'm afraid people will think I smell like a man..

Definitely not a safe blind buy.

This was a blind buy based on reviews because I wanted to try a floral citrus fragrance for a change. And it was on sale. :) Still, I cannot believe I paid that much money for a perfume that smells exactly like the "Soft Cotton" air freshener from AirWick's Pure range that I have in my bathroom. The same sharp synthetic citrusy opening that fades into a soft synthetic "white flowers-fresh linen-clean air" combo that is very, very pleasant, almost heavenly, and makes you wonder why can't laundry detergents make your sheets smell like this, even though you're not really sure why you associate this smell with freshly laundered sheets or clean air or white flowers. Or what those flowers might be. I don't regret buying it but the price, even on sale, might not have been worth it. On the plus side I smell very clean. One could say pure.

This was a gift from a friend who dislikes perfume, but who knows I'm a fragrance lover. She tested a bunch of fragrances and chose the one she personally liked best. This is key to Acqua Neroli, because it's the kind of fresh scent that is nearly universally appealing. It's a neroli citrus combo - a "white t-shirt" scent, just perfectly comfortable and easy. Comparisons to the enduringly classic 4711 are almost unavoidable, but that's such a beautiful-yet-fleeting scent, and this does a great job of creating a more robust version of that masterpiece. Clean's Acqua Neroli is a perfect - and perfectly unisex - summer fragrance, but it's also an uplifting pick-me-up for any time at all.

Initial spray smells like cleaning products, which didn’t last long. It softens into a very fresh, pleasant, clean scent. I happen to be a fan of all of the notes, so it’s not shocking that I like it. I would buy a bottle if the price was right, but I find it too linear to pay retail price. I wish I had a Scentsy like this. That would be in my warmer for sure!

I've compared this cologne to Tom Ford's Neroli Portofino Acqua several times (was given decants of both at Sephora).
Tom Ford starts off with more of a bite and then the smell fades at a quick rate.
Clean Acqua Neroli starts mellow and stays consistent in terms of longevity.
However, there's an underlying synthetic, dryer sheet vibe in Clean's Acqua Neroli. It's not blatant, but noticeable enough that I prefer the Tom Ford version more.
To me, it is very similar to Colors de Benetton Blue Benetton, only a little more masculine.

My nose goes blind to this when the citrus dies off. My partner insists I still smell nice. But, I can't smell it.

The citrus and freshness at the beginning are very nice. It lasts for about 45 minutes. The neroli comes out and is lovely. But, then, towards the end, something else is coming out. It feels round to me, but I can't smell it. It's like my nose goes completely blind to it, and I can only catch whiffs of the perfume now and then. So odd.
Don't get me wrong, this is a nice perfume. This most definitely won't happen to you.

Very nice scent, it does really smell clean on clothes! I'd prefer more neroli though, the orange/clementine here has more power than the white florals. For a more floral version of this I would suggest Serge Lutens Fleurs d'orangers (and Lutens' Fleurs de citronnier smells very similar to Acqua Neroli actually!)

Nothing to write home about though, I feel like Acqua Neroli could be a blend of all other neroli scents out there. It doesnt stand out in its category, but could satisfiy your fresh citrus fantasy.

This is TF Neroli Portifino. If you smell them side by side you might convince yourself there is a subtle difference, but in a scent trail they are identical with Clean Reserve having better longevity for a better price point. Great fresh citrus scent and I did layer it from Clean's website suggestion with Solar Bloom and it smells like what you want to smell like in the summer sun at the beach (Coconut Suntan Lotion and clean citrus sunshine dried laundry).

Scent: 7.5
Longevity: 6 (5 hrs)
Projection:5 (2-3 feet for 1 hr then very close with a good trail)
Price: 7 (can be found for cheaper than sephora prices of $98 on ebay and such)

If Tom Fords Neroli Portifino lasted longer than an hour, it would be this. I have both an they are honestly 98% the same in scent and $200 different in price. This outshines TF in the fact that it has longevity. I have 3 of the TF blue bottles; Amalfi, Neroli Portifino and Costa Azzura and they are basically just expensive bottles. I'm in the process of selling all three at a loss because they do not perform and this is going to be the replacement beach/golf/super hot day at the park scent.

I loved this immediately upon first sniff. There are all kinds of citrus in here, with some white pith to add a touch of bitterness, some green to keep it from being syrupy, and a little bit of musk for staying power. In going through my entire collection, this beats about 90% of them in their appeal to me. Highly recommended for citrus lovers who have too many sweet, fruity fragrances in their collection. This one stands out.

Crazy mad addicted to this one.
Fresh for spring and summer.
Neroli, orange, orangeflower and bergamot on a musky/ woody/ amber base.
Longevity is very good and silage is about average.
A perfect unisex scent.
Reminds me of spring/ summer by the sea. Definetely a vacation vibe to it.
Fresh, clean and crisp. Well blened and highly addictive.

I wrote a previous review, but I want to add a word to the wise: this is *only* a warm-weather scent. If it's below 50F / 10C, I caution against wearing it. In cold weather this turns harsh and astringent, like a dryer sheet with a dab of rubbing alcohol. I got no citrus at all with this in winter, and didn't repeat the experience after one day. (Luckily, this doesn't last as long in the cold, either.) So please, save this beauty for warmer days.

Yes, it's similar to 4711, but it's closer to Acqua Di Parma Colonia Essenza, as it seems to have more of a masculine bite, although still unisex IMO, and not as masculine as Essenza. I'd say it would be a great alternative to Essenza. I'd say this would be a must have fragrance for 40 dollars. It's a bit overpriced, as I would rather have an Acqua Di Parma bottle on my dresser for less than $70 on ebay. This is still a 5 star fragrance that is unisex for lovers looking for a summer neroli fragrance.

My first love was 4711. When I was younger, I’d soak cottenballs in the cologne and tuck into my bra to try to squeeze some longevity out of the fragrance. Then I found Tom Ford’s Neroli Portofino, and discovered it’s the same scent but lasts longer. It was also rather pricy. So I later: I used the 4711 body wash to shower, splash on the cologne head to toe, and then spray with a small bit of Tom Ford I got from samples. I can still smell it after a long day but it’s definitely a skin scent.

Then I found Clean’s Reserve Acqua Neroli, and again, it’s very similar to Neroli Portofino and 4711. So, I’ve added that to the rotation. (I got it and a bottle of Neroli Portofino for Christmas,)

While I won’t go hard and heavy until it warms up, I’m very pleased I have enough of my favorite scents to spray hard and smell like the fresh Mediterranean all summer long. I’ll happily spray away.

Now all I need is a hair mist...hmmm.

Clean Reserve’s Acqua Neroli is lovely, summer in a bottle, lasts all day on my skin and it puts me in my happy place. Try it-if you are a Neroli lover you won’t be disappointed-man or woman. The bottle is beautiful and will sit on a man’s dresser as well as a woman’s. And while it’s not inexpensive, it’s less per ounce than Ford. On me, it lasts all day. I haven’t been in public wearing it to get compliments yet, but I know it’s coming.

I love this perfume! I purchased a scent sampler from Sephora over the holidays, and this one was a standout. It is more of a summer scent, but I’m wearing it in January anyway. I’m a teacher, so I cannot wear scents with too much sillage. This fresh scent smells clean and is appropriate for work. I’ve been a Jo Malone fan for years and felt it was time for a new scent. I’m so glad I found this brand, and I plan to try other fragrances in their line.
This is a wonderful white floral perfume!

I’m pretty much in love with this perfume. It’s fresh, clean, pretty, and not offensive. Easy choice when I just can’t decide what else to wear. It’s a nice soft, smooth orange blossom scent. Longevity is great, about 6 hours before I need to reapply.

Going off the notes alone, I didn't think I'd love this as much as I do. This was a blind buy based on my general agreement with Clean brand scents, and they didn't let me down. This is from their more expensive Reserve line and it's noticeably better than their standard "laundry" type spritzes. This is unisex, bright, fresh, sparkling, and clean, with a warm, neutral base. It reminds me of Sun Light dishwashing liquid mixed with Palmolive, but infused with heated citrus and creamy, sweet musk.

If bergamot typically doesn't wear well on you, give this a try - the oranges overtake it and leave no hint of it behind after 10 minutes. The neroli top melts perfectly with the tiniest hint of sandalwood in the dry down. The zesty "clean" note from most of their fragrances does make an appearance in the middle, but it's nowhere near as prominent as in Fresh Laundry & Warm Cotton. Longevity is as expected for this price point, though I have not yet tested it in summer temps.

Notes I pick up but that aren't official are lemon, honeysuckle, and iris.

So, I took this and Tom Ford’s Neroli Portifino on a test drive today. The scents matched almost identically on my skin. I couldn’t tell the difference between the two except the TFNP was just a bit louder at the beginning. Dry down was the same scent too, however the TFNP was much more of a skin scent that faded much too quickly, especially for its price point. 4 hours is horrible for an eau de parfum. In the end, longevity went to Acqua Neroli. 8 hours and still going strong. You get much more value for your money with this one.

Edit: I fell in love! This can be worn as a day scent year round and it lasts a long time. Plus, $95 for 3oz is not bad considering there are some going for $130 for a 2.5 oz bottle, plus a little goes a long way. Then there’s the eco-friendly packaging and sustainability for people. It’s a win-win.

Wonderful fresh citrus, with neroli and bergamot dominating. The musk helps with longevity, but isn't overpowering - this is that rare perfume that sits close to the skin, but lasts half the day. Definitely a daytime spring and summer fragrance, and absolutely perfect for the workplace, especially if you work around people with sensitivities to scent.

This scent instantly caught my nose as the Sephora Consultant sprayed for some one else. I was like whoa! and impressed. Smells fresh soapy pungent clean with a spicy woody undertone. Smells natural mostly. This is an excellent buy for someone looking for a ultra clean neroli fresh scent

A clean and fresh citrusy scent that is great for summer. It gives off a “Cologne-like scent” when used by my husband, but gives off a fresh airy citrus blast when I use it. I didn’t like it when I used it at first. It grew on me. I get up to 6 hours before it becomes body scent. Give this one a chance. It’s another good fragrance from the clean line.

She is out on errands on the weekend. As she walks down the housecleaning isle at the supermarket she picks out starch and orange scented floor cleaner. Fastidiously finishing up shopping she goes home. At home she is greeted by the orange scent of the floor cleaner as she wipes up dirt and grime. Later she starches and irons her shirts for work.

Well this is what the perfume smells like to me. Not fresh enough to even be a bathroom spray. One can just head over and purchase some household cleaning supplies to attain this scent, or maybe it’s just my skin.

ETA: my husband said the perfume smelled like an orange dryer sheet.
I can objectively appreciate this fragrance. It's very well done. Just not for me personally, and I can't put my finger on why.

ABSOLUTELY DIVINE, HANDS DOWN. Fresh, sexy, beautiful, comforting, relaxing. I almost missed it at Sephora yesterday evening; thank God I turned around and saw it and took the bottle to my nose. I would've missed out on this masterpiece! I fell head over heels for it right away. I absolutely LOVE Tom Ford Neroli Portofino but I cannot afford a bottle. This smells so identical, but less sharp and softer. It's so mellow and airy. I discovered right then that Neroli is my favorite note in a fragrance, and boy, does it shine through or what?! Had I had the money, I would've bought a bottle of this on the spot. I will definitely be purchasing it soon. 15/10.

Scent: 15/10
Price: $95 for 3.4 fl. oz. at Sephora. Expensive? Yes. Worth it? Absolutely. This will be the most I'll ever have paid for a bottle of cologne with no regrets!
Longevity: 10/10! I sprayed it on around 7 PM and when I woke up at 7 AM this morning, I still smelled it on my neck!
Sillage: 11/10. With only one spray, I freshened up the subway and trains I was on with this amazing, bright, beautiful, and sexy Dudu (insider) scent! It's not overpowering at all. I felt so sexy.

THIS IS #2 on my all-time favorites list behind Neroli Portofino. I finally found what I'm looking for! =)
This is it, get it, it smells crazy fresh and clean, a tad bit lighter and better than tom fords neroli acqua

This one is by far the best clean brand fragrance I've ever smelled. The day it came out I purchased it full price at Sephora which is something I never do and I did that blindly based on the notes. I'm so glad I did it. It reminds me of Tom Ford Neroli Portofino but cheaper per ounce. It doesn't project that well in longevity is short but it's worth it. It smells incredible. If you like the Tom Ford you have to try this one.
I smelled it at Sephora and loved it. It smells very similar to Tom Ford's Neroli Portifino Acqua. I'm not sure about performance or longevity, but the smell is fantastic. A great summer fragrance.

I really like this fragrance. I was in Sephora torn between this and Tom Ford Mandarino di Amalfi Acqua. I chose this. Like mentioned in first review great for spring and summer. Not too feminine for a male to pull off. Uplifting scent. Spray away and you will feel better
